</s> category : landforms of south asia </s> category : member state of the commonwealth of nation </s> category : member state of the organisation of islamic cooperation </s> category : member state of the south asian association for regional cooperation </s> category : member state of the united nation </s> category : republic </s> category : commonwealth republic </s> category : small island developing state </s> category : south asian country </s> category : state and territory established in 1965 </s> category : former least developed country <article_end> <article_start> </s> tanzania ( ; ) , officially the united republic of tanzania ( jamhuri ya muungano wa tanzania ) , is a country in east africa within the african great lake region . it border uganda to the north ; kenya to the northeast ; comoro island and the indian ocean to the east ; mozambique and malawi to the south ; zambia to the southwest ; and rwanda , burundi , and the democratic republic of the congo to the west . mount kilimanjaro , africa 's highest mountain , is in northeastern tanzania . </s> many important [ fossil have been found in tanzania , such a 6-million-year-old pliocene ] hominid fossil . the genus [ [ australopithecus ranged all over africa 4 to 2 million year ago ; and the oldest remains of the genus homo are found near olduvai gorge . following the rise of homo erectus 1.8 ; million year ago , humanity spread all over the old world , and later in the new world and australia under the specie homo sapiens . h. sapiens also overtook africa and absorbed the older archaic specie and subspecies of humanity . one of the oldest known ethnic group still existing , the hadza people , appears to have originated in tanzania , and their oral history recall ancestor who were tall and were the first to use fire , medicine , and lived in cave , much like homo erectus or homo heidelbergensis who lived in the same region before them . </s> later in the stone and bronze age , prehistoric migration into tanzania included south cushitic language speaker who moved south from present-day ethiopia ; eastern cushitic people who moved into tanzania from north of lake turkana about 2,000 and 4,000 year ago ; and the southern nilotic language , including the datooga people , who originated from the present-day south sudanethiopia border region between 2,900 and 2,400 year ago . these movement took place at about the same time a the settlement of the bantu language from west africa in the lake victoria and lake tanganyika area . they subsequently migrated across the rest of tanzania between 2,300 and 1,700 year ago . </s> german rule began in mainland tanzania during the late 19th century when germany formed german east africa . this wa followed by british rule after world war i . the mainland wa governed a tanganyika , with the zanzibar archipelago remaining a separate colonial jurisdiction . following their respective independence in 1961 and 1963 , the two entity merged in 1964 to form the united republic of tanzania . the country had joined the british commonwealth of nation in 1961 and tanzania is still a member of the commonwealth a one republic . </s> the united nation estimated tanzania 's population at million , which is slightly smaller than south africa , making it the second most populous country located entirely south of the equator . the population is composed of about 120 ethnic group , linguistic group , and religious group . the sovereign state of tanzania is a presidential system constitutional republic and since 1996 it official capital city ha been dodoma where the president 's office , the national assembly ( tanzania ) , and some government ministry are located . dar e salaam , the former capital , retains most government office and is the country 's largest city , principal port , and leading commercial centre . tanzania is a dominant-party system de facto one-party state with the democratic socialism chama cha mapinduzi party in power . </s> tanzania is mountainous and densely forested in the north-east , where mount kilimanjaro is located . three of african great lake africa 's great lake are partly within tanzania . to the north and west lie lake victoria , africa 's largest lake , and lake tanganyika , the continent 's deepest lake , known for it unique specie of fish . to the south lie lake malawi . the eastern shore is hot and humid , with the zanzibar archipelago just offshore . the menai bay conservation area is zanzibar 's largest marine protected area . the kalambo fall , located on the kalambo river at the zambian border , is the second highest uninterrupted waterfall in africa . </s> christianity is the largest religion in tanzania , but there are also substantial muslim and animism minority . over 100 different language of tanzania , making it the most linguistically diverse country in east africa . the country doe not have a de jure official language , although the national language is swahili language . swahili is used in parliamentary debate , in the lower court , and a a medium of instruction in primary school . english is used in foreign trade , in diplomacy , in higher court , and a a medium of instruction in secondary and higher education ; although the tanzanian government is planning to discontinue english a the primary language of instruction it will be available a an optional course . approximately 10 per cent of tanzanian speak swahili a a first language , and up to 90 per cent speak it a a second language . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> the name `` tanzania `` wa created a a clipped compound of the name of the two state that unified to create the country : tanganyika and people 's republic of zanzibar . it consists of the first three letter of the name of the two state ( `` tan `` and `` zan `` ) and the suffix , `` ia `` to form tanzania . </s> the name `` tanganyika `` is derived from the swahili language word tanga ( `` sail `` ) and nyika ( `` uninhabited plain `` , `` wilderness `` ) , creating the phrase `` sail in the wilderness `` . it is sometimes understood a a reference to lake tanganyika . </s> the name of zanzibar come from `` zanj `` , the name for a local people ( said to mean `` black `` ) , and the arabic word `` barr `` , which mean coast or shore . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> ancient <section_title_end> </s> the indigenous population of eastern africa are thought to be the hadza language hadza people and sandawe people hunter-gatherer of tanzania . </s> the first wave of migration wa by south cushitic language speaker who moved south from ethiopia and somalia into tanzania . they are ancestral to the iraqw language , gorowa language , and burunge language . based on linguistic evidence , there may also have been two movement into tanzania of eastern cushitic people at about 4,000 and 2,000 year ago , originating from north of lake turkana . </s> archaeological evidence support the conclusion that southern nilotic language , including the datooga people , moved south from the present-day south sudan / ethiopia border region into central northern tanzania between 2,900 and 2,400 year ago . </s> these movement took place at approximately the same time a the settlement of the iron-making bantu language from west africa in the lake victoria and lake tanganyika area . they brought with them the west african planting tradition and the primary staple of yam ( vegetable ) . they subsequently migrated out of these region across the rest of tanzania between 2,300 and 1,700 year ago . </s> eastern nilotic language people , including the maasai people , represent a more recent migration from present-day south sudan within the past 500 to 1,500 year . </s> the people of tanzania have been associated with the production of iron and steel . the pare people were the main producer of highly demanded iron for people who occupied the mountain region of north-eastern tanzania . the haya people on the western shore of lake victoria invented a type of high-heat blast furnace , which allowed them to forge carbon steel at temperature exceeding more than 1,500 year ago . </s> traveler and merchant from the persian gulf and india have visited the east african coast since early in the first millennium ad . islam wa practised by some on the swahili coast a early a the eighth or ninth century a.d. </s> <section_title_start> medieval <section_title_end> </s> bantu-speakers built farming and trade village along the tanzanian coast from the outset of the first millennium . archaeological find at fukuchani , on the north-west coast of zanzibar , indicate a settled agricultural and fishing community from the 6th century ce at the latest . the considerable amount of daub found indicates timber building , and shell bead , bead grinder , and iron slag have been found at the site . there is evidence for limited engagement in long-distance trade : a small amount of imported pottery ha been found , le than 1 % of total pottery find , mostly from the gulf and dated to the 5th to 8th century . the similarity to contemporary site such a mkokotoni and dar e salaam indicate a unified group of community that developed into the first center of coastal maritime culture . the coastal town appear to have been engaged in indian ocean and inland african trade at this early period . trade rapidly increased in importance and quantity beginning in the mid-8th century and by the close of the 10th century zanzibar wa one of the central swahili trading town . </s> growth in egyptian and persian shipping from the red sea and the persian gulf revitalized indian ocean trade , particularly after the fatimid caliphate relocated to fustat ( cairo ) . swahili agriculturalist built increasingly dense settlement to tap into trade , these forming the earliest swahili city-state . the venda-shona kingdom of mapungubwe and zimbabwe in south africa and zimbabwe , respectively , became a major producer of gold around this same period . economic , social , and religious power wa increasingly vested in kilwa sultanate , tanzania 's major medieval city-state . kilwa controlled a number of smaller port stretching down to modern-day mozambique . sofala became the major gold emporium and kilwa grew rich off the trade , lying at the southern end of the indian ocean monsoon . kilwa 's major rival lay to the north , in modern-day kenya , namely mombasa and malindi . kilwa remained the major power in east africa until the arrival of the portuguese at the end of the 15th century . </s> <section_title_start> colonial <section_title_end> </s> claiming the coastal strip , omani sultan said bin sultan moved his capital to zanzibar city in 1840 . during this time , zanzibar became the centre for the east african slave trade . between 65 and 90 per cent of the arab-swahili people population of zanzibar wa enslaved . one of the most infamous slave trader on the east african coast wa tippu tip , who wa the grandson of an enslaved african . the nyamwezi people slave trader operated under the leadership of msiri and mirambo . according to timothy insoll , `` figure record the exporting of 718,000 slave from the swahili coast during the 19th century , and the retention of 769,000 on the coast . `` in the 1890s , slavery wa abolished . </s> in the late 19th century , germany conquered the region that are now tanzania ( minus zanzibar ) and incorporated them into german east africa ( gea ) . the supreme council of the paris peace conference , 1919 awarded all of gea to britain on 7 may 1919 , over the strenuous objection of belgium . the british secretary of state for the colony , alfred milner , 1st viscount milner , and belgium 's minister plenipotentiary to the conference , , then negotiated the anglo-belgian agreement of 30 may 1919 where britain ceded the north-western gea province of ruanda-urundi to belgium . the conference 's commission on mandate ratified this agreement on 16 july 1919 . the supreme council accepted the agreement on 7 august 1919 . on 12 july 1919 , the commission on mandate agreed that the small kionga triangle south of the rovuma river would be given to portuguese mozambique , with it eventually becoming part of independent mozambique . the commission reasoned that germany had virtually forced portugal to cede the triangle in 1894 . the treaty of versailles wa signed on 28 july 1919 , although the treaty did not take effect until 10 january 1920 . on that date , the gea wa transferred officially to britain , belgium , and portugal . also on that date , `` tanganyika `` became the name of the british territory . </s> during world war ii , about 100,000 people from tanganyika joined the ally of world war ii and were among the 375,000 african who fought with those force . tanganyikans fought in unit of the king 's african rifle during the east african campaign ( world war ii ) in somalia and ethiopian empire against the italian , in madagascar against the vichy french during the battle of madagascar , and in burma against the empire of japan during the burma campaign 194445 . tanganyika wa an important source of food during this war , and it export income increased greatly compared to the pre-war year of the great depression wartime demand , however , caused increased commodity price and massive inflation within the colony . </s> in 1954 , julius nyerere transformed an organisation into the politically oriented tanganyika african national union ( tanu ) . tanu 's main objective wa to achieve national sovereignty for tanganyika . a campaign to register new member wa launched , and within a year , tanu had become the leading political organisation in the country . nyerere became minister of british-administered tanganyika in 1960 and continued a prime minister when tanganyika became independent in 1961. </s> <section_title_start> modern <section_title_end> </s> british rule came to an end on 9 december 1961 , but for the first year of independence , tanganyika had a governor general who represented the british monarch . tanganyika also joined the commonwealth of nation in 1961 . on 9 december 1962 , tanganyika became a democratic republic under an executive president . </s> after the zanzibar revolution overthrew the arab dynasty in neighbouring zanzibar , accompanied with the slaughter of thousand of arab zanzibarians , which had become independent in 1963 , the archipelago merged with mainland tanganyika on 26 april 1964 . the new country wa then named the united republic of tanganyika and zanzibar . on 29 october of the same year , the country wa renamed the united republic of tanzania ( `` tan `` come from tanganyika and `` zan `` from zanzibar ) . the union of the two hitherto separate region wa controversial among many zanzibaris ( even those sympathetic to the revolution ) but wa accepted by both the nyerere government and the revolutionary government of zanzibar owing to shared political value and goal . </s> following tanganyika 's independence and unification with zanzibar leading to the state of tanzania , president nyerere emphasised a need to construct a national identity for the citizen of the new country . to achieve this , nyerere provided what is regarded a one of the most successful case of ethnic repression and identity transformation in africa . with over 130 language spoken within it territory , tanzania is one of the most ethnically diverse country in africa . despite this obstacle , ethnic division remained rare in tanzania when compared to the rest of the continent , notably it immediate neighbour , kenya . furthermore , since it independence , tanzania ha displayed more political stability than most african country , particularly due to nyerere 's ethnic repression method . </s> in 1967 , nyerere 's first presidency took a turn to the left politics after the arusha declaration , which codified a commitment to socialism a well a pan-africanism . after the declaration , bank and many large industry were nationalised . </s> tanzania wa also aligned with china , which from 1970 to 1975 financed and helped build the tazara railway from dar e salaam to zambia . nonetheless , from the late 1970s , tanzania 's economy took a turn for the worse , in the context of an international economic crisis affecting both developed and developing economy . </s> from the mid-1980s , the regime financed itself by borrowing from the international monetary fund and underwent some reform . since then , tanzania 's gross domestic product per caput ha grown and poverty ha been reduced , according to a report by the world bank . </s> in 1992 , the constitution of tanzania wa amended to allow multiple political party . in tanzania 's first multi-party election , held in 1995 , the ruling chama cha mapinduzi won 186 of the 232 elected seat in the national assembly , and benjamin mkapa wa elected a president . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> at , tanzania is the 13th largest country in africa and the 31st largest in the world , ranked between the larger egypt and smaller nigeria . it border kenya and uganda to the north ; rwanda , burundi , and the democratic republic of the congo to the west ; and zambia , malawi , and mozambique to the south . tanzania is located on the eastern coast of africa and ha an indian ocean coastline approximately long . it also incorporates several offshore island , including unguja ( zanzibar ) , pemba island , and mafia island . the country is the site of africa 's highest and lowest point : mount kilimanjaro , at above sea level , and the floor of lake tanganyika , at below sea level , respectively . </s> tanzania is mountainous and densely forested in the northeast , where mount kilimanjaro is located . three of african great lake africa 's great lake are partly within tanzania . to the north and west lie lake victoria , africa 's largest lake , and lake tanganyika , the continent 's deepest lake , known for it unique specie of fish . to the southwest lie lake nyasa . central tanzania is a large plateau , with plain and arable land . the eastern shore is hot and humid , with the zanzibar archipelago just offshore . </s> kalambo fall in the southwestern region of rukwa is the second highest uninterrupted waterfall in africa , and is located near the southeastern shore of lake tanganyika on the border with zambia . the menai bay conservation area is zanzibar 's largest marine protected area . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> climate varies greatly within tanzania . in the highland , temperature range between during cold and hot season respectively . the rest of the country ha temperature rarely falling lower than . the hottest period extends between november and february ( ) while the coldest period occurs between may and august ( ) . annual temperature is . the climate is cool in high mountainous region . </s> tanzania ha two major rainfall period : one is unimodality uni-modal ( octoberapril ) and the other is bi-modal ( octoberdecember and marchmay ) . the former is experienced in southern , central , and western part of the country , and the latter is found in the north from lake victoria extending east to the coast . the bi-modal rainfall is caused by the seasonal migration of the intertropical convergence zone . </s> climate change in tanzania is resulting in rising temperature with a higher likelihood of intense rainfall event ( resulting in flooding ) and of dry spell ( resulting in drought ) . climate change is already impacting the sector in tanzania of agriculture , water resource , health and energy . sea level rise and change in the quality of water are expected to impact fishery and aquaculture . </s> tanzania produced a national adaptation programme of action ( napa ) in 2007 a mandated by the united nation framework convention on climate change . in 2012 , tanzania produced a national climate change strategy in response to the growing concern of the negative impact of climate change and climate variability on the country s social , economic and physical environment . </s> <section_title_start> wildlife and conservation <section_title_end> </s> tanzania contains around 20 % of the specie of africa 's enormous warm-blooded animal populace , found over it 21 national park , reserve , 1 conservation area , and 3 marine park . spread over a zone of in excess of 42,000 square kilometer ( 16,000 sq . mi ) and shaping around 38 % of the nation 's area . </s> . tanzania ha 21 national park , plus a variety of game and forest reserve , including the ngorongoro conservation area . in western tanzania , gombe stream national park is the site of jane goodall 's ongoing study of common chimpanzee behaviour , which started in 1960. </s> tanzania is highly biodiversity and contains a wide variety of animal habitat . on tanzania 's serengeti plain , white-bearded wildebeest ( connochaetes taurinus mearnsi ) , other bovid and zebra participate in a large-scale annual migration . tanzania is home to about 130 amphibian and over 275 reptile specie , many of them strictly endemism and included in the international union for conservation of nature 's red list of country . tanzania ha the largest lion population in the world . </s> tanzania had a 2019 forest landscape integrity index mean score of 7.13/10 , ranking it 54th globally out of 172 country . </s> tanzania national park </s> * moshi national park </s> * gombe stream national park </s> * katavi national park </s> * kilimanjaro national park </s> * kitulo national park </s> * mahale mountain national park </s> * lake manyara national park </s> * mikumi national park </s> * mkomazi national park </s> * ruaha national park </s> * rubondo island national park </s> * saadani national park </s> * serengeti national park </s> * tarangire national park </s> * udzungwa mountain national park </s> * nyerere national park </s> * saanane island national park </s> * burigi-chato national park </s> * ibanda-kyerwa national park </s> * rumanyika-karagwe national park </s> * kigosi national park </s> * ugalla river national park </s> marine park </s> * mafia island marine park </s> * mnazi bay ruvuma estuary park </s> * tanga coelacanth marine park </s> conservation area </s> * ngorongoro conservation area </s> game reserve </s> * ikorongo game reserve </s> * kigosi game reserve </s> * kijereshi game reserve </s> * liparamba game reserve </s> * lukwati and piti game reserve </s> * lukwika lumesule </s> * msanjesi game reserve </s> * lwafi game reserve </s> * maswa game reserve </s> * mkungunero game reserve </s> * moyowosi game reserve </s> * rungwa game reserve </s> * kizigo game reserve </s> * muhesi game reserve </s> * uwanda game reserve </s> * rukwa game reserve </s> * selous game reserve </s> * swagaswaga game reserve </s> * ugalla river game reserve </s> <section_title_start> politics <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> government <section_title_end> </s> tanzania is a one party dominant state with the chama cha mapinduzi ( ccm ) party in power . from it formation until 1992 , it wa the only legally permitted party in the country . this changed on 1 july 1992 , when the constitution wa amended . </s> john magufuli won the october 2015 presidential election and secured a two-thirds majority in parliament . the main opposition party in tanzania is called chadema chama cha demokrasia na maendeleo ( chadema ) ( swahili language for `` party for democracy and progress `` ) . in zanzibar , the country 's semi-autonomous state , the civic united front civil united front ( cuf ) is considered the main opposition political party . </s> in november 2020 magufuli once again wa declared the winner for his second term a president . election fraud wa suspected . the national electoral commission announced that magufuli received 84 % , or about 12.5 million vote and the top opposition candidate , tundu lissu received 13 % , about 1.9 million vote . </s> <section_title_start> executive <section_title_end> </s> the president of tanzania and the list of tanzania national assembly member are elected concurrently by direct popular vote for five-year term . the vice president of tanzania vice-president is elected for a five-year term at the same time a the president and on the same ticket . neither the president nor the vice-president may be a member of the national assembly . the president appoints a prime minister of tanzania , subject to confirmation by the assembly , to serve a the government 's leader in the assembly . the president selects his or her cabinet of tanzania from assembly member . </s> <section_title_start> legislature <section_title_end> </s> all legislature power relating to mainland tanzania and union matter is vested in the national assembly of tanzania , which is unicameral and ha a maximum of 357 member . these include member elected to represent constituency , the attorney general , five member elected by the zanzibar house of representative from among it own member , the special woman 's seat that constitute at least 30 % of the seat that any party ha in the assembly , the speaker of the assembly ( if not otherwise a member of the assembly ) , and the person ( not more than ten ) appointed by the president . the tanzania electoral commission demarcates the mainland into constituency in the number determined by the commission with the consent of the president . </s> <section_title_start> judiciary <section_title_end> </s> tanzania 's legal system is based on english common law . </s> tanzania ha a four-level judiciary . the lowest-level court on the tanzanian mainland are the primary court . in zanzibar , the lowest-level court are the kadhi 's court for islamic family matter and the primary court for all other case . on the mainland , appeal is to either the district court or the resident magistrate court . in zanzibar , appeal is to the kadhi 's appeal court for islamic family matter and the magistrate court for all other case . from there , appeal is to the high court of tanzania . no appeal regarding islamic family matter can be made from the high court of zanzibar . otherwise , the final appeal is to the court of appeal of tanzania . </s> the high court of mainland tanzania ha three division commercial , labour , and land and 15 geographic zone . the high court of zanzibar ha an industrial division , which hears only labour dispute . </s> mainland and union judge are appointed by the chief justice of tanzania , except for those of the appellate court and the high court , who are appointed by the president of tanzania . </s> tanzania is a party to the rome statute of the international criminal court . </s> <section_title_start> zanzibar <section_title_end> </s> the legislative authority in zanzibar over all non-union matter is vested in the house of representative ( zanzibar ) ( per the tanzania constitution ) or the legislative council ( per the zanzibar constitution ) . </s> the legislative council ha two part : the president of zanzibar and the house of representative . the president is zanzibar 's head of government and the chairman of the revolutionary council , in which the executive authority of zanzibar is invested . zanzibar ha two vice-presidents , with the first being from the main opposition party in the house . the second is from the party in power and is the leader of government business in the house . </s> the president and the member of the house of representative have five-year term and can be elected for a second term . </s> the president selects minister from member of the house of representative , with the minister allocated according to the number of house seat won by political party . the revolutionary council consists of the president , both vice-presidents , all minister , the attorney general of zanzibar , and other house member deemed fit by the president . </s> the house of representative is composed of elected member , ten member appointed by the president , all the regional commissioner of zanzibar , the attorney general , and appointed female member whose number must be equal to 30 per cent of the elected member . the house determines the number of it elected member with the zanzibar electoral commission determining the boundary of each election constituency . in 2013 , the house had 81 member : fifty elected member , five regional commissioner , the attorney general , ten member appointed by the president , and fifteen appointed female member . </s> <section_title_start> administrative subdivisions <section_title_end> </s> in 1972 , local government on the mainland wa abolished and replaced with direct rule from the central government . local government , however , wa reintroduced in the beginning of the 1980s , when the rural council and rural authority were re-established . local government election took place in 1983 , and functioning council started in 1984 . in 1999 , a local government reform programme wa enacted by the national assembly ( tanzania ) , setting `` a comprehensive and ambitious agenda ... [ covering ] four area : political decentralization , financial decentralization , administrative decentralization and changed central-local relation , with the mainland government having overriding power within the framework of the constitution . `` </s> a of 2016 , tanzania is divided into thirty-one region of tanzania ( mkoa ) , twenty-six on the mainland and five in zanzibar ( three on unguja , two on pemba , tanzania ) . in 2012 , the thirty former region were divided into 169 district of tanzania ( wilaya ) , also known a local government authority . of those district , 34 were urban unit , which were further classified a three city council ( arusha , mbeya , and mwanza ) , nineteen municipal council , and twelve town council . </s> the urban unit have an autonomous city , municipal , or town council and are subdivided into ward and mtaa . the non-urban unit have an autonomous district council but are subdivided into village council or township authority ( first level ) and then into vitongoji . </s> the city of dar e salaam is unique because it ha a city council whose area of jurisdiction overlap three municipal council . the mayor of the city council is elected by that council . the twenty-member city council is composed of eleven person elected by the municipal council , seven member of the national assembly , and `` nominated member of parliament under 'special seat ' for woman `` . each municipal council also ha a mayor . `` the city council performs a coordinating role and attends to issue cutting across the three municipality `` , including security and emergency service . the city of mwanza ha a city council whose areal jurisdiction overlap two municipal council . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relations <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> bilateral relations <section_title_end> </s> apart from it border dispute with malawi , tanzania had cordial relation with it neighbour in 2012. </s> malawitanzania relation have been tense because of a lake malawi # tanzaniamalawi dispute over the country ' lake nyasa ( lake malawi ) border . an unsuccessful mediation regarding this issue took place in march 2014 . the two country agreed in 2013 to ask the international court of justice ( icj ) to resolve the dispute should mediation be unsuccessful . malawi , but not tanzania , ha accepted the compulsory jurisdiction of the icj . </s> rwandatanzania relation deteriorated in 2013 when tanzanian president jakaya kikwete said that if the democratic republic of the congo ( drc ) could negotiate with some of it enemy , rwanda should be able to do the same . rwandan president paul kagame then expressed `` contempt `` for kikwete 's statement . the tension wa renewed in may 2014 when , in a speech to the tanzanian national assembly ( tanzania ) , foreign affair minister bernard membe renewed his claim that rwandan were causing instability in the drc . rwandan foreign affair minister louise mushikiwabo responded , `` a for tanzania 's foreign minister whose anti-rwanda rant in parliament i heard , he would benefit from a lesson in the history of the region . `` </s> tanzania ha maintained strong tanzania-united kingdom relation with the united kingdom since it independence ; britain remains the largest non-african importer of tanzanian tea and other raw material are exchanged . britain remains a high contributor of tourist to tanzania . both are member of the commonwealth of nation and engage in strategic union in defence , security and ceremonial affair ; the tanzanian high commission of tanzania , london is in london and the british have a british high commission , dar e salaam in dar e salaam . </s> tanzaniachina relation have strengthened in recent year a trade between the two country and chinese investment in tanzanian infrastructure have increased rapidly . </s> tanzaniaunited state relation are warm , with president barack obama list of presidential trip made by barack obama in 2013. </s> tanzania 's relation with other donor country , including japan and member of the european union , are generally good , though donor are concerned about tanzania 's commitment to reducing government corruption . </s> <section_title_start> multilateral relations <section_title_end> </s> tanzania is a member of the east african community ( eac ) , along with uganda , kenya , rwanda , burundi and south sudan . according to the east african common market protocol of 2010 , the free trade and free movement of people is guaranteed , including the right to reside in another member country for purpose of employment . this protocol , however , ha not been implemented because of work permit and other bureaucratic , legal , and financial obstacle . </s> tanzania is also a member of the southern african development community ( sadc ) . the eac , the sadc , and the common market for eastern and southern africa agreed in june 2011 to negotiate the creation of a tripartite free trade area spanning 26 african country , with a goal to complete the first phase of negotiation within 36 month . </s> a of 31 october 2014 , tanzania wa contributing 2,253 soldier and other personnel to various united nation peacekeeping operation . the tanzania people 's defence force is participating along with south african and malawian military in the united nation force intervention brigade ( monusco ) in the democratic republic of the congo ( drc ) . the united nation security council authorised the force on 28 march 2013 to conduct targeted offensive operation to neutralise group that threaten peace in the drc . tanzania wa also participating in peacekeeping mission in the darfur region of sudan ( unamid ) ; abyei , control of which is contested between south sudan and sudan ( unisfa ) ; the central african republic ( minusca ) ; lebanon ( unifil ) ; and south sudan ( unmiss ) . </s> in 2019 , tanzania signed the un treaty on the prohibition of nuclear weapon . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> the tanzania people 's defence force ( tpdf ) ( kiswahili : jeshi la wananchi wa tanzania ( jwtz ) ) is the armed force of tanzania , operating a a people 's force under civilian control . it is composed of three branch or command : land force ( army ) , air force , naval command . tanzanian citizen are able to volunteer for military service from 15 year of age , and 18 year of age for compulsory military service upon graduation from secondary school . conscript service obligation wa 2 year a of 2004. </s> <section_title_start> human rights <section_title_end> </s> throughout tanzania , lgbt right by country or territory are illegal and carry a maximum penalty of life imprisonment . according to a 2007 pew research centre survey , 95 per cent of tanzanian believed that homosexuality should not be accepted by society . </s> people with albinism living in tanzania are often attacked , killed or mutilated because of superstition related to the black-magical practice known a muti that say body part of albino have magical property . </s> tanzania ha the highest occurrence of this human right violation among 27 african country where muti is known to be practised . </s> in december 2019 , amnesty international reported that the tanzanian government annulled the right of ngo a well a individual to directly file any case against it at the arusha-based african court for human and people ' right . </s> <section_title_start> economy and infrastructure <section_title_end> </s> , according to the imf , tanzania 's gross domestic product ( gdp ) wa an estimated $ 56.7 ; billion ( nominal ) , or $ 176.5 ; billion on a purchasing power parity ( ppp ) basis . gdp per caput ( ppp ) wa $ 3,457 . </s> from 2009 through 2013 , tanzania 's per caput gdp ( based on constant local currency ) grew an average of 3.5 % per year , higher than any other member of the east african community ( eac ) and exceeded by only nine country in sub-saharan africa : the democratic republic of the congo , ethiopia , ghana , lesotho , liberia , mozambique , sierra leone , zambia , and zimbabwe . </s> tanzania 's largest trading partner in 2017 for it u $ 5.3 ; billion in export were india , vietnam , south africa , switzerland , and china . it import totalled u $ 8.17 ; billion , with india , switzerland , saudi arabia , china , and the united arab emirate being the biggest partner . </s> tanzania weathered the great recession , which began in late 2008 or early 2009 , relatively well . strong gold price , bolstering the country 's mining industry of tanzania , and tanzania 's poor integration into global market helped to insulate the country from the downturn . since the recession ended , the tanzanian economy ha expanded rapidly thanks to strong tourism , telecommunication , and banking sector . </s> according to the united nation development programme , however , recent growth in the national economy ha benefited only the `` very few `` , leaving out the majority of the population . tanzania 's 2013 global hunger index wa worse than any other country in the eac except burundi . the proportion of person who were undernourished in 201012 wa also worse than any other eac country except burundi . </s> in 2020 , the world bank declared the rise of the tanzanian economy from low income to lower middle income country , with a gross domestic product ( gdp ) estimated to be between u $ 1,006 and u $ 3,955 . </s> <section_title_start> hunger and poverty <section_title_end> </s> tanzania ha made some progress towards reducing extreme hunger and malnutrition . the global hunger index ranked the situation a `` alarming `` with a score of 42 in the year 2000 ; since then the ghi ha declined to 29.5 . child in rural area suffer substantially higher rate of malnutrition and chronic hunger , although urban-rural disparity have narrowed a regard both stunting and underweight . low rural sector productivity arises mainly from inadequate infrastructure investment ; limited access to farm input , extension service and credit ; limited technology a well a trade and marketing support ; and heavy dependence on rain-fed agriculture and natural resource . </s> approximately 68 per cent of tanzania 's 44.9 ; million citizen live below the poverty line of $ 1.25 a day . 32 per cent of the population are malnourished . the most prominent challenge tanzania face in poverty reduction are unsustainable harvesting of it natural resource , unchecked cultivation , climate change and water- source encroachment , according to the united nation development programme ( undp ) . </s> there are very few resource for tanzanian in term of credit service , infrastructure or availability to improved agricultural technology , which further exacerbates hunger and poverty in the country according to the united nation development programme undp . tanzania rank 159 out of 187 country in poverty according to the united nation 's human development index ( 2014 ) . </s> the 2019 world bank report showed that in the last 10 year , poverty ha reduced by 8 per cent , from 34.4 % in 2007 to 26.4 % in 2018. </s> <section_title_start> agriculture <section_title_end> </s> the tanzanian economy is heavily based on agriculture , which in 2013 accounted for 24.5 per cent of gross domestic product , provides 85 % of export , and accounted for half of the employed workforce ; the agricultural sector grew 4.3 per cent in 2012 , le than half of the millennium development goal target of 10.8 % . 16.4 per cent of the land is arable land , with 2.4 per cent of the land planted with permanent crop . tanzania 's economy relies on farming , but climate change ha impacted their farming . </s> maize wa the largest food crop on the tanzania mainland in 2013 ( 5.17 ; million tonne ) , followed by cassava ( 1.94 ; million tonne ) , sweet potato ( 1.88 ; million tonne ) , bean ( 1.64 ; million tonne ) , banana ( 1.31 ; million tonne ) , rice ( 1.31 ; million tonne ) , and millet ( 1.04 ; million tonne ) . sugar wa the largest cash crop on the mainland in 2013 ( 296,679 tonne ) , followed by cotton ( 241,198 tonne ) , cashew nut ( 126,000 tonne ) , tobacco ( 86,877 tonne ) , coffee ( 48,000 tonne ) , sisal ( 37,368 tonne ) , and tea ( 32,422 tonne ) . beef wa the largest meat product on the mainland in 2013 ( 299,581 tonne ) , followed by lamb/mutton ( 115,652 tonne ) , chicken ( 87,408 tonne ) , and pork ( 50,814 tonne ) . </s> according to the 2002 national irrigation master plan , 29.4 ; million hectare in tanzania are suitable for irrigation farming ; however , only 310,745 hectare were actually being irrigated in june 2011. </s> <section_title_start> industry , energy and construction <section_title_end> </s> industry and construction is a major and growing component of the tanzanian economy , contributing 22.2 per cent of gdp in 2013 . this component includes mining and quarrying , manufacturing , electricity and natural gas , water supply , and construction . mining contributed 3.3 per cent of gdp in 2013 . the vast majority of the country 's mineral export revenue come from gold , accounting for 89 per cent of the value of those export in 2013 . it also export sizeable quantity of gemstone , including diamond and tanzanite . all of tanzania 's coal production , which totalled 106,000 short ton in 2012 , is used domestically . </s> only 15 per cent of tanzanian had access to electric power in 2011 . the government-owned tanesco ( tanesco ) dominates the electric supply industry in tanzania . the country generated 6.013 ; billion kilowatt hour ( kwh ) of electricity in 2013 , a 4.2 per cent increase over the 5.771 ; billion kwh generated in 2012 . generation increased by 63 per cent between 2005 and 2012 ; almost 18 per cent of the electricity generated in 2012 wa lost because of theft and transmission and distribution problem . the electrical supply varies , particularly when drought disrupt hydropower electric generation ; rolling blackout are implemented a necessary . the unreliability of the electrical supply ha hindered the development of tanzanian industry . in 2013 , 49.7 per cent of tanzania 's electricity generation came from natural gas , 28.9 per cent from hydroelectric source , 20.4 per cent from thermal source , and 1.0 per cent from outside the country . the government ha built a gas pipeline from mnazi bay-ruvuma estuary marine park to dar e salaam . this pipeline wa expected to allow the country to double it electricity generation capacity to 3,000 megawatt by 2016 . the government 's goal is to increase capacity to at least 10,000 megawatt by 2025. </s> according to pfc energy , 25 to 30 ; trillion cubic foot of recoverable natural gas resource have been discovered in tanzania since 2010 , bringing the total reserve to over 43 ; trillion cubic foot by the end of 2013 . the value of natural gas actually produced in 2013 wa u $ 52.2 ; million , a 42.7 per cent increase over 2012. </s> commercial production of gas from the songo songo island field in the indian ocean commenced in 2004 , thirty year after it wa discovered there . over 35 ; billion cubic foot of gas wa produced from this field in 2013 , with proven , probable , and possible reserve totalling 1.1 ; trillion cubic foot . the gas is transported by pipeline to dar e salaam . a of 27 august 2014 , tanesco owed the operator of this field , orca exploration group inc. </s> a newer natural gas field in mnazi bay in 2013 produced about one-seventh of the amount produced near songo songo island but ha proven , probable , and possible reserve of 2.2 ; trillion cubic foot . virtually all of that gas is being used for electricity generation in mtwara . </s> the ruvuma and nyuna region of tanzania have been explored mostly by the discovery company that hold a 75 per cent interest , aminex , and ha shown to hold in excess of 3.5 ; trillion cubic foot of natural gas . a pipeline connecting offshore natural gas field to tanzania 's commercial capital dar e salaam wa completed at the end of april 2015. </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> travel and tourism contributed 17.5 per cent of tanzania 's gross domestic product in 2016 and employed 11.0 per cent of the country 's labour force ( 1,189,300 job ) in 2013 . overall receipt rose from u $ 1.74 ; billion in 2004 to u $ 4.48 ; billion in 2013 , and receipt from international tourist rose from u $ 1.255 ; billion in 2010 to u $ 2 ; billion in 2016 . in 2016 , 1,284,279 tourist arrived at tanzania 's border compared to 590,000 in 2005 . the vast majority of tourist visit zanzibar or a `` northern circuit `` of serengeti national park , the ngorongoro conservation area , tarangire national park , lake manyara national park , and mount kilimanjaro . in 2013 , the most visited national park wa serengeti ( 452,485 tourist ) , followed by manyara ( 187,773 ) and tarangire ( 165,949 ) . </s> <section_title_start> banking <section_title_end> </s> the bank of tanzania is the central bank of tanzania and is primarily responsible for maintaining price stability , with a subsidiary responsibility for issuing tanzanian shilling note and coin . at the end of 2013 , the total asset of the tanzanian banking industry were 19.5 ; trillion tanzanian shilling , a 15 per cent increase over 2012. </s> <section_title_start> transport <section_title_end> </s> most transport in tanzania is by road , with road transport constituting over 75 per cent of the country 's freight traffic and 80 per cent of it passenger traffic . the road system is in generally poor condition . tanzania ha two railway company : tazara , which provides service between dar e salaam and kapiri mposhi ( in a copper-mining district in zambia ) , and tanzania railway limited , which connects dar e salaam with central and northern tanzania . rail travel in tanzania often entail slow journey with frequent cancellation or delay , and the railway have a deficient safety record . </s> in dar e salaam , there is a huge project of rapid bus , dar rapid transit agency dar rapid transit ( dart ) which connects suburb of dar e salaam city . the development of the dart system consists of six phase and is funded by the african development bank , the world bank and the government of tanzania . the first phase began in april 2012 , and it wa completed in december 2015 and launched operation in may 2016. </s> tanzania ha four international airport , along with over 120 small airport or landing strip . airport infrastructure tends to be in poor condition . airline in tanzania include air tanzania , precision air , fastjet , coastal aviation , and zanair . </s> <section_title_start> communications <section_title_end> </s> in 2013 , the communication sector wa the fastest growing in tanzania , expanding 22.8 per cent ; however , the sector accounted for only 2.4 per cent of gross domestic product that year . </s> a of 2011 , tanzania had 56 mobile telephone subscriber per 100 inhabitant , a rate slightly above the sub-saharan average . very few tanzanian have fixed-line telephone . approximately 12 per cent of tanzanian used the internet , though this number is growing rapidly . the country ha a fibre-optic cable network that replaced unreliable satellite service , but internet bandwidth remains very low . </s> <section_title_start> water supply and sanitation <section_title_end> </s> water supply and sanitation in tanzania ha been characterised by decreasing access to improved water source in the 2000s ( especially in urban area ) , steady access to some form of sanitation ( around 93 per cent since the 1990s ) , intermittent water supply , and generally low quality of service . many utility are barely able to cover their operation and maintenance cost through revenue because of low tariff and poor efficiency . there are significant region of tanzania difference , with the best performing utility being arusha , moshi , tanzania , and tanga , tanzania . </s> the government of tanzania ha embarked on a major sector reform process since 2002 . an ambitious national water sector development strategy that promotes integrated water resource management and the development of urban and rural water supply wa adopted in 2006 . decentralisation ha meant that responsibility for water and sanitation service provision ha shifted to local government authority and is carried out by 20 urban utility and about 100 district utility , a well a by community owned water supply organisation in rural area . </s> these reform have been backed by a significant increase of the budget starting in 2006 , when the water sector wa included among the priority sector of the national strategy for growth and reduction of poverty . the tanzanian water sector remains heavily dependent on external donor , with 88 per cent of the available fund being provided by external donor organisation . result have been mixed . for example , a report by deutsche gesellschaft fr internationale zusammenarbeit noted that `` despite heavy investment brought in by the world bank and the european union , ( the utility serving dar e salaam ) ha remained one of the worst performing water entity in tanzania . `` </s> <section_title_start> economic statistic controversy <section_title_end> </s> two article in the economist in july 2020 raised doubt about official claim of economic growth : `` if tanzania s economy grew by almost 7 % in the fiscal year to the end of june 2019 , why did tax revenue fall by 1 % ? and why ha bank lending to company slumped ? private data are bad , too . in 2019 sale at the biggest brewer fell by 5 % . sale of cement by the two biggest producer were almost flat . none of these thing is likely if growth is storming ahead . the discrepancy are so large that it is hard to avoid the conclusion that the government is lying . `` </s> tim staermose , a proponent of african investment , took issue with these data : `` some of these statement by the economist , based on the evidence i have gathered from primary source namely , the statutory financial report that listed company in tanzania are legally obligated to release are simply not true . bank lending to company a far a i can see ha not , 'slumped . ' the two biggest bank in tanzania , which between them account for approximately 40 % of the banking sector , both reported strong loan growth in 2019 . ... a for cement sale being 'almost flat , ' again , this is total nonsense . ... in 2019 twiga sold 6 % more cement by volume than it did in 2018 . in the first six month of 2020 , twiga already sold 8 % more cement than it had done by the same stage in 2019 . again , these number are very consistent with an economy that s reported to be growing at around 7 % per annum . ... [ on ] the 5 % fall in beer sale in 2019 ... the published 2019 annual report by tanzania brewery limited ( tbl ) will tell you there were one-off circumstance that largely drove the decline ... [ which ] resulted in sale falling . but tbl s profit actually rose in 2019 . `` </s> <section_title_start> food and nutrition <section_title_end> </s> poor nutrition remains a persistent problem within tanzania and varies hugely throughout the country 's region . united state agency for international development report that 16 % of child are underweight and 34 % experience stunted growth a a result of malnutrition . 10 region house 58 % of child suffering from stunted growth while 50 % of acutely malnourished child can be found in 5 region . over a 5-year period , the mara region district of tanzania saw a 15 % reduction in stunting in child under 5 year old , falling from 46 % to 31 % in 2005 and 2010 respectively . dodoma , on the other hand saw a 7 % increase in the prevalence of stunting in this age group , rising from 50 % in 2005 to 57 % in 2010 . overall availability of food doe not necessarily contribute to overall stunting figure . iringa region , mbeya region and rukwa region region , where overall availability of food is considered acceptable still experience stunting incidence in excess of 50 % . in some area where food shortage are common such a in the tabora region and singida region region , stunting incidence remain comparatively le than those seen in iringa , mbeya and rukwa . the tanzania food and nutrition centre attribute these discrepancy to variance in maternal malnutrition , poor infant feeding practice , hygiene practice and poor healthcare service . period of drought can have significant impact on the production of crop in tanzania . drought in east africa ha resulted in massive increase in the price of food staple such a maize and commercial sorghum , crop crucial to the nutrition of the majority of tanzania 's population . from 2015 to 2017 the price of maize when bought wholesale more than tripled , from 400 tanzanian shilling per kilogram to 1253 shilling per kilogram . </s> tanzania remains heavily agricultural , with 80 % of the total population engaging in subsistence farming . rural area are subjected to increased food shortage in comparison to urbanised area , with a survey carried out within the country in 2017 finding 84 % of people in rural area suffering food shortage over a 3-month period compared to 64 % of resident in city . this disparity between rural and city nutrition can be attributed to various factor ; increased nutritional need due to manual labour , more limited access to food a a result of poor infrastructure , high-susceptibility to the damaging effect of nature and the `` agricultural productivity gap `` . the agricultural productivity gap postulate that `` value added per worker `` is often much lower within the agricultural sector than that found within non-agricultural sector . furthermore , allocation of labour within the agricultural sector is largely allocated ineffectively . </s> <section_title_start> programme targeting hunger <section_title_end> </s> usaid programme focussing on nutrition operate within the morogoro , dodoma , iringa , mbeya , manyara region , songwe region and zanzibar region of tanzania . these `` feed the future initiative `` programme heavily invest in nutrition , infrastructure , policy , capacity of institution and agriculture which is identified by the organisation a a key area of economic growth in the country . a tanzanian government led initiative `` kilimo kwanza `` or `` agriculture first `` aim to encourage investment into agriculture within the private sector and hope to improve agricultural process and development within the country by seeking the knowledge of young people and the innovation that they can potentially provide . during the 1990s , around 25 % of tanzania 's population were provided access to iodized oil aimed to target iodine deficiency within expecting mother , a result of study showing the negative effect of in-utero iodine deficiency on cognitive development in child . research showed that child of mother with access to the supplement achieved on average greater than a third of a year more education than those who did not . </s> programme led by the world food programme operate within tanzania . the supplementary feeding programme ( sfp ) aim to target acute malnutrition by supplying blended food fortified with vitamin to pregnant woman and mother to child under 5 on a monthly basis . pregnant woman and mother to child under 2 have access to the mother and child health and nutrition programme 's `` super cereal `` which is supplied with the intent of reducing stunting in child . world food programme supplementation remains the main food source for tanzania 's refugee . super cereal , vegetable oil , pulse and salt are supplied a part of the protracted relief and recovery operation to meet the average person minimum daily caloric requirement of 2,100 kcal . unicef state that continued investment in nutrition within tanzania is of the utmost importance : estimate predict that tanzania stand to lose $ 20 billion by 2025 if nutrition within the country remains at it current level , however improvement in nutrition could produce a gain of around $ 4.7 billion </s> save the child , with the help of unicef and irish aid funding created the partnership for nutrition in tanzania ( panita ) , in 2011 . panita aim to use civil society organisation to target nutrition within the country . alongside this , various sector associated with nutrition are targeted such a agriculture , water , sanitation , education , economic development and social progress . panita is responsible for ensuring significant attention is given to nutrition in development plan and budget created on national and regional level within tanzania . since it conception , panita ha grown from 94 to 306 participating civil society organisation nationwide . agriculture within tanzania is targeted by the irish aid led initiative harnessing agriculture for nutrition outcome ( hano ) , which aim to merge nutrition initiative with agriculture in the lindi district of the country . the project aim to reduce stunting by 10 % in child aged 0 to 23 month . </s> <section_title_start> science and technology <section_title_end> </s> tanzania 's first `` national science and technology policy `` wa adopted in 1996 . the objective of the government 's `` vision 2025 `` ( 1998 ) document wa to `` transform the economy into a strong , resilient and competitive one , buttressed by science and technology `` . </s> under the umbrella of the one un initiative , unesco and tanzanian government department and agency formulated a series of proposal in 2008 for revising the `` national science and technology policy `` . the total reform budget of u $ 10 ; million wa financed from the one un fund and other source . unesco provided support for mainstreaming science , technology , and innovation into the new `` national growth and poverty reduction strategy `` for the mainland and zanzibar namely , mkukuta ii and mkuza ii , including in the field of tourism . </s> tanzania 's revised science policy wa published in 2010 . entitled `` national research and development policy `` , it recognises the need to improve the process of prioritisation of research capacity , develop international co-operation in strategic area of research and development , and improve planning for human resource . it also make provision for the establishment of a national research fund . this policy wa , in turn , reviewed in 2012 and 2013. </s> in 2010 , tanzania devoted 0.38 per cent of gdp to research and development . the global average in 2013 wa 1.7 per cent of gdp . tanzania had 69 researcher ( in head count ) per million population in 2010 . in 2014 , tanzania counted 15 publication per million inhabitant in internationally catalogued journal , according to thomson reuters ' web of science ( science citation index expanded ) . the average for sub-saharan africa wa 20 publication per million inhabitant and the global average 176 publication per million inhabitant . </s> <section_title_start> demographics <section_title_end> </s> { class= `` wikitable `` style= `` float : right ; margin-left : 10px `` </s> + population in tanzania </s> - </s> ! scope= `` col `` style= `` background : # cfb ; `` year </s> ! scope= `` col `` style= `` background : # cfb ; `` million </s> - </s> 1950 style= `` text-align : right ; `` 7.9 </s> - </s> 2000 style= `` text-align : right ; `` 35.1 </s> - </s> style= `` text-align : right ; `` </s> } </s> according to the 2012 census , the total population wa 44,928,923 . the under-15 age group represented 44.1 per cent of the population . </s> the population distribution in tanzania is uneven . most people live on the northern border or the eastern coast , with much of the remainder of the country being sparsely populated . density varies from in the katavi region to in the dar e salaam region . </s> approximately 70 per cent of the population is rural , although this percentage ha been declining since at least 1967 . dar e salaam ( population 4,364,541 ) is the largest city and commercial capital . dodoma ( population 410,956 ) is located in the centre of tanzania , is the capital of the country , and host the national assembly ( tanzania ) . </s> at the time of the foundation of the united republic of tanzania in 1964 the child mortality rate wa 335 death per 1,000 live birth . since independence the rate of child death declined to 62 per 1000 birth . </s> the population consists of list of ethnic group in tanzania . the sukuma people , nyamwezi people , chaga people , and haya people people each have a population exceeding 1 million . approximately 99 per cent of tanzanian are of native ethnic group of africa descent , with small number of arab , european , and asian descent . the majority of tanzanian , including the sukuma and the nyamwezi , are bantu people . </s> the population also includes people of arab , persian , and indian in tanzania origin , and small european and chinese people in tanzania community . many also identify a shirazi ( ethnic group ) . thousand of arab , persian , and indian were massacred during the zanzibar revolution of 1964 . a of 1994 , the asian community numbered 50,000 on the mainland and 4,000 on zanzibar . an estimated 70,000 arab and 10,000 european lived in tanzania . </s> some albino in tanzania have been the victim of violence in recent year . attack are often to hack off the limb of albino in the perverse superstitious belief that possessing the bone of albino will bring wealth . the country ha banned witch doctor to try to prevent the practice , but it ha continued and albino remain target . </s> according to 2010 tanzanian government statistic , the total fertility rate in tanzania wa 5.4 child born per woman , with 3.7 in urban mainland area , 6.1 in rural mainland area , and 5.1 in zanzibar . for all woman aged 4549 , 37.3 per cent had given birth to eight or more child , and for currently married woman in that age group , 45.0 per cent had given birth to that many child . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> official statistic on religion are unavailable because religious survey were eliminated from government census report after 1967 . tanzania 's religious field is dominated by christianity and islam a well a of different african traditional religion connected to ethnic custom . the word for religion in swahili , dini , generally apply to the world religion of christianity and islam meaning that follower of african traditional religion are consider to be of `` no religion `` . religious belonging is often ambiguous , with some people adhering to multiple religious identity at the same time ( for instance being christian but also following african traditional ritual ) something which point to that religious boundary are flexible and contextual . </s> according to a 2014 estimate by the cia world factbook , 61.4 % of the population wa christian , 35.2 % wa muslim , 1.8 % practiced traditional african religion , 1.4 % were unaffiliated with any religion , and 0.2 % followed other religion . nearly the entire population of zanzibar is muslim . of muslim , 16 % are ahmadiyya , 20 % are non-denominational muslim , 40 % are sunni , 20 per cent are shia , and 4 % are sufism . </s> within the christian community the roman catholic church is the largest denomination ( 51 % all christian ) . among the protestant , the large number of lutheran and moravian church point to the german missionary past of the country , while the number of anglican point to the british missionary history of tanganyika . a growing number have adopted pentecostalism , and adventist likewise have an increasing presence because of external missionary activity from scandinavia and the united state , especially during the first part of the 20th century . all of them have had some influence in varying degree from the walokole movement east african revival ( east african revival ) , which ha also been fertile ground for the spread of charismatic christianity and pentecostal group . </s> there are also active community of other religious group , primarily on the mainland , such a buddhism , hinduism in tanzania , and bah faith bah 's . </s> <section_title_start> languages <section_title_end> </s> more than 100 language of tanzania , making it the most linguistically diverse country in east africa . among the language spoken are all four of africa 's language family : bantu language , cushitic language , nilotic language , and khoisan language . there are no de jure official language in tanzania . </s> swahili is used in parliamentary debate , in the lower court , and a a medium of instruction in primary school . english is used in foreign trade , in diplomacy , in higher court , and a a medium of instruction in secondary and higher education , the tanzanian government , however , ha plan to discontinue english a a language of instruction . in connection with his ujamaa social policy , president nyerere encouraged the use of swahili to help unify the country 's many ethnic group . approximately 10 per cent of tanzanian speak swahili a a first language , and up to 90 per cent speak it a a second language . many educated tanzanian are trilingual , also speaking english . the widespread use and promotion of swahili is contributing to the decline of smaller language in the country . young child increasingly speak swahili a a first language , particularly in urban area . ethnic community language ( ecl ) other than kiswahili are not allowed a a language of instruction . nor are they taught a a subject , though they might be used unofficially in some case in initial education . television and radio programme in an ecl are prohibited , and it is nearly impossible to get permission to publish a newspaper in an ecl . there is no department of local or regional african language and literature at the university of dar e salaam . </s> arabic is co-official in zanzibar . </s> the sandawe people speak a language that may be related to the khoe language of botswana and namibia , while the language of the hadzabe people , although it ha similar click consonant , is arguably a language isolate . the language of the iraqw people is cushitic . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> in 2012 , the literacy rate in tanzania for person aged 15 and over wa estimated to be 67.8 per cent . education is compulsory until child reach age 15 . in 2010 , 74.1 per cent of child age 5 to 14 year were attending school . the primary school completion rate wa 80.8 per cent in 2012. </s> <section_title_start> healthcare <section_title_end> </s> , life expectancy at birth wa 61 year . the under-five mortality rate in 2012 wa 54 per 1,000 live birth . the maternal mortality rate in 2013 wa estimated at 410 per 100,000 live birth . premature death and malaria were tied in 2010 a the leading cause of death in child under 5 year old . the other leading cause of death for these child were , in decreasing order , malaria , diarrhoea , hiv , and measles . </s> malaria in tanzania cause death and disease and ha a `` huge economic impact `` . there were approximately 11.5 ; million case of clinical malaria in 2008 . in 200708 , malaria prevalence among child aged 6 month to 5 year wa highest in the kagera region ( 41.1 per cent ) on the western shore of lake victoria and lowest in the arusha region ( 0.1 per cent ) . </s> according to the 2010 tanzania demographic and health survey 2010 , 15 per cent of tanzanian woman had undergone female genital mutilation ( fgm ) and 72 per cent of tanzanian men had been circumcised . fgm is most common in the manyara region , dodoma region , arusha region , and singida region region and nonexistent in zanzibar . the prevalence of male circumcision wa above 90 per cent in the eastern ( [ refdar e salaam region , pwani region , and morogoro region region ) , northern ( kilimanjaro region , tanga region , arusha , and manyara region ) , and central area ( dodoma and singida region region ) and below 50 per cent only in the southern highland zone ( mbeya region , iringa region , and rukwa region region ) . </s> 2012 data showed that 53 per cent of the population used improved drinking water source ( defined a a source that `` by nature of it construction and design , is likely to protect the source from outside contamination , in particular from faecal matter `` ) and 12 per cent used improved sanitation facility ( defined a facility that `` likely hygienically separate human excreta from human contact `` but not including facility shared with other household or open to public use ) . </s> <section_title_start> women <section_title_end> </s> woman and men have equality before the law . </s> the government signed the convention on the elimination of all form of discrimination against woman ( cedaw ) in 1985. </s> nearly 3 out of ten female reported having experienced sexual violence before the age of 18. </s> the prevalence of female genital mutilation ha decreased . </s> school girl are reinstated back to school after delivery . </s> the police force administration strives to separate the gender desk from normal police operation to enhance confidentiality of the processing of woman victim of abuse . </s> most of the abuse and violence against woman and child occurs at the family level . </s> the constitution of tanzania requires that woman to constitute at least 30 % of all elected member of national assembly ( tanzania ) . the gender difference in education and training have implication later in life of these woman and girl . </s> unemployment is higher for female than for male . the right of a female employee to maternity leave is guaranteed in labour law . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> literature <section_title_end> </s> tanzania 's literary culture is primarily oral . major oral literary form include folktale , poem , riddle , proverb , and song . the greatest part of tanzania 's recorded oral literature is in swahili , even though each of the country 's language ha it own oral tradition . the country 's oral literature ha been declining because of the breakdown of the multigenerational social structure , making transmission of oral literature more difficult , and because increasing modernisation ha been accompanied by the devaluation of oral literature . </s> book in tanzania are often expensive and hard to come by . most tanzanian literature is in swahili or english . major figure in tanzanian written literature include shaaban robert ( considered the father of swahili literature ) , muhammed saley farsy , faraji katalambulla , adam shafi adam , muhammed said abdulla , said ahmed mohammed khamis , mohamed suleiman mohamed , euphrase kezilahabi , gabriel ruhumbika , ebrahim hussein , may balisidya , fadhy mtanga , abdulrazak gurnah , and penina muhando penina o. mlama . </s> <section_title_start> painting and sculpture <section_title_end> </s> two tanzanian art style have achieved international recognition . the tingatinga ( painting ) school of painting , founded by edward said tingatinga , consists of brightly coloured enamel painting on canvas , generally depicting people , animal , or daily life . after tingatinga 's death in 1972 , other artist adopted and developed his style , with the genre now being the most important tourist-oriented style in east africa . </s> historically , there were limited opportunity for formal european art training in tanzania and many aspiring tanzanian artist left the country to pursue their vocation . </s> <section_title_start> sports <section_title_end> </s> association football is very popular throughout the country . the most popular tanzanian premier league in dar e salaam are the young african f.c . and simba s.c . the tanzania football federation is the governing body for football in the country . </s> other popular sport include basketball , netball , boxing , volleyball , athletics ( sport ) , and rugby union . the national sport council also known a baraza la michezo la taifa is the governing body for sport in the country under the ministry of information , youth , sport and culture . </s> online betting website parimatch wa launched in 2017 in tanzania . </s> <section_title_start> cinema <section_title_end> </s> tanzania ha a popular film industry known a `` bongo movie `` . the music industry is known a `` bongo flava `` which is in itself also a niche genre of music in tanzania . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * index of tanzania-related article </s> * outline of tanzania </s> * tanzania ( spider ) , a genus of
