category : state and territory established in 1975 </s> category : country in oceania <article_end> <article_start> </s> uganda ( yuganda ) , officially the republic of uganda ( jamhuri ya uganda ) , is a landlocked country in east africa east-central africa . it is bordered to the east by kenya , to the north by south sudan , to the west by the democratic republic of the congo , to the south-west by rwanda , and to the south by tanzania . the southern part of the country includes a substantial portion of lake victoria , shared with kenya and tanzania . uganda is in the african great lake region . uganda also lie within the nile and ha a varied but generally a modified equatorial climate . </s> uganda is named after the buganda kingdom , which encompasses a large portion of the south of the country , including the capital kampala . the people of uganda were [ until 1,700 to 2,300 year ago , when bantu language bantu ] -speaking population migrated to the southern part of the country . </s> beginning in 1894 , the area wa ruled a a protectorate by the uk , which established administrative law across the territory . uganda gained independence from the uk on 9 october 1962 . the period since then ha been marked by violent conflict , including an eight-year-long [ [ military dictatorship led by idi amin . </s> the official language are english and swahili language , although `` any other language may be used a a medium of instruction in school or other educational institution or for legislative , administrative or judicial purpose a may be prescribed by law . `` luganda , a central language , is widely spoken across the country , and several other language are also spoken , including lango dialect , acholi dialect , nyoro language , runyankole , rukiga , southern luo language and lusoga . </s> uganda 's current president is yoweri kaguta museveni , who took power in january 1986 after a protracted ugandan bush war six-year guerrilla war . following constitutional amendment that removed term limit for the president , he wa able to stand and wa elected president of uganda in the 2011 and in the 2016 general election . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> pre-colonial uganda <section_title_end> </s> the resident of uganda were [ until 1,7002,300 year ago . bantu language bantu ] -speaking population , who were probably from central africa , migrated to the southern part of the country . </s> according to [ [ oral tradition , the empire of kitara covered an important part of the great lake of africa , from the northern lake lake albert ( uganda ) and lake kyoga to the southern lake lake victoria and lake tanganyika . bunyoro bunyoro-kitara is claimed a the antecedent of the toro kingdom , ankole , and busoga kingdom . </s> some luo people invaded the area of bunyoro and assimilated with the bantu society there , establishing the babiito dynasty of the current omukama of bunyoro ( ruler ) of bunyoro-kitara . </s> arab trader moved inland from the indian ocean coast of east africa in the 1830s for trade and commerce . in the late 1860s , bunyoro in north-eastern uganda found itself threatened from the north by egyptian-sponsored agent , unlike the arab trader from the east african coast who sought trade , were promoting foreign conquest . in 1869 , khedive ismail of egypt of egypt , seeking to annex the territory north of the border of lake victoria and east of lake albert ( africa ) and `` south of gondokoro , `` sent a british explorer , samuel baker , on a military expedition to the frontier of northern uganda , with the object of suppressing the slave-trade there and opening the way to commerce and civilization . the banyoro resisted baker , and he had to fight a desperate battle to secure his retreat . baker regarded the resistance a an act of treachery , and he denounced the banyoro in a book ( ismailia a narrative of the expedition to central africa for the suppression of slave trade , organised by ismail , khadive of egypt ( 1874 ) ) that wa widely read in britain . later the british arrived in uganda with a predisposition against bunyoro and siding with buganda which eventually would cost the kingdom half it territory until the `` lost county `` restored to bunyoro after independence . </s> in the 1860s , while arab sought influence from the north , british explorer searching for the source of the nile arrived in uganda . they were followed by british anglican missionary who arrived in the kingdom of buganda in 1877 ( a situation which gave rise to the death of the uganda martyr ) and were also followed by french catholic missionary in 1879 . the british government chartered the imperial british east africa company ( ibeac ) to negotiate trade agreement in the region beginning in 1888 . from 1886 , there were a series of religious war in buganda , initially between muslim and christian and then , from 1890 , between ba-ingleza protestant and ba-fransa catholic . because of civil unrest and financial burden , ibeac claimed that it wa unable to `` maintain their occupation `` in the region . british commercial interest were ardent to protect the trade route of the nile , which prompted the british government to annexe buganda and adjoining territory to create the uganda protectorate in 1894. </s> <section_title_start> uganda protectorate ( 18941962 ) <section_title_end> </s> the uganda protectorate wa a protectorate of the british empire from 1894 to 1962 . in 1893 , the imperial british east africa company transferred it administration right of territory consisting mainly of the kingdom of buganda to the british government . the imperial british east africa company relinquished it control over uganda after ugandan internal religious war had driven it into bankruptcy . </s> in 1894 , the uganda protectorate wa established , and the territory wa extended beyond the border of buganda by signing more treaty with the other kingdom ( toro ( kingdom ) in 1900 , ankole in 1901 , and bunyoro in 1933 ) to an area that roughly corresponds to that of present-day uganda . </s> the status of protectorate had significantly different consequence for uganda than had the region been made a colony like neighboring kenya , insofar a uganda retained a degree of self-government that would have otherwise been limited under a full colonial administration . </s> in the 1890s , 32,000 labourer from british india were indian diaspora in east africa under indentured labour contract to construct the uganda railway . most of the surviving indian returned home , but 6,724 decided to remain in east africa after the line 's completion . subsequently , some became trader and took control of cotton ginning and sartorial retail . </s> from 1900 to 1920 , a african trypanosomiasis epidemic in the southern part of uganda , along the north shore of lake victoria , killed more than 250,000 people . </s> <section_title_start> independence ( 1962 to 1965 ) <section_title_end> </s> uganda gained independence from the uk on 9 october 1962 with queen elizabeth ii a head of state and queen of uganda . in october 1963 , uganda became a republic but maintained it membership in the commonwealth of nation . </s> the first post-independence election , held in 1962 , wa won by an alliance between the uganda people 's congress ( upc ) and kabaka yekka ( ky ) . upc and ky formed the first post-independence government with milton obote a executive prime minister , with the buganda kabaka ( king ) mutesa ii of buganda holding the largely ceremonial position of president . </s> <section_title_start> buganda crisis ( 19621966 ) <section_title_end> </s> uganda 's immediate post-independence year were dominated by the relationship between the central government and the largest regional kingdom buganda . </s> from the moment the british created the uganda protectorate , the issue of how to manage the largest monarchy within the framework of a unitary state had always been a problem . colonial governor had failed to come up with a formula that worked . this wa further complicated by buganda 's nonchalant attitude to it relationship with the central government . buganda never sought independence but rather appeared to be comfortable with a loose arrangement that guaranteed them privilege above the other subject within the protectorate or a special status when the british left . this wa evidenced in part by hostility between the british colonial authority and buganda prior to independence . </s> within buganda , there were division between those who wanted the kabaka of buganda to remain a dominant monarch and those who wanted to join with the rest of uganda to create a modern secular state . the split resulted in the creation of two dominant buganda based party the kabaka yekka ( kabaka only ) ky , and the democratic party ( uganda ) ( dp ) that had root in the catholic church . the bitterness between these two party wa extremely intense especially a the first election for the post-colonial parliament approached . the kabaka particularly disliked the dp leader , benedicto kiwanuka . </s> outside buganda , a soft-spoken politician from northern uganda , milton obote , had forged an alliance of non-buganda politician to form the uganda people 's congress ( upc ) . the upc at it heart wa dominated by politician who wanted to rectify what they saw a the regional inequality that favoured buganda 's special status . this drew in substantial support from outside buganda . the party however remained a loose alliance of interest , but obote showed great skill at negotiating them into a common ground based on a federal formula . </s> at independence , the buganda question remained unresolved . uganda wa one of the few colonial territory that achieved independence without a dominant political party with a clear majority in parliament . in the pre-independence election , the upc ran no candidate in buganda and won 37 of the 61 directly elected seat ( outside buganda ) . the dp won 24 seat outside buganda . the `` special status `` granted to buganda meant that the 21 buganda seat were elected by proportional representation reflecting the election to the buganda parliament the lukikko . ky won a resounding victory over dp , winning all 21 seat . </s> the upc reached a high at the end of 1964 when the leader of the dp in parliament , basil kiiza bataringaya , crossed the parliamentary floor with five other mp , leaving dp with only nine seat . the dp mp were not particularly happy that the hostility of their leader , benedicto kiwanuka , towards the kabaka wa hindering their chance of compromise with ky . the trickle of defection turned into a flood when 10 ky member crossed the floor when they realised the formal coalition with the upc wa no longer viable . obote 's charismatic speech across the country were sweeping all before him , and the upc wa winning almost every local election held and increasing it control over all district council and legislature outside buganda . the response from the kabaka wa mute probably content in his ceremonial role and symbolism in his part of the country . however , there were also major division within his palace that made it difficult for him to act effectively against obote . by the time uganda had become independent , buganda `` wa a divided house with contending social and political force `` there were however problem brewing inside the upc . a it rank swelled , the ethnic , religious , regional , and personal interest began to shake the party . the party 's apparent strength wa eroded in a complex sequence of factional conflict in it central and regional structure . and by 1966 , the upc wa tearing itself apart . the conflict were further intensified by the newcomer who had crossed the parliamentary floor from dp and ky. </s> the upc delegate arrived in gulu in 1964 for their delegate conference . here wa the first demonstration a to how obote wa losing control of his party . the battle over the secretary-general of the party wa a bitter contest between the new moderate 's candidate grace ibingira and the radical john kakonge . ibingira subsequently became the symbol of the opposition to obote within the upc . this is an important factor when looking at the subsequent event that led to the crisis between buganda and the central government . for those outside the upc ( including ky supporter ) , this wa a sign that obote wa vulnerable . keen observer realised the upc wa not a cohesive unit . </s> the collapse of the upc-ky alliance openly revealed the dissatisfaction obote and others had about buganda 's `` special status `` . in 1964 , the government responded to demand from some part of the vast buganda kingdom that they were not the kabaka 's subject . prior to colonial rule , buganda had been rivalled by the neighbouring bunyoro kingdom . buganda had conquered part of bunyoro and the british colonialist had formalised this in the buganda agreement . known a the `` lost county `` , the people in these area wished to revert to being part of bunyoro . obote decided to allow a referendum , which angered the kabaka and most of the rest of buganda . the resident of the county voted to return to bunyoro despite the kabaka 's attempt to influence the vote . having lost the referendum , ky opposed the bill to pas the county to bunyoro , thus ending the alliance with the upc . </s> the tribal nature of ugandan politics wa also manifesting itself in government . the upc which had previously been a national party began to break along tribal line when ibingira challenged obote in the upc . the `` north/south `` ethnic divide that had been evident in economic and social sphere now entrenched itself in politics . obote surrounded himself with mainly northern politician a . a. neykon , felix onama , alex ojera while ibingira 's supporter who were subsequently arrested and jailed with him , were mainly from the south george magezi , b. kirya , matthias ngobi . in time , the two faction acquired ethnic label `` bantu `` ( the mainly southern ibingira faction ) and `` nilotic `` ( the mainly northern obote faction ) . the perception that the government wa at war with the bantu wa further enhanced when obote arrested and imprisoned the mainly bantu minister who backed ibingira . </s> these label brought into the mix two very powerful influence . first buganda the people of buganda are bantu and therefore naturally aligned to the ibingira faction . the ibingira faction further advanced this alliance by accusing obote of wanting to overthrow the kabaka . they were now aligned to opposing obote . second the security force the british colonialist had recruited the army and police almost exclusively from northern uganda due to their perceived suitability for these role . at independence , the army and police wa dominated by northern tribe mainly nilotic . they would now feel more affiliated to obote , and he took full advantage of this to consolidate his power . in april 1966 , obote passed out eight hundred new army recruit at moroto town , of whom seventy percent came from the northern region . </s> at the time there wa a tendency to perceive central government and security force a dominated by `` northerner `` particularly the acholi who through the upc had significant access to government position at national level . in northern uganda there were also varied degree of anti-buganda feeling , particularly over the kingdom 's `` special status `` before and after independence , and all the economic and social benefit that came with this status . `` obote brought significant number of northerner into the central state , both through the civil service and military , and created a patronage machine in northern uganda `` . however , both `` bantu `` and `` nilotic `` label represent significant ambiguity . the bantu category for example includes both buganda and bunyoro historically bitter rival . the nilotic label includes the lugbara , acholi , and langi , all of whom have bitter rivalry that were to define uganda 's military politics later . despite these ambiguity , these event unwittingly brought to fore the northerner/southerner political divide which to some extent still influence ugandan politics . </s> the upc fragmentation continued a opponent sensed obote 's vulnerability . at local level where the upc dominated most council discontent began to challenge incumbent council leader . even in obote 's home district , attempt were made to oust the head of the local district council in 1966 . a more worrying fact for the upc wa that the next national election loomed in 1967 and without the support of ky ( who were now likely to back the dp ) , and the growing factionalism in the upc , there wa the real possibility that the upc would be out of power in month . </s> obote went after ky with a new act of parliament in early 1966 that blocked any attempt by ky to expand outside buganda . ky appeared to respond in parliament through one of their few remaining mp , the terminally ill daudi ochieng . ochieng wa an irony although from northern uganda , he had risen high in the rank of ky and become a close confidant to the kabaka who had gifted him with large land title in buganda . in obote 's absence from parliament , ochieng laid bare the illegal plundering of ivory and gold from the congo that had been orchestrated by obote 's army chief of staff , colonel idi amin . he further alleged that obote , onama and neykon had all benefited from the scheme . parliament overwhelmingly voted in favour of a motion to censure amin and investigate obote 's involvement . this shook the government and raised tension in the country . </s> ky further demonstrated it ability to challenge obote from within his party at the upc buganda conference where godfrey binaisa ( the attorney general ) wa ousted by a faction believed to have the backing of ky , ibingira and other anti-obote element in buganda . obote 's response wa to arrest ibingira and other minister at a cabinet meeting and to assume special power in february 1966 . in march 1966 , obote also announced that the office of president and vice-president would cease to exist effectively dismissing the kabaka . obote also gave amin more power giving him the army commander position over the previous holder ( opolot ) who had relation to buganda through marriage ( possibly believing opolot would be reluctant to take military action against the kabaka if it came to that ) . obote abolished the constitution and effectively suspended election due in a few month . obote went on television and radio to accuse the kabaka of various offence including requesting foreign troop which appears to have been explored by the kabaka following the rumour of amin plotting a coup . obote further dismantled the authority of the kabaka by announcing among other measure : </s> * the abolition of independent public service commission for federal unit . this removed the kabaka 's authority to appoint civil servant in buganda . </s> * the abolition of the buganda high court removing any judicial authority the kabaka had . </s> * the bringing of buganda financial management under further central control . </s> * abolition of land for buganda chief . land is one the key source of kabaka 's power over his subject . </s> the line were now drawn for a show down between buganda and the central government . historian may argue about whether this could have been avoided through compromise . this wa unlikely a obote now felt emboldened and saw the kabaka a weak . indeed , by accepting the presidency four year earlier and siding with the upc , the kabaka had divided his people and taken the side of one against the other . within buganda 's political institution , rivalry driven by religion and personal ambition made the institution ineffective and unable to respond to the central government move . the kabaka wa often regarded a aloof and unresponsive to advice from the younger buganda politician who better understood the new post-independence politics , unlike the traditionalist who were ambivalent to what wa going on a long a their traditional benefit were maintained . the kabaka favoured the neo-traditionalists . </s> in may 1966 , the kabaka made his move . he asked for foreign help and the buganda parliament demanded that the uganda government leave buganda ( including the capital , kampala ) . in response obote ordered idi amin to attack the kabaka 's palace . the battle for the kabaka 's palace wa fierce the kabaka 's guard putting up more resistance that had been expected . the british trained captain the kabaka with about 120 armed men kept idi amin at bay for twelve hour . it is estimated that up to 2,000 people died in the battle which ended when the army called in heavier gun and overran the palace . the anticipated countryside uprising in buganda did not materialise and a few hour later a beaming obote met the press to relish his victory . the kabaka escaped over the palace wall and wa transported into exile in london by supporter . he died there three year later . </s> <section_title_start> 19661971 ( before the coup ) <section_title_end> </s> in 1966 , following a power struggle between the obote-led government and king muteesa , obote suspended the constitution and removed the ceremonial president and vice-president . in 1967 , a new constitution proclaimed uganda a republic and abolished the traditional kingdom . obote wa declared the president . </s> <section_title_start> 1971 ( after the coup ) 1979 ( end of amin regime ) <section_title_end> </s> after a 1971 ugandan coup d'tat , obote wa deposed from power and general idi amin seized control of the country . amin ruled uganda a dictator with the support of the military for the next eight year . he carried out mass killing within the country to maintain his rule . an estimated 80,000500,000 ugandan lost their life during his regime . aside from his brutality , he expulsion of asian in uganda in 1972 the entrepreneurial indian people minority from uganda . in june 1976 , palestinian terrorist hijacked an air france flight and forced it to land at entebbe international airport . one hundred of the 250 passenger originally on board were held hostage until an operation entebbe rescued them ten day later . amin 's reign wa ended after the uganda-tanzania war in 1979 , in which tanzanian force aided by ugandan exile invaded uganda . </s> <section_title_start> 1979present <section_title_end> </s> yoweri museveni ha been president since his force toppled the previous regime in january 1986. </s> list of political party in uganda were restricted in their activity beginning that year , in a measure ostensibly designed to reduce sectarian violence . in the non-partisan democracy non-party `` movement `` system instituted by museveni , political party continued to exist , but they could operate only a headquarters office . they could not open branch , hold rally , or field candidate directly ( although electoral candidate could belong to political party ) . a constitutional referendum cancelled this nineteen-year ban on multi-party politics in july 2005. </s> in the mid-to-late 1990s , museveni wa lauded by western country a part of a new generation of african leader . </s> his presidency ha been marred , however , by invading and occupying the democratic republic of the congo during the second congo war , resulting in an estimated 5.4 million death since 1998 , and by participating in other conflict in the great lake ( africa ) . he ha struggled for year in the civil war against the lord 's resistance army , which ha been guilty of numerous crime against humanity , including child slavery , the atiak massacre , and other mass murder . conflict in northern uganda ha killed thousand and displaced million . </s> parliament abolished presidential term limit in 2005 , allegedly because museveni used public fund to pay u $ 2,000 to each member of parliament who supported the measure . presidential election were held in february 2006 . museveni ran against several candidate , the most prominent of them being kizza besigye . </s> on 20 february 2011 , the uganda electoral commission declared the incumbent president yoweri kaguta museveni the winning candidate of the 2011 election that were held on 18 february 2011 . the opposition however , were not satisfied with the result , condemning them a full of sham and rigging . according to the official result , museveni won with 68 percent of the vote . this easily topped his nearest challenger , besigye , who had been museveni 's physician and told reporter that he and his supporter `` downrightly snub `` the outcome a well a the unremitting rule of museveni or any person he may appoint . besigye added that the rigged election would definitely lead to an illegitimate leadership and that it is up to ugandan to critically analyse this . the european union 's election observation mission reported on improvement and flaw of the ugandan electoral process : `` the electoral campaign and polling day were conducted in a peaceful manner [ ... ] however , the electoral process wa marred by avoidable administrative and logistical failure that led to an unacceptable number of ugandan citizen being disfranchised . `` </s> since august 2012 , hacktivist group anonymous ( group ) ha threatened ugandan official and hacked official government website over it anti-gay bill . some international donor have threatened to cut financial aid to the country if anti-gay bill continue . </s> indicator of a plan for succession by the president 's son , muhoozi kainerugaba , have increased tension . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> uganda is located in southeast africa between 1 n and 4 n latitude , and 30 e and 35 e longitude , it geography is very diverse consisting of volcanic hill , mountain , and lake . the country sits at an average of 900 meter above sea level . both the eastern and western border of uganda have mountain . the ruwenzori mountain range contains the highest peak in uganda , which is named alexandra and measure 5,094 meter . </s> <section_title_start> lakes and rivers <section_title_end> </s> much of the south of the country is heavily influenced by one of the world 's biggest lake , lake victoria , which contains many island . most important city are located in the south , near this lake , including the capital kampala and the nearby city of entebbe . </s> lake kyoga is in the centre of the country and is surrounded by extensive marshy area . </s> although landlocked , uganda contains many large lake . besides lake victoria and kyoga , there are lake albert ( africa ) , lake edward , and the smaller lake george ( uganda ) . </s> uganda lie almost completely within the nile basin . the victoria nile drain from lake victoria into lake kyoga and thence into lake albert on the congolese border . it then run northward into south sudan . an area in eastern uganda is drained by the turkwel river , part of the internal drainage basin of lake turkana . the extreme north-eastern part of uganda drain into the lotikipi basin , which is primarily in kenya . </s> <section_title_start> environment and conservation <section_title_end> </s> uganda ha list of protected area in uganda , including ten national park : bwindi impenetrable national park and rwenzori mountain national park ( both unesco world heritage site ) , kibale national park , kidepo valley national park , lake mburo national park , mgahinga gorilla national park , mount elgon national park , murchison fall national park , queen elizabeth national park , and semuliki national park . </s> the country had a 2019 forest landscape integrity index mean score of 4.36/10 , ranking it 128th globally out of 172 country . </s> <section_title_start> government and politics <section_title_end> </s> the president of uganda is both [ of state ] and [ of government ] . the president appoints a vice-president and a prime minister of uganda to aid him in governing . </s> the parliament is formed by the national assembly of uganda , which ha 449 member . these include ; 290 constituency representative , 116 district woman representative , 10 representative of the uganda people defence force , 5 representative of the youth , 5 representative of worker , 5 representative of person with disability and 18 ex-official member . </s> <section_title_start> corruption <section_title_end> </s> transparency international ha rated uganda 's public sector a one of the most corrupt in the world . in 2016 , uganda ranked 151st worst out of 176 and had a score of 25 on a scale from 0 ( perceived a most corrupt ) to 100 ( perceived a clean ) . </s> the world bank 's 2015 worldwide governance indicator ranked uganda in the worst 12 percentile of all country . according to the united state department of state 's 2012 human right report on uganda , `` the world bank 's most recent worldwide governance indicator reflected corruption wa a severe problem `` and that `` the country annually loses 768.9 billion shilling ( $ 286 million ) to corruption . `` </s> ugandan parliamentarian in 2014 earned 60 time what wa earned by most state employee , and they sought a major increase . this caused widespread criticism and protest , including the smuggling of two piglet into the parliament in june 2014 to highlight corruption amongst member of parliament . the protester , who were arrested , used the word `` mpigs `` to highlight their grievance . </s> a specific scandal , which had significant international consequence and highlighted the presence of corruption in high-level government office , wa the embezzlement of $ 12.6 million of donor fund from the office of the prime minister in 2012 . these fund were `` earmarked a crucial support for rebuilding northern uganda , ravaged by a 20-year war , and karamoja , uganda 's poorest region . `` this scandal prompted the eu , the uk , germany , denmark , ireland , and norway to suspend aid . </s> widespread grand and petty corruption involving public official and political patronage system have also seriously affected the investment climate in uganda . one of the high corruption risk area is the public procurement in which non-transparent under-the-table cash payment are often demanded from procurement officer . </s> what may ultimately compound this problem is the availability of oil . the petroleum bill , passed by parliament in 2012 and touted by the nrm a bringing transparency to the oil sector , ha failed to please domestic and international political commentator and economist . for instance , angelo izama , a ugandan energy analyst at the us-based open society foundation said the new law wa tantamount to `` handing over an atm ( cash ) machine `` to museveni and his regime . according to global witness in 2012 , a non-governmental organisation devoted to international law , uganda now ha `` oil reserve that have the potential to double the government 's revenue within six to ten year , worth an estimated u $ 2.4 billion per year . `` </s> the non-governmental organization ( amendment ) act , passed in 2006 , ha stifled the productivity of ngo through erecting barrier to entry , activity , funding and assembly within the sector . burdensome and corrupt registration procedure ( i.e . requiring recommendation from government official ; annual re-registration ) , unreasonable regulation of operation ( i.e . requiring government notification prior to making contact with individual in ngo 's area of interest ) , and the precondition that all foreign fund be passed through the bank of uganda , among other thing , are severely limiting the output of the ngo sector . furthermore , the sector 's freedom of speech ha been continually infringed upon through the use of intimidation , and the recent public order management bill ( severely limiting freedom of assembly ) will only add to the government 's stockpile of ammunition . </s> <section_title_start> administrative divisions <section_title_end> </s> a of 2018 , uganda is divided into 121 district of uganda . rural area of district are subdivided into sub-counties of uganda sub-counties , parish , and village . municipal and town council are designated in urban area of district . </s> political subdivision in uganda are officially served and united by the uganda local government association ( ulga ) , a voluntary and non-profit body which also serf a a forum for support and guidance for ugandan sub-national government . </s> parallel with the state administration , five traditional bantu people kingdom have remained , enjoying some degree of mainly cultural autonomy . the kingdom are toro kingdom , busoga , bunyoro , buganda , and rwenzururu . furthermore , some group attempt to restore ankole a one of the officially recognised traditional kingdom , to no avail yet . several other kingdom and chiefdoms are officially recognised by the government , including the union of alur chiefdoms , the iteso paramount chieftaincy , the paramount chieftaincy of lango and the padhola state . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relation <section_title_end> </s> uganda is a member of the east african community ( eac ) , along with kenya , tanzania , rwanda , burundi and south sudan . according to the east african common market protocol of 2010 , the free trade and free movement of people is guaranteed , including the right to reside in another member country for purpose of employment . this protocol , however , ha not been implemented because of work permit and other bureaucratic , legal , and financial obstacle . uganda is a founding member of the intergovernmental authority on development ( igad ) an eight-country bloc including government from the horn of africa , nile valley and the african great lake . it headquarters are in djibouti city . uganda is also a member of the organization of islamic cooperation . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> in uganda , the uganda people 's defence force serf a the military . the list of country by number of military and paramilitary personnel is estimated at 45,000 soldier on active duty . the uganda army is involved in several peacekeeping and combat mission in the region , with commentator noting that only the united state armed force is deployed in more country . uganda ha soldier deployed in the northern and eastern area of the democratic republic of the congo and in the central african republic , somalia , and south sudan . </s> <section_title_start> human rights <section_title_end> </s> there are many area which continue to attract concern when it come to human right in uganda . </s> conflict in the northern part of the country continues to generate report of abuse by both the rebel lord 's resistance army ( lra ) , led by joseph kony , and the uganda people 's defence force . a un official accused the lra in february 2009 of `` appalling brutality `` in the democratic republic of congo . </s> the number of internally displaced person is estimated at 1.4 ; million . torture continues to be a widespread practice amongst security organisation . attack on political freedom in the country , including the arrest and beating of opposition member of parliament , have led to international criticism , culminating in may 2005 in a decision by the british government to withhold part of it aid to the country . the arrest of the main opposition leader kizza besigye and the siege of the high court ( uganda ) during a hearing of besigye 's case by heavily armed security force before the ugandan general election , 2006 led to condemnation . </s> child labour is common in uganda . many child worker are active in agriculture . child who work on tobacco farm </s> in uganda are exposed to health hazard . child domestic servant in uganda risk sexual abuse . trafficking of child occurs . slavery </s> and forced labour are prohibited by the ugandan constitution . </s> the u committee for refugee and immigrant reported several violation of refugee right in 2007 , including forcible deportation by the ugandan government and violence directed against refugee . </s> torture and extrajudicial killing have been a pervasive problem in uganda in recent year . for instance , according to a 2012 u state department report , `` the african center for treatment and rehabilitation for torture victim registered 170 allegation of torture against police , 214 against the updf , 1 against military police , 23 against the special investigation unit , 361 against unspecified security personnel , and 24 against prison official `` between january and september 2012. </s> in september 2009 museveni refused kabaka muwenda mutebi , the baganda king , permission to visit some area of buganda kingdom , particularly the kayunga district . riot occurred and over 40 people were killed while others remain imprisoned to this date . furthermore , 9 more people were killed during the april 2011 `` walk to work `` demonstration . according to the human right watch 2013 world report on uganda , the government ha failed to investigate the killing associated with both of these event . </s> <section_title_start> lgbt rights <section_title_end> </s> in 2007 , a ugandan newspaper , the red pepper ( newspaper ) , published a list of allegedly gay men , many of whom suffered harassment a a result . </s> on 9 october 2010 , the ugandan newspaper rolling stone ( uganda ) published a front-page article titled `` 100 picture of uganda 's top homo leak `` that listed the name , address , and photograph of 100 homosexual alongside a yellow banner that read `` hang them `` . the paper also alleged that homosexual aimed to homosexual recruitment ugandan child . this publication attracted international attention and criticism from human right organisation , such a amnesty international , no peace without justice and the international lesbian , gay , bisexual , trans and intersex association . according to gay right activist , many ugandan have been attacked since the publication . on 27 january 2011 , gay right activist david kato wa murdered . </s> in 2009 , the ugandan parliament considered an uganda anti-homosexuality bill anti-homosexuality bill that would have broadened the criminalisation of homosexuality by introducing the death penalty for people who have previous conviction , or are hiv-positive , and engage in same-sex sexual act . the bill also included provision for ugandan who engage in same-sex sexual relation outside of uganda , asserting that they may be extradition back to uganda for punishment , and included penalty for individual , company , medium organisation , or non-governmental organization that support legal protection for homosexuality or sodomy . the private member 's bill wa submitted by member of parliament david bahati in uganda on 14 october 2009 , and wa believed to have had widespread support in the uganda parliament . the hacktivist group anonymous hacked into ugandan government website in protest of the bill . the debate of the bill wa delayed in response to global condemnation but wa eventually passed on 20 december 2013 and signed by president yoweri museveni on 24 february 2014 . the death penalty wa dropped in the final legislation . the law wa widely condemned by the international community . denmark , the netherlands , and sweden said they would withhold aid . the world bank on 28 february 2014 said it would postpone a u $ 90 million loan , while the united state said it wa reviewing tie with uganda . on 1 august 2014 , the constitutional court of uganda ruled the bill invalid a it wa not passed with the required quorum . a 13 august 2014 news report said that the ugandan attorney general had dropped all plan to appeal , per a directive from president museveni who wa concerned about foreign reaction to the bill and who also said that any newly introduced bill should not criminalise same-sex relationship between consenting adult . progress on the continent of africa ha been slow but progressing with south africa being the only country where same sex marriage are recognised . </s> <section_title_start> economy and infrastructure <section_title_end> </s> the bank of uganda is the central bank of uganda and handle monetary policy along with the printing of the ugandan shilling . </s> in 2015 , uganda 's economy generated export income from the following merchandise : coffee ( u $ 402.63 million ) , oil re-exports ( u $ 131.25 million ) , base metal and product ( u $ 120.00 million ) , fish ( u $ 117.56 million ) , maize ( u $ 90.97 million ) , cement ( u $ 80.13 million ) , tobacco ( u $ 73.13 million ) , tea ( u $ 69.94 million ) , sugar ( u $ 66.43 million ) , hide and skin ( u $ 62.71 million ) , cocoa bean ( u $ 55.67 million ) , bean ( u $ 53.88 million ) , sesame ( u $ 52.20 million ) , flower ( u $ 51.44 million ) , and other product ( u $ 766.77 million ) . </s> the country ha been experiencing consistent economic growth . in fiscal year 201516 , uganda recorded gross domestic product growth of 4.6 percent in real term and 11.6 percent in nominal term . this compare to 5.0 percent real growth in fiscal year 201415 . </s> the country ha largely untapped reserve of both crude oil and natural gas . while agriculture accounted for 56 percent of the economy in 1986 , with coffee a it main export , it ha now been surpassed by the service sector , which accounted for 52 percent of gdp in 2007 . in the 1950s , the british colonial regime encouraged some 500,000 subsistence farmer to join co-operatives . since 1986 , the government ( with the support of foreign country and international agency ) ha acted to rehabilitate an economy devastated during the regime of idi amin and the subsequent civil war . </s> in 2012 , the world bank still listed uganda on the heavily indebted poor country list . </s> economic growth ha not always led to poverty reduction . despite an average annual growth of 2.5 percent between 2000 and 2003 , poverty level increased by 3.8 percent during that time . this ha highlighted the importance of avoiding jobless growth and is part of the rising awareness in development circle of the need for development economics # equitable growth not just in uganda , but across the developing world . </s> with the uganda security exchange established in 1996 , several equity have been listed . the government ha used the stock market a an avenue for privatisation . all government treasury issue are listed on the security exchange . the capital market authority ha licensed 18 broker , asset manager , and investment advisor including : african alliance investment bank , baroda capital market uganda limited , crane financial service uganda limited , crested stock and security limited , dyer & blair investment bank , equity stock broker uganda limited , renaissance capital investment bank and uap financial service limited . a one of the way of increasing formal domestic saving , pension sector reform is the centre of attention ( 2007 ) . </s> uganda traditionally depends on kenya for access to the indian ocean port of mombasa . effort have intensified to establish a second access route to the sea via the lakeside port of bukasa in uganda and musoma in tanzania , connected by railway to arusha in the tanzanian interior and to the port of tanga , tanzania on the indian ocean . </s> uganda is a member of the east african community and a potential member of the planned east african federation . </s> uganda ha a large diaspora , residing mainly in the united state and the united kingdom . this diaspora ha contributed enormously to uganda 's economic growth through remittance and other investment ( especially property ) . according to the world bank , uganda received in 2016 an estimated u $ 1.099 billion in remittance from abroad , second only to kenya ( u $ 1.574 billion ) in the east african community . and seventh in africa uganda also serf a an economic hub for a number of neighbouring country like the democratic republic of the congo , south sudan , and rwanda . </s> the ugandan bureau of statistic announced inflation wa 4.6 percent in november 2016 . on 29 june 2018 , uganda 's statistic agency said the country registered a drop in inflation to 3.4 percent in the financial year ending 2017/18 compared to the 5.7 percent recorded in the financial year 2016/17 . </s> <section_title_start> industry <section_title_end> </s> uganda ranked a list of country by gdp ( nominal ) among the country of the world in nominal gross domestic product by the international monetary fund with a gdp of 26,349 ( u $ million ) . the world bank ranked uganda a list of country by gdp ( nominal ) in nominal gdp with a gdp of 25,891 ( u $ million ) . </s> based on the gdp with purchasing power parity the imf ranked uganda a list of country by gdp ( ppp ) ( 91,212 million of current int $ ) and the world bank list of country by gdp ( ppp ) ( 79,889 million of current int $ ) . </s> since the 1990s , the economy in uganda is growing . real gross domestic product ( gdp ) grew at an average of 6.7 % annually during the period 19902015 , whereas real gdp per caput grew at 3.3 % per annum during the same period . </s> <section_title_start> poverty <section_title_end> </s> uganda is one of the poorest nation in the world . in 2012 , 37.8 percent of the population lived on le than $ 1.25 a day . despite making enormous progress in reducing the countrywide poverty incidence from 56 percent of the population in 1992 to 24.5 percent in 2009 , poverty remains deep-rooted in the country 's rural area , which are home to 84 percent of ugandan . </s> people in rural area of uganda depend on farming a the main source of income and 90 per cent of all rural woman work in the agricultural sector . in addition to agricultural work , rural woman are responsible for the caretaking of their family . the average ugandan woman spends 9 hour a day on domestic task , such a preparing food and clothing , fetching water and firewood , and caring for the elderly , the sick a well a orphan . a such , woman on average work longer hour than men , between 12 and 18 hour per day , with a mean of 15 hour , a compared to men , who work between 8 and 10 hour a day . </s> to supplement their income , rural woman may engage in small-scale entrepreneurial activity such a rearing and selling local breed of animal . nonetheless , because of their heavy workload , they have little time for these income-generating activity . the poor can not support their child at school and in most case , girl drop out of school to help out in domestic work or to get married . other girl engage in sex work . a a result , young woman tend to have older and more sexually experienced partner and this put woman at a disproportionate risk of getting affected by hiv , accounting for about 5.7 per cent of all adult living with hiv in uganda . </s> maternal health in rural uganda lag behind national policy target and the millennium development goal , with geographical inaccessibility , lack of transport and financial burden identified a key demand-side constraint to accessing maternal health service ; a such , intervention like intermediate transport mechanism have been adopted a a mean to improve woman 's access to maternal health care service in rural region of the country . </s> gender inequality is the main hindrance to reducing woman 's poverty . woman are subjected to an overall lower social status than men . for many woman , this reduces their power to act independently , participate in community life , become educated and escape reliance upon abusive men . </s> <section_title_start> air transportation <section_title_end> </s> there are list of airport in uganda in uganda . commercial airline operate scheduled passenger service out of four airport . uganda ha an international airport , entebbe international airport , which is located south-west of kampala . in 2017 the airport traffic hit 1.53 million passenger , 8 % more than the previous year . a second international airport , hoima international airport , is currently under construction . </s> <section_title_start> road network <section_title_end> </s> road transportation is the most important way of transportation in uganda . 95 % of freight and passenger traffic is handled by road traffic . the road network in uganda is approximately long . about 4 % of these road are paved which mean about . the different type of road are national road ( 17 % ) , district road ( 26 % ) , urban road ( 7 % ) , and community road ( 50 % ) . the national road make up about 17 % of the road network but carry over 80 % of the total road traffic . in uganda there are 83,000 private car which mean 2.94 car per 1000 inhabitant . </s> <section_title_start> railroad <section_title_end> </s> the rail network in uganda is approximately long . the longest line are the main line from kampala to tororo ( ) , the western line from kampala to kasese ( ) , the northern line from tororo to pakwach ( ) . </s> <section_title_start> communications <section_title_end> </s> there are seven telecommunication company serving over 21 million subscriber in a population of over 34 million . more than 95 percent of internet connection are made using mobile phone . </s> the total mobile and fixed telephony subscription increased from over 20 million to over 21 million yielding an increment of over 1.1 million subscriber ( 5.4 increase ) compared to the 4.1 percent increase realised in the previous quarter q4 2014 ( octoberdecember ) . </s> { class= `` wikitable `` </s> +mobile & fixed telephony </s> ! indicator </s> ! q4 2014 </s> ! q1 2015 </s> ! change ( % ) </s> - </s> mobile subscription ( prepaid ) </s> 20,257,656 </s> 21,347,079 </s> 5.4 </s> - </s> mobile subscription ( post-paid ) </s> 108,285 </s> 110,282 </s> 1.8 </s> - </s> fixed subscription </s> 324,442 </s> 349,163 </s> 7.6 </s> - </s> tele-density </s> 56.5 </s> 62.5 </s> 10.6 </s> - </s> national status </s> 20,690,383 </s> 21,806,523 </s> 5.4 </s> } </s> <section_title_start> energy <section_title_end> </s> uganda is richly endowed with abundant energy resource , which are fairly distributed throughout the country . these include hydropower , biomass , solar , geothermal , peat and fossil fuel . </s> in the 1980s , the majority of energy in uganda came from charcoal and wood . however , oil wa found in the lake albert ( africa ) area , totaling an estimated barrel of crude . heritage oil discovered one of the largest crude oil find in uganda , and continues operation there . </s> uganda and tanzania signed a deal on 13 september 2016 that will see the two country build a 1,445 ; km , $ 3.5bn crude oil pipeline . the ugandatanzania crude oil pipeline ugandatanzania crude oil pipeline ( utcop ) , also known a the ugandatanzania crude oil pipeline east african crude oil pipeline ( eacop ) will be the first of it kind in east africa , will connect uganda s oil-rich hoima region with the indian ocean through the tanga port in tanzania . </s> <section_title_start> water supply and sanitation <section_title_end> </s> according to a 2006 published report , the ugandan water supply and sanitation sector had made substantial progress in urban area since the mid-1990s , with substantial increase in coverage a well a in operational and commercial performance . sector reform in the period 19982003 included the commercialisation and modernisation of the national water and sewerage corporation operating in city and larger town , a well a decentralisation and private sector participation in small town . </s> although these reform have attracted significant international attention , 38 percent of the population still had no access to an improved water source in 2010 . concerning access to improved sanitation , figure have varied widely . according to government figure , it wa 70 percent in rural area and 81 percent in urban area in 2011 , while according to un figure it wa only 34 percent . </s> the water and sanitation sector wa recognised a a key area under the 2004 poverty eradication action plan ( peap ) , uganda 's </s> main strategy paper to fight poverty . according to a 2006 published report , a comprehensive expenditure framework had been introduced to co-ordinate financial support by external donor , the national government , and ngo . the peap estimated that from 2001 to 2015 , about u $ 1.4 billion , or u $ 92 million per year , wa needed to increase water supply coverage up to 95 percent , with rural area needing u $ 956 million , urban area and large town needing u $ 281 million , and small town needing u $ 136 million . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> uganda s educational system , while lacking in many area , ha seen significant change in recent year . the educational system is set up so that child spend seven year in primary school , six year in secondary school , and three to five year in post secondary school . in 1997 , the government declared that primary school would be free for all child . this amendment ha had huge benefit . in 1986 , only two million child were attending primary school . by 1999 , six million child were attending primary school , and this number ha continued to climb . </s> following significant gain in access to primary education since 1997 when universal primary education ( upe ) wa introduced , uganda in 2007 became the first country in sub-saharan africa to introduce universal secondary education ( use ) . this bold step by the government of uganda led to an increase in lower secondary enrolment of nearly 25 % between 2007 and 2012. </s> at the 2002 census , uganda had a literacy rate of 66.8 percent ( 76.8 percent male and 57.7 percent female ) . public spending on education wa at 5.2 percent of the 20022005 gdp . </s> , the uganda national council for higher education website listed 46 private accredited university . to mention a few , makerere university , mbarara university , kyambogo university , gulu university , uganda christian university , kampala international university among many more . </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> health system <section_title_end> </s> there were eight physician per 100,000 person in the early 2000s . uganda 's elimination of user fee at state health facility in 2001 ha resulted in an 80 percent increase in visit , with over half of this increase coming from the poorest 20 percent of the population . this policy ha been cited a a key factor in helping uganda achieve it millennium development goal and a an example of the importance of equity in achieving those goal . despite this policy , many user are denied care if they do not provide their own medical equipment , a happened in the highly publicised case of jennifer anguko . poor communication within hospital , low satisfaction with health service and distance to health service provider undermine the provision of quality health care to people living in uganda , and particularly for those in poor and elderly-headed household . the provision of subsidy for poor and rural population , along with the extension of public private partnership , have been identified a important provision to enable vulnerable population to access health service . </s> <section_title_start> life expectancy <section_title_end> </s> life expectancy at birth wa estimated to be 53.45 year in 2012 . the infant mortality rate wa approximately 61 death per 1,000 child in 2012. </s> <section_title_start> infectious disease <section_title_end> </s> in july 2012 , there wa an ebola outbreak in the kibaale district of the country . on 4 october 2012 , the ministry of health officially declared the end of the outbreak after at least 16 people had died . </s> the health ministry announced on 16 august 2013 that three people had died in northern uganda from a suspected outbreak of congo crimean hemorrhagic fever . </s> uganda ha been among the rare hiv success story . infection rate of 30 per cent of the population in the 1980s fell to 6.4 percent by the end of 2008 . meanwhile , the practice of abstinence wa found to have decreased . </s> <section_title_start> reproductive health <section_title_end> </s> le than half of all sexually active unmarried woman use a modern contraceptive method , a fraction that ha barely changed from 2000 to 2011 . however , only ~26 % of married woman used contraceptive in 2011 . the use of contraceptive also differs substantially between poor ( ~15 % ) and wealthy woman ( ~40 % ) . a a result , ugandan woman have ~6 child while they prefer to have around ~4 . according to the 2011 uganda demographic and health survey ( dhs ) , more than 40 % of birth are unplanned . in 2010 , the ugandan ministry of health estimated that unsafe abortion accounted for 8 % of the country 's maternal death . the 2006 uganda demographic health survey ( udhs ) indicated that roughly 6,000 woman die each year from pregnancy-related complication . pilot study in 2012 by future health system have shown that this rate could be significantly reduced by implementing a voucher scheme for health service and transport to clinic . </s> the prevalence of female genital mutilation ( fgm ) is low : according to a 2013 unicef report , only 1 percent of woman in uganda have undergone fgm , with the practice being illegal in the country . </s> <section_title_start> crime and law enforcement <section_title_end> </s> in uganda , the allied democratic force is considered a violent rebel force that opposes the ugandan government . these rebel are an enemy of the uganda people 's defence force and are considered an affiliate of al-shabaab ( militant group ) al-shabaab . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> tourism in uganda is focused on uganda 's landscape and wildlife . it is a major driver of employment , investment and foreign exchange , contributing 4.9 trillion ugandan shilling ( u $ 1.88 billion or 1.4 billion a of august 2013 ) to uganda 's gross domestic product in the financial year 201213 . the uganda tourism board is responsible for maintaining information pertaining to tourism in uganda . the main attraction are photo safari through the list of protected area of uganda . other attraction include the mountain gorilla found in bwindi impenetrable national park ( binp ) and mgahinga gorilla national park ( mgnp ) , uganda having some of the oldest cultural kingdom in africa ha many national cultural site of uganda . uganda is a birding paradise boasting a massive bird list of more of than 1073 recorded bird specie ranking 4th in africa 's bird specie and 16th internationally . uganda ha landscape ranging from white-capped rwenzori mountain and the great rift valley . </s> <section_title_start> science and technology <section_title_end> </s> the national science , technology and innovation policy date from 2009 . it overarching goal is to strengthen national capability to generate , transfer and apply scientific knowledge , skill and technology that ensure sustainable utilization of natural resource for the realisation of uganda 's development objective . the policy precedes uganda vision 2040 , which wa launched in april 2013 to transform ugandan society from a peasant to a modern and prosperous country within 30 year , in the word of the cabinet . uganda vision 2040 vow to strengthen the private sector , improve education and training , modernize infrastructure and the underdeveloped service and agriculture sector , foster industrialization and promote good governance , among other goal . potential area for economic development include oil and gas , tourism , mineral and information and communication technology ( icts ) . </s> research funding climbed between 2008 and 2010 from 0.33 % to 0.48 % of gdp . over the same period , the number of researcher doubled ( in head count ) from 1 387 to 2 823 , according to the unesco institute for statistic . this represents a leap from 44 to 83 researcher per million inhabitant over the same period . one in four researcher is a woman . </s> uganda ha been able to manufacture prototype of car called kiira in which the government invested 70usd . </s> <section_title_start> demographic <section_title_end> </s> { class= `` wikitable floatright `` </s> + population </s> - </s> ! style= `` background : # cfb ; `` year </s> ! style= `` background : # cfb ; `` million </s> - </s> style= `` text-align : left ; `` 1950 style= `` text-align : right ; `` 5.1 </s> - </s> style= `` text-align : left ; `` 2000 style= `` text-align : right ; `` 24.0 </s> - </s> style= `` text-align : left ; `` style= `` text-align : right ; `` </s> } </s> uganda 's population grew from 9.5 million people in 1969 to 34.9 million in 2014 . with respect to the last inter-censal period ( september 2002 ) , the population increased by 10.6 million people in the past 12 year . uganda 's median age of 15 year is the lowest in the world . uganda ha the fifth highest total fertility rate in the world , at 5.97 child born per woman ( 2014 estimate ) . </s> there were about 80,000 indian in uganda before idi amin required the expulsion of asian from uganda expulsion of ugandan-asians ( mostly of indian origin ) in 1972 , which reduced the population to a low a 7,000 . many indian , however , returned to uganda after amin 's fall ouster in 1979 . around 90 percent of ugandan indian reside in kampala . </s> according to the united nation high commissioner for refugee , uganda host over 1.1 million refugee on it soil a of november 2018 . most come from neighbouring country in the african great lake region , particularly south sudan ( 68.0 percent ) and the democratic republic of the congo ( 24.6 % ) . </s> <section_title_start> languages <section_title_end> </s> swahili language , a widely used language throughout the african great lake region , wa approved a the country 's second official national language in 2005 . english language wa the only official language until the constitution wa amended in 2005 . although swahili ha not been favoured by the bantu-speaking population of the south and south-west of the country , it is an important lingua franca in the northern region . it is also widely used in the police and military force , which may be a historical result of the disproportionate recruitment of northerner into the security force during the colonial period . the status of swahili ha thus alternated with the political group in power . for example , idi amin , who came from the north-west , declared swahili to be the national language . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> the roman catholicism in uganda had the largest number of adherent ( 39.3 percent , down from 41.6 in 2002 ) , followed by the anglicanism church of uganda ( 32 percent , down from 35.9 percent ) . the category of evangelical/pentecostal/born-again showed the most growth , rising from 4.7 % in 2002 to 11.1 % in 2018 . adventism and other protestant church claimed most of the remaining christian , although there wa also a small eastern orthodox community . the next most reported religion of uganda wa islam in uganda , with muslim representing 13.7 percent of the population , up from 12.1 % in 2002. </s> the remainder of the population according to the 2014 census followed traditional religion ( 0.1 percent , down from 1 % in 2002 ) , other religion ( 1.4 percent ) , or had no religious affiliation ( 0.2 percent ) . </s> <section_title_start> largest city and towns <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> owing to the large number of community , culture within uganda is diverse . many asian ( mostly from india ) who were expelled during the regime of idi amin have returned to uganda . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> association football is the national sport in uganda . the uganda national football team , nicknamed `` the crane `` is controlled by the federation of uganda football association . they have never qualified for the fifa world cup final . their best finish in the african cup of nation wa second in 1978 african cup of nation . </s> , uganda at the olympics ha won a total of two gold , three silver , and two bronze medal ; four of which were in boxing at the summer olympics and three in sport of athletics . uganda at the commonwealth game ha collected 13 gold medal and a total 49 medal , all in boxing and athletics . </s> the uganda national boxing team is called the bomber . they have won four medal at the summer olympics from 1968 to 1980 , a well a two medal the 1974 world amateur boxing championship . notable boxer include cornelius boza-edwards , justin juuko , ayub kalule , john mugabi , eridadi mukwanga , joseph nsubuga , kassim ouma , sam rukundo and leo rwabwogo . </s> in athletics , john akii-bua won the first olympic gold medal for uganda . at the 1972 summer olympics in munich , he won the 400 metre hurdle race with a world record time of 47.82 second . 400 metre runner davis kamoga earned the bronze medal at 1996 summer olympics in atlanta and the silver medal at the 1997 world championship in athletics . dorcus inzikuru won the 3000 m steeplechase at the 2005 world championship in athletics and the 2006 commonwealth game . </s> stephen kiprotich ha won the marathon at the 2012 summer olympics in london and the 2013 world championship in athletics , and finished second at the 2015 tokyo marathon . joshua cheptegei ha won 10 ; km race at the world championship , world athletics cross country championship and commonwealth game , and ha set world record in 5 ; km and 15 ; km . halimah nakaayi won the 800 meter race at the 2019 world championship . </s> in cricket , uganda wa part of the east african cricket team that qualified for the cricket world cup in 1975 cricket world cup . </s> the country ha an increasingly successful uganda national basketball team . it is nicknamed `` the silverback , `` and made it debut at the 2015 fiba africa championship . </s> in july 2011 , kampala , uganda qualified for the 2011 little league world series in williamsport , pennsylvania for the first time , beating saudi arabian baseball team dharan ll , although visa complication prevented them from attending the series . little league team from uganda qualified for and attended the 2012 little league world series . </s> <section_title_start> olympics <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> cinema <section_title_end> </s> the ugandan film industry is relatively young . it is developing quickly , but still face an assortment of challenge . there ha been support for the industry a seen in the proliferation of film festival such a amakula , pearl international film festival , maisha african film festival and manya human right festival . however , filmmaker struggle against the competing market from other country on the continent such a those in nigeria and south africa in addition to the big budget film from hollywood . </s> the first publicly recognised film that wa produced solely by ugandan wa feeling struggle , which wa directed and written by hajji ashraf ssemwogerere in 2005 . this mark the year of ascent of film in uganda , a time where many enthusiast were proud to classify themselves a cinematographer in varied capacity . </s> the local film industry is polarised between two type of filmmaker . the first are filmmaker who use the nollywood video film era 's guerrilla approach to film making , churning out a picture in around two week and screening it in makeshift video hall . the second is the filmmaker who ha the film aesthetic , but with limited fund ha to depend on the competitive scramble for donor cash . </s> though cinema in uganda is evolving , it still face major challenge . along with technical problem such a refining acting and editing skill , there are issue regarding funding and lack of government support and investment . there are no school in the country dedicated to film , bank do not extend credit to film venture , and distribution and marketing of movie remains poor . </s> the uganda communication commission ( ucc ) is preparing regulation starting in 2014 that require ugandan television to broadcast 70 percent ugandan content and of this , 40 percent to be independent production . with the emphasis on ugandan film and the ucc regulation favouring ugandan production for mainstream television , ugandan film may become more prominent and successful in the near future . </s> <section_title_start> media <section_title_end> </s> uganda ha a number of medium outlet that broadcast domestically and globally . they cover news , business , sport , and entertainment . popular ugandan newspaper include : </s> * daily monitor </s> * new vision ( newspaper ) </s> * the independent </s> * observer </s> * east africa business week </s> television station based in uganda include : </s> * uganda broadcasting corporation uganda television state operated , with one national service . </s> * nb television owned by next medium . </s> * bb terefayina buganda broadcasting service owned by buganda kingdom . </s> * channel tv </s> * ltv-lighthouse tv/tbn uganda kampala ug .. christian </s> * bukedde tv ( bukedde 1 and bukedde 2 ) </s> * top tv </s> * record tv </s> * channel 44 </s> * urban tv </s> * ntv uganda . </s> * ab television </s> * baba tv running programme in busoga </s> * tv west broadcasting in lunyankole </s> * dream tv </s> * delta tv </s> * stv </s> regional tv </s> # salt medium </s> east african television </s> # kbc kenya broadcasting corporation </s> # tbc tanzania broadcasting corporation </s> # citizen tv kenya </s> # channel 10 </s> # tv africa </s> all of these terrestrial channel are transmitted via a dvb t2 digital tv signal . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * index of uganda-related article </s> * outline of uganda </s> <section_title_start> reference <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> * uganda tourism board </s> * uganda wildlife authority </s> * visit kampala with kampala capital city authority </s> * immigration department </s> category : uganda </s> category : east african country </s> category : english-speaking country and territory </s> category : landlocked country </s> category : least developed country </s> category : member state of the african union </s> category : member state of the commonwealth of nation </s> category : member state of the organisation of islamic cooperation </s> category : state and territory established in 1962 </s> category : swahili-speaking country and territory </s> category : member state of the united nation </s> category : commonwealth republic </s> category:1962 establishment in uganda </s> category : country in africa <article_end> <article_start> </s> lithuania ( ; lietuva ) , officially the republic of lithuania ( lietuvos respublika links=no ) , is a country in the baltic region of europe . lithuania is one of the baltic state . situated on the eastern shore of the baltic sea , to the southeast of sweden and to the east of denmark , lithuania is bordered by latvia to the north , belarus to the east and south , poland to the south , and kaliningrad oblast ( a russian enclave and exclave ) to the southwest . lithuania ha an estimated population of 2.8 million people . the capital and largest city is vilnius and other major city are kaunas and klaipda . lithuanian belong to the ethnic and linguistic group of balts . the official language , lithuanian language , is one of only two living language in the baltic language of the indo-european language indo-european language family , the other being latvian language . </s> for century , the southeastern shore of the baltic sea were inhabited by various balts . in the 1230s , the lithuanian land were united by mindaugas and the kingdom of lithuania wa created on 6 july 1253 . during the 14th century , the grand duchy of lithuania wa the largest country in europe ; present-day lithuania , belarus , ukraine , and part of poland and russia were the territory of the grand duchy . with the lublin union of 1569 , lithuania and poland formed a voluntary two-state personal union , the polishlithuanian commonwealth . the commonwealth lasted more than two century , until neighbouring country partition of poland it from 1772 to 1795 , with the russian empire annexing most of lithuania 's territory . </s> a world war i neared it end , lithuania 's act of independence of lithuania wa signed on 16 february 1918 , declaring the founding of the modern republic of lithuania . during the second world war , lithuania wa first soviet occupation of the baltic state ( 1940 ) and then by occupation of lithuania by nazi germany . a world war ii neared it end and the german retreated , the soviet occupation of the baltic state ( 1944 ) . on 11 march 1990 , a year before the formal dissolution of the soviet union , lithuania became the first baltic state to proclaim it independence , resulting in the restoration of the independent act of the re-establishment of the state of lithuania . </s> lithuania is considered a developed country and rank 34th ( out of 189 ) on the human development index . it rank favourably in metric of freedom in the world ( report ) , press freedom index and internet censorship and surveillance by country . however , lithuania ha been experiencing a gradual population decline since the 1990s , while suicide in lithuania is considered a huge social problem , with it suicide rate being the highest in all of the european union ( eu ) a well a the oecd , which the country are both a member of . lithuania is also a member of the council of europe , eurozone , the nordic investment bank , schengen agreement and nato . it also participates in the nb8 nordic-baltic cooperation of northern europe and eastern european country . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> the first known record of the name of lithuania ( lietuva ) is in a 9 march 1009 story of bruno of querfurt in the quedlinburg chronicle . the chronicle recorded a latinized form of the name lietuva : litua ( pronounced ) . due to the lack of reliable evidence , the true meaning of the name is unknown . nowadays , scholar still debate the meaning of the word and there are a few plausible version . </s> since lietuva ha a suffix ( -uva ) , the original word should have no suffix . a likely candidate is liet . because many baltic language ethnonyms originated from [ linguist have searched for it origin among local hydronyms . usually , such name evolved through the following process : hydronym toponym ethnonym ] . [ [ lietava river , a small river not far from kernav , the core area of the duchy of lithuania and a possible first capital of the eventual grand duchy of lithuania , is usually credited a the source of the name . however , the river is very small and some find it improbable that such a small and local object could have lent it name to an entire nation . on the other hand , such naming is not unprecedented in world history . </s> artras dubonis proposed another hypothesis , that lietuva relates to the word leiiai ( plural of leitis ) . from the middle of the 13th century , leiiai were a distinct warrior social group of the lithuanian society subordinate to the list of ruler of lithuania or the state itself . the word leiiai is used in the 1416th century historical source a an ethnonym for lithuanian ( but not samogitians ) and is still used , usually poetically or in historical context , in the latvian language , which is closely related to lithuanian . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> the first people settled in the territory of lithuania after the last glacial period in the 10th millennium bc : kunda culture , neman culture and narva culture . they were traveling hunter and did not form stable settlement . in the 8th millennium bc , the climate became much warmer , and forest developed . the inhabitant of what is now lithuania then travelled le and engaged in local hunting , gathering and fresh-water fishing . agriculture did not emerge until the 3rd millennium bc due to a harsh climate and terrain and a lack of suitable tool to cultivate the land . craft and trade also started to form at this time . over a millennium , the indo-european migration indo-european , who arrived in the 3rd 2nd millennium bc , mixed with the local population and formed various baltic tribe . </s> the baltic tribe did not maintain close cultural or political contact with the roman empire , but they did maintain trade contact ( see amber road ) . tacitus , in his study germania ( book ) , described the aesti people , inhabitant of the south-eastern baltic sea shore who were probably balts , around the year 97 ad . the western balts differentiated and became known to outside chronicler first . ptolemy in the 2nd century ad knew of the galindians and yotvingians , and early middle age chronicler mentioned old prussian , curonians and semigallians . </s> the lithuanian language is considered to be very conservative ( language ) for it close connection to indo-european root . it is believed to have differentiated from the latvian language , the most closely related existing language , around the 7th century . traditional lithuanian mythology , with many archaic element , were long preserved . ruler ' body were cremated up until the conversion to christianity : the description of the cremation ceremony of the grand duke algirdas and kstutis have survived . </s> <section_title_start> grand duchy of lithuania <section_title_end> </s> from the 9th to the 11th century , coastal balts were subjected to raid by the viking , and the king of denmark collected tribute at time . during the 1011th century , lithuanian territory were among the land paying tribute to kievan ru ' , and yaroslav the wise wa among the ruthenian ruler who invaded lithuania ( from 1040 ) . from the mid-12th century , it wa the lithuanian who were invading ruthenian territory . in 1183 , polotsk and pskov were ravaged , and even the distant and powerful novgorod republic wa repeatedly threatened by the excursion from the emerging lithuanian war machine toward the end of the 12th century . </s> from the late 12th century , an organized lithuanian military force existed ; it wa used for external raid , plundering and the gathering of slave . such military and pecuniary activity fostered social differentiation and triggered a struggle for power in lithuania . this initiated the formation of early statehood , from which the grand duchy of lithuania developed . </s> initially inhabited by fragmented baltic tribe , in the 1230s the lithuanian land were united by mindaugas , who wa crowned a king of lithuania on 6 july 1253 . after his assassination in 1263 , lithuanian mythology wa a target of the lithuanian crusade of the teutonic knight and the livonian order . siege of pilnai is noted for the lithuanian ' defense against the intruder . despite the devastating century-long struggle with the order , the grand duchy of lithuania expanded rapidly , overtaking former ruthenian principality of kievan ru ' . </s> on 22 september 1236 , the battle of saul between samogitians and the livonian brother of the sword took place close to iauliai . the livonian brother were defeated during it and their further conquest of the balts land were stopped . the battle inspired rebellion among the curonians , semigallians , selonians , oeselians , tribe previously conquered by the sword-brothers .
