territorial health insurance fund , covering vilnius , kaunas , klaipda , iauliai and panevys . contribution for people who are economically active are 9 % of income . </s> emergency medical service are provided free of charge to all resident . access to hospital treatment is normally by referral by a general practitioner . lithuania also ha one of the lowest [ care ] price in europe . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> according to the 2011 census , 77.2 % of resident of lithuania were catholic . catholicism ha been the main religion since the official christianisation of lithuania in 1387 . the catholic church wa persecuted by the russian empire a part of the russification policy and by the soviet union a part of the overall religion in the soviet union anti-religious campaign . during the soviet era , some priest actively led the resistance against the communist regime , a symbolised by the hill of cross and exemplified by the chronicle of the catholic church in lithuania . </s> 4.1 % of the population are eastern orthodox church , mainly among the russian minority . the community of old believer ( 0.8 % of population ) date back to the 1660s . </s> protestant are 0.8 % , of which 0.6 % are lutheranism and 0.2 % are lithuanian evangelical reformed church . the reformation did not impact lithuania to a great extent a seen in east prussia , estonia , or latvia . before world war ii , according to losch ( 1932 ) , the lutheran were 3.3 % of the total population . they were mainly german and prussian lithuanian in the klaipda region ( memel territory ) . this population flight and expulsion of german , and today protestantism is mainly represented by ethnic lithuanian throughout the northern and western part of the country , a well a in large urban area . newly arriving evangelicalism have established mission in lithuania since 1990. </s> hinduism is a minority religion and a fairly recent development in lithuania . hinduism is spread in lithuania by hindu organization : iskcon , sathya sai baba , brahma kumaris and osho rajneesh . iskcon ( lithuanian : krinos smons judjimas ) is the largest and the oldest movement a the first krishna follower date to 1979 . it ha three centre in lithuania : in vilnius , klaipda and kaunas . brahma kumaris maintains the centre brahma kumaris in antakalnis , vilnius . </s> the historical community of lipka tatar maintain islam in lithuania a their religion . lithuania wa historically home to a significant history of the jew in lithuania and wa an important centre of jewish scholarship and culture from the 18th century until the eve of world war ii . of the approximately 220,000 jew who lived in lithuania in june 1941 , almost all were killed during the holocaust in lithuania . the lithuanian jewish community numbered about 4,000 at the end of 2009. </s> romuva ( religion ) , the neopagan revival of the lithuanian mythology , ha gained popularity over the year . romuva claim to continue living pagan tradition , which survived in folklore and custom . romuva is a polytheism pagan faith , which asserts the sanctity of nature and ha element of ancestor worship . according to the lithuanian census of 2001 , there were 1,270 people of baltic faith in lithuania . that number jumped to 5,118 in the 2011 census . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> the constitution of lithuania mandate ten-year education ending at age 16 and guarantee a free public higher education for student deemed 'good ' . the ministry of education and science of the republic of lithuania proposes national educational policy and goal that are then voted for in the seimas . law govern long-term educational strategy along with general law on standard for higher education , vocational training , law and science , adult education , and special education . 5.4 % of gdp or 15.4 % of total public expenditure wa spent for education in 2016. </s> according to the world bank , the literacy rate among lithuanian aged 15 year and older is 100 % . school attendance rate are above the eu average and school leave is le common than in the eu . according to eurostat lithuania lead among other country of the european union in people with secondary education ( 93.3 % ) . based on oecd data , lithuania is among the top 5 country in the world in postsecondary ( tertiary ) education attainment . , 54.9 % of the population aged 25 to 34 , and 30.7 % of the population aged 55 to 64 had completed tertiary education . the share of tertiary-educated 2564-year-olds in stem ( science , technology , engineering , and mathematics ) field in lithuania were above the oecd average ( 29 % and 26 % respectively ) , similarly to business , administration and law ( 25 % and 23 % respectively ) . </s> modern lithuanian education system ha multiple structural problem . insufficient funding , quality issue , and decreasing student population are the most prevalent . lithuanian teacher salary are the lowest in the entire eu . low teacher salary wa the primary reason behind national teacher strike in 2014 , 2015 , and 2016 . salary in the higher education sector are also low . many lithuanian professor have a second job to supplement their income . pisa report from 2010 found that lithuanian result in math , science and reading were below oecd average . pisa report from 2015 reconfirmed these finding . the population age 6 to 19 ha decreased by 36 % between 2005 and 2015 . a a result , the student-teacher ratio is decreasing and expenditure per student is increasing , but school , particularly in rural area , are forced into reorganization and consolidation . a with other baltic state nation , in particular latvia , the large volume of higher education graduate within the country , coupled with the high rate of spoken second language is contributing to an education brain drain . </s> , there were 15 public and 6 private university a well a 16 public and 11 private college in lithuania ( see : list of university in lithuania ) . vilnius university is one of the list of oldest university in continuous operation and the largest university in lithuania . kaunas university of technology is the largest technical university in the baltic state and the second largest university in lithuania . in an attempt to reduce cost and adapt to sharply decreasing number of high-school student , lithuanian parliament decided to reduce the number of university in lithuania . in early 2018 , lithuanian university of educational science and aleksandras stulginskis university were merged into vytautas magnus university . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> lithuanian language <section_title_end> </s> the lithuanian language ( lietuvi kalba ) is the official state language of lithuania and is recognized a one of the official language of the european union . there are about 2.96 million native lithuanian speaker in lithuania and about 0.2 million abroad . </s> lithuanian is a baltic language , closely related to latvian language , although they are not mutual intelligibility . it is written in an adapted version of the latin alphabet . lithuanian is believed to be the conservative ( language ) living indo-european language indo-european tongue , retaining many feature of proto indo-european language proto indo-european . lithuanian language study are important for comparative linguistics and for reconstruction of proto-indo-european language . lithuanian wa studied by linguist such a franz bopp , august schleicher , adalbert bezzenberger , louis hjelmslev , ferdinand de saussure , winfred p. lehmann , vladimir toporov and others . </s> there are two main dialect of the lithuanian language : auktaitian dialect and samogitian dialect . auktaitian dialect is mainly used in the central , southern and eastern part of lithuania while samogitian dialect is used in the western part of the country . the samogitian dialect also ha many completely different word and is even considered a separate language by some linguist . nowadays , the distinguishing feature between the two main lithuanian dialect is the unequal pronunciation of accented and unaccented two-vowels uo and ie . </s> the groundwork for written lithuanian wa laid in 16th and 17th century by lithuanian nobleman and scholar , who promoted lithuanian language , created dictionary and published book mikalojus dauka , stanislovas rapolionis , abraomas kulvietis , jonas bretknas , martynas mavydas , konstantinas sirvydas , simonas vainoras-varnikis . </s> the first grammar book of the lithuanian language grammatica litvanica wa published in latin in 1653 by daniel klein ( grammarian ) . </s> jonas jablonskis ' work and activity are especially important for the lithuanian literature moving from the use of dialect to a standard lithuanian language . the linguistic material which he collected wa published in the 20 volume of academic dictionary of lithuanian and is still being used in research and in editing of text and book . he also introduced the letter into lithuanian writing . </s> <section_title_start> literature <section_title_end> </s> there is a great deal of lithuanian literature written in latin , the main scholarly language of the middle age . the edict of the lithuanian king mindaugas is the prime example of the literature of this kind . the letter of gediminas are another crucial heritage of the lithuanian latin writing . </s> one of the first lithuanian author who wrote in latin wa mikoaj hussowczyk ( around 1480 after 1533 ) . his poem carmen de statura , feritate ac venatione bisontis ( a song about the appearance , savagery and hunting of the bison ) , published in 1523 , describes the lithuanian landscape , way of life and custom , touch on some actual political problem , and reflects the clash of paganism and christianity . a person under the pseudonym ( around 1490 1560 ) wrote a treatise de moribus tartarorum , lituanorum et moscorum ( on the custom of tatar , lithuanian and muscovite ) in the middle of the 16th century , but it wa not published until 1615 . an extraordinary figure in the cultural life of lithuania in the 16th century wa the lawyer and poet of spanish origin petrus roysius maurus alcagnicensis ( around 1505 1571 ) . the publicist , lawyer , and mayor of vilnius , augustinus rotundus ( around 1520 -1582 ) wrote a no longer existent history of lithuania in latin around the year 1560. loannes radvanus , a humanist poet of the second half of the 16th century , wrote an epic poem imitating the aeneid of virgil . his radivilias , intended to become the lithuanian national epic , wa published in vilnius in 1588. </s> 17th century lithuanian scholar also wrote in latin kazimieras kojelaviius-vijkas , ygimantas liauksminas are known for their latin writing in theology , rhetoric and music . alberta kojalaviius-vijkas wrote first printed lithuanian history historia lithuania . </s> lithuanian literary work in the lithuanian language started being first published in the 16th century . in 1547 martynas mavydas compiled and published the first printed lithuanian book katekizmo prasti odiai ( the simple word of catechism ) , which mark the beginning of literature , printed in lithuanian . he wa followed by mikalojus dauka with katechizmas . in the 16th and 17th century , a in the whole christian europe , lithuanian literature wa primarily religious . </s> the evolution of the old ( 14th18th century ) lithuanian literature end with kristijonas donelaitis , one of the most prominent author of the age of enlightenment . donelaitis ' poem metai ( the season ( poem ) ) is a landmark of the lithuanian fiction literature , written in [ name= `` inst `` institute of lithuanian scientific society . </s> with a mix of classicism ] , [ [ sentimentalism ( literature ) and romanticism , the lithuanian literature of the first half of the 19th century is represented by maironis , antanas baranauskas , simonas daukantas and simonas staneviius . during the tsarist annexation of lithuania in the 19th century , the lithuanian press ban wa implemented , which led to the formation of the knygneiai ( book smuggler ) movement . this movement is thought to be the very reason the lithuanian language and literature survived until today . </s> 20th-century lithuanian literature is represented by juozas tumas-vaigantas , antanas vienuolis , bernardas brazdionis , antanas kma , balys sruoga , vytautas maernis and justinas marcinkeviius . </s> in 21st century debuted kristina sabaliauskait , renata erelyt , valdas papievis , laura sintija erniauskait , ruta sepetys . </s> <section_title_start> architecture <section_title_end> </s> several list of architect from lithuania famous lithuania-related architect are notable for their achievement in the field of architecture . johann christoph glaubitz , marcin knackfus , laurynas guceviius and karol podczaszyski were instrumental in introducing baroque architecture and neoclassical architecture architectural movement to the lithuanian architecture during the seventeenth to nineteenth century . vilnius is considered a a capital of the eastern europe baroque . vilnius old town that is full of astonishing baroque church and other building is a unesco world heritage site . </s> lithuania is also known for list of castle in lithuania . about twenty castle exist in lithuania . some castle had to be rebuilt or survive partially . many lithuanian noble ' historic list of palace and manor house in lithuania have remained till the nowadays and were reconstructed . lithuanian village life ha existed since the day of vytautas the great . zervynos and kapiniks are two of many ethnographic village in lithuania . rumiks is an open space museum where old ethnographic architecture is preserved . </s> during the interwar period , art deco , lithuanian national romanticism architectural style building were constructed in the lithuania 's temporary capital kaunas . it architecture is regarded a one of the finest example of the european art deco and ha received the european heritage label . </s> <section_title_start> arts and museums <section_title_end> </s> prancikus smugleviius , jan rustem , juozapas olekeviius and kanutas ruseckas are the most prominent lithuanian painter of the 18th and 19th century . </s> the lithuanian art museum wa founded in 1933 and is the largest museum of art conservation and display in lithuania . among other important museum are the palanga amber museum , where amber piece comprise a major part of the collection , national gallery of art , presenting collection of lithuanian art of the 20th and 21st century , national museum of lithuania presenting lithuanian archaeology , history and ethnic culture . in 2018 two private museum were opened mo museum devoted to modern and contemporary lithuanian art and tartle , exhibiting a collection of lithuanian art heritage and artefact . </s> perhaps the most renowned figure in lithuania 's art community wa the composer mikalojus konstantinas iurlionis ( 18751911 ) , an internationally renowned musician . the 2420 iurlionis asteroid , identified in 1975 , honor his achievement . the m. k. iurlionis national art museum , a well a the only military museum in lithuania , vytautas the great war museum , are located in kaunas . </s> other notable artist includes jonas mekas , george maciunas , petras kalpokas , antanas muidzinaviius , jonas ileika , , , adomas varna , petras rima , juozas zikaras , vytautas kairiktis , vinca grybas , stasys uinskas , , , robertas antinis , antanas gudaitis , , , antanas ukauskas , viktoras vizgirda , rimantas dichaviius , elvyra katalina kriauinait , arnas sauka , </s> at the 2019 venice biennale , lithuania won it first golden lion for best national pavilion with sun & sea ( marina ) modern opera `` sun & sea ( marina ) presented by the artist lina lapelyte , vaiva grainyte and rugile barzdziukaite , beating out 89 other pavilion for the honor . at an official collateral event to the biennale , lithuanian artist and filmmaker emilija karnulyt took home the future generation art prize awarding $ 100,000 to a global artist under the age of 35 , presented by the pinchukartcentre . </s> <section_title_start> theatre <section_title_end> </s> lithuania ha some very famous theatre director well known in the country and abroad . one of them is oskaras korunovas . he wa awarded more than forty time with special prize . possibly most prestigious award is swedish commander grand cross : order of the polar star . today 's the most famous theatre in lithuania are in vilnius , kaunas , klaipda and panevys . it is lithuanian national drama theatre , keistuoli teatras ( theatre of freak ) in vilnius , kaunas national drama theatre , theatre of oskaras korunovas , klaipda drama theatre , theatre of gytis ivanauskas , miltinis drama theatre in panevys , the doll 's theatre , russian drama theatre of lithuania and others . there are some very popular theatre festival like sirenos ( siren ) , theatrium , nerk teatr ( dive into the theatre ) and others . the figure dominating in lithuanian theatre world are director like eimuntas nekroius , jonas vaitkus , cezaris grauinis , gintaras varna , dalia ibelhauptait , artras areima ; number of talented actor like dainius gavenonis , rolandas kazlas , saulius balandis , gabija jaraminait and many others . </s> <section_title_start> cinema <section_title_end> </s> on 28 july 1896 , thomas edison live photography session wa held in the concert hall of the botanical garden of vilnius university . after a year , similar american movie were available with the addition of special phonograph record that also provided sound . in 1909 , lithuanian cinema pioneer and ladislas starevich released their first movie . soon the rainas ' recording of lithuania 's view became very popular among the lithuanian american abroad . in 1925 , pranas valuskis filmed movie naktis lietuvoje ( night in lithuania ) about lithuanian book smuggler that left the first bright lithuanian footprint in hollywood . the most significant and mature lithuanian american movie of the time aukso si ( golden goose ) wa created in 1965 by that featured motif from the brother grimm fairy tale . in 1940 , romuva cinema wa opened in kaunas and currently is the oldest still operational cinema in lithuania . after the occupation of the state , movie mostly were used for the soviet propaganda purpose , nevertheless almantas grikeviius , gytis lukas , henrikas ableviius , arnas ebrinas , raimondas vabalas were able to overcome the obstacle and create valuable film . after the restoration of the independence , arnas bartas , audrius stonys , arnas matelis , audrius juznas , algimantas puipa , , dijana and her husband kornelijus matuzeviius received success in international movie festival . </s> in 2018 , 4 265 414 cinema ticket were sold in lithuania with the average price of 5,26 euro . </s> <section_title_start> music <section_title_end> </s> lithuanian folk music belongs to baltic language music branch which is connected with neolithic corded ware culture . two instrument culture meet in the area inhabited by lithuanian : stringed ( kankls ) and wind instrument culture . lithuanian folk music is archaic , mostly used for ritual purpose , containing element of paganism faith . there are three ancient style of singing in lithuania connected with ethnographical region : monophony , [ and polyphony ] . folk song genre : sutartins ( multipart song ) , wedding song , war-historical time song , calendar cycle and ritual song and work song . </s> italian artist organized the first [ [ opera in lithuania on 4 september 1636 at the palace of the grand duke of lithuania by the order of wadysaw iv vas . currently , opera are staged at the lithuanian national opera and ballet theatre and also by independent troupe vilnius city opera . </s> mikalojus konstantinas iurlionis is the most renowned lithuanian painter and composer . during his short life he created about 200 piece of music . his work have had profound influence on modern lithuanian culture . his symphonic poem in the forest ( mike ) and the sea ( jra ) were performed only posthumous work . iurlionis contributed to symbolism and art nouveau and wa representative of the fin de sicle epoch . he ha been considered one of the pioneer of abstract art in europe . </s> in lithuania , choral music is very important . vilnius is the only city with three choir laureate ( brevis , jauna muzika and chamber choir of the conservatoire ) at the european grand prix for choral singing . there is a long-standing tradition of the dain vent ( lithuanian song festival ) . the first one took place in kaunas in 1924 . since 1990 , the festival ha been organised every four year and summons roughly 30,000 singer and folk dancer of various professional level and age group from across the country . in 2008 , lithuanian song and dance festival together with it latvian song and dance festival and estonian song festival version wa inscribed a unesco masterpiece of the oral and intangible heritage of humanity . gatvs muzikos diena ( street music day ) gather musician of various genre annually . </s> conductor mirga grainyt-tyla performing on the scene of rome , new york and birmingham . </s> modern classical composer emerged in seventy bronius kutaviius , feliksas bajoras , osvaldas balakauskas , onut narbutait , vidmantas bartulis and others . most of those composer explored archaic lithuanian music and it harmonic combination with modern minimalism and neoromanticism . </s> jazz scene wa active even during the year of soviet occupation . the real breakthrough would occur in 197071 with the coming together of the ganelin/tarasov/chekasin trio , the alleged instigator of the vilnius jazz school . most known annual event are vilnius jazz festival , kaunas jazz , birtonas jazz . </s> music information centre lithuania ( micl ) collect , promotes and share information on lithuanian musical culture . </s> <section_title_start> rock and protest music <section_title_end> </s> after the soviet occupation of the baltic state ( 1944 ) , the censorship in the soviet union soviet 's censorship continued firmly controlling all artistic expression in lithuania , and any violation by criticizing the regime would immediately result in punishment . the first local rock band started to emerge around 1965 and included kertukai , aitvarai and nuogi ant slenksio in kaunas , and kstutis antanlis , vienuoliai , and gli vaikai in vilnius , among others . unable to express their opinion directly , the lithuanian artist began organizing patriotic roko mara and were using metaphor in their song ' lyric , which were easily identified for their true meaning by the local . postmodernist rock music band anti and it vocalist algirdas kaupdas were one of the most active performer who mocked the soviet regime by using metaphor . for example , in the song zombiai ( zombie ) , the band indirectly sang about the red army soldier who occupied the state and it military base in ukmerg . vytautas kernagis ' song kolorado vabalai ( colorado potato beetle ) wa also a favourite due to it lyric in which true meaning of the colorado beetle wa intended to be the soviet decorated with the ribbon of saint george . </s> in the early independence year , rock band foje wa particularly popular and gathered ten of thousand of spectator to the concert . after disbanding in 1997 , foje vocalist andrius mamontovas remained one of the most prominent lithuanian performer and an active participant in various charity ( practice ) event . marijonas mikutaviius is famous for creating unofficial lithuania sport anthem try milijonai ( three million ) and official anthem of the eurobasket 2011 nebetyli sirgaliai ( english version wa named celebrate basketball ) . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> lithuanian cuisine feature the product suited to the cool and maritime climate continental climate of lithuania : barley , potato , rye , beet , green , berry , and mushroom are locally grown , and dairy product are one of it specialty . fish dish are very popular in the coastal region . since it share it climate and agricultural practice with northern europe , lithuanian cuisine ha some similarity to scandinavian cuisine . nevertheless , it ha it own distinguishing feature , which were formed by a variety of influence during the country 's long and difficult history . </s> dairy product are an important part of traditional lithuanian cuisine . these include white cottage cheese ( varks sris ) , curd ( vark ) , soured milk ( rgpienis ) , sour cream ( grietin ) , butter ( sviestas ) , and sour cream butter kastinis . traditional meat product are usually seasoned , matured and smoked smoked sausage ( deros ) , lard ( lainiai ) , skilandis , smoked ham ( kumpis ) . soup ( sriubos ) boletus soup , cabbage soup , beer soup , milk soup , cold-beet soup ( altibariai ) and various kind of porages ( ko ) are part of tradition and daily diet . freshwater fish , herring , wild berry and mushroom , honey are highly popular diet to this day . </s> one of the oldest and most fundamental lithuanian food product wa and is rye bread . rye bread is eaten every day for breakfast , lunch and dinner . bread played an important role in family ritual and agrarian ceremony . </s> lithuanian and other nation that once formed part of the grand duchy of lithuania share many dish and beverage . german cuisine also influenced lithuanian cuisine , introducing pork and potato dish , such a potato pudding ( kugelis or kugel ) and kishka ( food ) ( vdarai ) , a well a the baroque tree cake known a akotis . the most exotic of all the influence is eastern ( karaite ) cuisine the kibinai are popular in lithuania . lithuanian nobleman usually hired french chef , so french cuisine influence came to lithuania in this way . </s> balts were using mead ( midus ) for thousand of year . beer ( alus ) is the most common alcoholic beverage . lithuania ha a long farmhouse beer in lithuania , first mentioned in 11th century chronicle . beer wa brewed for ancient baltic festival and ritual . farmhouse brewing survived to a greater extent in lithuania than anywhere else , and through accident of history the lithuanian then developed a commercial brewing culture from their unique farmhouse tradition . lithuania is top 5 by consumption of beer per caput in europe in 2015 , counting 75 active brewery , 32 of them are microbrewery . the microbrewery scene in lithuania ha been growing in later year , with a number of bar focusing on these beer popping up in vilnius and also in other part of the country . </s> 8 lithuanian restaurant are listed in white guide baltic top 30. </s> <section_title_start> media <section_title_end> </s> the constitution of lithuania provides for freedom of speech and freedom of the press , and the government generally respect these right in practice . an independent press , an effective judiciary , and a functioning democratic political system combine to promote these freedom . however , the constitutional definition of freedom of expression doe not protect certain act , such a incitement to national , racial , religious , or social hatred , violence and discrimination , or slander , and disinformation . it is a crime to deny or `` grossly trivialize `` soviet or nazi german crime against lithuania or it citizen , or to deny genocide , crime against humanity , or war crime . </s> best-selling daily national newspaper in lithuania are lietuvos rytas ( about 18,8 % of all daily reader ) , ( 12,5 % ) , kauno diena ( 3,7 % ) , ( 3,2 % ) and vakar ekspresas ( 2,7 % ) . best-selling weekly newspaper are savait ( about 34 % of all weekly reader ) , mon ( 17 % ) , prie kavos ( 11,9 % ) , ji ( 8,7 % ) and ekspress nedelia ( 5,4 % ) . </s> in july 2018 , the most popular national television channel in lithuania were tv3 lithuania ( about 35,9 % of the auditorium ) , lnk ( television station ) ( 32,8 % ) , lithuanian national radio and television ( 30,6 % ) , btv ( lithuania ) ( 19,9 % ) , lietuvos rytas tv ( 19,1 % ) . </s> the most popular radio station in lithuania are m-1 ( lithuanian radio station ) m-1 ( about 15,8 % of all listener ) , lietus ( 12,2 % ) , lrt radijas ( 10,5 % ) and radiocentras ( 10,5 % ) . </s> <section_title_start> public holiday and festivals <section_title_end> </s> a a result of a thousand-years history , lithuania ha two national day . first one is the statehood day ( lithuania ) on 6 july , marking the establishment of the medieval kingdom of lithuania by mindaugas in 1253 . creation of modern lithuanian state is commemorated on 16 february a a act of independence of lithuania on which declaration of independence from russia and germany wa declared in 1918 . jonins ( previously known a rasos ) is a public holiday with paganic root that celebrates a solstice . a of 2018 , there are 13 public holiday ( which come with a day off ) . </s> kaziuko mug is an annual fair held since the beginning of the 17th century that commemorates the anniversary of saint casimir saint casimir 's death and gather thousand of visitor and many craftsman . other notable festival are vilnius international film festival , kauno miesto diena , klaipda sea festival , mados infekcija , vilnius book fair , vilnius marathon , devilstone open air , , great emaii kalvarija festival . </s> <section_title_start> sports <section_title_end> </s> basketball is the most popular and national sport of lithuania . the lithuania men 's national basketball team ha had significant success in international basketball event , having won the eurobasket on three occasion ( eurobasket 1937 , eurobasket 1939 and eurobasket 2003 ) , a well a total of 8 other medal in the eurobasket , the fiba world championship and the basketball at the summer olympics . the men 's national team also ha extremely high tv rating a about 76 % of the country 's population watched their game live in 2014 . lithuania hosted the eurobasket in 1939 and eurobasket 2011 . the historic lithuanian basketball team bc algiris , from kaunas , won the european basketball league euroleague in 1999 . lithuania ha produced a number of national basketball association player , including naismith memorial basketball hall of fame inductee arvydas sabonis and arnas mariulionis , and current nba player jonas valaninas and domantas sabonis . </s> lithuania ha won a total of lithuania at the olympics , including 6 gold medal in sport of athletics , modern pentathlon , shooting sport , and swimming ( sport ) . numerous other lithuanian won olympic medal representing soviet union . discus thrower virgilijus alekna is the most successful olympic athlete of independent lithuania , having won gold medal in the 2000 sydney olympics and 2004 athens game , a well a a bronze in 2008 beijing olympics and numerous iaaf world championship in athletics medal . more recently , the gold medal won by a then 15-year-old swimmer rta meilutyt at the 2012 summer olympics in london sparked a rise in popularity for the sport in lithuania . </s> lithuania ha produced prominent athlete in athletics , modern pentathlon , road cycling and track cycling , chess , rowing , aerobatics , world 's strongest man , wrestling , boxing , mixed martial art , kyokushin and other sport . </s> lithuania will host the 2021 fifa futsal world cup . it will be the first time lithuania ha hosted and participated in any fifa tournament . </s> few lithuanian athlete have found success in winter sport , although facility are provided by several ice rink and skiing slope , including snow arena , the first indoor ski slope in the baltic . in 2018 lithuania national ice hockey team won gold medal at the 2018 iihf world championship division i. </s> a lithuanian ethnic sport , known since the 17th century is ritinis . </s> lithuanian annually participate in the dakar rally . antanas jukneviius , vaidotas ala and benediktas vanagas are well known internationally . </s> <section_title_start> international rankings <section_title_end> </s> the following are link to international ranking of lithuania from selected research institute and foundation including economic output and various composite index . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * index of lithuania-related article </s> * list of lithuanian </s> * outline of lithuania </s> * human right in lithuania </s> <section_title_start> notes <section_title_end> </s> various source classify lithuania differently for statistical and other purpose . for example , united nation and eurovoc , among others , classify it a northern europe , the cia world factbook classifies it a eastern europe , and encyclopedia britannica locates it in northeastern europe . usage varies greatly , and controversially , in press source . </s> <section_title_start> references <section_title_end> </s> category : state and territory established in 1990 <article_end> <article_start> </s> montenegro ( ; , ) is a country in southeast europe on the adriatic sea coast of the balkan . it border bosnia and herzegovina to the north , serbia to the northeast , kosovo to the east , albania to the southeast , the adriatic sea and croatia to the west . the largest and capital city podgorica cover 10.4 % of montenegro 's territory and is home to 29.9 % of the country 's population , while cetinje ha the status of old royal capital . major group in the country are montenegrins . serb of montenegro form a significant minority at 28.7 % , followed by bosniaks , albanian and croat . </s> during the early medieval period , three principality were located on the territory of modern-day montenegro : duklja , roughly corresponding to the southern half ; travunia , the west ; and principality of serbia ( early medieval ) proper , the north . the zeta under the balii emerged in the 14th and 15th century . the name montenegro wa first used to refer to the country in the late 15th century . after falling under ottoman rule , montenegro regained it independence in 1696 under the rule of the house of petrovi-njego , first a a prince-bishopric of montenegro and later a a secular principality of montenegro . montenegro 's independence wa recognized by the great power at the congress of berlin in 1878 . in 1910 , the country became a kingdom of montenegro . after world war i , it became part of kingdom of yugoslavia . following the breakup of yugoslavia , the republic of republic of serbia ( 19922006 ) and republic of montenegro ( 19922006 ) together proclaimed a serbia and montenegro . following the montenegrin independence referendum , 2006 held in may 2006 , montenegro declared it independence and the confederation peacefully dissolved . </s> classified by the world bank a an upper middle-income country , montenegro is a member of the un , nato , the world trade organization , the organization for security and co-operation in europe , the council of europe , and the central european free trade agreement . montenegro is a founding member of the union for the mediterranean . it is also in the accession of montenegro to the european union the european union . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> the country 's english name derives from venetian language and translates a `` black mountain `` , deriving from the appearance of loven when covered in dense evergreen forest . in the monument of kotor , montenegro wa mentioned a montenegro in 1397 , a monte nigro in 1443 and a crna gora in 1435 and 1458 , but there are much older paper of latin source where montenegro is mentioned a monte nigro . the first mention of montenegro ( a monte nigro ) date to 9 november 1053 in a papal epistle and the others date to 1061 , 1097 , 1121 , 1125 , 1144 , 1154 , 1179 and 1189. </s> the native name crna gora , also meaning `` black mountain `` or `` black hill `` , came to denote the majority of contemporary montenegro in the 15th century . originally , it had referred to only a small strip of land under the rule of the patrovii tribe , but the name eventually came to be used for the wider mountainous region after the crnojevi noble family took power in upper zeta . the aforementioned region became known a stara crna gora 'old montenegro ' by the 19th century to distinguish the independent region from the neighbouring ottoman-occupied montenegrin territory of brda ' ( the ) highland ' . montenegro further increased it size several time by the 20th century , a the result of war against the ottoman empire , which saw the annexation of old herzegovina and part of metohija and southern raka ( region ) . it border have changed little since then , losing metohija and gaining the bay of kotor . </s> after the second session of the anti-fascist council for the national liberation of yugoslavia during world war ii in yugoslavia , the contemporary modern state of montenegro wa founded a the federal state of montenegro ( montenegrin language : / savezna drava crne gore ) on 15 november 1943 within the yugoslav federation by the state anti-fascist council for the national liberation of montenegro and boka . after the war , montenegro became a republic under it name , the socialist republic of montenegro people 's republic of montenegro ( montenegrin language : / narodna republika crna gora ) on 29 november 1945 . in 1963 , it wa renamed to the socialist republic of montenegro ( montenegrin language : / socijalistika republika crna gora ) . a the breakup of yugoslavia occurred , the srcg wa renamed to the republic of montenegro ( montenegrin language : / republika crna gora ) on 27 april 1992 within the serbia and montenegro by removing the adjective `` socialist `` from the republic 's title . since 22 october 2007 , a year after it independence , the name of the country became simply known a montenegro . </s> the iso 3166-1 alpha-2 iso alpha-2 code for montenegro is me and the iso 3166-1 alpha-3 alpha-3 code is mne . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> arrival of the slav <section_title_end> </s> three slav principality were located on the territory : duklja , roughly corresponding to the southern half , travunia , the west , and principality of serbia ( early medieval ) , the north . duklja gained it independence from the byzantine roman empire in 1042 . over the next few decade , it expanded it territory to neighbouring rascia and bosnia , and also became recognised a a kingdom . it power started declining at the beginning of the 12th century . after king bodin 's death ( in 1101 or 1108 ) , several civil war ensued . duklja reached it zenith under vojislav 's son , mihailo i of duklja ( 104681 ) , and his grandson constantine bodin ( 10811101 ) . </s> a the nobility fought for the throne , the kingdom wa weakened , and by 1186 , the territory of modern-day montenegro became part of the state ruled by stefan nemanja and wa a part of various state formation ruled by the nemanji dynasty for the next two century . after the serbian empire collapsed in the second half of the 14th century , the most powerful zetan family , the bali , became sovereign of zeta . </s> by the 13th century , zeta had replaced duklja when referring to the realm . in the late 14th century , southern montenegro ( lordship of zeta ) came under the rule of the bali noble family , then the crnojevi noble family , and by the 15th century , zeta wa more often referred to a crna gora ( venetian language : monte negro ) . </s> in 1421 , zeta wa annexed to the serbian despotate , but after 1455 , another noble family from zeta , the crnojevis , became sovereign ruler of the country , making it the last free monarchy of the balkan before it fell to the ottoman in 1496 , and got annexed to the sanjak of shkodr . during the reign of crnojevis , zeta became known under it current name ; montenegro . for a short time , montenegro existed a a separate autonomous sanjak in 15141528 ( sanjak of montenegro ) . also , old herzegovina region wa part of sanjak of herzegovina . </s> <section_title_start> ottoman period <section_title_end> </s> large portion fell under the control of the ottoman empire from 1496 to 1878 . in the 16th century , montenegro developed a unique form of autonomy within the ottoman empire permitting montenegrin clan freedom from certain restriction . nevertheless , the montenegrins were disgruntled with ottoman rule , and in the 17th century , raised numerous rebellion , which culminated in the defeat of the ottoman in the great turkish war at the end of that century . </s> montenegro consisted of territory controlled by warlike clan . most clan had a chieftain ( knez ) , who wa not permitted to assume the title unless he proved to be a worthy a leader a his predecessor . the great assembly of montenegrin clan ( zbor ) wa held every year on 12 july in cetinje , and any adult clansman could take part . </s> part of the territory were controlled by republic of venice and the first french empire and austria-hungary , it successor . in 1515 , montenegro became a theocracy led by the metropolitanate of montenegro and the littoral , which flourished after the petrovi-njego of cetinje became the traditional prince-bishops ( whose title wa `` vladika of montenegro `` ) . however , the venetian republic introduced governor who meddled in montenegrin politics . the republic wa succeeded by the austrian empire in 1797 , and the governor were abolished by prince-bishop petar ii petrovi-njego in 1832. </s> people from montenegro in this historical period have been described a orthodox serb . </s> <section_title_start> principality and kingdom of montenegro <section_title_end> </s> under nicholas i of montenegro ( ruled 18601918 ) , the principality wa enlarged several time in the montenegro-turkish war and wa recognised a independent in 1878 . nicholas i established diplomatic relation with the ottoman empire . </s> minor border skirmish excepted , diplomacy ushered in about 30 year of peace between the two state until the deposition of abdul hamid ii in 1909. </s> the political skill of abdul hamid ii and nicholas i played a major role in the mutually amicable relation . modernization of the state followed , culminating with the draft of a constitution in 1905 . however , political rift emerged between the reigning people 's party of montenegro people 's party , who supported the process of democratization and union with serbia , and those of the true people 's party , who were monarchist . </s> in 1858 one of the major montenegrin victory over the ottoman occurred at the battle of grahovac . mirko petrovi njego , elder brother of knjaz danilo , led an army of 7,500 and defeated the numerically superior ottoman with 15,000 troop at grahovac on 1 may 1858 . this forced the great power to officially demarcate the border between montenegro and ottoman empire , de facto recognizing montenegro 's independence . </s> in the battle of vuji do montenegrins inflicted major defeat to the ottoman army under grand vizier ahmed muhtar pasha . in the aftermath of the russian victory against the ottoman empire in the russo-turkish war of 18771878 , the great power of europe restructured the map of the balkan region . the ottoman empire recognized independence of montenegro in the treaty of berlin ( 1878 ) in 1878. </s> the first montenegrin constitution ( also known a the danilo code ) wa proclaimed in 1855. </s> in 1910 montenegro became kingdom of montenegro , and a a result of the balkan war in 1912 and 1913 ( in which the ottoman lost most of their balkan land ) , a common border with serbia wa established , with shkodr being awarded to a newly created albania , though the current capital city of montenegro , podgorica , wa on the old border of albania and yugoslavia . montenegro became one of the ally of world war i during world war i ( 191418 ) . in the battle of mojkovac fought in january 1916 between austria-hungary and the kingdom of montenegro , montenegrins achieved decisive victory despite being outnumbered five to one . from 1916 to october 1918 austria-hungary occupied montenegro . during the occupation , king nicholas fled the country and a government-in-exile wa set up in bordeaux . </s> <section_title_start> kingdom of yugoslavia <section_title_end> </s> in 1922 , montenegro formally became the zeta oblast in the kingdom of serb , croat and slovene , with the addition of the coastal area around budva and bay of kotor . in a further restructuring in 1929 , it became a part of a larger zeta banovina of the kingdom of yugoslavia that reached the neretva river . </s> nicholas 's grandson , the serb king alexander i of yugoslavia , dominated the yugoslav government . zeta banovina wa one of nine banovinas which formed the kingdom ; it consisted of the present-day montenegro and part of serbia , croatia , and bosnia . </s> <section_title_start> world war ii and socialist yugoslavia <section_title_end> </s> in april 1941 , nazi germany , the kingdom of italy , and other axis ally attacked and occupied the kingdom of yugoslavia . italian force occupied montenegro and established it a a puppet italian governorate of montenegro . </s> in may , the montenegrin branch of the communist party of yugoslavia started preparation for an uprising planned for mid-july . the communist party and it youth league organised 6,000 of it member into detachment prepared for guerrilla warfare . according to some historian , the first armed uprising in nazi germany-occupied europe happened on 13 july 1941 in montenegro . </s> unexpectedly , the uprising took hold , and by 20 july , 32,000 men and woman had joined the fight . except for the coast and major town ( podgorica , cetinje , pljevlja , and niki ) , which were besieged , montenegro wa mostly liberated . in a month of fighting , the italian army suffered 5,000 dead , wounded , and captured . the uprising lasted until mid-august , when it wa suppressed by a counter-offensive of 67,000 italian troop brought in from albania . faced with new and overwhelming italian force , many of the fighter laid down their arm and returned home . nevertheless , intense guerrilla fighting lasted until december . </s> fighter who remained under arm fractured into two group . most of them went on to join the yugoslav partisan , consisting of communist and those inclined towards active resistance ; these included arso jovanovi , sava kovaevi ( yugoslav partisan ) , svetozar vukmanovi-tempo , milovan ilas , peko dapevi , vlado dapevi , veljko vlahovi , and blao jovanovi . those loyal to the karaorevi dynasty and opposing communism went on to become chetniks , and turned to collaboration with italian against the partisan . </s> war broke out between partisan and chetniks during the first half of 1942 . pressured by italian and chetniks , the core of the montenegrin partisan went to serbia and bosnia , where they joined with other yugoslav partisan . fighting between partisan and chetniks continued through the war . chetniks with italian backing controlled most of the country from mid-1942 to april 1943 . montenegrin chetniks received the status of `` anti-communist militia `` and received weapon , ammunition , food ration , and money from italy . most of them were moved to mostar , where they fought in the battle of neretva against the partisan , but were dealt a heavy defeat . </s> during the german operation schwartz against the partisan in may and june 1943 , german disarmed large number of chetniks without fighting , a they feared they would turn against them in case of an allied invasion of the balkan . after the capitulation of italy in september 1943 , partisan managed to take hold of most of montenegro for a brief time , but montenegro wa soon german occupied territory of montenegro , and fierce fighting continued during late 1943 and entire 1944 . montenegro wa liberated by the partisan in december 1944. </s> montenegro became one of the six constituent republic of the communist socialist federal republic of yugoslavia ( sfry ) . it capital became podgorica , renamed titograd in honour of president josip broz tito . after the war , the infrastructure of yugoslavia wa rebuilt , industrialization began , and the university of montenegro wa established . greater autonomy wa established until the socialist republic of montenegro ratified a new constitution in 1974. </s> <section_title_start> montenegro within fr yugoslavia <section_title_end> </s> after the dissolution of the sfry in 1992 , montenegro remained part of a smaller federal republic of yugoslavia along with serbia . </s> in the montenegrin independence referendum , 1992 , the turnout wa 66 % , with 96 % of the vote cast in favour of the federation with serbia . the referendum wa boycotted by the muslim , albanian , and catholic minority , a well a the pro-independence montenegrins . the opponent claimed that the poll wa organized under anti-democracy with widespread propaganda from the state-controlled medium in favour of a pro-federation vote . no impartial report on the fairness of the referendum wa made , a it wa unmonitored , unlike in a later 2006 referendum when european union observer were present . </s> during the 19911995 bosnian war and croatian war , montenegrin police and military force joined serbian troop in the attack on dubrovnik , croatia . these operation , aimed at acquiring more territory , were characterized by a consistent pattern of large-scale violation of human right . </s> montenegrin general pavle strugar wa convicted for his part in the bombing of dubrovnik . </s> bosnian refugee were arrested by montenegrin police and transported to serb camp in foa ethnic cleansing , where they were subjected to systematic torture and executed . </s> in 1996 , milo ukanovi 's government severed tie between montenegro and it partner serbia , which wa led by slobodan miloevi . montenegro formed it own economic policy and adopted the german deutsche mark a it currency and subsequently montenegro and the euro , although not part of the eurozone currency union . subsequent government pursued pro-independence policy , and political tension with serbia simmered despite the political change in belgrade . </s> target in montenegro were bombed by nato force during operation allied force in 1999 , although the extent of these attack wa limited in both time and area affected . </s> in 2002 , serbia and montenegro came to a new agreement for continued cooperation and entered into negotiation regarding the future status of the federal republic of yugoslavia . this resulted in the belgrade agreement , which saw the country 's transformation into a more decentralised state union named serbia and montenegro in 2003 . the belgrade agreement also contained a provision delaying any future referendum on the independence of montenegro for at least three year . </s> <section_title_start> independence and recent history <section_title_end> </s> the status of the union between montenegro and serbia wa decided by a montenegrin independence referendum , 2006 on 21 may 2006 . a total of 419,240 vote were cast , representing 86.5 % of the total electorate ; 230,661 vote ( 55.5 % ) were for independence and 185,002 vote ( 44.5 % ) were against . this narrowly surpassed the 55 % threshold needed to validate the referendum under the rule set by the european union . according to the electoral commission , the 55 % threshold wa passed by only 2,300 vote . serbia , the member-states of the european union , and the permanent member of the united nation security council all diplomatic recognition montenegro 's independence . </s> the 2006 referendum wa monitored by five international observer mission , headed by an organization for security and co-operation in europe ( osce ) /odihr team , and around 3,000 observer in total ( including domestic observer from center for democracy and technology ( osce pa ) , the parliamentary assembly of the council of europe ( pace ) , the congress of local and regional authority of the council of europe ( clrae ) , and the european parliament ( ep ) to form an international referendum observation mission ( irom ) . the iromin it preliminary report `` assessed compliance of the referendum process with osce commitment , council of europe commitment , other international standard for democratic electoral process , and domestic legislation . `` furthermore , the report stated that the competitive pre-referendum environment wa marked by an active and generally peaceful campaign and that `` there were no report of restriction on fundamental civil and political right . `` </s> on 3 june 2006 , the montenegrin parliament declared the independence of montenegro , formally confirming the result of the referendum . </s> the law on the status of the descendant of the petrovi njego dynasty wa passed by the parliament of montenegro on 12 july 2011 . it rehabilitated the house of petrovi-njego and recognized limited symbolic role within the constitutional framework of the republic . </s> in 2015 , the investigative journalist ' network organized crime and corruption reporting project named montenegro 's long-time president and prime minister milo ukanovi `` person of the year in organized crime `` . the extent of ukanovi 's corruption led to street demonstration and call for his removal . </s> in october 2016 , for the day of the montenegrin parliamentary election , 2016 , a montenegrin coup d'tat attempt coup d'tat wa prepared by a group of person that included leader of the montenegrin opposition , serbian national and russian agent ; the coup wa prevented . in 2017 , fourteen people , including two russian national and two montenegrin opposition leader , andrija mandi and milan kneevi ( montenegrin politician ) , were indicted for their alleged role in the coup attempt on charge such a `` preparing a conspiracy against the constitutional order and the security of montenegro `` and an `` attempted terrorist act . `` </s> montenegro formally montenegronato relation of nato in june 2017 , though `` montenegro remains deeply divided over joining nato `` , an event that triggered a promise of retaliatory action on the part of russia 's government . </s> montenegro ha been in accession of montenegro to the european union with the eu since 2012 . in 2018 , the earlier goal of acceding by 2022 wa revised to 2025. </s> the 2019 montenegrin anti-corruption protest montenegrin anti-corruption protest began in february 2019 against the incumbent president milo ukanovi and the prime minister duko markovi-led government of montenegro # markovi cabinet ( 2016-present ) of the ruling democratic party of socialist ( dp ) , which ha been in power since 1991. </s> a of late december 2019 , the newly adopted law on religion , which de jure transfer the ownership of church building and estate built before 1918 from the serbian orthodox church to the montenegrin state , sparked a series of large 20192020 clerical protest in montenegro followed with road blockage . seventeen opposition democratic front ( montenegro ) mp were arrested prior to the voting for disrupting the vote . demonstration continued into march 2020 a peaceful protest walk , mostly organised by the metropolitanate of montenegro and the littoral in a number of montenegrin municipality . </s> in it political right and civil liberty worldwide report in may 2020 , freedom house marked montenegro a a [ regime ] rather than a democracy because of declining standard in governance , justice , election , and medium freedom . for the first time in three decade , in the 2020 montenegrin parliamentary election , the opposition won more vote than ukanovi 's ruling party . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> montenegro range from high peak along it border with serbia , kosovo , and albania , a segment of the karst of the western balkan peninsula , to a narrow coastal plain that is only wide . the plain stop abruptly in the north , where mount loven and mount orjen plunge into the inlet of the bay of kotor . </s> montenegro 's large karst region lie generally at elevation of above sea level ; some part , however , rise to , such a mount orjen ( ) , the highest massif among the coastal limestone range . the zeta river valley , at an elevation of , is the lowest segment . </s> the mountain of montenegro include some of the most rugged terrain in europe , averaging more than in elevation . one of the country 's notable peak is bobotov kuk in the durmitor mountain , which reach a height of . owing to the hyperhumid climate on their western side , the montenegrin mountain range were among the most ice-eroded part of the balkan peninsula during the last glacial period . </s> internationally , montenegro border croatia , bosnia and herzegovina , serbia , kosovo , and albania . it lie between latitude 41st parallel north 41 and 44th parallel north 44n , and longitude 18th meridian east 18 and 21st meridian east 21e . </s> * longest beach : velika plaa , ulcinj ; </s> * highest peak : zla kolata , prokletije at </s> * largest lake : skadar lake ; of surface area </s> * deepest canyon : tara river canyon ; </s> * biggest bay : bay of kotor ; </s> * deepest cave : iron deep , exploring started in 2012 , now more than long </s> montenegro is a member of the international commission for the protection of the danube river , a more than of the country 's territory lie within the danube drainage basin . </s> <section_title_start> biodiversity <section_title_end> </s> the diversity of the geological base , landscape , climate , and soil , and the position of montenegro on the balkan peninsula and adriatic sea , created the condition for high biological diversity , putting montenegro among the `` hot-spots `` of european and world biodiversity . the number of specie per area unit index in montenegro is 0.837 , which is the highest index recorded in any european country . </s> montenegro is home to three terrestrial ecoregions : balkan mixed forest , dinaric mountain mixed forest , and illyrian deciduous forest . it had a 2019 forest landscape integrity index mean score of 6.41/10 , ranking it 73rd globally out of 172 country . </s> <section_title_start> politics <section_title_end> </s> the constitution of montenegro describes the state a a `` civic engagement , democratic , environmentalism state of social justice , based on the rule of law . `` montenegro is an independent and sovereign republic that proclaimed it new constitution on 22 october 2007. </s> the president of montenegro is the [ of state ] , elected for a period of five year through direct election . the president represents the country abroad , promulgates law by ordinance , call election for the parliament of montenegro , and proposes candidate for prime minister of montenegro , president and justice of the constitutional court to the parliament . the president also proposes the calling of a referendum to parliament , grant amnesty for criminal offence prescribed by the national law , confers decoration and award and performs other constitutional duty and is a member of the supreme defence council . the official residence of the president is in cetinje . </s> the government of montenegro is the executive ( government ) of government authority of montenegro . the government is headed by the prime minister of montenegro , and consists of the deputy prime minister a well a minister . </s> the parliament of montenegro is a unicameral legislature body . it pass law , ratifies treaty , appoints the prime minister , minister , and justice of all court , adopts the budget and performs other duty a established by the constitution . parliament can pas a vote of no-confidence in the government by a simple majority . one representative is elected per 6,000 voter . </s> in 2019 , the freedom house reported that year of increasing state capture , abuse of power , and strongman tactic employed by the president ukanovi have tipped his country over the edge for the first time since 2003 , montenegro is no longer categorized a democracy and became a [ regime ] . the dp narrowly lost the 2020 montenegrin parliamentary election , ending it 30-year rule . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relation of montenegro <section_title_end> </s> after the promulgation of the declaration of independence in the parliament of the republic of montenegro on 3 june 2006 , following the independence referendum held on 21 may , the government of the republic of montenegro assumed the competence of defining and conducting the foreign policy of montenegro a a subject of international law and a sovereign state . the implementation of this constitutional responsibility wa vested in the ministry of foreign affair , which wa given the task of defining the foreign policy priority and activity needed for their implementation . these activity are pursued in close cooperation with other state administration authority , the president , the speaker of the parliament , and other relevant stakeholder . </s> integration into the european union is montenegro 's strategic goal . this process will remain in the focus of montenegrin foreign policy in the short term . </s> the second strategic and equally important goal , but one attainable in a shorter time span , wa joining nato , which would guarantee stability and security for pursuing other strategic goal . montenegro belief nato integration would speed up eu integration . in may 2017 nato accepted montenegro a a nato member starting 5 june 2017. </s> <section_title_start> symbol <section_title_end> </s> an official flag of montenegro , based on the royal standard of king nicholas i , wa adopted on 12 july 2004 by the montenegrin legislature . this royal flag wa red with a silver border , a silver coat of arm , and the initial , in cyrillic script ( corresponding to ni in latin script ) , representing king nicholas i . on the current flag , the border and arm are in gold and the royal cipher in the centre of the arm ha been replaced with a golden lion . </s> the national day of statehood day ( montenegro ) mark the date in 1878 when the congress of berlin recognized montenegro a the 27th independent state in the world and the start of one of the first popular uprising in europe against the axis power on 13 july 1941 in montenegro . </s> in 2004 , the montenegrin legislature selected a popular montenegrin traditional song , `` oj , svijetla majska zoro oh , bright dawn of may `` , a the national anthem . montenegro 's official anthem during the reign of king nicholas i wa ubavoj nam crnoj gori ( `` to our beautiful montenegro `` ) . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> the military of montenegro is a fully professional standing army under the ministry of defence ( montenegro ) and is composed of the montenegrin ground army , the montenegrin navy , and the montenegrin air force , along with special force . conscription wa abolished in 2006 . the military currently maintains a force of 1,920 active duty member . the bulk of it equipment and force were inherited from the armed force of the state union of serbia and montenegro ; a montenegro contained the entire coastline of the former union , it retained practically the entire naval force . </s> montenegro wa a member of nato 's partnership for peace program and then became an official candidate for full membership in the alliance . montenegro applied for a membership action plan on 5 november 2008 , which wa granted in december 2009 . montenegro is also a member of adriatic charter . montenegro wa invited to join nato on 2 december 2015 and on 19 may 2016 , nato and montenegro conducted a signing ceremony at nato headquarters in brussels for montenegro 's membership invitation . montenegro became nato 's 29th member state of nato on 5 june 2017 , despite russia 's objection . the government plan to have the army participate in peacekeeping mission through the un and nato such a the international security assistance force . </s> <section_title_start> administrative division <section_title_end> </s> montenegro is divided into twenty-three municipality ( optina ) . this includes 21 district-level municipality and 2 urban municipality , with two subdivision of municipality of podgorica , listed below . each municipality can contain multiple city and town . historically , the territory of the country wa divided into `` nahije `` . </s> { border= `` 0 `` cellpadding= `` 4 `` </s> - </s> ! no . municipality seat </s> - </s> 1 pljevlja municipality pljevlja </s> - </s> 2 pluine municipality pluine </s> - </s> 3 abljak municipality abljak </s> - </s> 4 mojkovac municipality mojkovac </s> - </s> 5 bijelo polje municipality bijelo polje </s> - </s> 6 berane municipality / petnjica municipality berane / petnjica ( 22 ) andrijevica </s> - </s> 12 plav municipality / gusinje municipality plav municipality / gusinje ( 23 ) </s> - </s> 13 kotor municipality kotor </s> - </s> 14 old royal capital cetinje cetinje </s> - </s> 15 danilovgrad municipality danilovgrad </s> - </s> 16 podgorica capital city podgorica / tuzi ( 24 ) </s> - </s> 17 herceg novi municipality herceg novi </s> - </s> 18 tivat municipality tivat </s> - </s> 19 budva municipality budva </s> - </s> 20 bar municipality bar , montenegro </s> - </s> 21 ulcinj municipality ulcinj </s> } </s> <section_title_start> city in montenegro <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> the economy of montenegro is mostly tertiary sector of the economy service-based and is in transition economy to a market economy . according to the international monetary fund , the nominal gdp of montenegro wa $ 5.424 ; billion in 2019 . the purchasing power parity for 2019 wa $ 12.516 ; billion , or $ 20,083 per caput . according to eurostat data , the montenegrin gdp per caput stood at 48 % of the eu average in 2018 . the central bank of montenegro is not part of the euro system but the country is `` euroisation `` , using montenegro and the euro a it currency . </s> gdp grew at 10.7 % in 2007 and 7.5 % in 2008 . the country entered a recession in 2008 a a part of the late-2000s recession , with gdp contracting by 4 % . however , montenegro remained a target for foreign direct investment , the only country in the balkan to increase it amount of direct foreign investment . the country exited the recession in mid-2010 , with gdp growth at around 0.5 % . however , the significant dependence of the montenegrin economy on foreign direct investment leaf it susceptible to external shock and a high export/import trade deficit . </s> in 2007 , the service sector made up 72.4 % of gdp , with industry and agriculture making up the rest at 17.6 % and 10 % , respectively . there are 50,000 farming household in montenegro that rely on agriculture to fill the family budget . </s> <section_title_start> infrastructure <section_title_end> </s> the montenegrin road infrastructure is not yet at western european standard . despite an extensive road network , no road are built to full motorway standard . construction of new motorway is considered a national priority , a they are important for uniform regional economic development and the development of montenegro a an attractive tourist destination . </s> current european route that pas through montenegro are european route e65 and european route e80 . </s> the backbone of the montenegrin rail network is the belgradebar railway , which provides international connection towards serbia . there is a domestic branch line , the niki-podgorica railway , which wa operated a a freight-only line for decade , and is now also open for passenger traffic after the reconstruction and electrification work in 2012 . the other branch line from podgorica towards the albanian border , the podgoricashkodr railway , is not in use . </s> montenegro ha two international airport , podgorica airport and tivat airport . the two airport served 1.1 ; million passenger in 2008. </s> the port of bar is montenegro 's main seaport . initially built in 1906 , the port wa almost completely destroyed during world war ii , with reconstruction beginning in 1950 . today , it is equipped to handle over 5 million ton of cargo annually , though the breakup of the former yugoslavia and the size of the montenegrin industrial sector ha resulted in the port operating at a loss and well below capacity for several year . the reconstruction of the belgrade-bar railway and the proposed belgrade-bar motorway are expected to bring the port back up to capacity . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> montenegro ha both a picturesque coast and a mountainous northern region . the country wa a well-known tourist spot in the 1980s . yet , the yugoslav war that were fought in neighbouring country during the 1990s crippled the tourist industry and damaged the image of montenegro for year . </s> with a total of 1.6 ; million visitor , montenegro is the 36th most visited country ( out of 47 country ) in europe . the montenegrin adriatic coast is long , with of beach and many well-preserved ancient old town . national geographic traveler ( edited once a decade ) rank montenegro among the `` 50 place of a lifetime `` , and the montenegrin seaside sveti stefan wa used a the cover for the magazine . the coast region of montenegro is considered one of the great new `` discovery `` among world tourist . in january 2010 , the new york time ranked the ulcinj south coast region of montenegro , including velika plaza , ada bojana , and the hotel mediteran of ulcinj , among the `` top 31 place to go in 2010 `` a part of a worldwide ranking of tourism destination . </s> montenegro wa also listed by yahoo travel among the `` 10 top hot spot of 2009 `` to visit , describing it a being `` [ c ] urrently ranked a the second fastest growing tourism market in the world ( falling just behind china ) `` . it is listed every year by prestigious tourism guide like lonely planet a a top tourist destination along with greece , spain and other popular location . </s> it wa not until the 2000s that the tourism industry began to recover , and the country ha since experienced a high rate of growth in the number of visit and overnight stay . </s> <section_title_start> demographic <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> ethnic structure <section_title_end> </s> according to the 2003 census , montenegro ha 620,145 citizen . if the methodology used up to 1991 had been adopted in the 2003 census , montenegro would officially have recorded 673,094 citizen . the result of the 2011 census show that montenegro had 620,029 citizen . </s> montenegro is a multinational state in which no ethnic group form a majority . major ethnic group include montenegrins ( ethnic group ) ( /crnogorci ) and serb ( /srbi ) ; others are bosniaks ( bonjaci ) , albanian ( albanci ; shqiptart ) and croat ( hrvati ) . the number of `` montenegrins `` and `` serb `` fluctuates widely from census to census due to change in how people perceive , experience , or choose to express , their identity and ethnic affiliation . </s> ethnic composition according to the 2011 official data : </s> { border= `` 1 `` cellpadding= `` 4 `` cellspacing= `` 0 `` class= `` toccolours `` style= `` align : left ; margin:0.5em 0 0 ; ( 1994 ) . the late medieval balkan : a critical survey from the late twelfth century to the ottoman conquest . the university of michigan press . </s> * </s> <section_title_start> further reading 2002 ) </s> * longley , norm . the rough guide to montenegro ( 2009 ) </s> * morrison , kenneth . montenegro : a modern history ( 2009 ) </s> * robert , elizabeth . realm of the black mountain : a
