govpubs </s> * </s> * montenegro profile from the bbc news </s> * culture corner leading montenegrin web portal for culture </s> * official website national park montenegro </s> * </s> * </s> category : montenegro </s> category:2006 establishment in montenegro * </s> category : balkan country </s> category : country in europe </s> category : member state of nato </s> category : member state of the council of europe </s> category : member state of the union for the mediterranean </s> category : member state of the united nation </s> category : serbian-speaking country and territory </s> category : southeastern european country </s> category : southern european country </s> category : state and territory established in 2006 <article_end> <article_start> </s> <article_end> <article_start> </s> angola ( ; ) , officially the republic of angola ( repblica de angola ) , is a country in the west coast of southern africa . it is the second largest lusophone ( list of territorial entity where portuguese is an official language portuguese-speaking ) country in both total area and list of country and dependency by population ( behind brazil ) , and it is the list of african country by area seventh-largest country in africa , bordered by namibia to the south , the democratic republic of the congo to the north , zambia to the east , and the atlantic ocean to the west . angola ha an enclave and exclave province , the province of cabinda province that border the republic of the congo and the democratic republic of the congo . the capital and largest city is luanda . </s> angola ha been inhabited since the paleolithic . it formation a a nation state originates from european exploration of africa , which initially began with coastal settlement and trading post founded in the 16th century . in the 19th century , european settler gradually began to establish themselves in the interior . the portuguese angola that became angola did not have it present border until the early 20th century , owing to resistance by native group such a the cuamato , the oukwanyama and the mbunda people . </s> after a protracted angolan war of independence anti-colonial struggle , angola achieved independence in 1975 a a marxismleninism marxistleninist people 's republic of angola one-party republic . the country descended into a devastating angolan civil war the same year , between the ruling mpla people 's movement for the liberation of angola ( mpla ) , backed by the soviet union and cuba , and the insurgent anti-communist unita ( unita ) , supported by the united state and south africa . following the end of the war in 2002 , angola emerged a a relatively stable unitary state , presidential system republic . </s> angola ha vast mineral resource estimation and oil reserve , and it economy is among the fastest-growing in the world , especially since the end of the civil war . however , economic growth is highly uneven , with most of the nation 's distribution of wealth # wealth concentration in a disproportionately small sector of the population . the standard of living remains low for most angolan ; life expectancy is among the lowest in the world , while infant mortality is among the highest . </s> angola is a member of the united nation , opec , african union , the community of portuguese language country , and the southern african development community . it population of 25.8 million is multicultural and multiethnic . angolan culture reflects century of portuguese rule , namely the predominance of the portuguese language and of the catholic church , intermingled with a variety of indigenous custom and tradition . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> the name angola come from the portuguese language colonial name portuguese angola ( 'kingdom of angola ' ) , which appeared a early a paulo dia de novais 's 1571 charter . the toponymy wa derived by the portuguese from the title list of ngolas of ndongo held by the king of kingdom of ndongo . ndongo in the [ between the cuanza river kwanza ] and [ [ lucala river , wa nominally a possession of the kingdom of kongo , but wa seeking greater independence in the 16th century . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> early migration and political units <section_title_end> </s> modern angola wa populated predominantly by nomadic khoi and san people prior to the first bantu migration . the khoi and san people were neither pastoralisms nor cultivator , but rather [ name=henderson they were displaced by bantu people ] arriving from the north in the first millennium bc , most of whom likely originated in what is today northwestern [ [ nigeria and southern niger . bantu speaker introduced the cultivation of banana and taro , a well a large cattle herd , to angola 's central highland and the luanda plain . </s> a number of political entity were established ; the best-known of these wa the kingdom of the kongo , based in angola , which extended northward to what is now the democratic republic of the congo , the republic of the congo and gabon . it established trade route with other city-state and civilisation up and down the coast of southwestern and western africa and even with great zimbabwe and the mutapa empire , although it engaged in little or no transoceanic trade . to it south lay the kingdom of ndongo , from which the area of the later portuguese colony wa sometimes known a dongo . </s> <section_title_start> portuguese colonization <section_title_end> </s> kingdom of portugal age of discovery diogo co reached the area in 1484 . the previous year , the portuguese had established relation with the kingdom of kongo , which stretched at the time from modern gabon in the north to the kwanza river in the south . the portuguese established their primary early trading post at soyo , which is now the northernmost city in angola apart from the cabinda province enclave and exclave . paulo dia de novais founded so paulo de loanda ( luanda ) in 1575 with a hundred family of settler and four hundred soldier . benguela wa fortified in 1587 and became a township in 1617. </s> the portuguese established several other settlement , fort and trading post along the angolan coast , principally trading in slavery in angola for plantation in the american south . local slave dealer provided a large number of slave for the portuguese empire , usually in exchange for manufactured good from europe . </s> this part of the atlantic slave trade continued until after empire of brazil brazil 's independence of brazil in the 1820s . </s> despite portugal 's territorial claim in angola , it control over much of the country 's vast interior wa minimal . in the 16th century portugal gained control of the coast through a series of treaty and war . life for european colonist wa difficult and progress slow . john iliffe ( historian ) note that `` portuguese record of angola from the 16th century show that a great famine occurred on average every seventy year ; accompanied by epidemic disease , it might kill one-third or one-half of the population , destroying the demographic growth of a generation and forcing colonist back into the river valley `` . </s> during the portuguese restoration war , the dutch west india company dutch loango-angola the principal settlement of luanda in 1641 , using alliance with local people to carry out attack against portuguese holding elsewhere . a fleet under salvador de s retook luanda in 1648 ; reconquest of the rest of the territory wa completed by 1650 . new treaty with the kingdom of kongo were signed in 1649 ; others with nzinga of ndongo and matamba 's kingdom of matamba and ndongo followed in 1656 . the conquest of pungo andongo in 1671 wa the last major portuguese expansion from luanda , a attempt to invade kongo in 1670 and matamba in 1681 failed . colonial outpost also expanded inward from benguela , but until the late 19th century the inroad from luanda and benguela were very limited . hamstrung by a series of political upheaval in the early 1800s , portugal wa slow to mount a large scale annexation of angolan territory . </s> the slave trade wa abolished in angola in 1836 , and in 1854 the colonial government freed all it existing slave . four year later , a more progressive administration appointed by lisbon abolished slavery altogether . however , these decree remained largely unenforceable , and the portuguese depended on assistance from the british royal navy to enforce their ban on the slave trade . this coincided with a series of renewed military expedition into the bush . </s> by the mid-nineteenth century portugal had established it dominion a far east a the congo river and a far south a momedes . until the late 1880s , lisbon entertained proposal to link angola with it colony in mozambique but wa blocked by british and belgian opposition . in this period , the portuguese came up against different form of armed resistance from various people in angola . </s> the berlin conference in 18841885 set the colony 's border , delineating the boundary of portuguese claim in angola , although many detail were unresolved until the 1920s . trade between portugal and it african territory rapidly increased a a result of protective tariff , leading to increased development , and a wave of new portuguese immigrant . </s> <section_title_start> angolan independence <section_title_end> </s> under colonial law , black angolan were forbidden from forming political party or labour union . the first nationalist movement did not take root until after world war ii , spearheaded by a largely westernised , portuguese-speaking urban class which included many mestios . during the early 1960s they were joined by other association stemming from ad hoc labour activism in the rural workforce . portugal 's refusal to address increasing angolan demand for self-determination provoked an armed conflict which erupted in 1961 with the baixa de cassanje revolt and gradually evolved into a protracted angolan war of independence that persisted for the next twelve year . throughout the conflict , three militant nationalist movement with their own partisan guerrilla wing emerged from the fighting between the portuguese government and local force , supported to varying degree by the portuguese communist party . </s> the fnla ( fnla ) recruited from bakongo refugee in zaire . benefiting from particularly favourable political circumstance in kinshasha , and especially from a common border with zaire , angolan political exile were able to build up a power base among a large expatriate community from related family , clan , and tradition . people on both side of the border spoke mutually intelligible dialect and enjoyed shared tie to the historical kingdom of kongo . though a foreigner skilled angolan could not take advantage of mobutu sese seko 's state employment programme , some found work a middleman for the absentee owner of various lucrative private venture . the migrant eventually formed the fnla with the intention of making a bid for political power upon their envisaged return to angola . </s> a largely ovimbundu guerrilla initiative against the portuguese in central angola from 1966 wa spearheaded by jonas savimbi and the unita ( unita ) . it remained handicapped by it geographic remoteness from friendly border , the ethnic fragmentation of the ovimbundu , and the isolation of peasant on european plantation where they had little opportunity to mobilise . </s> during the late 1950s , the rise of the marxistleninist mpla ( mpla ) in the east and dembos hill north of luanda came to hold special significance . formed a a coalition resistance movement by the angolan communist party , the organisation 's leadership remained predominantly ambundu and courted public sector worker in luanda . although both the mpla and it rival accepted material assistance from the soviet union or the people 's republic of china , the former harboured strong anti-imperialist view and wa openly critical of the united state and it support for portugal . this allowed it to win important ground on the diplomatic front , soliciting support from nonaligned government in morocco , ghana , guinea , mali , and the united arab republic . </s> the mpla attempted to move it headquarters from conakry to lopoldville in october 1961 , renewing effort to create a common front with the fnla , then known a the union of angolan people ( upa ) and it leader holden roberto . roberto turned down the offer . when the mpla first attempted to insert it own insurgent into angola , the cadre were ambushed and annihilated by upa partisan on roberto 's orderssetting a precedent for the bitter factional strife which would later ignite the angolan civil war . </s> <section_title_start> angolan civil war <section_title_end> </s> throughout the war of independence , the three rival nationalist movement were severely hampered by political and military factionalism , a well a their inability to unite guerrilla effort against the portuguese . between 1961 and 1975 the mpla , unita , and the fnla competed for influence in the angolan population and the international community . the soviet union and cuba became especially sympathetic towards the mpla and supplied that party with arm , ammunition , funding , and training . they also backed unita militant until it became clear that the latter wa at irreconcilable odds with the mpla . </s> the collapse of portugal 's estado novo ( portugal ) government following the 1974 carnation revolution suspended all portuguese military activity in africa and the brokering of a ceasefire pending negotiation for angolan independence . encouraged by the organisation of african unity , holden roberto , jonas savimbi , and mpla chairman agostinho neto met in mombasa in early january 1975 and agreed to form a coalition government . this wa ratified by the alvor agreement later that month , which called for general election and set the country 's independence date for 11 november 1975 . all three faction , however , followed up on the ceasefire by taking advantage of the gradual portuguese withdrawal to seize various strategic position , acquire more arm , and enlarge their militant force . the rapid influx of weapon from numerous external source , especially the soviet union and the united state , a well a the escalation of tension between the nationalist party , fueled a new outbreak of hostility . with tacit american and zairean support the fnla began massing large number of troop in northern angola in an attempt to gain military superiority . meanwhile , the mpla began securing control of luanda , a traditional ambundu stronghold . sporadic violence broke out in luanda over the next few month after the fnla attacked mpla force in march 1975 . the fighting intensified with street clash in april and may , and unita became involved after over two hundred of it member were massacred by an mpla contingent that june . an upswing in soviet arm shipment to the mpla influenced a decision by the central intelligence agency to likewise provide substantial covert aid to the fnla and unita . </s> in august 1975 , the mpla requested direct assistance from the soviet union in the form of ground troop . the soviet declined , offering to send adviser but no troop ; however , cuba wa more forthcoming and in late september dispatched nearly five hundred combat personnel to angola , along with sophisticated weaponry and supply . by independence there were over a thousand cuban soldier in the country . they were kept supplied by a massive cubaangola airbridge carried out with soviet aircraft . the persistent buildup of cuban and soviet military aid allowed the mpla to drive it opponent from luanda and blunt an abortive intervention by zairean and south african troop , which had deployed in a belated attempt to assist the fnla and unita . the fnla wa largely annihilated , although unita managed to withdraw it civil official and militia from luanda and seek sanctuary in the southern province . from there , savimbi continued to mount a determined insurgent campaign against the mpla . </s> between 1975 and 1991 , the mpla implemented an economic and political system based on the principle of scientific socialism , incorporating planned economy and a marxistleninist one-party state . it embarked on an ambitious programme of nationalization , and the domestic private sector wa essentially abolished . privately owned enterprise were nationalised and incorporated into a single umbrella of state-owned enterprise known a unidades economicas estatais ( uee ) . under the mpla , angola experienced a significant degree of modern industrialisation . however , corruption and graft also increased and public resource were either allocated inefficiently or simply embezzled by official for personal enrichment . the ruling party survived an attempted coup d'tat by the maoism-oriented communist organization of angola ( oca ) in 1977 , which wa suppressed after a series of bloody political purge left thousand of oca supporter dead . </s> the mpla abandoned it former marxist ideology at it third party congress in 1990 , and declared social democracy to be it new platform . angola subsequently became a member of the international monetary fund ; restriction on the market economy were also reduced in an attempt to draw foreign investment . by may 1991 it reached a peace agreement with unita , the bicesse accord , which scheduled angolan general election , 1992 for september 1992 . when the mpla secured a major electoral victory , unita objected to the result of both the presidential and legislative vote count and returned to war . following the election , the halloween massacre ( angola ) occurred from 30 october to 1 november , where mpla force killed thousand of unita supporter . </s> <section_title_start> 21st century <section_title_end> </s> on 22 march 2002 , jonas savimbi wa killed in action against government troop . unita and the mpla reached a cease-fire shortly afterwards . unita gave up it armed wing and assumed the role of a major opposition party . although the political situation of the country began to stabilise , regular democratic process did not prevail until the election in angola in 2008 and 2012 and the adoption of a new constitution of angola in 2010 , all of which strengthened the prevailing dominant-party system . </s> angola ha a serious humanitarian crisis ; the result of the prolonged war , of the abundance of minefield , of the continued political ( and to a much lesser degree ) military activity in favour of the independence of the enclave and exclave of cabinda ( province ) ( carried out in the context of the protracted cabinda war by the front for the liberation of the enclave of cabinda ) , but most of all , by the depredation of the country 's rich mineral resource by the rgime . while most of the internally displaced have now settled around the capital , in the so-called wikt : musseques , the general situation for angolan remains desperate . </s> drought in 2016 caused the worst food crisis in southern africa in 25 year . drought affected 1.4 million people across seven of angola 's 18 province . food price rose and acute malnutrition rate doubled , with more than 95,000 child affected . </s> jos eduardo do santos stepped down a president of angola after 38 year in 2017 , being peacefully succeeded by joo loureno , santos ' chosen successor . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> at , angola is the world 's twenty-third largest country - comparable in size to mali , or twice the size of france or of texas . it lie mostly between latitude 4th parallel south 4 and 18th parallel south 18 , and longitude 12th meridian east 12 and 24th meridian east 24e . </s> angola border namibia to the south , zambia to the east , the democratic republic of the congo to the north-east and the south atlantic ocean to the west . </s> the coastal enclave and exclave of cabinda ( province ) in the north ha border with the republic of the congo to the north and with the democratic republic of the congo to the south . </s> angola 's capital , luanda , lie on the atlantic coast in the northwest of the country . </s> angola had a 2018 forest landscape integrity index mean score of 8.35/10 , ranking it 23rd globally out of 172 country . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> angola , although located in a tropical zone , ha a climate uncharacteristic of this zone , due to the confluence of three factor : </s> * the cold benguela current flowing along the southern part of the coast </s> * the relief in the interior </s> * the influence of the namib desert in the southwest </s> angola 's climate feature two season : </s> * rainfall from november to april </s> * drought , known a cacimbo , from may to october , drier , a the name implies , and with lower temperature </s> while the coastline ha high rainfall rate , decreasing from north to south and from to , with average annual temperature above , one can divide the interior zone into three area : </s> * north , with high rainfall and high temperature </s> * central plateau , with a dry season and average temperature of the order of 19 ; c </s> * south , with very high thermal amplitude due to the proximity of the kalahari desert and the influence of mass of tropical air </s> <section_title_start> administrative divisions <section_title_end> </s> , angola is divided into province of angola ( provncias ) and municipality of angola . the municipality are further divided into 559 commune ( township ) . the province are : </s> <section_title_start> exclave of cabinda <section_title_end> </s> with an area of approximately , the northern angolan province of cabinda is unusual in being separated from the rest of the country by a strip , some wide , of the democratic republic of congo along the lower congo river . cabinda border the congo republic to the north and north-northeast and the drc to the east and south . the town of cabinda is the chief population centre . </s> according to a 1995 census , cabinda had an estimated population of 600,000 , approximately 400,000 of whom live in neighbouring country . population estimate are , however , highly unreliable . consisting largely of tropical forest , cabinda produce hardwood , coffee , cocoa , crude rubber and palm oil . </s> the product for which it is best known , however , is it oil , which ha given it the nickname , `` the kuwait of africa `` . cabinda 's petroleum production from it considerable offshore reserve now account for more than half of angola 's output . most of the oil along it coast wa discovered under portuguese angola by the cabinda gulf oil company ( cabgoc ) from 1968 onwards . </s> ever since portugal handed over sovereignty of it former overseas province of angola to the local independence group ( mpla , unita and fnla ) , the territory of cabinda ha been a focus of separatist guerrilla action opposing the government of angola ( which ha employed it armed force , the faaforas armada angolanas ) and cabindan separatist . the front for the liberation of the enclave of cabinda-foras armada de cabinda ( flec-fac ) announced a virtual federal republic of cabinda under the presidency of n'zita henriques tiago . one of the characteristic of the cabindan independence movement is it constant fragmentation , into smaller and smaller faction . </s> <section_title_start> government and politics <section_title_end> </s> the angolan government is composed of three branch of government : executive , legislative and judicial . the executive branch of the government is composed of the president , the vice-presidents and the council of minister . </s> the legislative branch comprises a 220-seat unicameralism legislature , the national assembly of angola , elected from both provincial and nationwide constituency . for decade , political power ha been concentrated in the presidency . </s> after 38 year of rule , in 2017 president do santos stepped down from mpla leadership . the leader of the winning party at the parliamentary election in august 2017 would become the next president of angola . the mpla selected the former defense minister joo loureno a santos ' chosen successor . </s> in what ha been described a a political purge to cement his power and reduce the influence of the do santos family , loureno subsequently sacked the chief of the national police , ambrsio de lemos , and the head of the intelligence service , apolinrio jos pereira . both are considered ally of former president do santos . he also removed isabel do santos , daughter of the former president , a head of the country 's state oil company sonangol . </s> <section_title_start> constitution <section_title_end> </s> the constitution of angola establishes the broad outline of government structure and delineates the right and duty of citizen . the legal system is based on portuguese law and customary law but is weak and fragmented , and court operate in only 12 of more than 140 municipality . a supreme court serf a the appellate tribunal ; a constitutional court doe not hold the power of judicial review . governor of the 18 province are appointed by the president . after the end of the civil war the regime came under pressure from within a well a from the international community to become more democratic and le authoritarian . it reaction wa to implement a number of change without substantially changing it character . </s> the constitution of angola , adopted in 2010 , did away with presidential election , introducing a system in which the president and the vice-president of the political party that win the parliamentary election automatically become president and vice-president . directly or indirectly , the president control all other organ of the state , so there is de facto no separation of power . in the classification used in constitutional law , this government fall under the category of authoritarian regime . </s> <section_title_start> armed forces <section_title_end> </s> the angolan armed force ( aaf ) are headed by a chief of staff who report to the minister of defence . there are three divisionsthe army ( exrcito ) , navy ( marinha de guerra , mga ) and national air force of angola ( forum area nacional , fan ) . total manpower is 107,000 ; plus paramilitary force of 10,000 ( 2015 est . ) . </s> it equipment includes russian-manufactured fighter , bomber and transport plane . there are also brazilian-made emb-312 tucanos for training , czech-made l-39s for training and bombing , and a variety of western-made aircraft such a the c-212\aviocar , sud aviation alouette iii , etc . a small number of aaf personnel are stationed in the democratic republic of the congo ( kinshasa ) and the republic of the congo ( brazzaville ) . </s> <section_title_start> police <section_title_end> </s> the national police department are public order , criminal investigation , traffic and transport , investigation and inspection of economic activity , taxation and frontier supervision , riot police and the rapid intervention police . the national police are in the process of standing up an air wing , to provide helicopter support for operation . the national police are developing their criminal investigation and forensic capability . the force ha an estimated 6,000 patrol officer , 2,500 taxation and frontier supervision officer , 182 criminal investigator and 100 financial crime detective and around 90 economic activity inspector . </s> the national police have implemented a modernisation and development plan to increase the capability and efficiency of the total force . in addition to administrative reorganisation , modernisation project include procurement of new vehicle , aircraft and equipment , construction of new police station and forensic laboratory , restructured training programme and the replacement of akm rifle with 9 ; mm uzi for officer in urban area . </s> <section_title_start> justice <section_title_end> </s> a supreme court serf a a court of appeal . the constitutional court is the supreme body of the constitutional jurisdiction , established with the approval of law no . 2/08 , of 17 june organic law of the constitutional court and law n. 3/08 , of 17 june organic law of the constitutional process . the legal system is based on portuguese and customary law , but it is weak and fragmented . there are only 12 court in more than 140 county in the country . it first task wa the validation of the candidacy of the political party to the legislative election of 5 september 2008 . thus , on 25 june 2008 , the constitutional court wa institutionalized and it judicial counselor assumed the position before the president of the republic . currently , seven advisory judge are present , four men and three woman . </s> in 2014 , a new penal code took effect in angola . the classification of money-laundering a a crime is one of the novelty in the new legislation . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relations <section_title_end> </s> angola is a founding member state of the community of portuguese language country ( cplp ) , also known a the lusophone commonwealth , an international organization and political association of lusophone nation across four continent , where portuguese language is an official language . </s> on 16 october 2014 , angola wa elected for the second time a non-permanent member of the united nation security council , with 190 favorable vote out of a total of 193 . the term of office began on 1 january 2015 and expired on 31 december 2016. </s> since january 2014 , the republic of angola ha been chairing the international conference for the great lake region ( cirgl ) . [ 80 ] in 2015 , cirgl executive secretary ntumba luaba said that angola is the example to be followed by the member of the organization , due to the significant progress made during the 12 year of peace , namely in term of socio-economic stability and political- military . </s> <section_title_start> human rights <section_title_end> </s> angola is classified a 'not free ' by freedom house in the freedom in the world 2014 report . the report noted that the angolan legislative election , 2012 , in which the ruling popular movement for the liberation of angola won more than 70 % of the vote , suffered from serious flaw , including outdated and inaccurate voter roll . voter turnout dropped from 80 % in 2008 to 60 % . </s> a 2012 report by the united state state department u.s. department of state said , `` the three most important [ right ] abuse [ in 2012 ] were official corruption and impunity ; limit on the freedom of assembly , association , speech , and press ; and cruel and excessive punishment , including reported case of torture and beating a well a unlawful killing by police and other security personnel . `` </s> angola ranked forty-two of forty-eight sub-saharan african state on the 2007 index of african governance list and scored poorly on the 2013 ibrahim index of african governance . it wa ranked 39 out of 52 sub-saharan african country , scoring particularly badly in the area of participation and human right , sustainable economic opportunity and human development . the ibrahim index us a number of variable to compile it list which reflects the state of governance in africa . </s> in 2019 , homosexuality act were decriminalized in angola , and the government also prohibited discrimination based on sexual orientation . the vote wa overwhelming : 155 for , 1 against , 7 abstaining . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> angola ha diamond , oil , gold , copper and a rich wildlife ( dramatically impoverished during the civil war ) , forest and fossil fuel . since independence , oil and diamond have been the most important economic resource . smallholding and plantation agriculture dramatically dropped in the angolan civil war , but began to recover after 2002. </s> angola 's economy ha in recent year moved on from the disarray caused by a quarter-century of angolan civil war to become the fastest-growing economy in africa and one of the fastest-growing in the world , with an average gdp growth of 20 % between 2005 and 2007 . in the period 200110 , angola had the world 's highest annual average gdp growth , at 11.1 % . </s> in 2004 , the exim bank of china approved a $ 2 ; billion line of credit to angola , to be used for rebuilding angola 's infrastructure , and to limit the influence of the international monetary fund there . </s> china is angola 's biggest trade partner and export destination a well a the fourth-largest source of import . bilateral trade reached $ 27.67 ; billion in 2011 , up 11.5 % year-on-year . china 's import , mainly crude oil and diamond , increased 9.1 % to $ 24.89 ; billion while china 's export to angola , including mechanical and electrical product , machinery part and construction material , surged 38.8 % . the oil overproduction led to a local price for unleaded gasoline of pound sterling 0.37 a gallon . </s> the angolan economy grew 18 % in 2005 , 26 % in 2006 and 17.6 % in 2007 . due to the global recession the economy contracted an estimated 0.3 % in 2009 . the security brought about by the 2002 peace settlement ha allowed the resettlement of 4 ; million displaced person and a resulting large-scale increase in agriculture production . angola 's economy is expected to grow by 3.9 percent in 2014 said the international monetary fund ( imf ) , robust growth in the non-oil economy , mainly driven by a very good performance in the agricultural sector , is expected to offset a temporary drop in oil production . </s> angola 's financial system is maintained by the national bank of angola and managed by governor : no : jose de lima massano . according to a study on the banking sector , carried out by deloitte , the monetary policy led by banco nacional de angola ( bna ) , the angolan national bank , allowed a decrease in the inflation rate put at 7.96 % in december 2013 , which contributed to the sector 's growth trend . estimate released by angola 's central bank , said country 's economy should grow at an annual average rate of 5 percent over the next four year , boosted by the increasing participation of the private sector . </s> although the country 's economy ha grown significantly since angola achieved political stability in 2002 , mainly due to fast-rising earnings in the oil sector , angola face huge social and economic problem . these are in part a result of almost continual armed conflict from 1961 on , although the highest level of destruction and socio-economic damage took place after the 1975 independence , during the long year of angolan civil war . however , high poverty rate and blatant social inequality chiefly stem from persistent authoritarianism , `` neo-patrimonial `` practice at all level of the political , administrative , military and economic structure , and of corruption in angola . the main beneficiary are political , administrative , economic and military power holder , who have accumulated ( and continue to accumulate ) enormous wealth . </s> `` secondary beneficiary `` are the middle stratum which are about to become social class . however , almost half the population ha to be considered poor , with dramatic difference between the countryside and the city ( where by now slightly more than 50 % of the people live ) . </s> a study carried out in 2008 by the angolan instituto nacional de estatstica found that in rural area roughly 58 % must be classified a `` poor `` according to un norm , but in the urban area only 19 % , and an overall rate of 37 % . in city , a majority of family , well beyond those officially classified a poor , must adopt a variety of survival strategy . in urban area social inequality is most evident and it is extreme in luanda . in the human development index angola constantly rank in the bottom group . </s> in january 2020 , a leak of government document known a the luanda leak showed that u.s. consulting company such a boston consulting group , mckinsey & company , and pricewaterhousecoopers had helped member of the family of former president jos eduardo do santos ( especially his daughter isabel do santos ) corruptly run sonangol for their own personal profit , helping them use the company 's revenue to fund vanity project in france and switzerland . </s> the enormous difference between the region pose a serious structural problem for the angolan economy , illustrated by the fact that about one third of economic activity are concentrated in luanda and neighbouring bengo province , while several area of the interior suffer economic stagnation and even regression . </s> one of the economic consequence of the social and regional disparity is a sharp increase in angolan private investment abroad . the small fringe of angolan society where most of the asset accumulation take place seek to spread it asset , for reason of security and profit . for the time being , the biggest share of these investment is concentrated in portugal where the angolan in portugal ( including the family of the state president ) in bank a well a in the domain of energy , telecommunication in angola , and mass medium ha become notable , a ha the acquisition of vineyard and orchard a well a of touristic enterprise . </s> angola ha upgraded critical infrastructure , an investment made possible by fund from the nation 's development of oil resource . according to a report , just slightly more than ten year after the end of the angolan civil war angola 's standard of living ha overall greatly improved . life expectancy , which wa just 46 year in 2002 , reached 51 in 2011 . mortality rate for child fell from 25 percent in 2001 to 19 percent in 2010 and the number of student enrolled in primary school ha tripled since 2001 . however , at the same time the social and economic inequality that ha characterised the country for so long ha not diminished , but on the contrary deepened in all respect . </s> with a stock of asset corresponding to 70 ; billion kz ( u $ 6.8 ; billion ) , angola is now the third-largest financial market in sub-saharan africa , surpassed only by nigeria and south africa . according to the angolan minister of economy , abrao gourgel , the financial market of the country grew modestly from 2002 and now lie in third place at the level of sub-saharan africa . </s> on 19 december 2014 , the capital market in angola started . angola stock exchange and derivative ( angola stock exchange and derivative , in english ) received the secondary public debt market , and it is expected to start the corporate debt market by 2015 , but the stock market should be a reality only in 2016. </s> <section_title_start> natural resources <section_title_end> </s> the economist reported in 2008 that diamond and oil make up 60 % of angola 's economy , almost all of the country 's revenue and all of it dominant export . growth is almost entirely driven by rising extraction of petroleum which surpassed in late 2005 and wa expected to grow to by 2007 . control of the petroleum industry is consolidated in sonangol group , a conglomerate owned by the angolan government . in december 2006 , angola wa admitted a a member of opec . </s> according to the heritage foundation , a conservative american think tank , oil production from angola ha increased so significantly that angola now is china 's biggest supplier of oil . `` china ha extended three multibillion dollar line of credit to the angolan government ; two loan of $ 2 billion from china exim bank , one in 2004 , the second in 2007 , a well a one loan in 2005 of $ 2.9 billion from china international fund ltd. `` </s> growing oil revenue also created opportunity for corruption in angola : according to a recent human right watch report , 32 ; billion u dollar disappeared from government account in 20072010 . furthermore , sonangol , the state-run oil company , control 51 % of cabinda 's oil . due to this market control the company end up determining the profit received by the government and the tax it pay . the council of foreign affair state that the world bank mentioned that sonangol `` is a taxpayer , it carry out quasi-fiscal activity , it invests public fund , and , a concessionaire , it is a sector regulator . this multifarious work programme creates conflict of interest and characterises a complex relationship between sonangol and the government that weakens the formal budgetary process and creates uncertainty a regard the actual fiscal stance of the state . `` </s> in 2002 angola demanded compensation for oil spill allegedly caused by chevron corporation , the first time it had fined a multinational corporation operating in it water . </s> operation in it list of diamond mine include partnership between state-run endiama and mining company such a alrosa which operate in angola . </s> access to biocapacity in angola is higher than world average . in 2016 , angola had 1.9 global hectare of biocapacity per person within it territory , slightly more than world average of 1.6 global hectare per person . in 2016 angola used 1.01 global hectare of biocapacity per person - their ecological footprint of consumption . this mean they use about half a much biocapacity a angola contains . a a result , angola is running a biocapacity reserve . </s> <section_title_start> agriculture <section_title_end> </s> agriculture and forestry is an area of potential opportunity for the country . the african economic outlook organization state that `` angola requires 4.5 million tonne a year of grain but grows only about 55 % of the maize it need , 20 % of the rice and just 5 % of it required wheat `` . </s> in addition , the world bank estimate that `` le than 3 percent of angola 's abundant fertile land is cultivated and the economic potential of the forestry sector remains largely unexploited `` . </s> before independence in 1975 , angola ( portugal ) wa a breadbasket of southern africa and a major exporter of banana , coffee and sisal , but angolan civil war ( 19752002 ) destroyed fertile countryside , left it littered with landmines and drove million into the city . </s> the country now depends on expensive food import , mainly from south africa and portugal , while more than 90 % of farming is done at the family and subsistence level . thousand of angolan small-scale farmer are trapped in poverty . </s> <section_title_start> transport <section_title_end> </s> transport in angola consists of : </s> * three separate rail transport in angola totalling </s> * of highway of which is paved </s> * 1,295 navigable inland waterway </s> * eight major sea port </s> * 243 list of airport in angola , of which 32 are paved . </s> angola center it port trade in five main port : port of namibe , port of lobito , soyo , cabinda and port of luanda . the port of luanda is the largest of the five , a well a being one of the busiest on the african continent . major expansion of this port is also taking place . </s> travel on highway outside of town and city in angola ( and in some case within ) is often not best advised for those without four-by-four vehicle . while a reasonable road infrastructure ha existed within angola , time and the war have taken their toll on the road surface , leaving many severely potholed , littered with broken asphalt . in many area driver have established alternate track to avoid the worst part of the surface , although careful attention must be paid to the presence or absence of landmine warning marker by the side of the road . the angolan government ha contracted the restoration of many of the country 's road . the road between lubango and namibe , for example , wa completed recently with funding from the european union , and is comparable to many european main route . completing the road infrastructure is likely to take some decade , but substantial effort are already being made . </s> <section_title_start> telecommunications <section_title_end> </s> the telecommunication industry is considered one of the main strategic sector in angola . </s> in october 2014 , the building of an optic fiber underwater cable wa announced . this project aim to turn angola into a continental hub , thus improving internet connection both nationally and internationally . </s> on 11 march 2015 , the first angolan forum of telecommunication and information technology wa held in luanda under the motto `` the challenge of telecommunication in the current context of angola `` , to promote debate on topical issue on telecommunication in angola and worldwide . a study of this sector , presented at the forum , said angola had the first telecommunication operator in africa to test lte with speed up to 400 mbit/s and mobile penetration of about 75 % ; there are about 3.5 million smartphones in the angolan market ; there are about of optical fibre installed in the country . </s> the first angolan satellite , angosat 1 angosat-1 , wa launched into orbit on 26 december 2017 . it wa launched from the baikonur cosmodrome in kazakhstan on board a zenit-3f rocket . the satellite wa built by russia 's rsc energia , a subsidiary of the state-run space industry player roscosmos . the satellite payload wa supplied by airbus defence & space . due to an on-board power failure during solar panel deployment , on 27 december , rsc energia revealed that they lost communication contact with the satellite . although , subsequent attempt to restore communication with the satellite were successful , the satellite eventually stopped sending data and rsc energia confirmed that angosat-1 wa inoperable . the launch of angosat-1 wa aimed at ensuring telecommunication throughout the country . according to aristides safeca , secretary of state for telecommunication , the satellite wa aimed at providing telecommunication service , tv , internet and e-government and wa expected to remain in orbit `` at best `` for 18 year . a replacement satellite named angosat-2 is in the work and is expected to be in service by 2020. </s> <section_title_start> technology <section_title_end> </s> the management of the top-level domain '.ao ' passed from portugal to angola in 2015 , following new legislation . a joint decree of minister of telecommunication and information technology jos carvalho da rocha and the minister of science and technology , maria cndida pereira teixeira , state that `` under the massification `` of that angolan domain , `` condition are created for the transfer of the domain root '.ao ' of portugal to angola `` . </s> <section_title_start> demographics <section_title_end> </s> { class= `` wikitable `` style= `` float : right ; margin-left : 10px `` </s> + population in angola </s> - </s> ! scope= `` col `` style= `` background : # cfb ; `` year </s> ! scope= `` col `` style= `` background : # cfb ; `` million </s> - </s> 1950 style= `` text-align : right ; `` 4.5 </s> - </s> 2000 style= `` text-align : right ; `` 16.4 </s> - </s> style= `` text-align : right ; `` </s> } </s> angola ha a population of 24,383,301 inhabitant according to the preliminary result of it 2014 census , the first one conducted or carried out since 15 december 1970 . it is composed of ovimbundu ( language umbundu ) 37 % , northern mbundu people ( language kimbundu ) 23 % , bakongo 13 % , and 32 % other ethnic group ( including the chokwe people , the ovambo people , the ganguela and the xindonga ) a well a about 2 % mestios ( mixed european and african ) , 1.6 % chinese and 1 % european . the ambundu and ovimbundu ethnic group combined form a majority of the population , at 62 % . the population is forecast to grow to over 60 million people to 2050 , 2.7 time the 2014 population . however , on 23 march 2016 , official data revealed by angola 's national statistic institute instituto nacional de estatstica ( ine ) , state that angola ha a population of 25,789,024 inhabitant . </s> it is estimated that angola wa host to 12,100 refugee and 2,900 asylum seeker by the end of 2007 . 11,400 of those refugee were originally from the democratic republic of congo , who arrived in the 1970s . there were an estimated 400,000 democratic republic of the congo migrant worker , at least 220,000 portuguese angolan , and about 259,000 chinese people in angola . 1 million angolan are mixed race ( black and white ) . </s> since 2003 , more than 400,000 democratic republic of the congo migrant have been expelled from angola . prior to independence in 1975 , angola had a community of approximately 350,000 portuguese , but the vast majority left after independence and the ensuing civil war . however , angola ha recovered it portuguese minority in recent year ; currently , there are about 200,000 registered with the consulate , and increasing due to the debt crisis in portugal and the relative prosperity in angola . the chinese population stand at 258,920 , mostly composed of temporary migrant . also , there is a small brazilian community of about 5,000 people . </s> , the total fertility rate of angola is 5.54 child born per woman ( 2012 estimate ) , the 11th highest in the world . </s> <section_title_start> language <section_title_end> </s> the language in angola are those originally spoken by the different ethnic group and portuguese language , introduced during the portuguese colonial era . the most widely spoken indigenous language are umbundu , kimbundu and kikongo , in that order . portuguese is the official language of the country . </s> although the exact number of those fluent in portuguese or who speak portuguese a a first language are unknown , a 2012 study mention that portuguese is the first language of 39 % of the population . in 2014 , a census carried out by the instituto nacional de estatstica in angola mention that 71.15 % of the nearly 25.8 million inhabitant of angola ( meaning around 18.3 million people ) use portuguese a a first or second language . </s> according to the 2014 census , portuguese language is spoken by 71.1 % of angolan , umbundu language by 23 % , kikongo language by 8.2 % , kimbundu by 7.8 % , chokwe language by 6.5 % , nyaneka language by 3.4 % , ngangela language by 3.1 % , fiote language by 2.4 % , kwanyama language by 2.3 % , muhumbi language by 2.1 % , luvale language by 1 % , and language of angola by 4.1 % . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> there are about 1,000 religious community , mostly christian , in angola . while reliable statistic are nonexistent , estimate have it that more than half of the population are catholic , while about a quarter adhere to the protestant church introduced during the colonial period : the congregationalist mainly among the ovimbundu of the central highland and the coastal region to it west , the methodist concentrating on the kimbundu speaking strip from luanda to malanje , the baptist almost exclusively among the bakongo of the north-west ( now present in luanda a well ) and dispersed adventist , reformed and lutheran . </s> in luanda and region there subsists a nucleus of the `` syncretic `` tocoists and in the north-west a sprinkling of kimbanguism can be found , spreading from the congo/zare . since independence , hundred of pentecostal and similar community have sprung up in the city , where by now about 50 % of the population is living ; several of these communities/churches are of brazilian origin . </s> the u.s. department of state estimate the muslim population at 80,00090,000 , le than 1 % of the population , while the islam in angola put the figure closer to 500,000 . muslim consist largely of migrant from west africa and the middle east ( especially lebanon ) , although some are local convert . the angolan government doe not islam in angola # legal status any muslim organization and often shuts down mosque or prevents their construction . </s> in a study assessing nation ' level of religious regulation and persecution with score ranging from 0 to 10 where 0 represented low level of regulation or persecution , angola wa scored 0.8 on government regulation of religion , 4.0 on social regulation of religion , 0 on government favoritism of religion and 0 on religious persecution . </s> foreign missionary were very active prior to independence in 1975 , although since the beginning of the anti-colonial fight in 1961 the portuguese colonial authority expelled a series of protestant missionary and closed mission station based on the belief that the missionary were inciting pro-independence sentiment . missionary have been able to return to the country since the early 1990s , although security condition due to the civil war have prevented them until 2002 from restoring many of their former inland mission station . </s> the catholic church and some major protestant denomination mostly keep to themselves in contrast to the `` new church `` which actively proselytize . catholic , a well a some major protestant denomination , provide help for the poor in the form of crop seed , farm animal , medical care and education . </s> <section_title_start> urbanization <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> epidemic of cholera , malaria , rabies and african [ fever like marburg virus marburg hemorrhagic fever ] , are common disease in several part of the country . many region in this country have high incidence rate of [ [ tuberculosis and high hiv/aids in africa rate . dengue , filariasis , leishmaniasis and onchocerciasis ( river blindness ) are other disease carried by insect that also occur in the region . angola ha one of the highest infant mortality rate in the world and one of the world 's lowest life expectancy . a 2007 survey concluded that low and deficient niacin status wa common in angola . demographic and health survey is currently conducting several survey in angola on malaria , domestic violence and more . </s> in september 2014 , the angolan institute for cancer control ( iacc ) wa created by presidential decree , and it will integrate the national health service in angola . the purpose of this new centre is to ensure health and medical care in oncology , policy implementation , programme and plan for prevention and specialised treatment . this cancer institute will be assumed a a reference institution in the central and southern region of africa . </s> in 2014 , angola launched a national campaign of vaccination against measles , extended to every child under ten year old and aiming to go to all 18 province in the country . the measure is part of the strategic plan for the elimination of measles 20142020 created by the angolan ministry of health which includes strengthening routine immunisation , a proper dealing with measles case , national campaign , introducing a second dose of vaccination in the national routine vaccination calendar and active epidemiological surveillance for measles . this campaign took place together with the vaccination against polio and vitamin a supplementation . </s> a 2016 angola and dr congo yellow fever outbreak outbreak , the worst in the country in three decade began in december 2015 . by august 2016 , when the outbreak began to subside , nearly 4,000 people were suspected of being infected . a many a 369 may have died . the outbreak began in the capital , luanda , and spread to at least 16 of the 18 province . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> although by law education in angola is compulsory and free for eight year , the government report that a percentage of pupil are not attending due to a lack of school building and teacher . pupil are often responsible for paying additional school-related expense , including fee for book and supply . </s> in 1999 , the gross primary enrollment rate wa 74 percent and in 1998 , the most recent year for which data are available , the net primary enrollment rate wa 61 percent . gross and net enrollment ratio are based on the number of pupil formally registered in primary school and therefore do not necessarily reflect actual school attendance . there continue to be significant disparity in enrollment between rural and urban area . in 1995 , 71.2 percent of child age 7 to 14 year were attending school . it is reported that higher percentage of boy attend school than girl . during the angolan civil war ( 19752002 ) , nearly half of all school were reportedly looted and destroyed , leading to current problem with overcrowding . </s> the ministry of education recruited 20,000 new teacher in 2005 and continued to implement teacher training . teacher tend to be underpaid , inadequately trained and overworked ( sometimes teaching two or three shift a day ) . some teacher may reportedly demand payment or bribe directly from their pupil . other factor , such a the presence of landmines , lack of resource and identity paper , and poor health prevent child from regularly attending school . although budgetary allocation for education were increased in 2004 , the education system in angola continues to be extremely under-funded . </s> according to estimate by the unesco institute for statistic , the adult literacy rate in 2011 wa 70.4 % . by 2015 , this had increased to 71.1 % . 82.9 % of male and 54.2 % of woman are literate a of 2001 . since independence from portugal in 1975 , a number of angolan student continued to be admitted every year at high school , politechnic institute and university in portugal and brazil through bilateral agreement ; in general , these student belong to the elite . </s> in september 2014 , the angolan ministry of education announced an investment of 16 million euro in the computerisation of over 300 classroom across the country . the project also includes training teacher at a national level , `` a a way to introduce and use new information technology in primary school , thus reflecting an improvement in the quality of teaching `` . </s> in 2010 , the angolan government started building the angolan medium library network , distributed throughout several province in the country to facilitate the people 's access to information and knowledge . each site ha a bibliographic archive , multimedia resource and computer with internet access , a well a area for reading , researching and socialising . the plan envisages the establishment of one medium library in each angolan province by 2017 . the project also includes the implementation of several medium library , in order to provide the several content available in the fixed medium library to the most isolated population in the country . at this time , the mobile medium library are already operating in the province of luanda , malanje , uge , cabinda and lunda south . a for rema , the province of luanda , benguela , lubango and soyo have currently working medium library . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> angolan culture ha been heavily influenced by portuguese culture , especially in term of language and religion , and the culture of the indigenous ethnic group of angola , predominantly bantu people . </s> the diverse ethnic communitiesthe ovimbundu , northern mbundu people , bakongo , chokwe people , mbunda people and other peoplesto varying degree maintain their own cultural trait , tradition and language , but in the city , where slightly more than half of the population now life , a mixed culture ha been emerging since colonial time ; in luanda , since it foundation in the 16th century . </s> in this urban culture , the portuguese heritage ha become more and more dominant . african root are evident in music and dance , and is moulding the way in which portuguese is spoken . this process is well reflected in contemporary angolan literature , especially in the work of angolan literature . </s> in 2014 , angola resumed the national festival of angolan culture after a 25-year break . the festival took place in all the provincial capital and lasted for 20 day , with the theme culture a a factor of peace and development . </s> <section_title_start> cinema <section_title_end> </s> in 1972 , one of angola 's first feature film , sarah maldoror 's co-production ( medium ) internationally co-produced sambizanga ( film ) , wa released at the carthage film festival to critical acclaim , winning the tanit d'or , the festival 's highest prize . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> basketball is the most popular sport in angola . it angola national basketball team ha won the afrobasket 11 time and hold the record of most title . a a top team in africa , it is a regular competitor at the basketball at the summer olympics and the fiba world cup . angola is home to one of africa 's first competitive league . </s> in football , angola hosted the 2010 africa cup of nation . the angola national football team qualified for the 2006 fifa world cup , their first appearance in the world cup final . they were eliminated after one defeat and two draw in the group stage . they won three cosafa cup and finished runner-up in the 2011 african nation championship . </s> angola ha participated in the world woman 's handball championship for several year . the country ha also appeared in the angola at the olympics for seven year and both regularly competes in and once ha hosted the fir roller hockey world cup , where the best finish is sixth . angola is also often believed to have historic root in the martial art `` capoeira angola `` and `` batuque ( game ) `` which were practiced by slavery in angola transported a part of the atlantic slave trade . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * outline of angola </s> * index of angola-related article </s> <section_title_start> 2003 u.s. department of state website . the information given there is , however , corrected and updated on the basis of the other source indicated . </s> <section_title_start> external links decade of angolan indicator , 20022012 `` . </s> * the participation of hungarian soldier in un peacekeeping operation in angola </s> category : angola </s> category:1975 establishment in angola </s> category : central african country </s> category : country in africa </s> category : former portuguese colony </s> category : least developed country </s> category : member state of opec </s> category : member state of the african union </s> category : member state of the community of portuguese language country </s> category : member state of the united nation </s> category : portuguese-speaking country and territory </s> category : republic </s> category : southern african country </s> category : state and territory established in 1975 <article_end> <article_start> </s> benin ( , ; bnin ) , officially the republic of benin ( rpublique du bnin ) ( formerly known a republic of dahomey ) , is a country in west africa . it is bordered by togo to the west , nigeria to the east , burkina faso to the north-west , and niger to the north-east . the majority of it population life on the small southern coastline of the bight of benin , part of the gulf of guinea in the northernmost tropical portion of the atlantic ocean . the capital of benin is porto-novo , but the seat of government is in cotonou , the country 's largest city and economic capital . benin cover an area of and it population in wa estimated to be approximately million . benin is a tropical nation , highly dependent on agriculture , and is a large exporter of cotton and palm oil . substantial employment and income arise from subsistence agriculture . </s> the official language of benin is french , with several indigenous language such a fon language , bariba language , yoruba language and dendi language also being commonly spoken . the largest religious group in benin is catholic church , followed closely by islam , vodun ( commonly referred to a voodoo outside the country ) and protestantism . benin is a member of the united nation , the african union , the economic community of west african state , the organisation of islamic cooperation , the south atlantic peace and cooperation zone , organisation internationale de la francophonie , the community of sahelsaharan state , the african petroleum producer association and the niger basin authority . </s> little is known of benin 's early history . from the 17th to the 19th century , the main political entity in the area were the kingdom of dahomey , along with the city-state of porto-novo , and a large area with many different nation to the north . this region wa referred to a the slave coast of west africa from a early a the 17th century due to the large number of enslaved people who were shipped to the new world during the trans-atlantic slave trade . after enslavement wa abolished , france took over the country and renamed it french dahomey . in 1960 , dahomey gained full independence from france . the sovereign state ha had a tumultuous history since then , with many different democratic government , military coup , and military government . a marxistleninist state called the people 's republic of benin existed between 1975 and 1990 . in 1991 , it wa replaced by the current multi-party system multi-party republic of benin . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> during the colonial period and at independence , the country wa geographical renaming dahomey . on 30 november 1975 , it wa renamed benin . `` dahomey changed it name to the republic of benin ( rpublique du benin ) in memory of pre-19th century greatness of ancient benin of nigeria `` , referring to the historic kingdom of benin . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> precolonial period <section_title_end> </s> the current country of benin combine three area which had distinctly different political system and ethnicity prior to french colonial control . before 1700 , there were a few important city-state along the coast ( primarily of the aja people ethnic group , but also including yoruba people and gbe language people ) and a mass of tribal region inland ( composed of bariba people , mahi , gedevi , and kabye people ) . the oyo empire , located primarily to the east of modern benin , wa the most significant large-scale military force in the region . it regularly conducted raid and exacted tribute from the coastal kingdom and the tribal region . the situation changed in the 1600s and early 1700s a the kingdom of dahomey , consisting mostly of fon people , wa founded on the abomey plateau and began taking over area along the coast . by 1727 , king agaja of the kingdom of dahomey had conquered the coastal city of allada and ouidah , but it had become a tributary of the oyo empire and did not directly attack the oyo allied city-state of porto-novo . the rise of the kingdom of dahomey , the rivalry between the kingdom and the city of porto-novo , and the continued tribal politics of the northern region , persisted into the colonial and post-colonial period . </s> the dahomey wa known for it culture and tradition . young boy were often apprenticed to older soldier , and taught the kingdom 's military custom until they were old enough to join the army . dahomey wa also famous for instituting an elite female soldier corp , called ahosi , i.e . the king 's wife , or mino , `` our mother `` in the fon language fongbe , and known by many european a the dahomean amazon . this emphasis on military preparation and achievement earned dahomey the nickname of `` black sparta `` from european observer and 19th-century explorer such a sir richard burton . </s> <section_title_start> early portuguese colonization and the slave trade <section_title_end> </s> the king of dahomey sold their war captive into atlantic slave trade . they also had a practice of killing war captive in a ceremony known a the annual custom of dahomey . by about 1750 , the king of dahomey wa earning an estimated 250,000 per year by selling african captive to european slave-traders . </s> though the leader of dahomey appear to have initially resisted the slave trade , it flourished in the region of dahomey for almost three hundred year , beginning in 1472 with a trade agreement with portuguese empire merchant . the area wa named the slave coast of west africa `` slave coast `` because of this flourishing trade . court protocol , which demanded that a portion of war captive from the kingdom 's many battle be decapitated , decreased the number of enslaved people exported from the area . the number went from 102,000 people per decade in the 1780s to 24,000 per decade by the 1860s . the decline wa partly due to the slave trade act 1807 banning the trans-atlantic slave trade by britain in 1808 , followed by other country . this decline continued until 1885 , when the last slave ship departed from the coast of the modern benin republic bound for brazil in south america , which had yet to abolish slavery . the capital 's name porto-novo is of portuguese origin , meaning `` new port `` . it wa originally developed a a port for the slave trade . </s> among the good the portuguese sought were carved item of ivory made by benin s artisan in the form of carved saltcellar , spoon , and hunting horn - the first piece of african art produced for sale abroad a exotic object . </s> <section_title_start> french colonial period <section_title_end> </s> by the middle of the nineteenth century , dahomey had begun to weaken and lose it status a the regional power . this enabled the french to take over the area in 1892 . in 1899 , the french included the land called french dahomey within the larger french west africa colonial region . </s> in 1958 , france granted autonomy to the republic of dahomey , and full independence on 1 august 1960 , which is celebrated each year a independence day , a public holiday in benin . the president who led the country to independence wa hubert maga . </s> <section_title_start> post-colonial period <section_title_end> </s> for the next twelve year after 1960 , ethnic strife contributed to a period of turbulence . there were several coup and regime change , with the figure of hubert maga , sourou migan apithy , justin ahomadgb , and mile derlin zinsou dominating ; the first three each represented a different area and ethnicity of the country . these three agreed to form a presidential council ( benin ) after violence marred the 1970 election . </s> on 7 may 1972 , maga ceded power to ahomadgb . on 26 october 1972 , lt. col. mathieu krkou overthrew the ruling triumvirate , becoming president and stating that the country would not `` burden itself by copying foreign ideology , and want neither capitalism , communism , nor socialism `` . on 30 november 1974 however , he announced that the country wa officially marxism , under control of the military council of the revolution ( cmr ) , which nationalized the petroleum industry and bank . on 30 november 1975 , he renamed the country to the people 's republic of benin . </s> the cmr wa dissolved in 1979 , and krkou arranged show election in which he wa the only allowed candidate . establishing relation with china , north korea , and great socialist people 's libyan arab jamahiriya , he put nearly all business and economic activity under state control , causing foreign investment in benin to dry up . krkou attempted to reorganize education , pushing his own aphorism such a `` poverty is not a fatality `` , resulting in a mass emigration of teacher , along with numerous other professional . the regime financed itself by contracting to take nuclear waste , first from the soviet union and later from france . </s> in 1980 , krkou converted to islam and changed his first name to ahmed . he changed his name back after claiming to be a born-again christian . in 1989 , riot broke out when the regime did not have enough money to pay it army . the banking system collapsed . eventually , krkou renounced marxism , and a convention forced krkou to release political prisoner and arrange election . marxismleninism wa abolished a the nation 's form of government . </s> the country 's name wa officially changed to the republic of benin on 1 march 1990 , after the newly formed government 's constitution wa completed . </s> in a 1991 election , krkou lost to nicphore soglo . krkou returned to power after winning the 1996 vote . in 2001 , a closely fought election resulted in krkou winning another term , after which his opponent claimed election irregularity . </s> in 1999 , krkou issued a national apology for the substantial role that african had played in the atlantic slave trade . </s> krkou and former president soglo did not run in the 2006 election , a both were barred by the constitution 's restriction on age and total term of candidate . </s> on 5 march 2006 , beninese presidential election , 2006 wa held that wa considered free and fair . it resulted in a two-round system between thomas boni yayi and adrien houngbdji . the runoff election wa held on 19 march and wa won by boni , who assumed office on 6 april . the success of the fair multi-party election in benin won praise internationally . boni wa beninese presidential election , 2011 , taking 53.18 % of the vote in the first roundenough to avoid a runoff election . he wa the first president to win an election without a runoff since the restoration of democracy in 1991. </s> in the beninese presidential election , 2016 , in which boni yayi wa barred by the constitution from running for a third term , businessman patrice talon won the second round with 65.37 % of the vote , defeating investment banker and former prime minister lionel zinsou . talon wa sworn in on 6 april 2016 . speaking on the same day that the constitutional court confirmed the result , talon said that he would `` first and foremost tackle constitutional reform `` , discussing his plan to limit president to a single term of five year in order to combat `` complacency `` . he also said that he planned to slash the size of the government from 28 to 16 member . </s> <section_title_start> politics <section_title_end> </s> benin 's politics take place in a framework of a presidential system representative democracy republic , in which the president of benin is both [ of state ] and [ of government ] , within a multi-party system . executive power is exercised by the government . legislative power is vested in both the government and the legislature . the judiciary is independent of the executive and the legislature . the political system is derived from the 1990 constitution of benin and the subsequent transition to democracy in 1991. </s> benin scored highly in the 2013 ibrahim index of african governance , which comprehensively measure the state of governance across the continent . benin wa ranked 18th out of 52 african country and scored best in the category of safety & rule of law and participation & human right . </s> in it 2007 worldwide press freedom index , reporter without border ranked benin 53rd out of 169 country . </s> benin ha been rated equal-88th out of 159 country in a 2005 analysis of police , business , and political corruption . </s>
