of the imperial house of japan </s> * national diet library </s> general information </s> * japan from university of colorado boulder library govpubs </s> * japan profile from bbc news </s> * japan from the organisation for economic co-operation and development </s> * </s> * old map of japan , from the eran laor cartographic collection , the national library of israel </s> category : japan </s> category : east asian country </s> category : g7 nation </s> category : group of eight nation </s> category : g20 nation </s> category : island country </s> category : member state of the united nation </s> category : northeast asian country </s> category : transcontinental country <article_end> <article_start> </s> colombia ( , ; ) , officially the republic of colombia ( ) , is a country in south america with insular region of colombia in north america . colombia is bounded on the north by the caribbean sea , the northwest by panama , the south by ecuador and peru , the east by venezuela , the southeast by brazil , and the west by the pacific ocean . it comprises 32 department of colombia and the capital district of bogot , the country 's largest city . </s> with over 50 million inhabitant colombia is one of the most race and ethnicity in colombia and language of colombia diverse country in the world , with it rich cultural heritage reflecting influence by various amerindian civilization , european settlement , forced african labor , and immigration from europe and the greater middle east . urban centre are concentrated in the andean highland and the caribbean coast . </s> colombia ha been inhabited by various indigenous people in colombia since at least 12,000 bce , including the muisca , quimbaya civilization , and the tairona . the spanish landed first in la guajira in 1499 and by the mid-16th century annexed part of the region , establishing the new kingdom of granada , with bogot a it capital . spanish american war of independence from spain wa achieved in 1810 , with what is now colombia emerging a the united province of new granada . the new nation experimented with federalism a the granadine confederation ( 1858 ) , and then the united state of colombia ( 1863 ) , before the republic of colombia wa finally declared in 1886 . separation of panama from colombia in 1903 , leading to colombia 's present border . beginning in the 1960s , the country suffered from an asymmetric low-intensity colombian armed conflict ( 1964present ) and political violence , both of which escalated in the 1990s . since 2005 , there ha been significant improvement in security , stability , and rule of law , a well a unprecedented economic growth and development . </s> colombia is one of the world 's 17 megadiverse country and ha the second-highest level of biodiversity of colombia in the world . it territory encompasses amazon natural region , andean natural region , orinoqua natural region , and tatacoa desert , and it is the only country in south america with coastline and island along both the caribbean natural region and pacific/choc natural region . </s> colombia is considered a regional power in international affair , being a member of major global and regional organization including the united nation , the world trade organization , the organisation for economic co-operation and development ( oecd ) , the organization of american state , the pacific alliance , the andean community , and a nato global partner . colombia 's diversified economy is the third largest in south america , with macroeconomic stability and favorable long-term growth prospect . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> the name `` colombia `` is derived from the last name of the italian navigator christopher columbus ( cristoforo colombo , link=no cristbal coln ) . it wa conceived a a reference to all of the new world . the name wa later adopted by the gran colombia of 1819 , formed from the territory of the old viceroyalty of new granada ( modern-day colombia , panama , venezuela , ecuador , and northwest brazil ) . </s> when venezuela , ecuador , and cundinamarca department ( 1820 ) came to exist a independent state , the former province of the republic of new granada adopted the name `` republic of new granada `` . new granada officially changed it name in 1858 to the granadine confederation . in 1863 the name wa again changed , this time to united state of colombia , before finally adopting it present name the republic of colombia in 1886. </s> to refer to this country , the colombian government us the term colombia and repblica de colombia . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> pre-columbian era <section_title_end> </s> owing to it location , the present territory of colombia wa a corridor of early human civilization from mesoamerica and the caribbean to the andes and amazon basin . the oldest archaeological find are from the pubenza archaeological site and el totumo archaeological site site in the magdalena valley southwest of bogot . these site date from the paleo-indian period ( 18,0008000 ; bce ) . at puerto hormiga archaeological site and other site , trace from the archaic period in south america ( ~80002000 ; bce ) have been found . vestige indicate that there wa also early occupation in the region of el abra and tequendama in cundinamarca department ( 1820 ) . the oldest pottery discovered in the america , found at san jacinto archaeological site , date to 50004000 ; bce . </s> indigenous people inhabited the territory that is now colombia by 12,500 ; bce . nomadic [ tribe at the el abra ] , [ [ tibit and tequendama site near present-day bogot traded with one another and with other culture from the magdalena river valley . a site including eight mile of pictogram that is under study at serrana de la lindosa wa revealed in november 2020 . their age is suggested a being 12,500 year old ( c. 10,480 b.c . ) by the anthropologist working on the site because of extinct fauna depicted . that would have been during the earliest known human occupation of the area now known a colombia . </s> between 5000 and 1000 ; bce , hunter-gatherer tribe transitioned to agrarian society ; fixed settlement were established , and pottery appeared . beginning in the 1st millennium bce , group of indigenous people of the america including the muisca , zen , quimbaya civilization , and tairona developed the political system of cacicazgos with a pyramidal structure of power headed by cacique . the muisca inhabited mainly the area of what is now the department of colombia of boyac department and cundinamarca department high plateau ( altiplano cundiboyacense ) where they formed the muisca confederation . they farmed maize , potato , quinoa , and cotton , and traded gold , colombian emerald , blanket , ceramic handicraft , coca and especially halite with neighboring nation . the tairona inhabited northern colombia in the isolated mountain range of sierra nevada de santa marta . the quimbaya inhabited region of the cauca river valley between the cordillera occidental ( colombia ) and cordillera central ( colombia ) range of the colombian andes . most of the amerindian practiced agriculture and the social structure of each indigenous community wa different . some group of indigenous people such a the carib lived in a state of permanent war , but others had le bellicose attitude . </s> <section_title_start> european annexation <section_title_end> </s> alonso de ojeda ( who had sailed with columbus ) reached the guajira peninsula in 1499 . spanish explorer , led by rodrigo de bastidas , made the first exploration of the caribbean basin in 1500 . christopher columbus navigated near the caribbean in 1502 . in 1508 , vasco nez de balboa accompanied an expedition to the territory through the region of gulf of urab and they founded the town of santa mara la antigua del darin in 1510 , the first stable settlement on the continent . </s> santa marta wa founded in 1525 , and cartagena , colombia in 1533 . spanish conquistador gonzalo jimnez de quesada led an expedition to the interior in april 1536 , and christened the district through which he passed `` new kingdom of granada `` . in august 1538 , he founded provisionally it capital near the muisca cacicazgo of bacat , and named it `` santa fe `` . the name soon acquired a suffix and wa called santa fe de bogot . two other notable journey by early conquistador to the interior took place in the same period . sebastin de belalczar , conqueror of quito , traveled north and founded cali , in 1536 , and popayn , in 1537 ; from 1536 to 1539 , german conquistador nikolaus federmann crossed the orinoqua natural region , colombia and went over the cordillera oriental ( colombia ) in a search for el dorado , the `` city of gold `` . the legend and the gold would play a pivotal role in luring the spanish and other european to new granada during the 16th and 17th century . </s> the list of conquistador in colombia made frequent alliance with the enemy of different indigenous community . indian auxiliary were crucial to conquest , a well a to creating and maintaining empire . indigenous people in new granada experienced a decline in population due to conquest a well a eurasian disease , such a smallpox , to which they had no immunity . regarding the land a deserted , the spanish crown sold property to all person interested in colonised territory , creating large farm and possession of mine . </s> in the 16th century , the nautical science in spain reached a great development thanks to numerous scientific figure of the casa de contratacin and nautical science wa an essential pillar of the iberian ship development , 14001600 . </s> <section_title_start> colonial exchange <section_title_end> </s> in 1542 , the region of new granada , along with all other spanish possession in south america , became part of the viceroyalty of peru , with it capital in lima . in 1547 , new granada became the captaincy-general of new granada within the viceroyalty . </s> in 1549 , the real audiencia wa created by a royal decree , and new granada wa ruled by the royal audience of santa fe de bogot , which at that time comprised the province of santa marta , rio de san juan , popayn , guayana and cartagena . but important decision were taken from the colony to spain by the council of the indie . </s> in the 16th century , european began to bring atlantic slave trade from africa . spain wa the only european power that could not establish factory ( trading post ) in africa to purchase slave ; therefore , the spanish empire relied on the asiento system , awarding merchant ( mostly from portuguese empire , french colonial empire , south sea company # slave trade under the asiento , and the dutch empire ) the license to trade enslaved people to their overseas territory . some people defended the human right and freedom of oppressed people . the indigenous people could not be enslaved because they were legally commoner of the spanish crown . to protect the indigenous people , several form of land ownership and regulation were established : resguardos , encomiendas and hacienda . </s> the viceroyalty of new granada wa created in 1717 , then temporarily removed , and then re-established in 1739 . it capital wa santa f de bogot . this viceroyalty included some other province of northwestern south america that had previously been under the jurisdiction of the new spain or viceroyalty of peru and correspond mainly to today 's venezuela , ecuador , and panama . so , bogot became one of the principal administrative center of the spanish possession in the new world , along with lima and mexico city , though it remained somewhat backward compared to those two city in several economic and logistical way . </s> after great britain declared war on spain in 1739 , battle of cartagena de india quickly became the british force ' top target , but an upset spanish victory during the war of jenkins ' ear , a war with great britain for economic control of the caribbean , cemented spanish dominance in the caribbean until the seven year ' war . </s> the 18th-century priest , botanist and mathematician jos celestino mutis wa delegated by viceroy antonio caballero y gngora to conduct an inventory of the nature of new granada . started in 1783 , this became known a the royal botanical expedition to new granada . it classified plant and wildlife , and founded the first astronomical observatory in the city of santa fe de bogot . in july 1801 the prussian scientist alexander von humboldt reached santa fe de bogot where he met with mutis . in addition , historical figure in the process of independence in new granada emerged from the expedition a the astronomer francisco jos de caldas , the scientist francisco antonio zea , the zoologist jorge tadeo lozano and the painter salvador rizo . </s> <section_title_start> independence <section_title_end> </s> since the beginning of the period of conquest and colonization , there were several rebel movement against spanish rule , but most were either crushed or remained too weak to change the overall situation . the last one that sought outright independence from spain sprang up around 1810 and culminated in the colombian declaration of independence , issued on 20 july 1810 , the day that is now celebrated a the nation 's independence day . this movement followed the independence of st. domingue ( present-day haiti ) in 1804 , which provided some support to an eventual leader of this rebellion : simn bolvar . francisco de paula santander also would play a decisive role . </s> a movement wa initiated by antonio nario , who opposed spanish centralism and led the opposition against the viceroyalty . cartagena , colombia became independent in november 1811 . in 1811 the united province of new granada were proclaimed , headed by camilo torres tenorio . the emergence of two distinct ideological current among the patriot ( federalism and unitary state ) gave rise to a period of patria boba . shortly after the napoleonic war ended , ferdinand vii , recently restored to the throne in spain , unexpectedly decided spanish reconquest of new granada to retake most of northern south america . the viceroyalty wa restored under the command of juan smano , whose regime punished those who participated in the patriotic movement , ignoring the political nuance of the junta ( spanish american independence ) . the retribution stoked renewed rebellion , which , combined with a weakened spain , made possible a successful rebellion led by the venezuelan-born military career of simn bolvar , who finally proclaimed spanish american war of independence in 1819 . the royalist ( spanish american independence ) pro-spanish resistance wa defeated in 1822 in the present territory of colombia and in 1823 in venezuela . </s> the territory of the viceroyalty of new granada became the gran colombia , organized a a subdivision of gran colombia of colombia , panama , ecuador , venezuela , part of guyana and brazil and north of maran river . the congress of ccuta in 1821 adopted a colombian constitution of 1821 for the new republic . simn bolvar became the first president of colombia , and francisco de paula santander wa made vice president of colombia . however , the new republic wa unstable and three country emerged from the collapse of gran colombia in 1830 ( new granada , ecuador and venezuela ) . </s> colombia wa the first constitutional government in south america , and the colombian liberal party and colombian conservative party party , founded in 1848 and 1849 , respectively , are two of the oldest surviving political party in the america . slavery wa abolished in the country in 1851. </s> internal political and territorial division led to the dissolution of gran colombia in 1830 . the so-called `` cundinamarca province `` adopted the name `` republic of the new granada `` , which it kept until 1858 when it became the `` confederacin granadina `` ( granadine confederation ) . after a colombian civil war ( 18601862 ) two-year civil war in 1863 , the `` united state of colombia `` wa created , lasting until 1886 , when the country finally became known a the republic of colombia . internal division remained between the bipartisan political force , occasionally igniting very bloody civil war , the most significant being the thousand day ' war ( 18991902 ) . </s> <section_title_start> 20th century <section_title_end> </s> the united state of america 's intention to influence the area ( especially the panama canal construction and control ) led to the separation of panama from colombia in 1903 and the establishment of it a a nation . the united state paid colombia $ 25,000,000 in 1921 , seven year after completion of the canal , for redress of president theodore roosevelt 's role in the creation of panama , and colombia recognized panama under the term of the thomsonurrutia treaty . colombia and peru went to leticia incident because of territory dispute far in the amazon basin . the war ended with a peace deal brokered by the league of nation . the league finally awarded the disputed area to colombia in june 1934. </s> soon after , colombia achieved some degree of political stability , which wa interrupted by a bloody conflict that took place between the late 1940s and the early 1950s , a period known a la violencia ( `` the violence `` ) . it cause wa mainly mounting tension between the two leading political party , which subsequently ignited after the assassination of the liberal presidential candidate jorge elicer gaitn on 9 april 1948 . the ensuing riot in bogot , known a el bogotazo , spread throughout the country and claimed the life of at least 180,000 colombian . </s> colombia entered the korean war when laureano gmez wa elected president . it wa the only latin american country to join the war in a direct military role a an ally of the united state . particularly important wa the resistance of the colombian troop at battle of old baldy . </s> the violence between the two political party decreased first when gustavo rojas pinilla deposed the laureano gmez of colombia in a coup d'tat and negotiated with the guerrilla , and then under the colombian military junta of general gabriel par . </s> after rojas ' deposition , the colombian conservative party and colombian liberal party agreed to create the national front ( colombia ) , a coalition that would jointly govern the country . under the deal , the presidency would alternate between conservative and liberal every 4 year for 16 year ; the two party would have parity in all other elective office . the national front ended `` la violencia `` , and national front administration attempted to institute far-reaching social and economic reform in cooperation with the alliance for progress . despite the progress in certain sector , many social and political problem continued , and guerrilla group were formally created such a the revolutionary armed force of colombia , the national liberation army ( colombia ) and the 19th of april movement m-19 to fight the government and political apparatus . </s> since the 1960s , the country ha suffered from an asymmetric warfare low intensity conflict low-intensity colombian armed conflict ( 1964present ) between military force of colombia , guerrilla movement in colombia and paramilitarism in colombia . the conflict escalated in the 1990s , mainly in remote rural area . since the beginning of the armed conflict , [ right defender ] have fought for the respect for human right , despite staggering opposition . several guerrilla ' organization decided to demobilize after peace negotiation in 19891994 . </s> the united state ha been heavily involved in the conflict since it beginning , when in the early 1960s the u.s. government encouraged the colombian military to attack leftist militia in rural colombia . this wa part of the u.s. fight against communism . mercenary and multinational corporation such a chiquita brand international are some of the international actor that have contributed to the violence of the conflict . </s> beginning in the mid-1970s colombian drug cartel became major producer , processor and exporter of illegal drug trade in colombia , primarily cannabis ( drug ) and cocaine . </s> on 4 july 1991 , a new colombian constitution of 1991 wa promulgated . the change generated by the new constitution are viewed a positive by colombian society . </s> <section_title_start> 21st century <section_title_end> </s> the administration of president lvaro uribe ( 200210 ) , adopted the democratic security policy which included an integrated counter-terrorism and counter-insurgency campaign . the government economic plan also promoted confidence in investor . a part of a controversial peace process the united self-defense force of colombia ( right-wing paramilitary ) a a formal organization had ceased to function . in february 2008 , million of colombian demonstrated against farc and other outlawed group . </s> after peace negotiation in cuba , the government of colombia of president juan manuel santos and guerrilla of farc-ep announced a final agreement to end the conflict . however , a colombian peace agreement referendum , 2016 to ratify the deal wa unsuccessful . afterward , the colombian government and the farc signed a revised colombian peace process in november 2016 , which the colombian congress approved . in 2016 , president santos wa awarded the 2016 nobel peace prize . the government began a process of attention and comprehensive reparation for victim of conflict . colombia show modest progress in the struggle to defend human right , a expressed by human right watch . a special jurisdiction of peace ha been created to investigate , clarify , prosecute and punish serious human right violation and grave breach of international humanitarian law which occurred during the armed conflict and to satisfy victim ' right to justice . during his visit to colombia , pope francis paid tribute to the victim of the conflict . </s> 2010 colombiavenezuela diplomatic crisis colombia 's relation with venezuela have fluctuated due to ideological difference between both government . colombia ha offered humanitarian aid with food and medicine to mitigate the shortage of supply in venezuela . colombia 's foreign ministry said that all effort to resolve crisis in venezuela ( 2012present ) venezuela 's crisis should be peaceful . colombia proposed the idea of the sustainable development goal and a final document wa adopted by the united nation . 201920 colombian protest are a series of country-wide protest against inequality , police brutality , corruption and in favor of the colombian peace process . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> the geography of colombia is characterized by it six main natural region of colombia that present their own unique characteristic , from the andes mountain range region shared with ecuador and venezuela ; the pacific coastal region shared with panama and ecuador ; the caribbean coastal region shared with venezuela and panama ; the llano ( plain ) shared with venezuela ; the amazon rainforest region shared with venezuela , brazil , peru and ecuador ; to the insular region ( colombia ) , comprising island in both the atlantic and pacific ocean . it share it maritime limit with costa rica , nicaragua , honduras , jamaica , haiti , and the dominican republic . </s> colombia is bordered to the northwest by panama , to the east by venezuela and brazil , and to the south by ecuador and peru ; it established it maritime boundary with neighboring country through seven agreement on the caribbean sea and three on the pacific ocean . it lie between latitude 12th parallel north 12n and 4th parallel south 4 and between longitude 67th meridian west 67 and 79th meridian west 79w . </s> part of the pacific ring of fire , a region of the world subject to earthquake and volcano , in the interior of colombia the andes are the prevailing geographical feature . most of colombia 's population center are located in these interior highland . beyond the colombian massif ( in the southwestern department of cauca department and nario department ) , these are divided into three branch known a cordilleras ( mountain range ) : the cordillera occidental ( colombia ) , running adjacent to the pacific coast and including the city of santiago de cali ; the cordillera central ( colombia ) , running between the cauca river and magdalena river valley ( to the west and east , respectively ) and including the city of medelln , manizales , pereira , colombia , and armenia , quindo ; and the cordillera oriental ( colombia ) , extending northeast to the guajira peninsula and including bogot , bucaramanga , and ccuta . </s> peak in the cordillera occidental exceed , and in the cordillera central and cordillera oriental they reach . at , bogot is the highest city of it size in the world . </s> east of the andes lie the savanna of the llano , part of the orinoco river basin , and in the far southeast , the jungle of the amazon rainforest . together these lowland comprise over half colombia 's territory , but they contain le than 6 % of the population . to the north the caribbean region of colombia , home to 21.9 % of the population and the location of the major port city of barranquilla and cartagena , colombia , generally consists of low-lying plain , but it also contains the sierra nevada de santa marta mountain range , which includes the country 's tallest peak ( pico cristbal coln and pico simn bolvar ) , and the la guajira desert . by contrast the narrow and discontinuous pacific region of colombia , backed by the baud mountain mountain , are sparsely populated and covered in dense vegetation . the principal pacific port is buenaventura , colombia . </s> the main river of colombia are magdalena river , cauca river , guaviare river , atrato river , meta river , putumayo river and caquet river . colombia ha four main drainage system : the pacific drain , the caribbean drain , the orinoco basin and the amazon basin . the orinoco and amazon river river mark limit with colombia to venezuela and peru respectively . </s> protected area and the `` national park system `` cover an area of about and account for 12.77 % of the colombian territory . compared to neighboring country , rate of deforestation in colombia are still relatively low . colombia had a 2018 forest landscape integrity index mean score of 8.26/10 , ranking it 25th globally out of 172 country . colombia is the sixth country in the world by magnitude of total renewable freshwater supply , and still ha large reserve of freshwater . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> the climate of colombia is characterized for being tropical presenting variation within natural region of colombia and depending on the altitude , temperature , [ wind and rainfall . the diversity of climate zone in colombia is characterized for having tropical rainforest ] s , [ [ savanna , steppe , desert and mountain climate . </s> mountain climate is one of the unique feature of the andes and other high altitude relief where climate is determined by elevation . below in elevation is the tierra caliente , where temperature are above . about 82.5 % of the country 's total area lie in the warm altitudinal zone . the tierra templada located between is characterized for presenting an average temperature ranging between . the tierra fra is present between and the temperature vary between . beyond lie the alpine condition of the forested zone and then the treeless grassland of the pramos . above , where temperature are below freezing , the climate is tierra helada , a zone of permanent snow and ice . </s> <section_title_start> biodiversity <section_title_end> </s> colombia is one of the megadiverse country in biodiversity , ranking first in list of bird of colombia . a for plant , the country ha between 40,000 and 45,000 plant specie , equivalent to 10 or 20 % of total global specie , which is even more remarkable given that colombia is considered a country of intermediate size . colombia is the second most biodiverse country in the world , lagging only after brazil which is approximately 7 time bigger . </s> colombia is the country with the planet 's highest biodiversity , having the highest rate of specie by area a well a the largest number of endemism ( specie that are not found naturally anywhere else ) of any country . about 10 % of the specie of the earth live in colombia , including over 1,900 specie of bird , more than in europe and north america combined . colombia ha 10 % of the world 's list of mammal of colombia specie , 14 % of the amphibian specie and 18 % of the endemic bird of colombia specie of the world . </s> colombia ha about 2,000 specie of marine fish and is the second most diverse country in freshwater fish . it is also the country with the most endemic specie of list of butterfly of colombia , is first in orchid specie , and had approximately 7,000 specie of beetle . colombia is second in the number of amphibian specie and is the third most diverse country in list of reptile of colombia and arecaceae . there are about 1,900 specie of mollusk and according to estimate there are about 300,000 specie of invertebrate in the country . in colombia there are 32 terrestrial biome and 314 type of ecosystem . </s> <section_title_start> government and politics <section_title_end> </s> the government of colombia take place within the framework of a presidential system participatory democracy republic a established in the constitution of 1991 . in accordance with the principle of separation of power , government is divided into three branch : the executive branch , the legislative branch and the judicial branch . </s> a the head of the executive branch , the president of colombia serf a both [ of state ] and [ of government ] , followed by the vice president of colombia and the council of minister of the republic of colombia . the president is elected by popular vote to serve a single four-year term ( in 2015 , colombia 's congress approved the repeal of a 2004 constitutional amendment that changed the one-term limit for president to a two-term limit ) . at the provincial level executive power is vested in list of colombian department governor , municipality of colombia and local administrator for smaller administrative subdivision , such a corregimientos of colombia or comunas . all regional election are held one year and five month after the presidential election . </s> the legislative branch of government is represented nationally by the congress of colombia , a bicameral institution comprising a 166-seat chamber of representative of colombia and a 102-seat senate of colombia . the senate is elected nationally and the chamber of representative is elected in electoral district . member of both house are elected to serve four-year term two month before the president , also by popular vote . </s> the judicial branch is headed by judiciary of colombia , consisting of the supreme court of justice of colombia which deal with penal and civil matter , the council of state of colombia , which ha special responsibility for administrative law and also provides legal advice to the executive , the constitutional court of colombia , responsible for assuring the integrity of the colombian constitution , and the superior council of judicature , responsible for auditing the judicial branch . colombia operates a system of civil law ( legal system ) , which since 2005 ha been applied through an adversarial system . </s> despite a number of controversy , the democratic security policy ha ensured that former president lvaro uribe remained popular among colombian people , with his approval rating peaking at 76 % , according to a poll in 2009 . however , having served two term , he wa constitutionally barred from seeking re-election in 2010 . in the run-off election on 20 june 2010 the former minister of defense juan manuel santos won with 69 % of the vote against the second most popular candidate , antanas mockus . a second round wa required since no candidate received over the 50 % winning threshold of vote . santos won nearly 51 % of the vote in second-round election on 15 june 2014 , beating right-wing rival scar ivn zuluaga , who won 45 % . ivn duque won in the second round with 54 % of the vote , against 42 % for his left-wing rival , gustavo petro . his term a colombia 's president run for four year beginning 7 august 2018. </s> <section_title_start> foreign affair <section_title_end> </s> the foreign affair of colombia are headed by the president , a head of state , and managed by the ministry of foreign affair ( colombia ) . colombia ha diplomatic mission in all continent . </s> colombia wa one of the 4 founding member of the pacific alliance , which is a political , economic and co-operative integration mechanism that promotes the free circulation of good , service , capital and person between the member , a well a a common stock exchange and joint embassy in several country . colombia is also a member of the united nation , the world trade organization , the organisation for economic co-operation and development , the organization of american state , the organization of ibero-american state , and the andean community of nation . colombia is a global partner of nato . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> the executive branch of government is responsible for managing the defense of colombia , with the president commander-in-chief of the armed force . the ministry of national defence ( colombia ) exercise day-to-day control of the military of colombia and the colombian national police . colombia ha 455,461 active military personnel . and in 2016 3.4 % of the country 's gdp went towards military expenditure , placing it 24th in the world . colombia 's armed force are the largest in latin america , and it is the second largest spender on it military after brazil . in 2018 , colombia signed the un treaty on the prohibition of nuclear weapon . </s> the colombian military is divided into three branch : the national army of colombia ; the colombian air force ; and the colombian navy . the national police function a a gendarmerie , operating independently from the military a the law enforcement agency for the entire country . each of these operates with their own intelligence apparatus separate from the national intelligence directorate ( colombia ) ( dni , in spanish ) . </s> the national army is formed by division , brigade , special brigade , and special unit , the colombian navy by the colombian naval infantry , the naval force of the caribbean , the naval force of the pacific , the naval force of the south , the naval force of the east , colombia coast guard , naval aviation , and the specific command of san andres y providencia and the air force by 15 air unit . the national police ha a presence in all municipality . </s> <section_title_start> administrative division <section_title_end> </s> colombia is divided into 32 department of colombia and one bogot , which is treated a a department ( bogot also serf a the capital of the cundinamarca department ) . department are subdivided into municipality of colombia , each of which is assigned a municipal seat , and municipality are in turn subdivided into corregimientos of colombia in rural area and into comunas of colombia in urban area . each department ha a local government with a governor and assembly directly elected to four-year term , and each municipality is headed by a mayor and council . there is a popularly elected local administrative board in each of the corregimientos or comunas . </s> in addition to the capital four other city have been designated district of colombia ( in effect special municipality ) , on the basis of special distinguishing feature . these are barranquilla , cartagena , colombia , santa marta and buenaventura , colombia . some department have local administrative subdivision , where town have a large concentration of population and municipality are near each other ( for example , in antioquia and cundinamarca ) . where department have a low population ( for example amazona , vaups and vichada ) , special administrative division are employed , such a `` department corregimientos `` , which are a hybrid of a municipality and a corregimiento . </s> click on a department on the map below to go to it article . </s> } </s> <section_title_start> largest city and town <section_title_end> </s> colombia is a highly urbanized country with 77.1 % of the population living in urban area . the largest city in the country are bogot , with 7,387,400 inhabitant , medelln , with 2,382,399 inhabitant , cali , with 2,172,527 inhabitant , and barranquilla , with 1,205,284 inhabitant . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> historically an agrarian economy , colombia urbanised rapidly in the 20th century , by the end of which just 15.8 % of the workforce were employed in agriculture , generating just 6.6 % of gdp ; 19.6 % of the workforce were employed in industry and 64.6 % in service , responsible for 33.4 % and 59.9 % of gdp respectively . the country 's economic production is dominated by it strong domestic demand . consumer spending by household is the largest component of gdp . </s> colombia 's market economy grew steadily in the latter part of the 20th century , with gross domestic product ( gdp ) increasing at an average rate of over 4 % per year between 1970 and 1998 . the country suffered a recession in 1999 ( the first full year of negative growth since the great depression ) , and the recovery from that recession wa long and painful . however , in recent year growth ha been impressive , reaching 6.9 % in 2007 , one of the list of country by gdp ( real ) growth rate in latin america . according to international monetary fund estimate , in 2012 , colombia 's gdp ( ppp ) wa u $ 500 ; billion ( list of country by gdp ( ppp ) and third in south america ) . </s> total government expenditure account for 27.9 percent of the domestic economy . external debt equal 39.9 percent of gross domestic product . a strong fiscal climate wa reaffirmed by a boost in bond rating . annual inflation closed 2017 at 4.09 % yoy ( vs. 5.75 % yoy in 2016 ) . the average national unemployment rate in 2017 wa 9.4 % , although the informality is the biggest problem facing the labour market ( the income of formal worker climbed 24.8 % in 5 year while labor income of informal worker rose only 9 % ) . colombia ha free-trade zone ( ftz ) , such a zona franca del pacifico , located in the valle del cauca , one of the most striking area for foreign investment . </s> the financial sector ha grown favorably due to good liquidity in the economy , the growth of credit and the positive performance of the colombian economy . the colombian stock exchange through the latin american integrated market ( mercado integrado latinoamericano ) offer a regional market to trade equity . colombia is now one of only three economy with a perfect score on the strength of legal right index , according to the world bank . </s> the electricity production in colombia come mainly from renewable energy source . 69.93 % is obtained from the hydroelectricity . colombia 's commitment to renewable energy wa recognized in the 2014 global green economy index ( ggei ) , ranking among the top 10 nation in the world in term of greening efficiency sector . </s> colombia is rich in natural resource , and it main export include mineral fuel , oil , distillation # industrial distillation , fruit and other agricultural product , sugar and sugar confectionery , food product , plastic , precious stone , metal , forest product , chemical industry , pharmaceutical , vehicle , electronic product , electrical equipment , perfumery and cosmetic , machinery , manufactured article , textile and fabric , clothing and footwear , glass and glassware , furniture , prefabricated building , military product , home and office material , construction equipment , software , among others . principal trading partner are the united state , china , the european union and some latin american country . </s> non-traditional export have boosted the growth of colombian foreign sale a well a the diversification of destination of export thanks to new free trade agreement . </s> in 2017 , the national administrative department of statistic ( dane ) reported that 26.9 % of the population were living below the poverty line , of which 7.4 % in `` extreme poverty `` . the multidimensional poverty rate stand at 17.0 percent of the population . the government ha also been developing a process of financial inclusion within the country 's most vulnerable population . </s> recent economic growth ha led to a considerable increase of new millionaire , including the new entrepreneur , colombian with a net worth exceeding u $ 1 ; billion . </s> the contribution of tourism in colombia travel & tourism to gdp wa u $ 5,880.3bn ( 2.0 % of total gdp ) in 2016 . tourism generated 556,135 job ( 2.5 % of total employment ) in 2016 . foreign tourist visit were predicted to have risen from 0.6 ; million in 2007 to 4 ; million in 2017. </s> <section_title_start> science and technology <section_title_end> </s> colombia ha more than 3,950 research group in science and technology . innpulsa , a government body that promotes entrepreneurship and innovation in the country , provides grant to startup , in addition to other service it and institution like apps.co provide . co-working space have arisen to serve a community for startup large and small . organization such a the corporation for biological research ( cib ) for the support of young people interested in scientific work ha been successfully developed in colombia . the international center for tropical agriculture based in colombia investigates the increasing challenge of global warming and food security . </s> important invention related to medicine have been made in colombia , such a the first artificial cardiac pacemaker , invented by the electronics engineer jorge reynolds pombo , invention of great importance for those who suffer from heart failure . also invented in colombia were the microkeratome and keratomileusis technique , which form the fundamental basis of what now is known a lasik ( one of the most important technique for the correction of refractive error of vision ) and the salomn hakim # the invention of the valve for the treatment of hydrocephalus , among others . colombia ha begun to innovate in military technology for it army and other army of the world ; especially in the design and creation of personal ballistic protection product , military hardware , military robot , bomb , simulator and radar . </s> some leading colombian scientist are joseph m. tohme , researcher recognized for his work on the genetic diversity of food , manuel elkin patarroyo who is known for his groundbreaking work on synthetic vaccine for malaria , francisco lopera who discovered the `` paisa mutation `` or a type of early-onset alzheimer 's disease early-onset alzheimer 's , rodolfo llins known for his study of the intrinsic neuron property and the theory of a syndrome that had changed the way of understanding the functioning of the brain , jairo quiroga puello recognized for his study on the characterization of synthetic substance which can be used to fight fungus , tumor , tuberculosis and even some virus and ngela restrepo who established accurate medical diagnosis and treatment to combat the effect of a disease caused by the paracoccidioides brasiliensis , among other scientist . </s> <section_title_start> transportation <section_title_end> </s> transportation in colombia is regulated within the function of the ministry of transport ( colombia ) and entity such a the national road institute ( invas ) responsible for the highway in colombia , the aerocivil , responsible for civil aviation and list of airport in colombia , the national infrastructure agency ( colombia ) , in charge of concession ( contract ) through publicprivate partnership , for the design , construction , maintenance , operation , and administration of the transport infrastructure , the general maritime directorate ( dimar ) ha the responsibility of coordinating maritime traffic control along with the colombian navy , among others and under the supervision of the superintendency of port and transport ( colombia ) . the road network in colombia ha a length of about 215,000 ; km of which 23,000 are paved . rail transport in colombia in colombia is dedicated almost entirely to rail freight transport and the railway network ha a length of 1,700 ; km of potentially active rail . colombia ha 3,960 kilometer of gas pipeline , 4,900 kilometer of oil pipeline , and 2,990 kilometer of refined-products pipeline . </s> the target of colombia 's government is to build 7,000 ; km of road for the 20162020 period and reduce travel time by 30 per cent and transport cost by 20 per cent . a toll road concession programme will comprise 40 project , and is part of a larger strategic goal to invest nearly $ 50bn in transport infrastructure , including : railway system ; making the magdalena river navigable again ; improving port facility ; a well a an expansion of el dorado international airport bogot 's airport . </s> <section_title_start> demographic <section_title_end> </s> with an estimated 50 ; million people in 2020 , colombia is the list of country by population third-most populous country in latin america , after brazil and mexico . at the beginning of the 20th century , colombia 's population wa approximately 4 ; million . since the early 1970s colombia ha experienced steady decline in it fertility , mortality , and population growth rate . the population growth rate for 2016 is estimated to be 0.9 % . about 26.8 % of the population were 15 year old or younger , 65.7 % were between 15 and 64 year old , and 7.4 % were over 65 year old . the proportion of older person in the total population ha begun to increase substantially . colombia is projected to have a population of 55.3 ; million by 2050. </s> the population is concentrated in the andean region of colombia and along the caribbean region of colombia , also the population density are generally higher in the andean region . the nine eastern lowland department , comprising about 54 % of colombia 's area , have le than 6 % of the population . traditionally a rural society , urbanization wa very heavy in the mid-20th century , and colombia is now one of the most urbanized country in latin america . the urban population increased from 31 % of the total in 1938 to nearly 60 % in 1973 , and by 2014 the figure stood at 76 % . the population of bogot alone ha increased from just over 300,000 in 1938 to approximately 8 ; million today . in total seventy-two city now have population of 100,000 or more ( 2015 ) . colombia ha the world 's largest population of internally displaced person ( idp ) , estimated to be up to 4.9 ; million people . </s> the life expectancy is 74.8 year in 2015 and infant mortality is 13.1 per thousand in 2016 . in 2015 , 94.58 % of adult and 98.66 % of youth are literate and the government spends about 4.49 % of it gdp in education . </s> <section_title_start> languages <section_title_end> </s> more than 99.2 % of colombian speak spanish , also called castilian ; 65 amerindian language , two creole language , the romani language and colombian sign language are also used in the country . english ha official status in the archipelago of san andrs , providencia and santa catalina . </s> including spanish , a total of 101 language are listed for colombia in the ethnologue database . the specific number of spoken language varies slightly since some author consider a different language what others consider to be variety or dialect of the same language . best estimate recorded 71 language that are spoken in-country today ; most of which belong to the chibchan language , tucanoan language , borawitoto language borawitoto , guajiboan language , arawakan language , cariban language , barbacoan language , and piaroasaliban language language family . there are currently about 850,000 speaker of native language . </s> <section_title_start> ethnic group <section_title_end> </s> colombia is ethnically diverse , it people descending from the original indigenous people in colombia inhabitant , spanish colonist , african colombian originally brought to the country a slave , and 20th-century european diaspora and the arab colombian , all contributing to a diverse cultural heritage . the demographic distribution reflects a pattern that is influenced by colonial history . white live all throughout the country , mainly in urban center and the burgeoning highland and coastal city . the population of the major city also include mestizo . mestizo colombian campesinos ( people living in rural area ) also live in the andean highland where some spanish conqueror mixed with the woman of amerindian chiefdoms . mestizo include artisan and small tradesman that have played a major part in the urban expansion of recent decade . </s> the 2018 colombian census reported that the `` non-ethnic population `` , consisting of white colombian and mestizo colombian ( those of mixed european and amerindian ancestry ) , constituted 87.58 % of the national population . 6.68 % is of afro-colombian ancestry . indigenous people in colombia comprise 4.31 % of the population . raizal people comprise 0.06 % of the population . palenquero people comprise 0.02 % of the population . 0.01 % of the population are romani people . an extraofficial estimate considers that the 49 % of the colombian population is mestizo colombian or of mixed european and amerindian ancestry , and that approximately 37 % is white colombian , mainly of spanish immigration to colombia lineage , but there is also a large population of arab colombian descent ; in some sector of society there is a considerable input of german colombian and italian colombian ancestry . </s> many of the indigenous people in colombia experienced a reduction in population during the spanish rule and many others were absorbed into the mestizo population , but the remainder currently represents over eighty distinct culture . reserve ( resguardos ) established for indigenous people occupy ( 27 % of the country 's total ) and are inhabited by more than 800,000 people . some of the largest indigenous group are the wayuu , the paez people , the pasto , the ember people and the zen . the department of department of la guajira , cauca department , nario department , crdoba department and sucre department have the largest indigenous population . </s> the national indigenous organization of colombia ( onic ) , founded at the first national indigenous congress in 1982 , is an organization representing the indigenous people of colombia . in 1991 , colombia signed and ratified the current international law concerning indigenous people , indigenous and tribal people convention , 1989. </s> ethnic group of africa were brought a slavery , mostly to the coastal lowland , beginning early in the 16th century and continuing into the 19th century . large afro-colombian community are found today on the pacific coast . british and jamaican people migrated mainly to the island of san andres and providencia . a number of other european and north american migrated to the country in the late 19th and early 20th century , including people from the former ussr during and after the second world war . </s> many immigrant community have settled on the caribbean coast , in particular recent immigrant from the ethnic group in west asia and europe . barranquilla ( the largest city of the colombian caribbean ) and other caribbean city have the largest population of lebanese colombian , palestinian people , and other arab colombian . there are also important community of chinese , japanese colombian , romani people and history of the jew in colombia . there is a major migration trend of venezuelan people , due to the political and economic situation in venezuela . in august 2019 , colombia offered citizenship to more than 24,000 child of venezuelan refugee who were born in colombia . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> the national administrative department of statistic ( dane ) doe not collect religious statistic , and accurate report are difficult to obtain . however , based on various study and a survey , about 90 % of the population adheres to christianity , the majority of which ( 70.9 % 79 % ) are roman catholic , while a significant minority ( 16.7 % ) adhere to protestantism ( primarily evangelicalism ) . some 4.7 % of the population is atheist or agnostic , while 3.5 % claim to believe in god but do not follow a specific religion . 1.8 % of colombian adhere to jehovah 's witness and adventism and le than 1 % adhere to other religion , such a the bah faith , islam , judaism , buddhism , mormonism , hinduism , animism , hare krishna movement , rastafari movement , orthodox catholic church , and spiritual study . the remaining people either did not respond or replied that they did not know . in addition to the above statistic , 35.9 % of colombian reported that they did not practice their faith actively . </s> while colombia remains a mostly roman catholic country by baptism number , the 1991 colombian constitution guarantee freedom of religion and all religious faith and church are equally free before the law . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> colombia lie at the crossroad of latin american culture and the broader american continent , and a such ha been hit by a wide range of cultural influence . indigenous people of the america , culture of spain and other culture of europe , culture of africa , culture of the united state , culture of the caribbean , and arab culture influence , a well a other latin american cultural influence , are all present in colombia 's modern culture . urban migration , industrialization , globalization , and other political , social and economic change have also left an impression . </s> many national symbol of colombia , both object and theme , have arisen from colombia 's diverse cultural tradition and aim to represent what colombia , and the colombian people , have in common . cultural expression in colombia are promoted by the government through the ministry of culture ( colombia ) . </s> <section_title_start> literature <section_title_end> </s> colombian literature date back to pre-columbian era ; a notable example of the period is the epic poem known a the legend of yurupary . in spanish colonial time , notable writer include juan de castellanos ( elegas de varones ilustres de india ) , hernando domnguez camargo and his epic poem to san ignacio de loyola , pedro simn , juan rodrguez freyle ( el carnero ) , lucas fernndez de piedrahita , and the nun francisca josefa de la concepcin , representative of mysticism . </s> post-independence literature linked to romanticism highlighted antonio nario , jos fernndez madrid , camilo torres tenorio and francisco antonio zea . in the second half of the nineteenth century and early twentieth century the literary genre known a costumbrismo became popular ; great writer of this period were tom carrasquilla , jorge isaac and rafael pombo ( the latter of whom wrote notable work of child 's literature ) . within that period , author such a jos asuncin silva , jos eustasio rivera , len de greiff , porfirio barba-jacob and jos mara vargas vila developed the modernismo movement . in 1872 , colombia established the colombian academy of language , the first spanish language academy in the america . candelario obeso wrote the groundbreaking canto populares de mi tierra ( 1877 ) , the first book of poetry by an afro-colombian author . </s> between 1939 and 1940 seven book of poetry were published under the name stone and sky ( movement ) in the city of bogot that significantly impacted the country ; they were edited by the poet jorge rojas . in the following decade , gonzalo arango founded the movement of `` nadaism `` in response to the violence of the time ; he wa influenced by nihilism , existentialism , and the thought of another great colombian writer : fernando gonzlez ( writer ) . during the latin american boom , successful writer emerged , led by nobel prize in literature gabriel garca mrquez and his magnum opus , one hundred year of solitude , eduardo caballero caldern , manuel meja vallejo , and lvaro mutis , a writer who wa awarded the miguel de cervantes prize and the prince of asturias award for letter . other leading contemporary author are fernando vallejo , william ospina ( rmulo gallegos prize ) and germn castro caycedo . </s> <section_title_start> visual art <section_title_end> </s> colombian art ha over 3,000 year of history . colombian artist have captured the country 's changing political and cultural backdrop using a range of style and medium . there is archeological evidence of ceramic being produced earlier in colombia than anywhere else in the america , dating a early a 3,000 ; bce . </s> the earliest example of gold craftsmanship have been attributed to the tumaco people of the pacific coast and date to around 325 ; bce . roughly between 200 ; bce and 800 ce , the san agustn , huila , master of stonemasonry , entered it `` classical period `` . they erected raised ceremony centre , sarcophagus , and large stone monolith depicting anthropomorphic and zoomorphism form out of rock ( geology ) . </s> colombian art ha followed the trend of the time , so during the 16th to 18th century , roman catholicism in spain had a huge influence on colombian art , and the popular baroque style wa replaced with rococo when the bourbon ascended to the monarchy of spain . more recently , colombian artist pedro nel gmez and santiago martnez delgado started the colombian murial movement in the 1940s , featuring the neoclassicism feature of art deco . </s> since the 1950s , the colombian art started to have a distinctive point of view , reinventing traditional element under the concept of the 20th century . example of this are the greiff portrait by ignacio gmez jaramillo , showing what the colombian art could do with the new technique applied to typical colombian theme . carlos correa , with his paradigmatic `` naturaleza muerta en silencio `` ( silent dead nature ) , combine geometrical abstraction ( art ) and cubism . alejandro obregn is often considered a the father of modern colombian painting , and one of the most influential artist in this period , due to his originality , the painting of colombian landscape with symbolism ( art ) and expressionism use of animal , ( specially the andean condor ) . fernando botero , omar rayo , enrique grau , dgar negret , david manzur , rodrigo arena betancourt , oscar murillo ( artist ) , doris salcedo and oscar muoz ( artist ) are some of the colombian artist featured at the international level . </s> the colombian sculpture from the sixteenth to 18th century wa mostly devoted to religious art of ecclesiastic art , strongly influenced by the spanish school of sacred sculpture . during the early period of the colombian republic , the national artist were focused in the production of sculptural portrait of politician and public figure , in a plain neoclassicist trend . during the 20th century , the colombian sculpture began to develop a bold and innovative work with the aim of reaching a better understanding of national sensitivity . </s> colombian photography wa marked by the arrival of the daguerreotype . jean-baptiste louis gros wa who brought the daguerreotype process to colombia in 1841 . the piloto public library ha latin america 's largest archive of negative , containing 1.7 ; million antique photograph covering colombia 1848 until 2005. </s> the colombian press ha promoted the work of the cartoonist . in recent decade , fanzines , internet and independent publisher have been fundamental to the growth of the comic in colombia . </s> <section_title_start> architecture <section_title_end> </s> throughout the time , there have been a variety of list of architectural style , from those of indigenous people to contemporary one , passing through colonial ( military and religious ) , republican , transition and modern style . </s> ancient habitation area , longhouses , terrace ( agriculture ) , road a the inca road system , cemetery , [ and necropolis ] e are all part of the [ [ indigenous architecture . some prominent indigenous structure are the andean preceramic and ceramic archaeological site of tequendama , tierradentro ( a park that contains the largest concentration of list of pre-columbian culture pre-columbian monumental shaft tomb with side chamber ) , the largest collection of religious monument and megalithic sculpture in south america , located in san agustn archaeological park san agustn , huila , ciudad perdida ( an archaeological site with a series of terrace carved into the mountainside , a net of tiled road , and several circular plaza ) , and the large village mainly built with stone , wood , cane , and mud . </s> architecture during the period of conquest and colonization is mainly derived of adapting european architecture to local condition , and spanish architecture , especially andalusian and extremaduran , can be easily seen . when european founded city two thing were making simultaneously : the dimensioning of geometrical space ( town square , street ) , and the location of a tangible point of map orientation . the construction of fort wa common throughout the caribbean and in some city of the interior , because of the danger that represented the english , french , and dutch piracy in the caribbean and the hostile indigenous group . church , chapel , school , and hospital belonging to catholic religious order cause a great urban impact . baroque architecture is used in military building and public space . marcelino arroyo , francisco jos de caldas and domingo de petrs were great representative of neo-classical architecture . </s> the capitolio nacional is a great representative of romanticism . wood wa extensively used in door , window , railing , and ceiling during the colonization of antioquia department . the caribbean region of colombia architecture acquires a strong arabic architecture . the teatro de cristbal coln in bogot is a lavish example of architecture from the 19th century . the quintas house with innovation in the volumetric conception are some of the best example of the republican architecture ; the republican action in the city focused on the design of three type of spatial analysis : park with forest , small urban park and avenue ( landscape ) and the gothic architecture wa most commonly used for the design of church . </s> deco style , rationalism ( architecture ) , eclecticism in architecture folklorist and art deco ornament ( art ) resource significantly influenced the architecture of colombia , especially during the transition period . international style ( architecture ) contributed with new construction technology and new building material ( steel , reinforced concrete , glass and synthetic material ) and the topology architecture and concrete slab also have a great influence . the most influential architect of the modern movement were rogelio salmona and fernando martnez sanabria . </s> the contemporary architecture of colombia is designed to give greater importance to the building material , this architecture take into account the specific geographical feature and is also an architecture that appeal to the sens . the architectural conservation of colombia ha been promoted in recent year . </s> <section_title_start> music <section_title_end> </s> colombia ha a vibrant collage of talent that touch a full spectrum of rhythm . musician , composer , music producer and singer from colombia are recognized internationally such a shakira , juanes , carlos vives and others . colombian music blend european-influenced guitar and song structure with large gaita flute and percussion instrument from the indigenous population , while it percussion structure and dance form come from africa . colombia ha a diverse and dynamic musical environment . </s> guillermo uribe holgun , an important cultural figure in the national symphony orchestra of colombia , luis antonio calvo and blas emilio atehorta are some of the greatest exponent of the art music . the bogot philharmonic orchestra is one of the most active orchestra in colombia . </s> caribbean music ha many vibrant rhythm , such a cumbia ( colombia ) ( it is played by the maraca , the drum , the gaitas and guacharaca ) , porro ( it is a monotonous but joyful rhythm ) , mapal ( with it fast rhythm and constant clapping ) and the `` vallenato `` , which originated in the northern part of the caribbean coast ( the rhythm is mainly played by the caja , the guacharaca , and accordion ) . </s> the music from the pacific coast , such a the currulao ( music genre ) , is characterized by it strong use of drum ( instrument such a the native marimba , the conunos , the bass drum , the side drum , and the cuatro guasas or tubular rattle ) . an important rhythm of the south region of the pacific coast is the contradanza ( it is used in dance show due to the striking colour of the costume ) . marimba music , traditional chant and dance from the colombia south pacific region are on unesco intangible cultural heritage list unesco 's representative list of the intangible cultural heritage of humanity . </s> important musical rhythm of the andean region ( colombia ) are the danza ( dance of andean folklore arising from the transformation of the european contredance ) , the bambuco ( it is played with guitar , colombian tiple and mandolin , the rhythm is danced by couple ) , the pasillo ( a rhythm inspired by the austrian waltz and the colombian `` danza `` , the lyric have been composed by well-known poet ) , the guabina ( the tiple , the bandola and the requinto are the basic instrument ) , the sanjuanero ( it originated in tolima department and huila department department , the rhythm is joyful and fast ) . apart from these traditional rhythm , salsa music ha spread throughout the country , and the city of cali is considered by many salsa singer to be 'the new salsa capital of the world ' . </s> the instrument that distinguish the music of the orinoqua natural region are the [ the cuatro ( instrument ) cuatro ] ( a type of four-stringed guitar ) and maraca . important rhythm of this region are the [ [ joropo ( a fast rhythm and there is also tapping a a result of it flamenco ancestry ) and the galeron ( it is heard a lot while cowboy are working ) . </s> the music of the amazon region is strongly influenced by the indigenous religious practice . some of the musical instrument used are the manguar ( a musical instrument of ceremonial type , consisting of a pair of large cylindrical drum ) , the quena ( melodic instrument ) , the rondador , the conga , bell , and different type of flute . </s> the music of the archipelago of san andrs , providencia and santa catalina is usually accompanied by a mandolin , a washtub bass tub-bass , a jawbone ( instrument ) , a guitar and maraca . some popular archipelago rhythm are the schottische , the calypso music , the polka and the mento . </s> <section_title_start> popular culture <section_title_end> </s> theater wa introduced in colombia during the spanish colonization of the america in 1550 through zarzuela company . colombian theater is supported by the ministry of culture and a number of private and state owned organization . the theater of colombia ibero-american theater festival of bogot is the cultural event of the highest importance in colombia and one of the biggest theater festival in the world . other important theater event are : the festival of puppet the fanfare ( medelln ) , the manizales theater festival , the caribbean theatre festival ( santa marta ) and the art festival of popular culture `` cultural invasion `` ( bogot ) . </s> although the cinema of colombia is young a an industry , more recently the film industry wa growing with support from the film act passed in 2003 . many film festival take place in colombia , but the two most important are the cartagena film festival , which is the oldest film festival in latin america , and the bogot film festival . </s> some important national circulation newspaper are el tiempo ( colombia ) and el espectador . television in colombia ha two privately owned tv network and three state-owned tv network with national coverage , a well a six regional tv network and dozen of local tv station . private channel , rcn tv and caracol televisin are the highest-rated . the regional channel and regional newspaper cover a department or more and it content is made in these particular area . </s> colombia ha three major national radio in colombia : radiodifusora nacional de colombia , a state-run national radio ; caracol radio and rcn radio , privately owned network with hundred of affiliate . there are other national network , including cadena super , todelar , and colmundo . many hundred of radio station are registered with the ministry of information technology and communication ( colombia ) . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> colombia 's varied cuisine is influenced by it diverse fauna and flora a well a the cultural tradition of the ethnic group . colombian dish and ingredient vary widely by region . some of the most common ingredient are : cereal such a rice and maize ; tuber such a potato and cassava ; assorted legume ; meat , including beef , chicken , pork and goat ; fish ; and seafood . colombia cuisine also feature a variety of tropical fruit such a physalis peruviana , acca sellowiana , eugenia stipitata , pitaya , purple mangosteen , passiflora ligularis , papaya , guava , mora ( blackberry ) , solanum quitoense , annona muricata and passionfruit . colombia is one of the world 's largest consumer of fruit juice . </s> among the most representative appetizer and soup are tostones ( fried green plantain ) , sancocho de gallina ( chicken soup with root vegetable ) and ajiaco ( potato and corn soup ) . representative snack and bread are pandebono , arepas ( corn cake ) , aborrajados ( fried sweet plantain with cheese ) , torta de choclo , empanadas and almojbanas . representative main course are bandeja paisa , lechona tolimense , ternera a la llanera , tamale and fish dish ( such a arroz de lisa ) , especially in coastal region where kibbeh , suero , costeo cheese and carimaolas are also eaten . representative side dish are papa chorreadas ( potato with cheese ) , remolachas rellenas con huevo duro ( beet stuffed with [ egg ] ) and coconut rice ( coconut rice ) . organic food is a current trend in big city , although in general across the country the fruit and veggie are very natural and fresh . </s> representative dessert are buuelos , natillas , maria luisa cake , bocadillo made of guayaba ( guava jelly ) , cocadas ( coconut ball ) , casquitos de guayaba ( candied guava peel ) , torta de natas , obleas , crme caramel de mango , roscn , milhoja , manjar blanco , dulce de feijoa , dulce de mountain papaya , torta de mojicn , and esponjado de curuba . typical sauce ( salsa ) are [ ( tomato and onion sauce ) and colombian-style aj ( sauce ) aj ] . </s> some representative beverage are [ [ coffee production in colombia ( tinto ) , champ , cholado , lulada , avena ( beverage ) colombiana , sugarcane juice , aguapanela , aguardiente , [ chocolate ] and fresh fruit juice ( often made with water or milk ) . </s> <section_title_start> sports <section_title_end> </s> tejo ( sport ) is colombia 's national sport and is a team sport that involves launching projectile to hit a target . but of all sport in colombia , association football is the most popular . colombia national football team wa the champion of the 2001 copa amrica , in which they set a new record of being undefeated , conceding no goal and winning each match . colombia ha been awarded `` fifa world ranking # best mover of the year `` twice . </s> colombia is a hub for inline speed skating . the national team is a perennial powerhouse at the world roller speed skating championship . colombia ha traditionally been very good in cycle sport and a large number of colombian cyclist have triumphed in major competition of cycling . </s> baseball is popular in city like cartagena , colombia and barranquilla . of those city have come good player like : orlando cabrera , dgar rentera , who wa champion of the world series in 1997 world series and 2010 world series and others who have played in major league baseball . colombia wa baseball world cup in 1947 and 1965. </s> boxing is one of the sport that ha produced more world champion for colombia . </s> motorsports also occupies an important place in the sporting preference of colombian ; juan pablo montoya is a race car driver known for winning 7 formula one event . colombia also ha excelled in sport such a uci bmx world championship , judo , shooting sport , taekwondo , wrestling , [ diving ] and sport of athletics , also ha a long tradition in olympic weightlifting and bowling . </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> the overall life expectancy in colombia at birth is 74.8 year ( 71.2 year for male and 78.4 year for female ) . healthcare reform have led to massive improvement in the healthcare system of the country , with health standard in colombia improving very much since the 1980s . although this new system ha widened population coverage by the social and health security system from 21 % ( pre-1993 ) to 96 % in 2012 , health equity persist . </s> through medical tourism , many people from over the world travel from their place of residence to other country in search of medical treatment and the attraction in the country visited . colombia is projected a one of latin america 's main destination in term of health tourism due to the quality of it [ care professional ] s , a good number of institution devoted to health , and an immense inventory of natural and architectural site . city such a bogot , cali , medelln and bucaramanga are the most visited in cardiology procedure , neurology , dental treatment , stem cell therapy , otorhinolaryngology , ophthalmology and joint replacement because of the quality of medical treatment . </s> a study conducted by amrica economa magazine ranked 21 colombian health facility among the top 44 in latin america , amounting to 48 percent of the total . a cancer research and treatment centre wa declared a a project of national strategic interest . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> the educational experience of many colombian child begin with attendance at a preschool academy until age five ( educacin preescolar ) . basic education ( educacin bsica ) is compulsory by law . it ha two stage : primary basic education ( educacin bsica primaria ) which go from first to fifth grade child from six to ten year old , and secondary basic education ( educacin bsica secundaria ) , which go from sixth to ninth grade . basic education is followed by middle vocational education ( educacin medium vocacional ) that comprises the tenth and eleventh grade . it may have different vocational training modality or specialty ( academic , technical , business , and so on . ) according to the curriculum adopted by each school . </s> after the successful completion of all the basic and middle education year , a [ diploma ] is awarded . the high-school graduate is known a a bachiller , because secondary basic school and middle education are traditionally considered together a a unit called bachillerato ( sixth to eleventh grade ) . student in their final year of middle education take the icfes examination ( now renamed saber 11 ) to gain access to higher education ( educacin superior ) . this higher education includes undergraduate professional study , technical , technological and intermediate professional education , and post-graduate study . technical professional institution of higher education are also opened to student holder of a qualification in art and business . this qualification is usually awarded by the national service of learning ( colombia ) after a two year curriculum . </s> bachilleres ( high-school graduate ) may enter into a professional undergraduate career program offered by a university ; these program last up to five year ( or le for technical , technological and intermediate professional education , and post-graduate study ) , even a much to six to seven year for some career , such a medicine . in colombia , there is not an institution such a college ; student go directly into a career program at a university or any other educational institution to obtain a professional , technical or technological title . once graduated from the university , people are granted a ( professional , technical or technological ) diploma and licensed ( if required ) to practice the career they have chosen . for some professional career program , student are required to take the saber-pro test , in their final year of undergraduate academic education . </s> public spending on education a a proportion of gross domestic product in 2015 wa 4.49 % . this represented 15.05 % of total government expenditure . the gross enrolment ratio stood at 113.56 % and 98.09 % respectively . school-life expectancy wa 14.42 year . a total of 94.58 % of the population aged 15 and older were recorded a literate , including 98.66 % of those aged 1524 . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * index of colombia-related article </s> * outline of colombia </s> <section_title_start> note <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> </s> * national park of colombia </s> * </s> category : colombia </s> category : andean community </s> category : country in south america </s> category : constitutional republic </s> category : former spanish colony </s> category : member state of the united nation </s> category : republic </s> category : spanish-speaking country and territory </s> category : state and territory established in 1810 </s> category : transcontinental country <article_end> <article_start> </s> turkey ( trkiye ) , officially the republic of turkey ( trkiye cumhuriyeti links=no ) , is a list of transcontinental country straddling southeastern europe and western asia . it is bordered on it northwest by greece and bulgaria ; north by the black sea ; northeast by georgia ( country ) ; east by armenia , azerbaijan , and iran ; southeast by iraq ; south by syria and the mediterranean sea ; and west by the aegean sea . istanbul , which straddle europe and asia , is the country 's largest city , while ankara is the capital . approximately 70 to 80 percent of the country 's citizen are ethnic turkish people , while the largest minority are kurd at 20 percent . </s> one of the world 's earliest permanently settled region , present-day turkey wa home to important neolithic site , and wa inhabited by various civilisation . hellenization started in the area during the era of alexander the great and continued into the byzantine era . the seljuk empire began migrating in the 11th century , and the sultanate of rum ruled anatolia until the mongol invasion of anatolia in 1243 , when it
