popular music . the root of traditional music in turkey span across century to a time when the seljuk turk migrated to anatolia and persia in the 11th century and contains element of both turkic and pre-turkic influence . much of it modern popular music can trace it root to the emergence in the early 1930s drive for westernization . </s> with the assimilation of immigrant from various region the diversity of musical genre and musical instrumentation also expanded . turkey ha also seen documented folk music and recorded popular music produced in the ethnic style of music of greece , music of armenia , music of albania , music of poland and jewish community , among others . </s> many turkish city and town have vibrant local music scene which , in turn , support a number of regional musical style . despite this however , western music style like pop music and kanto ( music ) lost popularity to arabesque in the late 1970s and 1980s . it became popular again by the beginning of the 1990s , a a result of an opening economy and society . with the support of sezen aksu , the resurging popularity of pop music gave rise to several international turkish pop star such a tarkan ( singer ) and sertab erener . the late 1990s also saw an emergence of underground music producing alternative turkish rock music , electronica , turkish hip hop hip-hop , hip hop music and dance music in opposition to the mainstream corporate pop music and arabesque music genre , which many believe have become too commercial . internationally acclaimed turkish jazz and blue musician and composer include ahmet ertegun ( founder and president of atlantic record ) , nkhet ruacan and kerem grsev . </s> the turkish five is a name used by some author to identify the five pioneer of western classical music in turkey , namely ahmed adnan saygun , ulvi cemal erkin , cemal reit rey , hasan ferit alnar and necil kazm ak . internationally acclaimed turkish musician of western classical music include pianist dil biret , verda erman , glsin onay , the pekinel sister ( gher and sher pekinel ) , ayegl sarca and fazl say ; violinist ayla erduran and suna kan ; opera singer semiha berksoy , leyla gencer and gne grle ; and conductor emre arac , grer aykal , erol erdin , rengim gkmen and hikmet imek . </s> turkish dance is diverse . hora ( dance ) is performed in east thrace ; zeybek dance in the aegean region , marmara region and central anatolia region east-central anatolia region ; teke in the mediterranean region ; kak oyunlar and karlama in central anatolia region west-central anatolia , black sea region , marmara region and mediterranean region ; horon in the black sea region ; halay in eastern anatolia region and the central anatolia region ; and bar ( dance ) and lezginka in the eastern anatolia region . </s> <section_title_start> architecture <section_title_end> </s> the seljuk architecture combined the element and characteristic of the architecture of central asia with those of persian architecture , arab architecture , armenian architecture and byzantine architecture architecture . the transition from seljuk architecture to ottoman architecture is most visible in bursa , which wa the capital of the ottoman empire between 1335 and 1413 . following the fall of constantinople ottoman conquest of constantinople ( istanbul ) in 1453 , ottoman architecture wa significantly influenced by byzantine architecture . topkap palace in istanbul is one of the most famous example of classical ottoman architecture and wa the primary residence of the ottoman sultan for approximately 400 year . mimar sinan ( c.14891588 ) wa the most important architect of the classical period in ottoman architecture . he wa the chief architect of at least 374 building which were constructed in various eyalet of the ottoman empire in the 16th century . </s> since the 18th century , turkish architecture ha been increasingly influenced by european style , and this can be particularly seen in the tanzimat era building of istanbul like the dolmabahe palace , raan palace , feriye saraylar , beylerbeyi palace , kksu palace , ihlamur palace and yldz palace palace , which were all designed by member of the balyan family of ottoman armenian court architect . the ottoman era yal waterfront house ( yal ) on the bosphorus also reflect the fusion between classical ottoman and european architectural style during the aforementioned period . </s> the first national architectural movement in the early 20th century sought to create a new architecture , which wa based on motif from seljuk and ottoman architecture . the leading architect of this movement were vedat tek ( 18731942 ) , mimar kemaleddin bey ( 18701927 ) , arif hikmet koyunolu ( 18881982 ) and giulio mongeri ( 18731953 ) . building from this era are the istanbul main post office in istanbul ( 19051909 ) , tayyare apartment ( 19191922 ) , istanbul 4th vakf han ( 19111926 ) , state art and sculpture museum ( 19271930 ) , ethnography museum of ankara ( 19251928 ) , the first ziraat bank headquarters in ankara ( 19251929 ) , the first trkiye bankas headquarters in ankara ( 19261929 ) , bebek , istanbul mosque , and kamer hatun mosque . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> turkish cuisine is largely the heritage of ottoman cuisine . in the early year of the republic , a few study were published about regional anatolian dish but cuisine did not feature heavily in turkish folkloric study until the 1980s , when the fledgling tourism industry encouraged the turkish state to sponsor two food symposium . the paper submitted at the symposium presented the history of turkish cuisine on a `` historical continuum `` that dated back to turkic origin in central asia and continued through the seljuk and ottoman period . </s> many of the paper presented at these first two symposium were unreferenced . prior to the symposium , the study of turkish culinary culture wa first popularised by the publication of sheyl nver 's fifty dish in turkish history in 1948 . this book wa based on recipe found in an 18th century ottoman manuscript . his second book wa about palace cuisine during the reign of mehmet ii . following the publication of nver 's book subsequent study were published , including a 1978 study by a historian named bahaettin gel about the central asian cuisine origin of turkish cuisine . </s> ottoman cuisine contains element of turkish cuisine , byzantine cuisine , balkan cuisine , armenian cuisine , kurdish cuisine , arab cuisine and persian cuisine cuisine . the country 's position between europe , asia , and the mediterranean sea helped the turk in gaining complete control of the major trade route , and an ideal landscape and climate allowed plant and animal to flourish . turkish cuisine wa well established by the mid-1400s , the beginning of the ottoman empire 's six hundred-year reign . yogurt salad , fish in olive oil , sharbat and dolma became turkish staple . the empire , eventually spanning from austria and ukraine to arabia and north africa , used it land and water route to import exotic ingredient from all over the world . by the end of the 16th century , the ottoman court housed over 1,400 live-in cook and passed law regulating the freshness of food . since the fall of the empire in world war i ( 19141918 ) and the establishment of the turkish republic in 1923 , foreign food such a french hollandaise sauce and western fast food have made their way into the modern turkish diet . </s> <section_title_start> sports <section_title_end> </s> the most popular sport in turkey is association football . galatasaray s.k . ( football ) won the 2000 uefa cup final and 2000 uefa super cup in 2000 . the turkish national football team ha won the bronze medal at the 2002 fifa world cup , the 2003 fifa confederation cup and uefa euro 2008. </s> other mainstream sport such a basketball and volleyball are also popular . the turkey national basketball team men 's national basketball team won the silver medal at the 2010 fiba world championship and at the eurobasket 2001 , which were both hosted by turkey ; and is one of the most successful at the basketball at the mediterranean game . turkish basketball club fenerbahe men 's basketball played the final of the euroleague in three consecutive season ( 201516 euroleague , 201617 euroleague and 201718 euroleague ) , becoming the european champion in 2017 and runner-up in 2016 and 2018 . another turkish basketball club , anadolu efes s.k . won the 199596 fiba kora cup 199596 fiba kora cup , were the runner-up of the 201819 euroleague and the 199293 fiba european cup 199293 fiba saporta cup , and finished third at the 19992000 fiba euroleague 19992000 euroleague and the 200001 fiba suproleague 200001 suproleague . beikta men 's basketball team won the 201112 fiba eurochallenge 201112 eurochallenge , and galatasaray s.k . ( men 's basketball ) won the 201516 eurocup basketball 201516 eurocup . the final of the 201314 euroleague woman basketball championship wa played between two turkish team , galatasaray s.k . ( woman 's basketball ) and fenerbahe woman 's basketball , and won by galatasaray . the turkey woman 's national basketball team woman 's national basketball team won the silver medal at the eurobasket woman 2011 and the bronze medal at the eurobasket woman 2013 . like the men 's team , the woman 's basketball team is one of the most successful at the basketball at the mediterranean game . </s> the turkey woman 's national volleyball team woman 's national volleyball team won the gold medal at the 2015 european game , the silver medal at the 2003 woman 's european volleyball championship , the bronze medal at the 2011 woman 's european volleyball championship , and the bronze medal at the 2012 fivb world grand prix . they also won multiple medal over multiple decade at the volleyball at the mediterranean game . woman 's volleyball club , namely fenerbahe woman 's volleyball , eczacba istanbul and vakfbank spor kulb , have won numerous european championship title and medal . fenerbahe woman 's volleyball won the 2010 fivb woman 's club world championship and the cev woman 's champion league 2012 cev woman 's champion league . representing european volleyball confederation a the winner of the 201213 cev woman 's champion league , vakfbank also became the world champion by winning the 2013 fivb volleyball woman 's club world championship . recently vakfbank ha won the 2017 fivb volleyball woman 's club world championship and the 201718 cev woman 's champion league for the fourth time in their history . </s> the traditional national sport of turkey ha been oil wrestling ( olive oil wrestling ) since ottoman time . edirne province ha hosted the annual krkpnar oil wrestling tournament since 1361 , making it the oldest continuously held sporting competition in the world . in the 19th and early 20th century , ottoman turkish oil wrestling champion such a yusuf smail , nurullah hasan and kzlckl mahmut acquired international fame in europe and north america by winning world heavyweight wrestling championship title . international wrestling style governed by international federation of associated wrestling style such a freestyle wrestling and greco-roman wrestling are also popular , with many european , world and olympic championship title won by turkish wrestler both individually and a a national team . renowned turkish freestyle and greco-roman wrestler who won international competition include yaar dou , celal atik , mahmut atalay , hamza yerlikaya , rza kayaalp and taha akgl . </s> <section_title_start> media and cinema <section_title_end> </s> hundred of television channel , thousand of local and national radio station , several dozen newspaper , a productive and profitable cinema of turkey and a rapid growth of broadband internet use constitute a vibrant medium industry in turkey . the majority of the tv audience are shared among public broadcaster turkish radio and television corporation and the network-style channel such a kanal d , show tv , atv ( turkey ) and star tv ( turkey ) . the broadcast medium have a very high penetration a satellite dish and cable television system are widely available . the rtk radio and television supreme council ( rtk ) is the government body overseeing the broadcast medium . by circulation , the list of newspaper in turkey are posta ( newspaper ) , hrriyet , szc , sabah ( newspaper ) and habertrk . </s> turkish television drama are increasingly becoming popular beyond turkey 's border and are among the country 's most vital export , both in term of profit and public relation . after sweeping the middle east 's television market over the past decade , turkish show have aired in more than a dozen south america and central american country in 2016 . turkey is today the world 's second largest exporter of television series . </s> yeilam is the sobriquet that refers to the turkish film art and industry . the first movie exhibited in the ottoman empire wa the lumiere brother ' 1895 film , l'arrive d'un train en gare de la ciotat , which wa shown in istanbul in 1896 . the first turkish-made film wa a documentary entitled ayastefanos'taki ru abidesinin ykl ( demolition of the russian monument at yeilky ) , directed by fuat uzknay and completed in 1914 . the first narrative film , sedat simavi 's the spy , wa released in 1917 . turkey 's first sound film wa shown in 1931 . turkish director like nuri bilge ceylan , ylmaz gney and ferzan zpetek won numerous international award such a the palme d'or and golden bear . </s> despite legal provision , medium freedom in turkey ha steadily deteriorated from 2010 onwards , with a precipitous decline following the failed 2016 turkish coup d'tat attempt on 15 july 2016 . a of december 2016 , at least 81 list of arrested journalist in turkey in turkey and more than 100 news outlet were closed . freedom house list turkey 's medium freedom in turkey a freedom of the press ( report ) . the medium crackdown also extend to internet censorship with 2017 block of wikipedia in turkey between 29 april 2017 and 15 january 2020. </s> <section_title_start> see also turkish-speaking country and territory </s> category : country in europe </s> category : transcontinental country </s> category : kurdish-speaking country and territory </s> category : azerbaijani-speaking country and territory <article_end> <article_start> </s> finland ( suomi ; finland , ) , officially the republic of finland ( suomen tasavalta , republiken finland ) , is a nordic country located in northern europe . finland share land border with sweden to the west , russia to the east , and norway to the north and is defined by the gulf of bothnia to the west and the gulf of finland to the south that are part of the baltic sea . </s> finland ha a population of approximately 5.5 million , making it the list of european country by population 25th-most populous country in europe . the main language is finnish language , a finnic language of the uralic language language family . swedish language is the second finland swedish , and is mainly spoken in certain coastal area of the country and on land island . finland is a parliamentary republic consisting of 19 region of finland and 310 municipality of finland . the climate varies significantly relative to latitude , from southern finland 's [ continental climate ] to the boreal climate of the north . finland is primarily a boreal forest biome , with more than 180,000 recorded list of lake of finland , leading to the denomination `` the land of a thousand lake `` . with an area of , finland is the area and population of european country eighth-largest country in europe , and the most list of country and territory by population density country in the european union . helsinki , the capital of finland , is the largest metropolitan area with over 1.5 million people , which produce a third of the country 's gross domestic product . tampere and turku are the next largest urban area . </s> finland wa inhabited around 9000 ; bc after last glacial period . the stone age introduced several different ceramic style and culture . the bronze age and iron age were characterised by extensive contact with other culture in fennoscandia and the baltic region . from the late 13th century , finland gradually became an integral part of sweden a a consequence of the northern crusade , the legacy of which is reflected in the prevalence of the swedish language and it official status . in 1809 , a a result of the finnish war , finland wa annexed by the russian empire a the autonomous grand duchy of finland , during which golden age of finnish art and the idea of independence of finland began to take hold . in 1906 , finland became the first european state to universal suffrage # date by country , and the first in the world to give all adult citizen the right to run for public office . nicholas ii of russia , the last tsar of russian empire , tried to russification of finland and also terminate it political autonomy , but after the 1917 russian revolution , finland finnish declaration of independence . in 1918 , the fledgling state wa divided by the finnish civil war . during world war ii , finland fought the soviet union in the winter war and the continuation war , and nazi germany in the lapland war . after the war , finland lost part of it territory , but maintained it independence . </s> finland largely remained an agriculture country until the 1950s . after world war ii , the country rapidly industrialised and developed an advanced economy , while building an extensive welfare state based on the nordic model , resulting in widespread prosperity and a high list of country by gdp ( nominal ) per caput . finland joined the united nation in 1955 and adopted an official policy of neutrality . finland joined the oecd in 1969 , the partnership for peace in 1994 , the european union in 1995 , the euro-atlantic partnership council in 1997 , and the eurozone at it inception in 1999. </s> finland is a top performer in numerous international ranking of finland , including education , economic competitiveness , civil liberty , quality of life and human development . in 2015 , finland wa ranked first in the world human capital and the press freedom index and a the most stable country in the world during 20112016 in the fragile state index , and second in the global gender gap report . it also ranked first on the world happiness report report for 2018 , 2019 and 2020. </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> finland <section_title_end> </s> the earliest written appearance of the name finland is thought to be on three runestones . two were found in the swedish province of uppland and have the inscription finlonti ( runestone u 582 ) . the third wa found in gotland . it ha the inscription finlandi ( runestone g 319 ) and date back to the 13th century . the name can be assumed to be related to the tribe name finnish tribe , which is mentioned at first known time ad 98 ( disputed meaning ) . </s> <section_title_start> suomi <section_title_end> </s> the name suomi ( ) ha uncertain origin , but a common etymology with saame ( sami people , a finno-ugric people in lapland ( finland ) ) and tavastia ( historical province ) ( a province in the inland ) ha been suggested ( proto-finnic wikt : reconstruction : proto-finnic/hm * hm from older * m , possibly loaned into proto-saami a wikt : reconstruction : proto-samic/sm * sm ) , whose source could be the proto-baltic word wikt : reconstruction : proto-balto-slavic/em * em , meaning ' ( low ) land ' . according to the hypothesis , * sm or * m directly wa loaned back into baltic a * sma- ( compare latvian sm 'finn , saaremaa ' ) , from which northern finnic reborrowed it ( perhaps via a germanic intermediate * sma- ) a * sma- * sme- 'finland ' . in addition to the close relative of finnish ( the finnic language ) , this name is also used in the baltic language latvian language ( som , somija ) and lithuanian language ( suomi , suomija ) , although these are evidently later borrowing . an alternative hypothesis by petri kallio suggests the proto-indo-european word wikt : reconstruction : proto-indo-european/m * ( d ) m-on- 'human ' ( cf . gothic guma , latin homo ) , being borrowed into uralic a * oma . </s> earlier theory suggested derivation from suomaa ( fen land ) or suoniemi ( fen cape ) , but these are now considered outdated . </s> it ha been suggested that the finnish word suomi is first attested the royal frankish annals annal for 811 , which mention a person called suomi among the danish delegation at a peace treaty with the frank . if so , it is also the earliest evidence for the change from the proto-finnic monophthong to the finnish diphthong . however , some historical linguist view this interpretation of the name a unlikely , supposing another etymology or that the spelling originated a a scribal error ( in which case the sound-change could have happened much later ) . </s> <section_title_start> concept <section_title_end> </s> in the earliest historical source , from the 12th and 13th century , the term finland refers to the coastal region around turku from perni to uusikaupunki . this region later became known a southwest finland in distinction from the country name finland . finland became a common name for the whole country in a centuries-long process that started when the catholic church established a missionary diocese in nousiainen in the northern part of the province of suomi possibly sometime in the 12th century . </s> the devastation of finland during the great northern war ( 17141721 ) and during the russo-swedish war ( 17411743 ) caused sweden to begin carrying out major effort to defend it eastern half from russia . these 18th-century experience created a sense of a shared destiny that when put in conjunction with the unique finnish language , led to the adoption of an expanded concept of finland . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> prehistory <section_title_end> </s> if the archaeology find from wolf cave are the result of neanderthal neanderthal ' activity , the first people inhabited finland approximately 120,000130,000 year ago . the area that is now finland wa settled in , at the latest , around 8,500 bc during the stone age towards the end of the last glacial period . the artifact ( archaeology ) the first settler left behind present characteristic that are shared with those found in estonia , russia , and norway . the earliest people were [ using stone tool . </s> the first pottery appeared in 5200 ; bc , when the comb ceramic culture wa introduced . the arrival of the corded ware culture in southern coastal finland between 3000 and 2500 bc may have coincided with the start of agriculture . even with the introduction of agriculture , hunting and fishing continued to be important part of the subsistence economy . </s> in the bronze age permanent all-year-round cultivation and animal husbandry spread , but the cold climate phase slowed the change . culture in finland shared common feature in pottery and also ax had similarity but local feature existed . seima-turbino phenomenon seima-turbino-phenomenon brought first bronze artifact to the region and possibly also the finno-ugric language finno-ugric-languages . commercial contact that had so far mostly been to estonia started to extend to scandinavia . domestic manufacture of bronze artifact started 1300 bc with maaninka-type bronze ax . bronze wa imported from volga river region and from southern scandinavia . </s> in the iron age population grew especially in hme and savo region . finland proper wa the most densely populated area . cultural contact to the baltic and scandinavia became more frequent . commercial contact in the baltic sea region grew and extended during the 8th and 9th century . </s> main export from finland were fur , slave , castoreum , and falcon to european court . import included silk and other fabric , jewelry , ulfberht sword , and , in lesser extent , glass . production of iron started approximately in 500 bc . </s> at the end of the 9th century , indigenous artifact culture , especially woman 's jewelry and weapon , had more common local feature than ever before . this ha been interpreted to be expressing common finnish identity which wa born from an image of common origin . </s> an early form of finnic language spread to the baltic sea region approximately 1900 bc with the seima-turbino phenomenon seima-turbino-phenomenon . common finnic language wa spoken around gulf of finland 2000 year ago . the dialect from which the modern-day finnish language wa developed came into existence during the iron age . although distantly related , the sami people retained the hunter-gatherer lifestyle longer than the finn . the sami cultural identity and the sami language have survived in lapland , the northernmost province , but the sami have been displaced or assimilated elsewhere . </s> the 12th and 13th century were a violent time in the northern baltic sea . the livonian crusade wa ongoing and the finnish tribe such a the tavastians and karelia ( historical province of finland ) were in early finnish war with republic of novgorod and with each other . also , during the 12th and 13th century several crusade from the catholic realm of the baltic sea area were made against the finnish tribe . according to historical source , dane waged at least three crusade to finland , in 1187 or slightly earlier , in 1191 and in 1202 , and swede , possibly the so-called second swedish crusade , in 1249 against tavastians and the third swedish crusade in 1293 against the karelian . the so-called first swedish crusade , possibly in 1155 , is most likely an unreal event . also , it is possible that german made violent conversion of finnish pagan in the 13th century . according to a papal letter from 1241 , the king of norway wa also fighting against `` nearby pagan `` at that time . </s> <section_title_start> swedish era <section_title_end> </s> a a result of the crusade and the colonisation of some finnish coastal area with christian swedish-speaking population of finland during the middle age , including the old capital turku , finland gradually became part of the kingdom of sweden and the sphere of influence of the catholic church . due to the swedish conquest , the finnish upper class lost it position and land to the new swedish and german nobility and to the catholic church . in sweden even in the 17th and 18th century , it wa clear that finland wa a conquered country and it inhabitant could be treated arbitrarily . swedish king visited finland rarely and in swedish contemporary text finn were portrayed to be primitive and their language inferior . </s> finland swedish became the dominant language of the nobility , administration , and education ; finnish language wa chiefly a language for the peasantry , clergy , and local court in predominantly finnish-speaking area . during the protestant reformation , the finn gradually converted to lutheranism . </s> in the 16th century , mikael agricola published the first written work in finnish , and finland 's current capital city , helsinki , wa founded by gustav i of sweden . the first university in finland , the royal academy of turku , wa established in 1640 . the finn reaped a reputation in the thirty year ' war ( 16181648 ) a a well-trained cavalryman called `` hakkapeliitta `` , that division excelled in sudden and savage attack , raid ( military ) and reconnaissance , which gustavus adolphus of sweden took advantage of in his significant battle , like in the battle of breitenfeld ( 1631 ) ( 1631 ) and the battle of rain ( 1632 ) . finland suffered a severe great famine of finland ( 16951697 ) famine in 16961697 , during which about one third of the finnish population died , and a the plague during the great northern war . </s> in the 18th century , war between sweden and russia twice led to the occupation of finland by russian force , time known to the finn a the greater wrath ( 17141721 ) and the russo-swedish war ( 17411743 ) ( 17421743 ) . it is estimated that almost an entire generation of young men wa lost during the great wrath , due mainly to the destruction of home and farm , and to the burning of helsinki . by this time finland wa the predominant term for the whole area from the gulf of bothnia to the russian border . </s> two russo-swedish war in twenty-five year served a reminder to the finnish people of the precarious position between sweden and russia . an increasingly vocal elite in finland soon determined that finnish tie with sweden were becoming too costly , and following russo-swedish war ( 17881790 ) russo-swedish war ( 17881790 ) , the finnish elite 's desire to break with sweden only heightened . </s> even before the war there were conspiring politician , among them georg magnus sprengtporten col g. m. sprengtporten , who had supported gustav iii of sweden # coup d'tat gustav iii 's coup in 1772 . sprengporten fell out with the king and resigned his commission in 1777 . in the following decade he tried to secure russian support for an autonomous finland , and later became an adviser to catherine ii . in the spirit of the notion of adolf ivar arwidsson ( 17911858 ) , `` we are not swede , we do not want to become russian , let u therefore be finn `` , the finnish national identity started to become established . </s> notwithstanding the effort of finland 's elite and nobility to break tie with sweden , there wa no genuine independence movement in finland until the early 20th century . a a matter of fact , at this time the finnish peasantry wa outraged by the action of their elite and almost exclusively supported gustav 's action against the conspirator . ( the high court of turku condemned sprengtporten a a traitor c . 1793 . ) the swedish era ended in the finnish war in 1809. </s> <section_title_start> russian empire era <section_title_end> </s> on 29 march 1809 , having been taken over by the army of alexander i of russia in the finnish war , finland became an autonomous grand duchy of finland in the russian empire with the recognition given at diet of porvoo held in porvoo , until the end of 1917 . in 1811 , alexander i incorporated the russian vyborg governorate into the grand duchy of finland . in 1854 , finland became involved in russia 's involvement in the crimean war , when the british and french navy bombed the finnish coast and land during the so-called land war . during the russian era , the finnish language began to gain recognition . from the 1860s onwards , a strong finnish ethnic nationalism known a the fennoman movement grew , and one of it most prominent leading figure of the movement wa the philosopher j. v. snellman , who wa strictly inclined to hegelianism hegel 's idealism , and who pushed for the stabilization of the status of the finnish language and it own currency , the finnish markka , in the grand duchy of finland . milestone included the publication of what would become finland 's national epic the kalevala in 1835 , and the finnish language 's achieving equal legal status with swedish in 1892. </s> the finnish famine of 18661868 killed approximately 15 % of the population , making it one of the worst famine in european history . the famine led the russian empire to ease financial regulation , and investment rose in following decade . economic and political development wa rapid . the gross domestic product ( gdp ) per caput wa still half of that of the united state and a third of that of britain . </s> in 1906 , universal suffrage wa adopted in the grand duchy of finland . however , the relationship between the grand duchy and the russian empire soured when the russian government made move to restrict finnish autonomous area . for example , the universal suffrage wa , in practice , virtually meaningless , since the tsar did not have to approve any of the law adopted by the finnish parliament . desire for independence gained ground , first among radical liberal and socialist . the case is known a the `` russification of finland `` , driven by the last tsar of russian empire , nicholas ii of russia . </s> <section_title_start> civil war and early independence <section_title_end> </s> after the 1917 february revolution , the position of finland a part of the russian empire wa questioned , mainly by russian social democratic labour party . since the head of state wa the tsar of russia , it wa not clear who the chief executive of finland wa after the revolution . the parliament , controlled by social democrat , passed the so-called power act to give the highest authority to the parliament . this wa rejected by the russian provisional government which decided to dissolve the parliament . </s> new election were conducted , in which right-wing party won with a slim majority . some social democrat refused to accept the result and still claimed that the dissolution of the parliament ( and thus the ensuing election ) were extralegal . the two nearly equally powerful political bloc , the right-wing party and the social democratic party , were highly antagonized . </s> the october revolution in russia changed the geopolitical situation anew . suddenly , the right-wing party in finland started to reconsider their decision to block the transfer of highest executive power from the russian government to finland , a the bolshevik took power in russia . rather than acknowledge the authority of the independence of finland # power act of a few month earlier , the right-wing government , led by prime minister of finland p. e. svinhufvud , presented finnish declaration of independence on 4 december 1917 , which wa officially approved two day later by parliament of finland , on 6 december 1917 . russian soviet federative socialist republic ( rsfsr ) , led by vladimir lenin , recognized independence on 4 january 1918. </s> on 27 january 1918 , the official opening shot of the war were fired in two simultaneous event . the government started to disarm the russian force in ostrobothnia ( historical province ) , and the social democratic party of finland staged a coup . the latter gained control of southern finland and helsinki , but the white government continued in exile from vaasa . this sparked the brief but bitter finnish civil war . the white guard ( finland ) , who were supported by german empire , prevailed over the red guard ( finland ) , which were guided by kullervo manner 's desire to make young independent country a finnish socialist worker ' republic ( also known a `` red finland `` ) and thus part of rsfsr . after the war , ten of thousand of red and suspected sympathizer were interned in camp , where thousand died by execution or from malnutrition and disease . deep social and political enmity wa sown between the red and white and would last until the winter war and beyond ; still , even nowadays , the civil war is an inherently sensitive , emotional topic . the civil war and the 19181920 activist expedition called `` heimosodat `` into soviet russia strained eastern relation . at that time , the idea of greater finland wa also properly on display for the first time . </s> after kingdom of finland ( 1918 ) , when an attempt to make prince frederick charles of hesse a king for finland proved to be a poor success , finland became a presidential system republic , with k. j. sthlberg elected a it first president in 1919 . a a liberal nationalist and with a legal background , sthlberg anchored the state in liberal democracy , guarded the fragile germ of the rule of law , and embarked on internal reform . finland wa also one of the first european country to strongly aim for woman right , which is why miina sillanp served on tanner cabinet vin tanner 's cabinet a the first female minister in finnish history in 19261927 . the finnishrussian border wa determined by the treaty of tartu ( russianfinnish ) in 1920 , largely following the historic border but granting pechengsky district ( petsamo ) and it barents sea harbour to finland . finnish democracy did not see any soviet coup attempt and survived the anti-communist lapua movement . the relationship between finland and the soviet union wa tense . army officer were trained in france , and relation with western europe and sweden were strengthened . </s> in 1917 , the population wa 3 million . credit-based land reform wa enacted after the civil war , increasing the proportion of capital-owning population . about 70 % of worker were occupied in agriculture and 10 % in industry . the largest export market were the united kingdom and germany . </s> <section_title_start> world war ii and after <section_title_end> </s> finland fought the soviet union in the winter war of 19391940 after the soviet union attacked finland and in the continuation war of 19411944 , following operation barbarossa , when finland aligned with germany following germany 's invasion of the soviet union . for 872 day , the german army , aided indirectly by finnish force , siege of leningrad , the ussr 's second-largest city . after resisting a vyborgpetrozavodsk offensive in june/july 1944 led to a standstill , finland reached an armistice with the soviet union . this wa followed by the lapland war of 19441945 , when finland fought retreating german force in northern finland . perhaps the most famous war hero during the aforementioned war were simo hyh , aarne juutilainen , and lauri trni . </s> the treaty signed in 1947 and 1948 with the soviet union included finnish obligation , restraint , and reparationsas well a further finnish territorial concession in addition to those in the moscow peace treaty of 1940 . a a result of the two war , finland ceded pechengsky district , along with portion of finnish karelia and salla . this amounted to 10 % of it land area and 20 % of it industrial capacity , including the port of vyborg ( viipuri ) and the ice-free liinakhamari ( liinahamari ) . evacuation of finnish karelia almost the whole population , some 400,000 people , fled these area . the former finnish territory now constitutes part of russia 's republic of karelia , leningrad oblast , and murmansk oblast . finland wa never occupied by soviet force and it retained it independence , but at a loss of about 97,000 soldier . the finnish war reparation to the soviet union amounted to $ 300 million ( million in ) . </s> finland rejected marshall plan , in apparent finlandization . however , the united state provided secret development aid and helped the social democratic party , in hope of preserving finland 's independence . establishing trade with the western power , such a the united kingdom , and paying reparation to the soviet union produced a transformation of finland from a primarily agriculture economy to an industrialised one . valmet wa founded to create material for war reparation . after the reparation had been paid off , finland continued to trade with the soviet union in the framework of bilateral trade . </s> in 1950 , 46 % of finnish worker worked in agriculture and a third lived in urban area . the new job in manufacturing , service , and trade quickly attracted people to the town . the average number of birth per woman declined from a baby boom peak of 3.5 in 1947 to 1.5 in 1973 . when baby-boomers entered the workforce , the economy did not generate job quickly enough , and hundred of thousand emigrated to the more industrialized sweden , with emigration peaking in 1969 and 1970 . the 1952 summer olympics brought international visitor . finland took part in trade liberalization in the world bank , the international monetary fund and the general agreement on tariff and trade . </s> officially claiming to be neutral country , finland lay in the grey zone between the western world and the soviet union . the finno-soviet treaty of 1948 ( finno-soviet pact of friendship , cooperation and mutual assistance ) gave the soviet union some leverage in finnish domestic politics . this wa extensively exploited by president urho kekkonen against his opponent . he maintained an effective monopoly on soviet relation from 1956 on , which wa crucial for his continued popularity . in politics , there wa a tendency of avoiding any policy and statement that could be interpreted a anti-soviet . this phenomenon wa given the name `` finlandization `` by the west german press . during the cold war , finland also developed into one of the center of the cold war espionage east-west espionage , in which both the kgb and the cia played their part . the 1949 established finnish security intelligence service ( supo , suojelupoliisi ) , an operational security agency authority and a police unit under the ministry of the interior ( finland ) , whose core area of activity are counter-intelligence , counter-terrorism and national security , also participated in this activity in some place . </s> despite close relation with the soviet union , finland maintained a market economy . various industry benefited from bilateral trade with the soviet , which explains the widespread support that pro-soviet policy enjoyed among business interest in finland . economic growth wa rapid in the postwar era , and by 1975 finland 's gdp per caput wa the 15th-highest in the world . in the 1970s and '80s , finland built one of the most extensive welfare state in the world . finland negotiated with the european economic community ( eec , a predecessor of the european union ) a treaty that mostly abolished custom duty towards the eec starting from 1977 , although finland did not fully join . in 1981 , president urho kekkonen 's failing health forced him to retire after holding office for 25 year . </s> finland reacted cautiously to the collapse of the soviet union , but swiftly began increasing integration with the west . on 21 september 1990 , finland unilaterally declared the paris peace treaty obsolete , following the german reunification decision nine day earlier . </s> miscalculated macroeconomic decision , a finnish banking crisis of 1990s , the collapse of it largest trading partner ( the soviet union ) , and a global economic downturn caused a deep early 1990s depression in finland . the depression bottomed out in 1993 , and finland saw steady economic growth for more than ten year . like other nordic country , finland decentralised it economy since the late 1980s . financial and product market regulation were loosened . some state enterprise have been privatized and there have been some modest tax cut . finland joined the european union in 1995 , and the eurozone in 1999 . much of the late 1990s economic growth wa fueled by the success of the mobile phone manufacturer nokia , which held a unique position of representing 80 % of the market capitalization of the helsinki stock exchange . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> lying approximately between latitude 60th parallel north 60 and 70th parallel north 70 n , and longitude 20th meridian east 20 and 32nd meridian east 32 e , finland is one of the world 's northernmost country . of world capital , only reykjavk lie more to the north than helsinki . the distance from the southernmost point hanko , finland in uusimaa to the northernmost nuorgam in lapland is . </s> finland ha about 168,000 lake ( of area larger than ) and 179,000 island . it largest lake , saimaa , is the fourth largest in europe . the finnish lakeland is the area with the most lake in the country ; many of the major city in the area , most notably tampere , jyvskyl and kuopio , are located in the immediate vicinity of the large lake . the greatest concentration of island is found in the southwest , in the archipelago sea between continental finland and the main island of land . </s> much of the geography of finland is a result of the ice age . the glacier were thicker and lasted longer in fennoscandia compared with the rest of europe . their eroding effect have left the finnish landscape mostly flat with few hill and fewer mountain . it highest point , the halti at , is found in the extreme north of lapland at the border between finland and norway . the highest mountain whose peak is entirely in finland is ridnitohkka at 1,316 ; m ( 4,318 ; ft ) , directly adjacent to halti . </s> the retreating glacier have left the land with moraine deposit in formation of esker . these are ridge of stratified gravel and sand , running northwest to southeast , where the ancient edge of the glacier once lay . among the biggest of these are the three salpausselk ridge that run across southern finland . </s> having been compressed under the enormous weight of the glacier , terrain in finland is rising due to the post-glacial rebound . the effect is strongest around the gulf of bothnia , where land steadily rise about a year . a a result , the old sea bottom turn little by little into dry land : the surface area of the country is expanding by about annually . relatively speaking , finland is rising from the sea . </s> the landscape is covered mostly by coniferous taiga forest and fen , with little cultivated land . of the total area 10 % is lake , river and pond , and 78 % forest . the forest consists of pine , spruce , birch , and other specie . finland is the largest producer of wood in europe and among the largest in the world . the most common type of rock is granite . it is a ubiquitous part of the scenery , visible wherever there is no soil cover . moraine or till is the most common type of soil , covered by a thin layer of [ of biological origin . podzol ] profile development is seen in most forest soil except where drainage is poor . [ [ gleysols and peat bog occupy poorly drained area . </s> <section_title_start> biodiversity <section_title_end> </s> phytogeography , finland is shared between the arctic , central european , and northern european province of the circumboreal region within the boreal kingdom . according to the world wide fund for nature , the territory of finland can be subdivided into three ecoregions : the scandinavian and russian taiga , sarmatic mixed forest , and scandinavian montane birch forest and grassland . taiga cover most of finland from northern region of southern province to the north of lapland . on the southwestern coast , south of the helsinki-rauma , finland line , forest are characterized by mixed forest , that are more typical in the baltic region . in the extreme north of finland , near the tree line and arctic ocean , montane birch forest are common . finland had a 2018 forest landscape integrity index mean score of 5.08/10 , ranking it 109th globally out of 172 country . </s> similarly , finland ha a diverse and extensive range of fauna . there are at least sixty native mammalian specie , 248 breeding bird specie , over 70 fish specie , and 11 reptile and frog specie present today , many migrating from neighboring country thousand of year ago . </s> large and widely recognized wildlife mammal found in finland are the brown bear , gray wolf , wolverine , and moose . the brown bear , which is also nicknamed a the `` king of the forest `` by the finn , is the country 's official national animal , which also occur on the coat of arm of the satakunta region of finland is a crown-headed black bear carrying a sword , possibly referring to the regional capital city of pori , whose swedish name bjrneborg and the latin name arctopolis literally mean `` bear city `` or `` bear fortress `` . three of the more striking bird are the whooper swan , a large european swan and the national bird of finland ; the western capercaillie , a large , black-plumaged member of the grouse family ; and the eurasian eagle-owl . the latter is considered an indicator of old-growth forest connectivity , and ha been declining because of landscape fragmentation . the most common breeding bird are the willow warbler , common chaffinch , and redwing . of some seventy specie of freshwater fish , the northern pike , perch , and others are plentiful . atlantic salmon remains the favourite of fly fishing enthusiast . </s> the endangered saimaa ringed seal , one of only three lake seal specie in the world , exists only in the saimaa lake system of southeastern finland , down to only 390 seal today . it ha become the emblem of the finnish association for nature conservation . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> the main factor influencing finland 's climate is the country 's geographical position between the 60th and 70th northern parallel in the eurasian continent 's coastal zone . in the kppen climate classification , the whole of finland lie in the subarctic climate , characterized by warm summer and freezing winter . within the country , the temperateness varies considerably between the southern coastal region and the extreme north , showing characteristic of both a oceanic climate and a continental climate . finland is near enough to the atlantic ocean to be continuously warmed by the gulf stream . the gulf stream combine with the moderating effect of the baltic sea and numerous inland lake to explain the unusually warm climate compared with other region that share the same latitude , such a alaska , siberia , and southern greenland . </s> winter in southern finland ( when mean daily temperature remains below ) are usually about 100 day long , and in the inland the snow typically cover the land from about late november to april , and on the coastal area such a helsinki , snow often cover the land from late december to late march . even in the south , the harshest winter night can see the temperature fall to although on coastal area like helsinki , temperature below are rare . climatic summer ( when mean daily temperature remains above ) in southern finland last from about late may to mid-september , and in the inland , the warmest day of july can reach over . although most of finland lie on the taiga belt , the southernmost coastal region are sometimes classified a [ name= `` havas `` </s> in northern finland , particularly in lapland , the winter are long and cold , while the summer are relatively warm but short . the most severe winter day in lapland can see the temperature fall down to . the winter of the north last for about 200 day with permanent snow cover from about mid-october to early may . summer in the north are quite short , only two to three month , but can still see maximum daily temperature above during heat wave . no part of finland ha arctic tundra ] , but [ [ alpine tundra can be found at the fell lapland . </s> the finnish climate is suitable for cereal farming only in the southernmost region , while the northern region are suitable for animal husbandry . </s> a quarter of finland 's territory lie within the arctic circle and the midnight sun can be experienced for more day the farther north one travel . at finland 's northernmost point , the sun doe not set for 73 consecutive day during summer , and doe not rise at all for 51 day during winter . </s> <section_title_start> region <section_title_end> </s> finland consists of 19 region of finland , called maakunta in finnish and landskap in swedish . the region are governed by regional council which serve a forum of cooperation for the municipality of finland of a region . the main task of the region are regional planning and development of enterprise and education . in addition , the public health service are usually organized on the basis of region . currently , the only region where a popular election is held for the council is kainuu . other regional council are elected by municipal council , each municipality sending representative in proportion to it population . </s> in addition to inter-municipal cooperation , which is the responsibility of regional council , each region ha a state employment and economic development centre which is responsible for the local administration of labour , agriculture , fishery , forestry , and entrepreneurial affair . the finnish defence force regional office are responsible for the regional defence preparation and for the administration of conscription within the region . </s> region represent dialectal , cultural , and economic variation better than the former province of finland , which were purely administrative division of the central government . historically , region are division of [ province of finland ] , area which represent dialect and culture more accurately . </s> six regional state administrative agency of finland were created by the state of finland in 2010 , each of them responsible for one of the region called alue in finnish and region in swedish ; in addition , land wa designated a seventh region . these take over some of the task of the earlier province of finland ( lni/ln ) , which were abolished . </s> } </s> the region of eastern uusimaa eastern uusimaa ( it-uusimaa ) wa consolidated with uusimaa on 1 january 2011. </s> <section_title_start> administrative division <section_title_end> </s> the fundamental administrative division of the country are the municipality of finland , which may also call themselves town or city . they account for half of public spending . spending is financed by municipal income tax , state subsidy , and other revenue . , there are 310 municipality , and most have fewer than 6,000 resident . </s> in addition to municipality , two intermediate level are defined . municipality co-operate in seventy sub-regions of finland sub-regions and nineteen region of finland . these are governed by the member municipality and have only limited power . the autonomous province of land ha a permanent democratically elected regional council . sami people have a semi-autonomous sami native region ( finland ) in lapland for issue on language and culture . </s> in the following chart , the number of inhabitant includes those living in the entire municipality ( kunta/kommun ) , not just in the built-up area . the land area is given in km2 , and the density in inhabitant per km2 ( land area ) . the figure are a of . the capital region comprising helsinki , vantaa , espoo and kauniainen form a continuous conurbation of over 1.1 million people . however , common administration is limited to voluntary cooperation of all municipality , e.g . in helsinki metropolitan area council . </s> <section_title_start> politics <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> constitution <section_title_end> </s> the constitution of finland defines the political system ; finland is a parliamentary republic within the framework of a representative democracy . the prime minister of finland is the country 's most powerful person . the current version of the constitution wa enacted on 1 march 2000 , and wa amended on 1 march 2012 . citizen can run and vote in parliamentary , municipal , presidential and election in the european union . </s> <section_title_start> president <section_title_end> </s> the [ of state ] of finland is president of finland ( in finnish : suomen tasavallan presidentti ; in swedish : republiken finland president ) . finland ha had for most of it independence a semi-presidential system , but in the last few decade the power of the president have been diminished . in constitution amendment , which came into effect in 1991 or 1992 and also with a new drafted constitution of 2000 , amended in 2012 , the president 's position ha become primarily a ceremonial office . however , the president still lead the nation 's foreign politics together with the council of state and is the commander-in-chief of the defence force . the position still doe entail some power , including responsibility for foreign relation of finland ( excluding affair related to the european union ) in cooperation with the finnish government , being commander-in-chief , some decree and pardoning power , and some appointive power . direct , one- or two-stage election are used to elect the president for a term of six year and for a maximum of two consecutive 6-year term . the current president is sauli niinist ; he took office on 1 march 2012 . former president were kaarlo juho sthlberg k. j. sthlberg ( 19191925 ) , lauri kristian relander l. k. relander ( 19251931 ) , pehr evind svinhufvud p. e. svinhufvud ( 19311937 ) , kysti kallio ( 19371940 ) , risto ryti ( 19401944 ) , carl gustaf emil mannerheim c. g. e. mannerheim ( 19441946 ) , juho kusti paasikivi j. k. paasikivi ( 19461956 ) , urho kekkonen ( 19561982 ) , mauno koivisto ( 19821994 ) , martti ahtisaari ( 19942000 ) , and tarja halonen ( 20002012 ) . </s> the current president wa elected from the rank of the national coalition party for the first time since 1946 . the presidency between 1946 and the present wa instead held by a member of the social democratic party of finland or the centre party ( finland ) . </s> <section_title_start> parliament <section_title_end> </s> the 200-member unicameralism parliament of finland ( eduskunta , riksdag ) exercise supreme legislative authority in the country . it may alter the constitution and ordinary law , dismiss the cabinet , and override presidential veto . it act are not subject to judicial review ; the constitutionality of new law is assessed by the parliament 's parliament of finland # committee . the parliament is elected for a term of four year using the proportional d'hondt method within a number of multi-seat constituency through the open list # most open multi-member district . various parliament committee listen to expert and prepare legislation . </s> since universal suffrage wa introduced in 1906 , the parliament ha been dominated by the centre party ( finland ) ( former agrarian union ) , the national coalition party , and the social democratic party of finland . these party have enjoyed approximately equal support , and their combined vote ha totalled about 6580 % of all vote . their lowest common total of mp , 121 , wa reached in the 2011 election . for a few decade after 1944 , the communist party of finland were a strong fourth party . due to the electoral system of proportional representation , and the relative reluctance of voter to switch their support between party , the relative strength of the party have commonly varied only slightly from one election to another . however , there have been some long-term trend , such a the rise and fall of the communist during the cold war ; the steady decline into insignificance of the liberal ( finland ) and it predecessor from 1906 to 1980 ; and the rise of the green league since 1983. </s> the marin cabinet is the incumbent 76th government of finland . it wa formed following the collapse of the rinne cabinet and officially took office on 10 december 2019 . the cabinet consists of a coalition formed by the social democratic party of finland , the centre party ( finland ) , the green league , the left alliance ( finland ) , and the swedish people 's party of finland swedish people 's party . </s> <section_title_start> cabinet <section_title_end> </s> after parliamentary election , the party negotiate among themselves on forming a new cabinet ( the finnish government ) , which then ha to be approved by a simple majority vote in the parliament . the cabinet can be dismissed by a parliamentary vote of no confidence , although this rarely happens ( the last time in 1957 ) , a the party represented in the cabinet usually make up a majority in the parliament . </s> the cabinet exercise most executive power , and originates most of the bill that the parliament then debate and vote on . it is headed by the prime minister of finland , and consists of him or her , of other minister , and of the chancellor of justice # finland . the current prime minister is sanna marin ( social democratic party ) . each minister head his or her ministry , or , in some case , ha responsibility for a subset of a ministry 's policy . after the prime minister , the most powerful minister is the minister of finance ( finland ) . the incumbent minister of finance is matti vanhanen . </s> a no one party ever dominates the parliament , finnish cabinet are multi-party coalition . a a rule , the post of prime minister go to the leader of the biggest party and that of the minister of finance to the leader of the second biggest . </s> <section_title_start> law <section_title_end> </s> the judicial system of finland is a civil law ( legal system ) system divided between court with regular civil and criminal jurisdiction and administrative court with jurisdiction over litigation between individual and the public administration . finnish law is codified and based on judiciary of sweden and in a wider sense , civil law or roman law . the court system for civil and criminal jurisdiction consists of local court ( krjoikeus , tingsrtt ) , regional appellate court ( hovioikeus , hovrtt ) , and the judicial system of finland # supreme court ( korkein oikeus , hgsta domstolen ) . the administrative branch of justice consists of administrative court ( hallinto-oikeus , frvaltningsdomstol ) and the judicial system of finland # supreme administrative court ( korkein hallinto-oikeus , hgsta frvaltningsdomstolen ) . in addition to the regular court , there are a few special court in certain branch of administration . there is also a judicial system of finland # high court of impeachment for criminal charge against certain high-ranking officeholder . </s> around 92 % of resident have confidence in finland 's security institution . the overall crime in finland is not high in the eu context . some crime type are above average , notably the high [ rate for western europe . a day fine ] system is in effect and also applied to offense such a [ [ speeding . </s> finland ha successfully fought against government corruption , which wa more common in the 1970s and '80s . for instance , economic reform and eu membership introduced stricter requirement for open bidding and many public monopoly were abolished . today , finland ha a very low number of corruption charge ; transparency international rank finland a one of the least corrupt country in europe . </s> in 2008 , transparency international criticized the lack of transparency of the system of finnish political finance . according to group of state against corruption in 2007 , corruption should be taken into account in the finnish system of election fund better . 2007 campaign finance scandal of finland broke out in spring 2008 . nine minister of government submitted incomplete funding report and even more of the member of parliament . the law includes no punishment of false fund report of the elected politician . </s> <section_title_start> human right <section_title_end> </s> 6 in two sentence of the finnish constitution state : `` no one shall be placed in a different position on situation of sex , age , origin , language , religion , belief , opinion , state of health , disability or any other personal reason without an acceptable reason . `` </s> finland ha been ranked above average among the world 's country in democracy , press freedom , and [ development ( humanity ) human development ] . </s> amnesty international ha expressed concern regarding some issue in finland , such a alleged permitting of stopover of cia extraordinary rendition , the imprisonment of objector to military service , and societal discrimination against romani people and member of other ethnic and linguistic minority . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relation <section_title_end> </s> according to the 2012 constitution , the president ( currently sauli niinist ) lead foreign policy in cooperation with the government , except that the president ha no role in eu affair . </s> in 2008 , president martti ahtisaari wa awarded the nobel peace prize . finland wa considered a cooperative model state , and finland did not oppose proposal for a common eu defence policy . this wa reversed in the 2000s , when tarja halonen and erkki tuomioja made finland 's official policy to resist other eu member ' plan for common defence . </s> <section_title_start> social security <section_title_end> </s> finland ha one of the world 's most extensive welfare system , one that guarantee decent living condition for all resident : finn , and non-citizens . since the 1980s the social security ha been cut back , but still the system is one of the most comprehensive in the world . created almost entirely during the first three decade after world war ii , the social security system wa an outgrowth of the traditional nordic belief that the state wa not inherently hostile to the well-being of it citizen , but could intervene benevolently on their behalf . according to some social historian , the basis of this belief wa a relatively benign history that had allowed the gradual emergence of a free and independent peasantry in the nordic country and had curtailed the dominance of the nobility and the subsequent formation of a powerful right wing . finland 's history ha been harsher than the history of the other nordic country , but not harsh enough to bar the country from following their path of social development . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> the finnish defence force consist of a en cadre of professional soldier ( mainly officer and technical personnel ) , currently serving conscript , and a large reserve . the standard readiness strength is 34,700 people in uniform , of which 25 % are professional soldier . a universal male conscription is in place , under which all male finnish national above 18 year of age serve for 6 to 12 month of armed service or 12 month of civilian ( non-armed ) service . </s> voluntary post-conscription overseas peacekeeping service is popular , and troop serve around the world in un , nato , and eu mission . approximately 500 woman choose voluntary military service every year . woman are allowed to serve in all combat arm including front-line infantry and special force . </s> the army consists of a highly mobile field army backed up by local defence unit . the army defends the national territory and it military strategy employ the use of the heavily forested terrain and numerous lake to wear down an aggressor , instead of attempting to hold the attacking army on the frontier . </s> finnish defence expenditure per caput is one of the highest in the european union . the finnish military doctrine is based on the concept of total defence . the term total mean that all sector of the government and economy are involved in the defence planning . the armed force are under the command of the chief of defence ( finland ) ( currently general jarmo lindberg ) , who is directly subordinate to the president in matter related to military command . the branch of the military are the finnish army , the finnish navy , and the finnish air force . the finnish border guard is under the ministry of the interior but can be incorporated into the defence force when required for defence readiness . </s> even while finland ha n't joined the north atlantic treaty organization , the country ha joined the nato response force , the eu battlegroup , the nato partnership for peace and in 2014 signed a nato memorandum of understanding , thus forming a practical coalition . in 2015 , the finland-nato tie were strengthened with a host nation support agreement allowing assistance from nato troop in emergency situation . finland ha been an active participant in the afghanistan and kosovo . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> the economy of finland ha a per caput output equal to that of other european economy such a those of france , germany , belgium , or the uk . the largest sector of the economy is the service sector at 66 % of gdp , followed by manufacturing and refining at 31 % . primary sector of the economy represents 2.9 % . with respect to international trade , the key economic sector is manufacturing . the largest industry in 2007 were electronics ( 22 % ) ; machinery , vehicle , and other engineered metal product ( 21.1 % ) ; forest industry ( 13 % ) ; and chemical ( 11 % ) . the gross domestic product peaked in 2008. , the country 's economy is at the 2006 level . </s> finland ha significant timber , mineral ( iron , chromium , copper , nickel , and gold ) , and freshwater resource . forestry , paper factory , and the agriculture ( on which taxpayer spend around 3 billion annually ) are important for rural resident so any policy change affecting these sector are politically sensitive for politician dependent on rural vote . the greater helsinki area generates around one third of finland 's gdp . in a 2004 oecd comparison , high-technology manufacturing in finland ranked second largest after ireland . knowledge-intensive service have also resulted in the smallest and slow-growth sector especially agriculture and low-technology manufacturing being ranked the second largest after ireland . </s> finland 's climate and soil make growing crop a particular challenge . the country lie between the latitude 60n and 70n , and it ha severe winter and relatively short growing season that are sometimes interrupted by frost . however , because the gulf stream and the north atlantic drift current moderate the climate , finland contains half of the world 's arable land north of 60 north latitude . annual precipitation is usually sufficient , but it occurs almost exclusively during the winter month , making summer drought a constant threat . in response to the climate , farmer have relied on quick-ripening and frost-resistant variety of crop , and they have cultivated south-facing slope a well a richer bottomland to ensure production even in year with summer frost . most farmland wa originally either forest or swamp , and the soil ha usually required treatment with lime and year of cultivation to neutralize excess acid and to improve fertility . irrigation ha generally not been necessary , but drainage system are often needed to remove excess water . finland 's agriculture ha been efficient and productiveat least when compared with farming in other european country . </s> forest play a key role in the country 's economy , making it one of the world 's leading wood producer and providing raw material at competitive price for the crucial wood-processing industry . a in agriculture , the government ha long played a leading role in forestry , regulating tree cutting , sponsoring technical improvement , and establishing long-term plan to ensure that the country 's forest continue to supply the wood-processing industry . to maintain the country 's comparative advantage in forest product , finnish authority moved to raise lumber output toward the country 's ecological limit . in 1984 , the government published the forest 2000 plan , drawn up by the ministry of agriculture and forestry . the plan aimed at increasing forest harvest by about 3 % per year , while conserving forestland for recreation and other us . </s> private sector employee amount to 1.8 million , out of which around a third with tertiary education . the average cost of a private sector employee per hour wa 25.10 in 2004. , average purchasing power-adjusted income level are similar to those of italy , sweden , germany , and france . in 2006 , 62 % of the workforce worked for enterprise with le than 250 employee and they accounted for 49 % of total business turnover and had the strongest rate of growth . the female employment rate is high . gender segregation between male-dominated profession and female-dominated profession is higher than in the u . the proportion of part-time worker wa one of the lowest in oecd in 1999 . in 2013 , the 10 largest private sector employer in finland were itella , nokia , op financial group op-pohjola , i a/s , vr ( company ) , kesko , upm-kymmene , yit , metso , and nordea . </s> the unemployment rate wa 9.4 % in 2015 , having risen from 8.7 % in 2014 . youth unemployment rate rose from 16.5 % in 2007 to 20.5 % in 2014 . a fifth of resident are outside the job market at the age of 50 and le than a third are working at the age of 61 . in 2014 , nearly one million people were living with minimal wage or unemployed not enough to cover their cost of living . </s> , 2.4 million household reside in finland . the average size is 2.1 person ; 40 % of household consist of a single person , 32 % two person and 28 % three or more person . residential building total 1.2 million , and the average residential space is per person . the average residential property without land cost 1,187 per sq metre and residential land 8.60 per sq metre . 74 % of household had a car . there are 2.5 million car and 0.4 million other vehicle . </s> around 92 % have a mobile phone and 83.5 % ( 2009 ) list of country by number of internet user . the average total household consumption wa 20,000 , out of which housing consisted of about 5,500 , transport about 3,000 , food and beverage ( excluding alcoholic beverage ) at around 2,500 , and recreation and culture at around 2,000 . according to invest in finland , private consumption grew by 3 % in 2006 and consumer trend included durables , high-quality product , and spending on well-being . </s> in 2017 , finland 's gdp reached 224 billion . however , second quarter of 2018 saw a slow economic growth . unemployment rate fell to a near one-decade low in june , marking private consumption growth much higher . </s> finland ha the highest concentration of cooperative relative to it population . the largest retailer , which is also the largest private employer , s group s-group , and the largest bank , op-group , in the country are both cooperative . </s> <section_title_start> energy <section_title_end> </s> the free and largely privately owned financial and physical nordic energy market traded in nasdaq omx commodity europe and nord pool spot exchange , have provided competitive price compared with other eu country . , finland ha roughly the lowest industrial electricity price in the eu-15 ( equal to france ) . </s> in 2006 , the energy market wa around 90 terawatt hour and the peak demand around 15 gigawatts in winter . this mean that the list of country by energy consumption per caput is around 7.2 ton of oil equivalent per year . industry and construction consumed 51 % of total consumption , a relatively high figure reflecting finland 's industry . finland 's [ resource are limited to peat ] and wood . about 1015 % of the electricity is produced by [ web url=http : //www.metsavastaa.net/vattenkraft title=metsvastaa : vattenkraft language=sv publisher=metsavastaa.net access-date=6 march 2011 url-status=dead archive-url=https : //web.archive.org/web/20090303204918/http : //www.metsavastaa.net/vattenkraft archive-date=3 march 2009 } } which is low compared with more mountainous sweden or norway . in 2008 , [ [ renewable energy ] ( mainly hydropower and various form of wood energy ) wa high at 31 % compared with the eu average of 10.3 % in final energy consumption . [ [ russia in the european energy sector supply more than 75 % of finland 's list of country by oil export and 100 % of total list of country by natural gas export . </s> finland ha four privately owned nuclear reactor producing 18 % of the country 's energy and one research reactor ( decommissioned 2018 ) at the otaniemi campus . the fifth areva-siemens ag-built reactor the world 's largest at 1600 mwe and a focal point of europe 's nuclear industry ha faced many delay and is currently scheduled to be operational by 20182020 , a decade after the original planned opening . a varying amount ( 517 % ) of electricity ha been imported from russia ( at around 3 gigawatt power line capacity ) , sweden and norway . </s> the onkalo spent nuclear fuel repository is currently under construction at the olkiluoto nuclear power plant in the municipality of eurajoki , on the west coast of finland , by the company posiva . energy company are about to increase nuclear power production , a in july 2010 the finnish parliament granted permit for additional two new reactor . </s> <section_title_start> transport <section_title_end> </s> finland 's road system is utilized by most internal cargo and passenger traffic . the annual state operated road network expenditure of around 1 billion is paid for with vehicle and fuel tax which amount to around 1.5 billion and 1 billion , respectively . among the highway in finland , the most significant and busiest main road include the turku highway ( european route e18 ) , the tampere highway ( european route e12 ) , the lahti highway ( european route e75 ) , and the ring road ( ring i and ring iii ) of the helsinki metropolitan area and the tampere ring road of the tampere urban area . </s> the main international passenger gateway is helsinki airport , which handled about 17 million passenger in 2016 . oulu airport is the second largest , whilst another list of airport in finland have scheduled passenger service . the helsinki airport-based finnair , blue1 , and nordic regional airline , norwegian air shuttle sell air service both domestically and internationally . helsinki ha an optimal location for great circle ( i.e . the shortest and most efficient ) route between western europe and the far east . </s> despite having a low population density , the government annually spends around 350 million to maintain the network of railway track . rail transport is handled by the state owned vr group , which ha a 5 % passenger market share ( out of which 80 % are from urban trip in greater helsinki ) and 25 % cargo market share . since 12 december 2010 , karelian train , a joint venture between russian railway and vr group , ha been running karelian train class sm6 operated high-speed service between saint petersburg 's finlyandsky rail terminal and helsinki 's helsinki central railway station railway station . these service are branded a `` allegro `` train . the journey from helsinki to saint petersburg take only three and a half hour . a [ rail ] line is planned between elsa-rata , with a line from the capital to tampere also proposed . helsinki opened the world 's northernmost helsinki metro in 1982 , which also serf the neighbouring city of espoo since 2017. </s> the majority of international cargo shipment are handled at port . vuosaari harbour in helsinki is the largest container port in finland ; others include kotka , hamina , hanko , finland , pori , rauma , finland , and oulu . there is passenger traffic from helsinki and turku , which have ferry connection to tallinn , mariehamn , stockholm and travemnde . the helsinki-tallinn route one of the busiest passenger sea route in the world ha also been served by a helicopter line , and the helsinki-tallinn tunnel ha been proposed to provide railway service between the two city . largely following the example of the resund bridge ] between [ [ sweden and denmark , the kvarken bridge connecting ume in sweden and vaasa in finland to cross the gulf of bothnia ha also been planned for decade . </s> <section_title_start> industry <section_title_end> </s> finland rapidly industrialized after world war ii , achieving gdp per caput level comparable to that of japan or the uk in the beginning of the 1970s . initially , most of the economic development wa based on two broad group of export-led industry , the `` metal industry `` ( metalliteollisuus ) and `` forest industry `` ( metsteollisuus ) . the `` metal industry `` includes shipbuilding , metalworking , the automotive industry , engineered product such a motor and electronics industry , and production of metal and alloy including steel , copper and chromium . many of the world 's biggest cruise ship , including m freedom of the sea and the oasis of
