the sea have been built in finnish shipyard . </s> the `` forest industry `` includes forestry , timber , pulp and paper , and is often considered a logical development based on finland 's extensive forest resource , a 73 % of the area is covered by forest . in the pulp and paper industry , many major company are based in finland ; ahlstrom-munksj , mets board , and upm ( company ) are all finnish forest-based company with revenue exceeding 1 billion . however , in recent decade , the finnish economy ha diversified , with company expanding into field such a electronics ( nokia ) , metrology ( vaisala ) , petroleum ( neste ) , and video game ( rovio entertainment ) , and is no longer dominated by the two sector of metal and forest industry . likewise , the structure ha changed , with the service sector growing , with manufacturing declining in importance ; agriculture remains a minor part . despite this , production for export is still more prominent than in western europe , thus making finland possibly more vulnerable to global economic trend . </s> in 2017 , the finnish economy wa estimated to consist of approximately 2.7 % agriculture , 28.2 % manufacturing and 69.1 % service . in 2019 , the per-capita income of finland wa estimated to be $ 48,869 . in 2020 , finland wa ranked 20th on the ease of doing business index , among 190 jurisdiction . </s> <section_title_start> public policy <section_title_end> </s> finnish politician have often emulated other nordic and the nordic model . nordic have been free-trading and relatively welcoming to skilled migrant for over a century , though in finland immigration is relatively new . the level of protection in commodity trade ha been low , except for agricultural product . </s> finland ha top level of economic freedom in many area . finland is ranked 16th in the 2008 global index of economic freedom and 9th in europe . while the manufacturing sector is thriving , the oecd point out that the service sector would benefit substantially from policy improvement . </s> the 2007 international institute for management development world competitiveness yearbook ranked finland 17th most competition ( company ) . the world economic forum 2008 index ranked finland the 6th most competitive . in both indicator , finland 's performance wa next to germany , and significantly higher than most european country . in the business competitiveness index 20072008 finland ranked third in the world . </s> economist attribute much growth to reform in the product market . according to the oecd , only four eu-15 country have le regulated product market ( uk , ireland , denmark and sweden ) and only one ha le regulated financial market ( denmark ) . nordic country were pioneer in liberalizing energy , postal , and other market in europe . the legal system is clear and business bureaucracy le than most country . property right are well protected and contractual agreement are strictly honoured . finland is rated the least corrupt country in the world in the corruption perception index and 13th in the ease of doing business index . this indicates exceptional ease in cross-border trading ( 5th ) , contract enforcement ( 7th ) , business closure ( 5th ) , tax payment ( 83rd ) , and low worker hardship ( 127th ) . </s> finnish law universal validity of collective labour agreement that are drafted every few year for each profession and seniority level . the agreement becomes universally enforceable provided that more than 50 % of the employee support it , in practice by being a member of a relevant trade union . the unionization rate is high ( 70 % ) , especially in the middle class ( confederation of union for academic professional in finland80 % ) . a lack of a national agreement in an industry is considered an exception . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> in 2017 , tourism in finland grossed approximately 15.0 billion with a 7 % increase from the previous year . of this , 4.6 billion ( 30 % ) came from foreign tourism . in 2017 , there were 15.2 million overnight stay of domestic tourist and 6.7 million overnight stay of foreign tourist . much of the sudden growth can be attributed to the globalisation of the country a well a a rise in positive publicity and awareness . while russia remains the largest market for foreign tourist , the biggest growth came from chinese market ( 35 % ) . tourism contributes roughly 2.7 % to finland 's gdp , making it comparable to agriculture and forestry . </s> baltic sea cruiseferries between major coastal and port city in the baltic region , including helsinki , turku , mariehamn , tallinn , stockholm , and travemnde , play a significant role in the local tourism industry . by passenger count , the port of helsinki is the busiest port in the world . the helsinki-vantaa international airport is the fourth busiest airport in the nordic country in term of passenger number , and about 90 % of finland 's international air traffic pass through the airport . </s> lapland ( finland ) ha the highest tourism consumption of any finnish region . above the arctic circle , in midwinter , there is a polar night , a period when the sun doe not rise for day or week , or even month , and correspondingly , midnight sun in the summer , with no sunset even at midnight ( for up to 73 consecutive day , at the northernmost point ) . lapland is so far north that the aurora borealis , fluorescence in the high atmosphere due to solar wind , is seen regularly in the fall , winter , and spring . finnish lapland is also locally regarded a the home of saint nicholas or santa claus , with several theme park , such a santa claus village and santa park in rovaniemi . </s> tourist attraction in finland include the natural landscape found throughout the country a well a urban attraction . finland is covered with thick pine forest , rolling hill , and lake . finland contains 40 list of national park of finland ( such a the koli national park in north karelia ) , from the southern shore of the gulf of finland to the high fell of lapland . outdoor activity range from nordic skiing , golf , fishing , yachting , lake cruise , hiking , and kayaking , among many others . bird-watching is popular for those fond of avifauna , however hunting is also popular . moose and [ are common game in finland . finland also ha urbanised region with many cultural event and activity . list of tourist attraction in helsinki tourist attraction in helsinki ] include the [ [ helsinki cathedral and the suomenlinna sea fortress . olavinlinna in savonlinna host the annual savonlinna opera festival , and the medieval milieu of the city of turku , rauma , finland and porvoo also attract curious spectator . </s> <section_title_start> demographic <section_title_end> </s> the population of finland is currently about 5.5 million inhabitant and is aging with the birth rate at 10.42 birth per 1,000 population per year , or a total fertility rate of 1.49 child born per woman , one of the lowest in the world , below the replacement rate of 2.1 , it remains considerably below the high of 5.17 child born per woman in 1887 . finland subsequently ha one of the oldest population in the world , with the average age of 42.6 year . approximately half of voter are estimated to be over 50 year old . finland ha an average population density of 18 inhabitant per square kilometre . this is the third-lowest population density of any european country , behind those of norway and iceland , and the lowest population density in the eu . finland 's population ha always been concentrated in the southern part of the country , a phenomenon that became even more pronounced during 20th-century urbanisation . two of the three largest city in finland are situated in the greater helsinki metropolitan areahelsinki and espoo , and some municipality in the metropolitan area have also shown clear growth of population year after year , the most notable being jrvenp , nurmijrvi , kirkkonummi , kerava and sipoo . in the largest city of finland , tampere hold the third place after helsinki and espoo while also helsinki-neighbouring vantaa is the fourth . other city with population over 100,000 are turku , oulu , jyvskyl , kuopio , and lahti . </s> , there were 402,619 people with a foreign background living in finland ( 7.3 % of the population ) , most of whom are from russia , estonia , somalia , iraq and former yugoslavia . the child of foreigner are not automatically given finnish citizenship , a finnish nationality law practice and maintain jus sanguinis policy where only child born to at least one finnish parent are granted citizenship . if they are born in finland and can not get citizenship of any other country , they become citizen . additionally , certain person of finnish descent who reside in country that were once part of soviet union ] , retain the [ [ right of return # finland , a right to establish permanent residency in the country , which would eventually entitle them to qualify for citizenship . 387,215 people in finland in 2018 were born in another country , representing 7 % of the population . the 10 largest foreign born group are ( in order ) from russia , estonia , sweden , iraq , somalia , china , thailand , serbia , vietnam and turkey . </s> the immigrant population is growing . by 2035 , the three largest cite in finland are projected to have a foreign speaking population percentage of over a quarter each , with helsinki rising to 26 % , espoo to 30 % and vantaa to 34 % . the helsinki region alone will have 437,000 foreign speaker , up by 236,000. </s> <section_title_start> language <section_title_end> </s> finnish and swedish language are the official language of finland . finnish predominates nationwide while swedish is spoken in some coastal area in the west and south and in the autonomous region of land , which is the only monolingual swedish speaking region in finland . the native language of 87.3 % of the population is finnish , which is part of the finnic subgroup of the uralic language . the language is one of only four official language of the european union not of indo-european language indo-european origin . a a result it ha no relation to the other dominant north germanic language in the nordic country . finnish is closely related to karelian language and estonian language and more remotely to the sami language and hungarian language . swedish is the native language of 5.2 % of the population ( swedish-speaking finn ) . finnish is dominant in all the country 's larger city , although helsinki , turku and vaasa have undergone a language shift since finland got separated from sweden . </s> since swedish is a compulsory school subject , general knowledge of the language is good also among non-native speaker . in 2005 , a total of 47 % of the finnish citizen reported ability to speak swedish either a primary or a secondary language . likewise , a majority of mainland sweden finn are able to speak some or fluent finnish . however , the vast majority of sweden finnish youth self-reported a seldom using finnish with 71 % mostly or always speaking swedish in social setting outside of their household . the finnish side of the land border with sweden is unilingually finnish-speaking , with a stark language divide over the torne river and the swedish side having a northern sweden accent vastly differing from the version of language spoken in other part of finland . there is a sizeable pronunciation difference in the swedish being spoken in the two country although the mutual intelligibility is nearly universal . </s> the nordic country # language language and karelian language are also specially treated in some context . </s> finnish kalo language is spoken by some 5,0006,000 people ; it and finnish sign language are also recognized in the constitution . there are two sign language : finnish sign language , spoken natively by 4,0005,000 people , and finland-swedish sign language , spoken natively by about 150 people . mishar tatar dialect is spoken by a finnish tatar minority of about 800 people whose ancestor moved to finland mainly during russian rule from the 1870s to the 1920s . </s> the sami language ha an official language status in the north , in lapland or in northern lapland , where the sami people predominate , numbering around 7,000 and recognized a an indigenous people . about a quarter of them speak a sami language a their mother tongue . the sami language that are spoken in finland are northern sami , inari sami language , and skolt sami language . </s> the right of minority group ( in particular sami people # finland , swedish-speaking population of finland , and finnish kale ) are protected by the constitution . </s> the largest immigrant language are russian language ( 1.5 % ) , estonian language ( 0.9 % ) , arabic ( 0.6 % ) , somali language ( 0.4 % ) and english language ( 0.4 % ) . english is studied by most pupil a a compulsory subject from the first grade ( at seven year of age ) in the comprehensive school ( in some school other language can be chosen instead ) , a a result of which finn ' english language skill have been significantly strengthened over several decade . german , french , spanish and russian can be studied a second foreign language from the fourth grade ( at 10 year of age ; some school may offer other option ) . </s> 93 % of finn can speak a second language . the figure in this section should be treated with caution , a they come from the official finnish population register . people can only register one language and so bilingual or multilingual language user ' language competency are not properly included . a citizen of finland that speaks bilingually finnish and swedish will often be registered a a finnish only speaker in this system . similarly `` old domestic language `` is a category applied to some language and not others for political not linguistic reason , for example russian . </s> <section_title_start> largest city <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> with 3.9 million member , the evangelical lutheran church of finland is one of the largest lutheran church in the world and is also by far finland 's largest religious body ; at the end of 2019 , 68.7 % of finn were member of the church . the evangelical lutheran church of finland see it share of the country 's population declining by roughly one percent annually in recent year . the decline ha been due to both church membership resignation and falling baptism rate . the second largest group , accounting for 26.3 % of the population in 2017 , ha no religious affiliation . the irreligious group rose quickly from just below 13 % in the year 2000 . a small minority belongs to the finnish orthodox church ( 1.1 % ) . other protestant denomination and the roman catholic church are significantly smaller , a are the jewish and other non-christian community ( totalling 1.6 % ) ; for example , in the protestant trend , there are about 1,500 baptist concentrated in the region of central finland , and there are only about 2,000 methodism who are scattered around the country . the pew research center estimated the muslim population at 2.7 % in 2016 . the main lutheran and orthodox church are national church of finland with special role such a in state ceremony and school . </s> in 1869 , finland wa the first nordic country to disestablishment evangelical lutheran church of finland by introducing the church act , followed by the church of sweden in 2000 . although the church still maintains a special relationship with the state , it is not described a a state religion in the constitution of finland or other law passed by the finnish parliament . finland 's state church wa the church of sweden until 1809 . a an autonomous grand duchy under russia 18091917 , finland retained the lutheran state church system , and a state church separate from sweden , later named the evangelical lutheran church of finland , wa established . it wa detached from the state a a separate judicial entity when the new church law came to force in 1869 . after finland had gained independence in 1917 , religious freedom wa declared in the constitution of 1919 and a separate law on religious freedom in 1922 . through this arrangement , the evangelical lutheran church of finland lost it position a a state church but gained a constitutional status a a national church alongside the finnish orthodox church , whose position however is not codified in the constitution . </s> in 2016 , 69.3 % of finnish child were baptism and 82.3 % were confirmation ( lutheran church ) in 2012 at the age of 15 , and over 90 % of the funeral are christian . however , the majority of lutheran attend church only for special occasion like christmas ceremony , wedding , and funeral . the lutheran church estimate that approximately 1.8 % of it member attend church service weekly . the average number of church visit per year by church member is approximately two . </s> according to a 2010 eurobarometer poll , 33 % of finnish citizen responded that `` they believe there is a god `` ; 42 % answered that `` they believe there is some sort of spirit or life force `` ; and 22 % that `` they do not believe there is any sort of spirit , god , or life force `` . according to issp survey data ( 2008 ) , 8 % consider themselves `` highly religious `` , and 31 % `` moderately religious `` . in the same survey , 28 % reported themselves a `` agnostic `` and 29 % a `` non-religious `` . </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> life expectancy ha increased from 71 year for men and 79 year for woman in 1990 to 79 year for men and 84 year for woman in 2017 . the under-five mortality rate ha decreased from 51 per 1,000 live birth in 1950 to 2.3 per 1,000 live birth in 2017 , ranking finland 's rate among the lowest in the world . the fertility rate in 2014 stood at 1.71 child born/per woman and ha been below sub-replacement fertility of 2.1 since 1969 . with a low birth rate woman also become mother at a later age , the mean age at first live birth being 28.6 in 2014 . a 2011 study published in the lancet medical journal found that finland had the lowest stillbirth rate out of 193 country , including the uk , france and new zealand . </s> there ha been a slight increase or no change in welfare and health inequality between population group in the 21st century . lifestyle-related disease are on the rise . more than half a million finn suffer from diabetes , type 1 diabetes being globally the most common in finland . many child are diagnosed with type 2 diabetes . the number of musculoskeletal disease and cancer are increasing , although the cancer prognosis ha improved . allergy and dementia are also growing health problem in finland . one of the most common reason for work disability are due to mental disorder , in particular major depressive disorder . treatment for depression ha improved and a a result the historically high suicide rate have declined to 13 per 100 000 in 2017 , closer to the north european average . suicide rate are still among the highest among developed country in the oecd . </s> there are 307 resident for each doctor . about 19 % of health care is funded directly by household and 77 % by taxation . </s> in april 2012 , finland wa ranked 2nd in gross national happiness in a report published by the earth institute . since 2012 , finland ha every time ranked at least in the top 5 of world 's happiest country in the annual world happiness report by the united nation , a well a ranking a the happiest country in 2018. </s> <section_title_start> education and science <section_title_end> </s> most pre-tertiary education is arranged at municipal level . even though many or most school were started a private school , today only around 3 percent of student are enrolled in private school ( mostly specialist language and international school ) , much le than in sweden and most other developed country . pre-school education is rare compared with other eu country and formal education is usually started at the age of 7 . primary school take normally six year and lower secondary school three year . most school are managed by municipal official . </s> the flexible curriculum is set by the ministry of education ( finland ) and the education board . education is compulsory between the age of 7 and 16 . after lower secondary school , graduate may either enter the workforce directly , or apply to trade school or gymnasium ( school ) ( upper secondary school ) . trade school offer a vocational education : approximately 40 % of an age group choose this path after the lower secondary school . academically oriented gymnasium have higher entrance requirement and specifically prepare for abitur and tertiary education . graduation from either formally qualifies for tertiary education . </s> in tertiary education , two mostly separate and non-interoperating sector are found : the profession-oriented polytechnic and the research-oriented university . education is free and living expense are to a large extent financed by the government through student benefit . there are 15 university and 24 university of applied science ( uas ) in the country . the university of helsinki is ranked 75th in the top university ranking of 2010 . the world economic forum rank finland 's tertiary education no . 1 in the world . around 33 % of resident have a tertiary degree , similar to nordic and more than in most other oecd country except canada ( 44 % ) , united state ( 38 % ) and japan ( 37 % ) . the proportion of foreign student is 3 % of all tertiary enrollment , one of the lowest in oecd , while in advanced program it is 7.3 % , still below oecd average 16.5 % . other reputable university of finland include aalto university in espoo , both university of turku and bo akademi university in turku , university of jyvskyl , university of oulu , lut university in lappeenranta and lahti , university of eastern finland in kuopio and joensuu , and tampere university . </s> more than 30 % of tertiary graduate are in science-related field . forest improvement , material research , environmental science , neural network , low-temperature physic , brain research , biotechnology , genetic technology , and communication showcase field of study where finnish researcher have had a significant impact . </s> finland ha a long tradition of adult education , and by the 1980s nearly one million finn were receiving some kind of instruction each year . forty percent of them did so for professional reason . adult education appeared in a number of form , such a secondary evening school , civic and worker ' institute , study centre , vocational course centre , and folk high school . study centre allowed group to follow study plan of their own making , with educational and financial assistance provided by the state . folk high school are a distinctly nordic institution . originating in denmark in the 19th century , folk high school became common throughout the region . adult of all age could stay at them for several week and take course in subject that ranged from handicraft to economics . </s> finland is highly productive in scientific research . in 2005 , finland had the fourth most scientific publication per caput of the oecd country . in 2007 , 1,801 patent were filed in finland . </s> in addition , 38 percent of finland 's population ha a university or college degree , which is among the highest percentage in the world . </s> in 2010 a new law wa enacted considering the university , which defined that there are 16 of them a they were excluded from the public sector to be autonomous legal and financial entity , however enjoying special status in the legislation . a result many former state institution were driven to collect funding from private sector contribution and partnership . the change caused deep rooted discussion among the academic circle . </s> english language is important in finnish education . there are a number of degree program that are taught in english , which attracts thousand of degree and exchange student every year . </s> in december 2017 the oecd reported that finnish father spend an average of eight minute a day more with their school-aged child than mother do . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> sauna <section_title_end> </s> the finn ' love for sauna is generally associated with finnish cultural tradition in the world . sauna is a type of dry steam bath practiced widely in finland , which is especially evident in the strong tradition around midsummer and christmas . in finland , the sauna ha been a traditional cure or part of the treatment for many different disease , thanks to the heat , which why the sauna ha been a very hygiene place . there is an old finnish saying : `` jos sauna , terva ja viina ei auta , on tauti kuolemaksi . `` ( in literally : `` if sauna , tar and liquor doe n't help you , then a disease is deadly `` ) the word is of proto-finnish origin ( found in finnic and smi language ) dating back 7,000 year . steam bath have been part of european tradition elsewhere a well , but the sauna ha survived best in finland , in addition to sweden , the baltic state baltic state ] , russia , norway , and part of the united state and canada . moreover , nearly all finnish house have either their own sauna or in multistory apartment house , a timeshare sauna . public sauna were previously common , but the tradition ha declined when sauna have been built nearly everywhere ( private home , municipal swimming hall , hotel , corporate headquarters , gym , etc . ) . at one time , the [ [ world sauna championship were held in heinola , finland , but the death of a russian competitor in 2010 finally stopped organizing the competition a too dangerous . </s> the finnish sauna culture wa inscribed on the unesco intangible cultural heritage list at the 17 december 2020 meeting of the unesco intergovernmental organization committee convention for the safeguarding of the intangible cultural heritage . a authorized by the state , the finnish heritage agency commits , together with finnish sauna community and promoter of the sauna culture , to safeguard the vitality of the sauna tradition and to highlight it importance a part of custom and wellbeing . </s> <section_title_start> literature <section_title_end> </s> written finnish could be said to have existed since mikael agricola translated the new testament into finnish during the protestant reformation , but few notable work of literature were written until the 19th century and the beginning of a finnish national romanticism . this prompted elia lnnrot to collect finnish and karelian folk poetry and arrange and publish them a the kalevala , the finnish national epic . the era saw a rise of poet and novelist who wrote in finnish , notably aleksis kivi ( the seven brother ) , minna canth ( anna liisa ) , eino leino ( helkavirsi ) , johannes linnankoski ( the song of the blood-red flower ) and juhani aho ( the railroad ( novel ) and juha ( novel ) ) . many writer of the national awakening wrote in swedish , such a the national poet j. l. runeberg ( the tale of ensign stl ) and zachris topelius ( the tomten in bo castle ) . </s> after finland became independent , there wa a rise of modernist literature , most famously the finnish-speaking mika waltari and swedish-speaking edith sdergran . frans eemil sillanp wa awarded the nobel prize in literature in 1939 . world war ii prompted a return to more national interest in comparison to a more international line of thought , characterized by vin linna with his the unknown soldier ( novel ) and under the north star trilogy . besides lnnrot 's kalevala and waltari , the swedish-speaking tove jansson , best known a the creator of the moomins , is the most translated finnish writer ; her book have been translated into more than 40 language . popular modern writer include arto paasilinna , veikko huovinen , antti tuuri , ilkka remes , kari hotakainen , sofi oksanen , tuomas kyr , and jari tervo , while the best novel is annually awarded the prestigious finlandia prize . </s> <section_title_start> visual art , design , and architecture <section_title_end> </s> the visual art in finland started to form their individual characteristic in the 19th century , when romantic nationalism wa rising in autonomic finland . the best known of finnish painter , akseli gallen-kallela , started painting in a naturalist style , but moved to national romanticism . other notable world-famous finnish painter include magnus enckell , pekka halonen , eero jrnefelt , helene schjerfbeck and hugo simberg . finland 's best-known sculptor of the 20th century wa win aaltonen , remembered for his monumental bust ( sculpture ) and sculpture . finn have made major contribution to [ and industrial design ] : among the internationally renowned figure are [ [ timo sarpaneva , tapio wirkkala and ilmari tapiovaara . finnish architecture is famous around the world , and ha contributed significantly to several style internationally , such a jugendstil ( or art nouveau ) , nordic classicism and functionalism ( architecture ) . among the top 20th-century finnish architect to gain international recognition are eliel saarinen and his son eero saarinen . architect alvar aalto is regarded a among the most important 20th-century designer in the world ; he helped bring functionalism ( architecture ) to finland , but soon wa a pioneer in it development towards an organic style . aalto is also famous for his work in furniture , lamp , textile and glassware , which were usually incorporated into his building . </s> <section_title_start> music <section_title_end> </s> ; classical </s> much of finland 's classical music is influenced by traditional karelian melody and lyric , a comprised in the kalevala . karelian culture is perceived a the purest expression of the baltic finn myth and belief , le influenced by germanic people influence than the nordic folk dance music that largely replaced the kalevaic tradition . finnish folk music ha undergone a root revival in recent decade , and ha become a part of popular music . </s> the people of northern finland , sweden , and norway , the sami people , are known primarily for highly spiritual song called joik . the same word sometimes refers to lavlu or vuelie song , though this is technically incorrect . </s> the first finnish opera wa written by the german-born composer fredrik pacius in 1852 . pacius also wrote the music to the poem maamme maamme/vrt land ( our country ) , finland 's national anthem . in the 1890s finnish nationalism based on the kalevala spread , and jean sibelius became famous for his vocal symphony kullervo ( sibelius ) . he soon received a grant to study runo singer in karelia and continued his rise a the first prominent finnish musician . in 1899 he composed finlandia , which played it important role in finland gaining independence . he remains one of finland 's most popular national figure and is a symbol of the nation . another one of the most significant and internationally best-known finnish-born classical composer long before sibelius wa bernhard crusell . </s> today , finland ha a very lively classical music scene and many of finland 's important list of finnish composer are still alive , such a magnus lindberg ( finnish composer ) , kaija saariaho , kalevi aho , and aulis sallinen . the composer are accompanied by a large number of great conductor such a esa-pekka salonen , osmo vnsk , jukka-pekka saraste , and leif segerstam . some of the internationally acclaimed finnish classical musician are karita mattila , soile isokoski , pekka kuusisto , olli mustonen , and linda brava . </s> ; modern </s> iskelm ( coined directly from the german word schlager , meaning `` hit `` ) is a traditional finnish word for a light popular song . finnish popular music also includes various kind of dance music ; tango music , a style of music of argentina , is also popular . the light music in swedish-speaking area ha more influence from sweden . modern finnish popular music includes a number of prominent rock band , jazz musician , [ hop ] performer , dance music act , etc . also , at least a couple of finnish polka are known worldwide , such a skkijrven polkka and ievan polkka . </s> during the early 1960s , the first significant wave of finnish rock group emerged , playing instrumental rock inspired by group such a the shadow . around 1964 , beatlemania arrived in finland , resulting in further development of the local rock scene . during the late 1960s and '70s , finnish rock musician increasingly wrote their own music instead of translating international hit into finnish . during the decade , some progressive rock group such a tasavallan presidentti and wigwam ( finnish band ) gained respect abroad but failed to make a commercial breakthrough outside finland . this wa also the fate of the rock and roll group hurriganes . the finnish punk scene produced some internationally acknowledged name including terveet kdet in the 1980s . hanoi rock wa a pioneering 1980s glam rock act that inspired the american [ rock ] group gun n ' rose , among others . </s> many finnish metal band have gained international recognition ; finland ha been often called the `` promised land of heavy metal `` , because there are more than 50 metal band for every 100,000 inhabitant more than any other nation in the world . him ( finnish band ) and nightwish are some of finland 's most internationally known band . him 's 2005 album dark light music recording sale certification in the united state . apocalyptica are an internationally famous finnish group who are most renowned for mixing strings-led classical music with classic heavy metal . other well-known metal band are amorphis , beast in black , child of bodom , ensiferum , finntroll , impaled nazarene , insomnium , korpiklaani , moonsorrow , reverend bizarre , sentenced , sonata arctica , stratovarius , swallow the sun , turisas , waltari , and wintersun . </s> after finnish hard rock/heavy metal band lordi won the eurovision song contest 2006 , finland hosted the competition eurovision song contest 2007 . alternative rock band poet of the fall , formed in 2003 , have released eight studio album and have toured widely . </s> in the field of electronic music , the most famous finnish artist in the world is dj darude , whose most famous work is an instrumental song sandstorm ( instrumental ) `` sandstorm `` from 1999 . that song ha not only certified gold and platinum in the united state by the recording industry association of america for sale over one million copy , but ha also become a strong part of the internet meme culture . </s> <section_title_start> cinema and television <section_title_end> </s> in the film industry , notable director include brother mika kaurismki and aki kaurismki , dome karukoski , antti jokinen , jalmari helander , mauritz stiller , edvin laine , teuvo tulio , spede pasanen , and hollywood film director and producer renny harlin . internationally well-known finnish actor and actress include jasper pkknen , peter franzn , laura birn , irina bjrklund , samuli edelmann , krista kosonen , ville virtanen ( actor ) and joonas suotamo . around twelve feature film are made each year . </s> one of the most internationally successful finnish film are the white reindeer , directed by erik blomberg in 1952 , which won the golden globe award for best foreign language film in 1956 , five year after it limited release in the united state ; the man without a past , directed by aki kaurismki in 2002 , which wa nominated for the academy award for best foreign language film in 2002 and won the grand prix ( cannes film festival ) at the 2002 cannes film festival ; and the fencer , directed by klaus hr in 2015 , which wa nominated for the 73rd golden globe award # film in the best foreign language film category a a finnish/german/estonian co-production . </s> in finland , the most significant film include the unknown soldier ( 1955 film ) , directed by edvin laine in 1955 , which is shown on television every independence day ( finland ) . here , beneath the north star from 1968 , also directed by laine , which includes the finnish civil war from the perspective of the red guard ( finland ) , is also one of the most significant work in finnish history . a 1960 crime film comedy film inspector palmu 's mistake ( film ) inspector palmu 's mistake , directed by matti kassila , wa voted in 2012 the best finnish film of all time by finnish film critic and journalist in a poll organized by yle uutiset , but the 1984 comedy film uuno turhapuro in the army , the ninth film in the uuno turhapuro , remains finland 's most seen domestic film made since 1968 by finnish audience . </s> although finland 's television offering are largely known for their domestic drama ( film and television ) , such a the long-running soap opera series salatut elmt , there are also internationally known drama series , such a syke tv series and bordertown ( finnish tv series ) . one of finland 's most internationally successful tv show are the backpacking travel documentary series madventures ( finnish tv program ) and the reality tv show the dudesons . </s> <section_title_start> medium and communication <section_title_end> </s> thanks to it emphasis on transparency and equal right , finland 's press ha been rated the freest in the world . </s> today , there are around 200 newspaper , 320 popular magazine , 2,100 professional magazine , 67 commercial radio station , three digital radio channel and one nationwide and five national public broadcasting . </s> each year , around 12,000 book title are published and 12 million record are sold . </s> sanoma publishes the newspaper helsingin sanomat ( it circulation of 412,000 making it the largest ) , the tabloid ( newspaper format ) ilta-sanomat , the commerce-oriented taloussanomat and the television channel nelonen . the other major publisher alma medium publishes over thirty magazine , including the newspaper aamulehti , tabloid iltalehti and commerce-oriented kauppalehti . worldwide , finn , along with other nordic people and the japanese , spend the most time reading newspaper . </s> yle , the finnish broadcasting company , operates five television channel and thirteen radio channel in both national language . yle is funded through a mandatory television license and fee for private broadcaster . all tv channel are broadcast digital television , both terrestrially and on cable . the commercial television channel mtv3 and commercial radio channel radio nova ( finland ) are owned by nordic broadcasting ( bonnier group and proventus industrier ) . </s> in regard to telecommunication infrastructure , finland is the highest ranked country in the world economic forum 's network readiness index ( nri ) an indicator for determining the development level of a country 's information and communication technology . finland ranked 1st overall in the 2014 nri ranking , unchanged from the year before . this is shown in it penetration throughout the country 's population . around 79 % of the population use the internet ( 2007 ) . finland had around 1.52 million broadband internet connection by the end of june 2007 or around 287 per 1,000 inhabitant . all finnish school and public library have internet connection and computer and most resident have a mobile phone . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> finnish cuisine is notable for generally combining traditional country fare and [ cuisine ] with contemporary style cooking . fish ( food ) and meat play a prominent role in traditional finnish dish from the western part of the country , while the dish from the eastern part have traditionally included various vegetable and edible mushroom . refugee from karelia contributed to food in eastern finland . </s> finnish food often use wholemeal product ( rye , barley , oat ) and berry ( such a bilberry , lingonberry , cloudberry , and sea buckthorn ) . milk and it derivative like buttermilk are commonly used a food , drink , or in various recipe . various turnip were common in traditional cooking , but were replaced with the potato after it introduction in the 18th century . </s> according to the statistic , red meat consumption ha risen , but still finn eat le beef than many other nation , and more fish and poultry . this is mainly because of the high cost of meat in finland . </s> finland ha the world 's highest per caput consumption of coffee . milk consumption is also high , at an average of about , per person , per year , even though 17 % of the finn are lactose intolerant . </s> <section_title_start> public holiday <section_title_end> </s> there are several holiday in finland , of which perhaps the most characteristic of finnish culture include christmas ( joulu ) , midsummer ( juhannus ) , may day # finland ( vappu ) and independence day ( finland ) ( itsenisyyspiv ) . of these , christmas and midsummer are special in finland because the actual festivity take place on eve , such a christmas eve ( jouluaatto ) and midsummer # finland midsummer 's eve ( juhannusaatto ) , while christmas day ( joulupiv ) and midsummer 's day ( juhannuspiv ) are more consecrated to rest . other public holiday in finland are new year 's day ( uudenvuodenpiv ) , epiphany ( holiday ) # finland ( loppiainen ) , good friday ( pitkperjantai ) , easter sunday ( psiissunnuntai ) and easter monday ( psiismaanantai ) , ascension day ( helatorstai ) , all saint ' day ( pyhinpiv ) and saint stephen 's day # finland saint stephen 's day ( tapaninpiv ) . all official holiday in finland are established by act of parliament . on the other hand , laskiainen that is strongly part of the finnish tradition is not defined a a public holiday in relation to the above-mentioned holiday . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> various sporting event are popular in finland . pespallo , resembling baseball , is the national sport of finland , although the most popular sport in term of spectator is ice hockey . the 2016 iihf world championship final , finland-canada , wa watched by 69 % of finnish people on tv . other popular sport include track and field , cross-country skiing , ski jumping , association football , volleyball and basketball . while ice hockey is the most popular sport when it come to attendance at game , association football is the most played team sport in term of the number of player in the country and is also the most appreciated sport in finland . </s> in term of medal and gold medal won per caput , finland is the best performing country in olympic history . finland first participated a a nation in it own right at the olympic game in 1908 , while still an autonomous grand duchy of finland within the russian empire . at the 1912 summer olympics , great pride wa taken in the three gold medal won by the original `` flying finn `` hannes kolehmainen . </s> finland wa one of the most successful country at the olympic game before world war ii . at the 1924 summer olympics , finland , a nation then of only 3.2 million people , came second in the medal count . in the 1920s and '30s , finnish long-distance runner dominated the olympics , with paavo nurmi winning a total of nine olympic gold medal between 1920 and 1928 and setting 22 official world record between 1921 and 1931 . nurmi is often considered the greatest finnish sportsman and one of the greatest athlete of all time . </s> for over 100 year , finnish male and female athlete have consistently excelled at the javelin throw . the event ha brought finland nine olympic gold medal , five world championship , five european championship , and 24 world record . </s> in addition to kolehmainen and nurmi , some of finland 's most internationally well-known and successful sportspeople are long-distance runner ville ritola and lasse virn ; ski-jumpers matti nyknen and janne ahonen ; cross-country skier veikko hakulinen , eero mntyranta , marja-liisa kirvesniemi and mika myllyl ; rower pertti karppinen ; gymnast heikki savolainen ( gymnast ) ; professional skateboarder arto saari ; ice hockey player kimmo timonen , jari kurri , teemu selnne , and saku koivu ; football player jari litmanen and sami hyypi ; basketball player hanno mttl ; alpine skier kalle palander and tanja poutiainen ; formula one world champion keke rosberg , mika hkkinen and kimi rikknen ; four-time world rally champion juha kankkunen and tommi mkinen ; and 13-time world enduro champion juha salminen , seven-time champion kari tiainen , and the five-time champion mika ahola , biathlete kaisa mkrinen and samuli aro . finland is also one of the most successful nation in bandy , being the only nation beside russia and sweden to win a bandy world championship . </s> the 1952 summer olympics were held in helsinki . other notable sporting event held in finland include the 1983 world championship in athletics and 2005 world championship in athletics . </s> finland also ha a notable history in figure skating . finnish skater have won 8 world championship and 13 junior world cup in synchronized skating , and finland is considered one of the best country at the sport . </s> some of the most popular recreational sport and activity include floorball , nordic walking , running , cycling , and skiing ( alpine skiing , cross-country skiing , and ski jumping ) . </s> floorball , in term of registered player , occupies third place after football and ice hockey . according to the finnish floorball federation , floorball is the most popular school , youth , club and workplace sport . , the total number of licensed player reach 57,400. </s> especially since the 2014 fiba basketball world cup , finland national basketball team finland 's national basketball team ha received widespread public attention . more than 8,000 finn travelled to spain to support their team . overall , they chartered more than 40 airplane . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * bibliography of finland </s> * list of finland-related
