addition , it is projected that the improved road condition will encourage more tourism in the more inaccessible eastern region of bhutan . currently , the road condition appear to be deterring tourist from visiting bhutan due to the increased instance of road block , landslide and dust disruption caused by the widening project . </s> <section_title_start> rail <section_title_end> </s> although bhutan currently ha no railway , it ha entered into an agreement with india to link southern bhutan to india 's vast network by constructing an , indian gauge rail link between hashimara in west bengal and toribari in bhutan . the construction of the railway via satali , bharna bari and dalsingpara by indian railway will be funded by india . bhutan 's nearest railway station is hasimara . </s> <section_title_start> demographics <section_title_end> </s> bhutan had a population of people in . bhutan ha a median age of 24.8 year . there are 1,070 male to every 1,000 female . the literacy rate in bhutan is 59.5 percent . </s> <section_title_start> ethnic group <section_title_end> </s> bhutanese people primarily consist of the ngalops and sharchop people , called the western bhutanese and eastern bhutanese respectively . although the sharchops are slightly larger in demographic size , the ngalops dominate the political sphere , a the king and the political elite belong to this group . the ngalops primarily consist of bhutanese living in the western part of the country . their culture is closely related to that of tibet . much the same could be said of the sharchops , the largest group , who traditionally follow the nyingmapa rather than the official drukpa kagyu form of tibetan buddhism . in modern time , with improved transportation infrastructure , there ha been much intermarriage between these group . </s> the lhotshampa , meaning `` southerner bhutanese `` , are a heterogeneous group of mostly people of nepal ancestry who have sought political and cultural recognition including equality in right to abode , language , and dress . unofficial estimate claimed that they constituted 45 % of the population in the 1988 census . starting in the 1980s , bhutan adopted a policy of `` one nation one people `` to exert cultural ( in language , dress and religion ) and political dominance of the majority drukpa people . the policy manifested in banning of teaching of nepali language language in school and denial of citizenship to those who were not able to prove officially issued land holding title prior to 1950 specifically targeting ethnic nepali-speaking minority group ( `` lhotshampa `` ) , representing one-third of the population at the time . this resulted in widespread unrest and political demonstration . in 1988 , the bhutanese authority carried out a special census in southern bhutan , region of high lhotshampa population , resulting in mass denationalization of lhotshampas , followed by forcible deportation of 107,000 lhotshampas , approximately one-sixth of the total population at the time . those who had been granted citizenship by the bhutanese citizenship act 1958 were stripped of their citizenship . member of bhutanese police and army were involved in burning of lhotshampa house , land confiscation and other widespread human right abuse including arrest , torture and rape of lhotshampas involved in political protest . following forcible deportation from bhutan , lhotshampas spent almost two decade in refugee camp in nepal and were resettled in various western country such a the united state between 20072012 . </s> <section_title_start> cities and towns <section_title_end> </s> * thimphu , the largest city and capital of bhutan . </s> * damphu , tsirang , the administrative headquarters of tsirang district . </s> * jakar , the administrative headquarters of bumthang district and the place where buddhism entered bhutan . </s> * mongar , the eastern commercial hub of the country . </s> * paro , bhutan , site of the paro airport . </s> * phuentsholing , bhutan 's commercial hub . </s> * punakha , the old capital . </s> * samdrup jongkhar , the southeastern town on the border with india . </s> * trashigang , administrative headquarters of trashigang district , the most populous district in the country . </s> * trongsa , in central bhutan , which ha the largest and the most magnificent of all the dzongs in bhutan . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> it is estimated that between two-thirds and three-quarters of the bhutanese population follow vajrayana buddhism , which is also the state religion . about one-quarter to one-third are follower of hinduism . other religion account for le than 1 % of the population . the current legal framework , in principle guarantee freedom of religion ; proselytism , however , is forbidden by a royal government decision and by judicial interpretation of the constitution of bhutan . </s> buddhism wa introduced to bhutan in the 7th century ad . tibetan king songtsn gampo ( reigned 627649 ) , a convert to buddhism , ordered the construction of two buddhist temple , at bumthang ( town ) in central bhutan and at kyichu lhakhang ( near paro , bhutan ) in the paro valley . </s> <section_title_start> languages <section_title_end> </s> the national language is dzongkha ( bhutanese ) , one of 53 language in the tibetic language family . the script , locally called chhokey ( literally , `` dharma language `` ) , is identical to classical tibetan . in bhutan 's education system , english is the medium of instruction , while dzongkha is taught a the national language . ethnologue list 24 language currently spoken in bhutan , all of them in the tibeto-burman family , except nepali language , an indo-aryan language indo-aryan language . </s> until the 1980s , the government sponsored the teaching of nepali in school in southern bhutan . with the adoption of the driglam namzhag ( bhutanese code of etiquette ) and it expansion into the idea of strengthening the role of dzongkha , nepali wa dropped from the curriculum . the language of bhutan are still not well characterized , and several have yet to be recorded in an in-depth academic grammar . before the 1980s , the lhotshampa ( nepali-speaking community ) , mainly based in southern bhutan , constituted approximately 30 % of the population . however , after a purge of lhotshaampas from 1990 to 1992 this number might not accurately reflect the current population . </s> dzongkha is partially intelligible with sikkimese language and spoken natively by 25 % of the population . tshangla language , the language of the sharchop and the principal pre-tibetan language of bhutan , is spoken by a greater number of people . it is not easily classified and may constitute an independent branch of tibeto-burman . nepali language speaker constituted some 40 % of the population . the larger minority language are dzala language ( 11 % ) , limbu language ( 10 % ) , kheng language ( 8 % ) , and bantawa language ( 8 % ) . there are no reliable source for the ethnic or linguistic composition of bhutan , so these number do not add up to 100 % . </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> bhutan ha a life expectancy of 70.2 year ( 69.9 for male and 70.5 for female ) according to the latest data for 2016 from the world bank . </s> basic healthcare in bhutan is free , a provided by the constitution of bhutan . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> historically , education in bhutan wa monasticism , with secularity school education for the general population introduced in the 1960s . the mountainous landscape pose barrier to integrated educational service . </s> today , bhutan ha two decentralized university with eleven constituent college spread across the kingdom . these are the royal university of bhutan and khesar gyalpo university of medical science , respectively . the first five-year plan of bhutan five-year plan provided for a central education authorityin the form of a director of education appointed in 1961and an organized , modern school system with free and universal primary education . </s> education program were given a boost in 1990 , when the asian development bank ( see glossary ) granted a u $ 7.13 ; million loan for staff training and development , specialist service , equipment and furniture purchase , salary and other recurrent cost , and facility rehabilitation and construction at royal bhutan polytechnic . </s> since the beginning of modern education in bhutan , teacher from indiaespecially keralahave served in some of the most remote village of bhutan . thus , 43 retired teacher who had served for the longest length of time were personally invited to thimphu , bhutan during the teacher ' day celebration in 2018 , where they were honored and individually thanked by his majesty jigme khesar namgyel wangchuck . to celebrate 50 year of diplomatic relation between bhutan and india , bhutan 's education minister , jai bir rai honored 80 retired teacher who served in bhutan at a special ceremony organized at kolkata , india on 6 january 2019 . currently , there are 121 teacher from india placed in school across bhutan . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> bhutan ha a rich and unique cultural heritage that ha largely remained intact because of it isolation from the rest of the world until the mid-20th century . one of the main attraction for tourist is the country 's culture and tradition . bhutanese tradition is deeply steeped in it buddhist heritage . hinduism is the second most dominant religion in bhutan , being most prevalent in the southern region . the government is increasingly making effort to preserve and sustain the current culture and tradition of the country . because of it largely unspoiled natural environment and cultural heritage , bhutan ha been referred to a the last shangri-la . </s> while bhutanese citizen are free to travel abroad , bhutan is viewed a inaccessible by many foreigner . another reason for it being an unpopular destination is the cost , which is high for tourist on tighter budget . entry is free for citizen of india , bangladesh , and the maldives , but all other foreigner are required to sign up with a bhutanese tour operator and pay around u $ 250 per day that they stay in the country , though this fee cover most travel , lodging and meal expense . bhutan received 37,482 visitor arrival in 2011 , of which 25 % were for meeting , incentive , conferencing , and exhibition . </s> bhutan is the list of smoking ban # bhutan to ban smoking . it ha been illegal to smoke in public or sell tobacco , according to tobacco control act of bhutan 2010 . violator are fined the equivalent of $ 232a month 's salary in bhutan . </s> <section_title_start> dress <section_title_end> </s> the national dress for bhutanese men is the gho , a knee-length robe tied at the waist by a cloth belt known a the kera . woman wear an ankle-length dress , the kira ( dress ) , which is clipped at the shoulder with two identical brooch called the koma and tied at the waist with kera . an accompaniment to the kira is a long-sleeved blouse , the `` wonju , `` which is worn underneath the kira . a long-sleeved , jacket-like garment called the `` toego `` is worn over the kira . the sleeve of the wonju and the tego are folded together at the cuff , inside out . social status and class determine the texture , color , and decoration that embellish the garment . </s> jewelry is commonly worn by woman , especially during religious festival ( `` tsechus `` ) and public gathering . to strengthen bhutan 's identity a an independent country , bhutanese law requires all bhutanese government employee to wear the national dress at work and all citizen to wear the national dress while visiting school and other government office though many citizen , particularly adult , choose to wear the customary dress a formal attire . </s> varicolored scarf , known a rachu for woman and kabney for men , are important indicator of social standing , a bhutan ha traditionally been a feudal society ; in particular , red is the most common color worn by woman . the `` bura maap `` ( red scarf ) is one of highest honor a bhutanese civilian can receive . it , a well a the title of dasho , come from the throne in recognition of an individual s outstanding service to the nation . on previous occasion , the king himself conferred bura maaps to outstanding individual such a the director general of department hydropower and power system , yeshi wangdi , the deputy chairperson of national council , dasho dr. sonam kinga , and former national assembly speaker , dasho ugyen dorji . </s> <section_title_start> architecture <section_title_end> </s> bhutanese architecture remains distinctively traditional , employing rammed earth and wattle and daub construction method , stone masonry , and intricate woodwork around window and roof . traditional architecture us no nail or iron bar in construction . characteristic of the region is a type of castle fortress known a the dzong architecture . since ancient time , the dzongs have served a the religious and secular administrative center for their respective district . the university of texas at el paso in the united state ha adopted bhutanese architecture for it building on campus , a have the nearby hilton garden inn and other building in the city of el paso . </s> <section_title_start> public holidays <section_title_end> </s> bhutan ha public holiday in bhutan , most of which coincide with traditional , seasonal , secular or religious festival . they include the winter solstice ( around 1 january , depending on the lunar calendar ) , lunar new year ( february or march ) , the king 's birthday and the anniversary of his coronation , the official end of monsoon season ( 22 september ) , national day ( 17 december ) , and various buddhist and hindu celebration . </s> <section_title_start> film industry <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> music and dance <section_title_end> </s> dance drama and masked dance such a the cham dance are common traditional feature at festival , usually accompanied by traditional music . at these event , dancer depict hero , demon , daemon ( classical mythology ) , death head , animal , god , and caricature of common people by wearing colorful wooden or composition face mask and stylized costume . the dancer enjoy royal patronage , and preserve ancient folk and religious custom and perpetuate the ancient lore and art of mask-making . </s> the music of bhutan can generally be divided into traditional and modern variety ; traditional music comprises religious and folk genre , the latter including zhungdra and boedra . the modern rigsar is played on a mix of traditional instrument and electronic keyboard , and date back to the early 1990s ; it show the influence of indian popular music , a hybrid form of traditional and western popular influence . </s> <section_title_start> family structure <section_title_end> </s> in bhutanese family , inheritance generally pass matrilineally through the female rather than the male line . daughter will inherit their parent ' house . a man is expected to make his own way in the world and often move to his wife 's home . love marriage are more common in urban area , but the tradition of arranged marriage among acquainted family is still prevalent in most of the rural area . although uncommon , polygamy is accepted , often being a device to keep property in a contained family unit rather than dispersing it . the previous king , jigme singye wangchuck , who abdicated in 2006 , had four queen , all of whom are sister . the current king , jigme khesar namgyel wangchuck , wed jetsun pema ( born 1990 ) , 21 , a commoner and daughter of a pilot , on 13 october 2011. </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> rice ( bhutanese red rice ) , buckwheat , and increasingly maize , are the staple of bhutanese cuisine . the local diet also includes pork , beef , yak meat , chicken , and lamb . soup and stew of meat and dried vegetable spiced with chilies and cheese are prepared . ema datshi , made very spicy with cheese and chilies , might be called the national dish for it ubiquity and the pride that bhutanese have for it . dairy food , particularly butter and cheese from yak and cow , are also popular , and indeed almost all milk is turned into butter and cheese . popular beverage include butter tea , black tea , locally brewed ara ( drink ) ( rice wine ) , and beer . bhutan is the first country in the world to have banned the sale of tobacco under it tobacco control act of bhutan 2010. </s> <section_title_start> sports <section_title_end> </s> bhutan 's national and most popular sport is archery . competition are held regularly in most village . it differs from olympic game standard in technical detail such a the placement of the target and atmosphere . two target are placed over apart , and team shoot from one end of the field to the other . each member of the team shoot two arrow per round . traditional bhutanese archery is a social event , and competition are organized between village , town , and amateur team . there is usually plenty of food and drink complete with singing and dancing . attempt to distract an opponent include standing around the target and making fun of the shooter 's ability . dart ( khuru ) is an equally popular outdoor team sport , in which heavy wooden dart pointed with a 10 ; cm nail are thrown at a paperback-sized target away . </s> another traditional sport is the digor ( sport ) , which resembles the shot put and horseshoe . </s> another popular sport is basketball . in 2002 , bhutan 's bhutan national football team played montserrat national football team , in what wa billed a the other final ; the match took place on the same day brazil played germany in the 2002 fifa world cup final , but at the time bhutan and montserrat were the world 's two lowest ranked team . the match wa held in thimphu 's changlimithang stadium , and bhutan won 40 . a documentary of the match wa made by the dutch filmmaker johan kramer . bhutan won it first two fifa world cup qualifying match , beating sri lanka national football team 10 in sri lanka and 21 in bhutan , taking the aggregate at 31 . cricket ha also gained popularity in bhutan , particularly since the introduction of television channel from india . the bhutan national cricket team is one of the most successful affiliate nation in the region . </s> <section_title_start> woman in the workforce <section_title_end> </s> woman have begun to participate more in the work force and their participation is one of the highest in the region . however , the unemployment rate among woman are still higher than those of men and woman are in more unsecure work field , such a agriculture . most of the work that woman do outside of the home is in family-based agriculture which is insecure and is one of the reason why woman are falling behind men when it come to income . woman also , in general , work lower-quality job than men and only earn 75 % of men 's earnings . the unemployment rate among woman is also higher than that of men . </s> <section_title_start> woman in the household <section_title_end> </s> rooted deep in bhutan culture is the idea of selflessness and the woman of bhutan take on this role in the context of the household . bhutan culture ha shown a tolerance for domestic violence with nearly 1/4 of all woman having had experienced some form of violence from their husband or partner . some bhutanese community have what is referred to a matrilineal community , where the eldest daughter receives the largest share of the land . this is due to the belief that she will stay and take care of her parent while the son will move out and work to get his own land and for his own family . importantly , land ownership doe not necessarily equate to economic benefit - despite the eldest daughter having control of the house , it is the husband that is in charge of making decision . however , the younger generation ha stepped away from this belief , in splitting the land evenly between the child instead of the eldest daughter inheriting the most land . </s> <section_title_start> woman 's health <section_title_end> </s> throughout bhutan , there ha been an improvement in reproductive health service that ha led to a drastic drop in maternal mortality rate , dropping from 1,000 in 1990 to 180 in 2010 . there ha also been an increase in contraceptive use from le than 1/3 in 2003 to 2/3 in 2010. </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * index of bhutan-related article </s> * outline of bhutan </s> <section_title_start> notes <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> reference <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> further reading <section_title_end> </s> * </s> * aris , michael . bhutan : the early history of a himalayan kingdom ( aris & phillips , 1979 ) . </s> * </s> * </s> * </s> * </s> * rizal , dhurba . the royal semi-authoritarian democracy of bhutan ( lexington book , 2015 ) . </s> * roble , chelsea m. education and society in bhutan : tradition and modernisation ( routledge , 2016 ) . </s> * </s> * rose , leo e. the politics of bhutan ( cornell university press , 1977 ) . </s> * sinha , awadhesh coomar . himalayan kingdom bhutan : tradition , transition , and transformation ( indus publishing , 2001 ) . </s> * </s> * </s> * </s> * </s> * </s> * </s> * </s> * </s> * </s> <section_title_start> external links <section_title_end> </s> * bhutan.gov.bt official government web portal of bhutan </s> * bhutan . the world factbook . central intelligence agency . </s> * bhutan link at the national library of bhutan . </s> * bhutan profile , bbc news . </s> * bhutan from ucb library govpubs . </s> * bhutan , encyclopdia britannica entry . </s> * </s> * </s> * </s> * key development forecast for bhutan from international future . </s> category : bhutan </s> category : landlocked country </s> category : least developed country </s> category : member state of the south asian association for regional cooperation </s> category : member state of the united nation </s> category : south asian country </s> category : state and territory established in 1907 </s> category : country in asia </s> category : tibetan buddhist place </s> category : geographical article missing image alternative text <article_end> <article_start> </s> tajikistan ( , ; , , tadzhikistan ) , officially the republic of tajikistan ( jumhurii tojikiston ) , is a landlocked country in central asia with an area of and an estimated population of 9,537,645 people . it is bordered by afghanistan to the afghanistantajikistan border , uzbekistan to the tajikistanuzbekistan border , kyrgyzstan to the kyrgyzstantajikistan border and china to the chinatajikistan border . the traditional homeland of the tajik include present-day tajikistan a well a part of afghanistan and uzbekistan . </s> the territory that now constitutes tajikistan wa previously home to several ancient culture , including the city of sarazm of the neolithic and the bronze age and wa later home to kingdom ruled by people of different faith and culture , including the oxus valley civilisation , andronovo culture , buddhism , nestorian christianity , historical vedic religion , zoroastrianism , manichaeism and islam . the area ha been ruled by numerous empire and dynasty , including the achaemenid empire , sasanian empire , hephthalite empire , samanid empire and the mongol empire . after being ruled by the timurid dynasty and the khanate of bukhara , the timurid renaissance flourished . the region wa later conquered by the russian empire and subsequently by the soviet union . within the soviet union , the national delimitation in the soviet union # national delimitation in central asia country 's modern border were drawn when it wa part of uzbek soviet socialist republic a an tajik autonomous soviet socialist republic before becoming a tajik soviet socialist republic full-fledged soviet republic in 1929. </s> on 9 september 1991 , tajikistan became an independent sovereign nation when the soviet union dissolution of the soviet union . a civil war in tajikistan wa fought almost immediately after independence , lasting from 1992 to 1997 . since the end of the war , newly established political stability and foreign aid have allowed the country 's economy to grow . the country , led by president of tajikistan emomali rahmon since 1994 , ha been criticised by a number of non-governmental organization for authoritarian leadership , corruption and widespread human right in tajikistan , including torture , arbitrary imprisonment , lack of freedom of religion in tajikistan and other civil liberty , and worsening political repression . </s> tajikistan is a presidential republic consisting of four province . most of tajikistan 's population belongs to the tajik ethnic group , who speak tajik language ( a dialect of persian language ) . russian language is used a the inter-ethnic language . while the state is constitutionally secular , islam in tajikistan is practiced by 98 % of the population . in the gorno-badakhshan oblast , despite it sparse population , there is large linguistic diversity where rushani dialect , shughni language , ishkashimi language , wakhi language and tajik are some of the language spoken . mountain cover more than 90 % of the country . it is a developing country with a transition economy that is highly dependent on remittance , aluminium and cotton production . tajikistan is a member of the united nation , commonwealth of independent state , organization for security and co-operation in europe , organisation of islamic cooperation , economic cooperation organization , shanghai cooperation organisation and collective security treaty organization a well a an nato partnership for peace . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> tajikistan mean the `` land of the tajik `` . the suffix `` -stan `` is persian language for `` place of `` or `` country `` and tajik is , most likely , the name of a pre-islamic ( before the seventh century a.d. ) tribe . </s> one of the most prominent persian dictionary , the amid dictionary , give the following explanation of the term , according to multiple source : </s> * neither arab nor turk , he who speaks persian , a persian-speaking person . </s> * an arab child who is bred in persia , and thus speaks persian . </s> an older dictionary , : fa : qias al-luqat , also defines tajik a `` one who is neither a mongol nor a turk `` . </s> tajikistan appeared a tadjikistan or tadzhikistan in english prior to 1991 . this is due to a transliteration from the `` `` . in russian , there is no single letter j to represent the phoneme // , and therefore , or dzh , is used . tadzhikistan is the most common alternate spelling and is widely used in english literature derived from russian source . `` tadjikistan `` is the spelling in french and can occasionally be found in english language text . the way of writing tajikistan in the perso-arabic script is : . </s> even though the library of congress 's 1997 country study of tajikistan found it difficult to definitively state the origin of the word `` tajik `` because the term is `` embroiled in twentieth-century political dispute about whether turkic or iranian people were the original inhabitant of central asia . `` most scholar concluded that contemporary tajik are the descendant of ancient eastern iranian inhabitant of central asia , in particular , the sogdians and the bactrians , and possibly other group , with an admixture of western iranian persian and non-iranian people . according to richard nelson frye , a leading historian of iranian and central asian history , the persian migration to central asia may be considered the beginning of the modern tajik nation , and ethnic persian , along with some element of east-iranian bactrians and sogdians , a the main ancestor of modern tajik . in later work , frye expands on the complexity of the historical origin of the tajik . in a 1996 publication , frye explains that many `` factor must be taken into account in explaining the evolution of the people whose remnant are the tajik in central asia `` and that `` the people of central asia , whether iranian language or turkic language speaking , have one culture , one religion , one set of social value and tradition with only language separating them . `` </s> regarding tajik , the encyclopdia britannica state : </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> early history <section_title_end> </s> culture in the region have been dated back to at least the 4th millennium bce , including the bronze age bactriamargiana archaeological complex , the andronovo culture culture and the sarazm pro-urban site of sarazm , a unesco world heritage site . </s> the earliest recorded history of the region date back to about 500bc when much , if not all , of modern tajikistan wa part of the achaemenid empire . some author have also suggested that in the 7th and 6th century bc , part of modern tajikistan , including territory in the zeravshan valley , formed part of kambojas before it became part of the achaemenid empire . </s> after the region 's conquest by alexander the great it became part of the greco-bactrian kingdom , a successor state of alexander 's empire . northern tajikistan ( the city of khujand and panjakent ) wa part of sogdia , a collection of city-state which wa overrun by scythian and yuezhi nomadic tribe around 150bc . the silk road passed through the region and following the expedition of chinese explorer zhang qian during the reign of emperor wu of han ( 141bc87bc ) commercial relation between han dynasty and sogdiana flourished . sogdians played a major role in facilitating trade and also worked in other capacity , a farmer , carpetweavers , glassmaker , and woodcarver . </s> the kushan empire , a collection of yuezhi tribe , took control of the region in the first century ce and ruled until the 4th century ce during which time buddhism , nestorian christianity , zoroastrianism , and manichaeism were all practised in the region . later the hephthalite empire , a collection of nomadic tribe , moved into the region and arab brought islam in the early eighth century . central asia continued in it role a a commercial crossroad , linking china , the steppe to the north , and the islamic heartland . </s> it wa temporarily under the control of the tibetan empire and chinese from 650 to 680 and then under the control of the umayyad in 710 . the samanids , 819 to 999 , restored persian people control of the region and enlarged the city of samarkand and bukhara ( both city are today part of uzbekistan ) which became the cultural centre of iran and the region wa known a khorasan . the kara-khanid khanate conquered transoxania ( which corresponds approximately with modern-day uzbekistan , tajikistan , southern kyrgyzstan and southwest kazakhstan ) and ruled between 999 and 1211 . their arrival in transoxania signalled a definitive shift from iranian to turkic predominance in central asia , but gradually the kara-khanids became assimilated into the perso-arab muslim culture of the region . </s> during genghis khan 's mongol invasion of khwarezmia and eastern iran in the early 13th century the mongol empire took control over nearly all of central asia . in le than a century the mongol empire broke up and modern tajikistan came under the rule of the chagatai khanate . tamerlane created the timurid dynasty and took control of the region in the 14th century . </s> modern tajikistan fell under the rule of the khanate of bukhara during the 16th century and with the empire 's collapse in the 18th century it came under the rule of both the emirate of bukhara and khanate of kokand . the emirate of bukhara remained intact until the 20th century but during the 19th century , for the second time in world history , a european power ( the russian empire ) began to conquer part of the region . </s> <section_title_start> russian tajikistan <section_title_end> </s> russian imperialism led to the russian empire 's conquest of central asia during the late 19th century 's great game . between 1864 and 1885 , russia gradually took control of the entire territory of russian turkestan , the tajikistan portion of which had been controlled by the emirate of bukhara and khanate of kokand . russia wa interested in gaining access to a supply of cotton and in the 1870s attempted to switch cultivation in the region from grain to cotton ( a strategy later copied and expanded by the soviet ) . by 1885 tajikistan 's territory wa either ruled by the russian empire or it vassal state , the emirate of bukhara , nevertheless tajik felt little russian influence . </s> during the late 19th century the jadid established themselves a an islamic social movement throughout the region . although the jadidists were pro-modernization and not necessarily anti-russian , the russian viewed the movement a a threat because the russian empire wa predominately christian . russian troop were required to restore order during uprising against the khanate of kokand between 1910 and 1913 . further violence occurred in july 1916 when demonstrator attacked russian soldier in khujand over the threat of forced conscription during world war i . despite russian troop quickly bringing khujand back under control , clash continued throughout the year in various location in tajikistan . </s> <section_title_start> soviet tajikistan <section_title_end> </s> after the russian revolution of 1917 guerrilla throughout central asia , known a basmachi , waged kokand autonomy against bolshevik army in a futile attempt to maintain independence . the bolshevik prevailed after a four-year war , in which mosque and village were burned down and the population heavily suppressed . soviet authority started a campaign of secularisation . practising islam , judaism , and christianity wa discouraged and repressed , and many mosque , church ( building ) , and synagogue were closed . a a consequence of the conflict and soviet agriculture policy , central asia , tajikistan included , suffered a famine that claimed many life . </s> in 1924 , the tajik autonomous soviet socialist republic wa created a a part of uzbekistan , but in 1929 the tajik soviet socialist republic ( tajik ssr ) wa made a separate constituent republic ; however , the predominantly ethnic tajik city of samarkand and bukhara remained in the uzbek soviet socialist republic . between 1927 and 1934 , collectivisation of agriculture and a rapid expansion of cotton production took place , especially in the southern region . soviet collectivisation policy brought violence against peasant and forced resettlement occurred throughout tajikistan . consequently , some peasant fought collectivisation and revived the basmachi movement . some small scale industrial development also occurred during this time along with the expansion of irrigation infrastructure . </s> two round of stalin 's purge ( 19271934 and great purge 19371938 ) resulted in the expulsion of nearly 10,000 people , from all level of the communist party of tajikistan . ethnic russian were sent in to replace those expelled and subsequently russian dominated party position at all level , including the top position of first secretary . between 1926 and 1959 the proportion of russian among tajikistan 's population grew from le than 1 % to 13 % . bobojon ghafurov , first secretary of the communist party of tajikistan from 19461956 , wa the only tajik politician of significance outside of the country during the soviet era . he wa followed in office by tursun uljabayev ( 195661 ) , jabbor rasulov ( 19611982 ) , and rahmon nabiyev ( 19821985 , 19911992 ) . </s> tajik began to be conscripted into the soviet army in 1939 and during world war ii around 260,000 tajik citizen fought against germany , finland and japan . between 60,000 ( 4 % ) and 120,000 ( 8 % ) of tajikistan 's 1,530,000 citizen were killed during world war ii . following the war and stalin 's reign , attempt were made to further expand the agriculture and industry of tajikistan . during 195758 nikita khrushchev 's virgin land campaign focused attention on tajikistan , where living condition , education and industry lagged behind the other republic of the soviet union . in the 1980s , tajikistan had the lowest household saving rate in the ussr , the lowest percentage of household in the two top per caput income group , and the lowest rate of university graduate per 1000 people . by the late 1980s tajik nationalist were calling for increased right . real disturbance did not occur within the republic until 1990 . the following year , the soviet union collapsed , and tajikistan declared it independence on 9 september 1991 , a day which is now celebrated a the country 's independence day ( tajikistan ) . </s> <section_title_start> gaining independence <section_title_end> </s> in soviet time , supporter of tajikistan independence were harshly persecuted by the kgb , and most were shot and jailed for long year . after the beginning of the perestroika era , declared by mikhail gorbachev throughout the ussr , supporter of the independence of the republic began to speak openly and freely . in tajikistan ssr , the independence movement ha been active since 1987 . supporter of independence were the islamic renaissance party of tajikistan , the democratic party ( tajikistan ) and the national democratic rastokhez rastokhez ( revival ) movement . on the eve of the dissolution of the soviet union , the population of tajikistan ssr wa divided into two camp . the first wanted independence for tajikistan , the restoration of tajik culture and language , the restoration of political and cultural relation with iran and afghanistan and other country , and the second part of the population opposed independence , considering it the best option to remain part of the ussr . opposed independence mainly russian-speaking population of tajikistan . </s> since february 1990 , there have been riot and strike in dushanbe ( 1990 dushanbe riot ) and other city of tajikistan due to the difficult socio-economic situation , lack of housing , and youth unemployment . the nationalist and democratic opposition , and supporter of independence joined the strike and began to demand the independence of the republic and democratic reform . islamism also began to hold strike and demand respect for their right and independence of the republic . the soviet leadership introduced internal troop in dushanbe to eliminate the unrest . </s> <section_title_start> independence <section_title_end> </s> the nation almost immediately fell into tajikistani civil war that involved various faction fighting one another ; these faction were often distinguished by clan loyalty . more than 500,000 resident fled during this time because of persecution , increased poverty and better economic opportunity in the west or in other former soviet republic . emomali rahmon came to power in 1992 , defeating former prime minister abdumalik abdullajanov in a november presidential election with 58 % of the vote . the election took place shortly after the end of the war , and tajikistan wa in a state of complete devastation . the estimated dead numbered over 100,000 . around 1.2 million people were refugee inside and outside of the country . in 1997 , a ceasefire wa reached between rahmon and opposition party under the guidance of gerd d. merrem , special representative to the secretary general , a result widely praised a a successful united nation peacekeeping initiative . the ceasefire guaranteed 30 % of ministerial position would go to the united tajik opposition . tajikistani presidential election , 1999 were held in 1999 , though they were criticised by opposition party and foreign observer a unfair and rahmon wa re-elected with 98 % of the vote . tajik presidential election , 2006 were again won by rahmon ( with 79 % of the vote ) and he began his third term in office . several opposition party boycotted the 2006 election and the organization for security and cooperation in europe ( osce ) criticised it , although observer from the commonwealth of independent state claimed the election were legal and transparent . rahmon 's administration came under further criticism from the osce in october 2010 for it censorship and repression of the medium . the osce claimed that the tajik government censored tajik and foreign website and instituted tax inspection on independent printing house that led to the cessation of printing activity for a number of independent newspaper . </s> russian border troop were stationed along the tajikafghan border until summer 2005 . since the september 11 , 2001 attack , france troop have been stationed at the dushanbe airport in support of air operation of nato 's international security assistance force in afghanistan . united state army and united state marine corp personnel periodically visit tajikistan to conduct joint training mission of up to several week duration . the government of india rebuilt the ayni air base , a military airport located 15 ; km southwest of dushanbe , at a cost of $ 70 million , completing the repair in september 2010 . it is now the main base of the tajikistan air force . there have been talk with russia concerning use of the ayni facility , and russia continues to maintain a large base on the outskirt of dushanbe . </s> in 2010 , there were concern among tajik official that islamic militarism in the east of the country wa on the rise following the escape of 25 militant from a tajik prison in august , an ambush that killed 28 tajik soldier in the rasht valley in september , and another ambush in the valley in october that killed 30 soldier , followed by fighting outside gharm that left 3 militant dead . to date the country 's interior ministry asserts that the central government maintains full control over the country 's east , and the military operation in the rasht valley wa concluded in november 2010 . however , 2012 gorno-badakhshan clash in july 2012. </s> in 2015 , russia sent more troop to tajikistan . </s> in may 2015 , tajikistan 's national security suffered a serious setback when colonel gulmurod khalimov , commander of the special-purpose police unit ( omon ) of the interior ministry , defected to the islamic state of iraq and the levant . </s> <section_title_start> politics <section_title_end> </s> almost immediately after independence , tajikistan wa plunged into a civil war that saw various faction fighting one another . these faction were supported by foreign country including afghanistan , iran , pakistan , uzbekistan and russia . russia and iran focused on keeping peace in the warring nation to decrease the chance of united state u.s. or turkey involvement . most notably , russia backed the pro-government faction and deployed troop from the commonwealth of independent state to guard the tajikistan-afghan border . all but 25,000 of the more than 400,000 ethnic russian , who were mostly employed in industry , fled to russia . by 1997 , the war had ended after a tajikistani civil war between the government and the islamist-led opposition , a central government began to take form , with peaceful election in 1999. </s> `` longtime observer of tajikistan often characterize the country a profoundly averse to risk and skeptical of promise of reform , a political passivity they trace to the country s ruinous civil war , `` ilan greenberg wrote in a news article in the new york time just before the country 's november 2006 presidential election . </s> tajikistan is officially a republic , and hold election in tajikistan for the list of president of tajikistan and parliament , operating under a presidential system . it is , however , a dominant-party system , where the people 's democratic party of tajikistan routinely ha a vast majority in parliament . emomali rahmon ha held the office of president of tajikistan continuously since november 1994 . the prime minister is kokhir rasulzoda , the first deputy prime minister is matlubkhon davlatov and the two deputy prime minister are murodali alimardon and ruqiya qurbanova . </s> the parliamentary election of 2005 aroused many accusation from opposition party and international observer that president emomali rahmon corruptly manipulates the election process and unemployment . the most recent election , in february 2010 , saw the ruling pdpt lose four seat in parliament , yet still maintain a comfortable majority . the organization for security and co-operation in europe election observer said the 2010 polling `` failed to meet many key osce commitment `` and that `` these election failed on many basic democratic standard . `` the government insisted that only minor violation had occurred , which would not affect the will of the tajik people . </s> the presidential election held on 6 november 2006 wa boycotted by `` mainline `` opposition party , including the 23,000-member islamic renaissance party of tajikistan . four remaining opponent `` all but endorsed the incumbent `` , rahmon . tajikistan gave iran it support in iran 's membership bid to join the shanghai cooperation organisation , after a meeting between the tajik president and the iranian foreign minister . </s> freedom of the press is ostensibly officially guaranteed by the government , but independent press outlet remain restricted , a doe a substantial amount of web content . according to the institute for war & peace reporting , access is blocked to local and foreign website including avesta.tj , tjknews.com , ferghana.ru , centrasia.org and journalist are often obstructed from reporting on controversial event . in practice , no public criticism of the regime is tolerated and all direct protest is severely suppressed and doe not receive coverage in the local medium . </s> in the economist 's democracy index report of 2020 , tajikistan is placed 160th , just after saudi arabia , a an `` authoritarian regime `` . </s> in july 2019 , un ambassador of 37 country , including tajikistan , have signed a joint letter to the unhrc defending china 's xinjiang re-education camp in the xinjiang region . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> tajikistan is landlocked country , and is the smallest nation in central asia by area . it lie mostly between latitude 36th parallel north 36 and 41st parallel north 41 n , and longitude 67th meridian east 67 and 75th meridian east 75 e. it is covered by mountain of the pamir mountain range , and most of the country is over above sea level . the only major area of lower land are in the north ( part of the fergana valley ) , and in the southern kofarnihon river and vakhsh river river valley , which form the amu darya . dushanbe is located on the southern slope above the kofarnihon valley . </s> the amu darya and panj river river mark the border with afghanistan , and the glacier in tajikistan 's mountain are the major source of runoff ( water ) for the aral sea . there are over 900 river in tajikistan longer than 10 kilometre . </s> <section_title_start> administrative division <section_title_end> </s> tajikistan consists of 4 administrative division . these are the province ( viloyat ) of sughd and khatlon , the autonomous province of gorno-badakhshan autonomous province gorno-badakhshan ( abbreviated a gbao ) , and the region of republican subordination ( rrp ; raiony respublikanskogo podchineniya in romanization of russian from russian or ntj in tajik language ; formerly known a karotegin province ) . each region is divided into several district of tajikistan ( , nohiya or raion ) , which in turn are subdivided into jamoats of tajikistan ( village-level self-governing unit ) and then village ( qyshloqs of tajikistan ) . , there were 58 district and 367 jamoats in tajikistan . </s> <section_title_start> lake <section_title_end> </s> about 2 % of the country 's area is covered by lake , the best known of which are the following : </s> * kayrakkum reservoir kayrakum ( qairoqqum ) reservoir ( sughd ) </s> * iskanderkul ( fann mountain ) </s> * kulikalon lake ( kul-i kalon ) ( fann mountain ) </s> * nurek dam ( khatlon ) </s> * karakul ( tajikistan ) ( kyrgyz language : - ; eastern pamir mountain ) </s> * sarez lake ( pamir mountain ) </s> * shadau lake ( pamir mountain ) </s> * zorkul ( pamir mountain ) </s> <section_title_start> biodiversity <section_title_end> </s> tajikistan contains five terrestrial ecoregions : alai-western tian shan steppe , gissaro-alai open woodland , pamir alpine desert and tundra , badghyz and karabil semi-desert , and paropamisus xeric woodland . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> nearly 47 % of tajikistan 's gdp come from immigrant remittance ( mostly from tajik working in russia ) . the current economic situation remains fragile , largely owing to corruption , uneven economic reform , and economic mismanagement . with foreign revenue precariously dependent upon remittance from migrant worker overseas and export of aluminium and cotton , the economy is highly vulnerable to external shock . in fy 2000 , international assistance remained an essential source of support for rehabilitation program that reintegrated former civil war combatant into the civilian economy , which helped keep the peace . international assistance also wa necessary to address the second year of severe drought that resulted in a continued shortfall of food production . on 21 august 2001 , the red cross announced that a famine wa striking tajikistan , and called for international aid for tajikistan and uzbekistan ; however , access to food remains a problem today . in january 2012 , 680,152 of the people living in tajikistan were living with food insecurity . out of those , 676,852 were at risk of phase 3 ( acute food and livelihood crisis ) food insecurity and 3,300 were at risk of phase 4 ( humanitarian emergency ) . those with the highest risk of food insecurity were living in the remote murghob district of gorno-badakhshan autonomous province . </s> tajikistan 's economy grew substantially after the war . the gdp of tajikistan expanded at an average rate of 9.6 % over the period of 20002007 according to the world bank data . this improved tajikistan 's position among other central asian country ( namely turkmenistan and uzbekistan ) , which seem to have degraded economically ever since . the primary source of income in tajikistan are aluminium production , cotton growing and remittance from migrant worker . cotton account for 60 % of agricultural output , supporting 75 % of the rural population , and using 45 % of irrigated arable land . the aluminium industry is represented by the state-owned tajik aluminum company the biggest aluminium plant in central asia and one of the biggest in the world . </s> tajikistan 's river , such a the vakhsh river and the panj river , have great hydropower potential , and the government ha focused on attracting investment for project for internal use and electricity export . tajikistan is home to the nurek dam , the second highest dam in the world . lately , russia 's rao ues energy giant ha been working on the sangtuda-1 hydroelectric power station ( 670 ; mw capacity ) commenced operation on 18 january 2008 . other project at the development stage include sangtuda-2 by iran , zerafshan by the chinese company sinohydro , and the rogun dam that , at a projected height of , would supersede the nurek dam a highest in the world if it is brought to completion . a planned project , casa-1000 , will transmit 1000 mw of surplus electricity from tajikistan to pakistan with power transit through afghanistan . the total length of transmission line is 750 ; km while the project is planned to be on public-private partnership basis with the support of wb , ifc , adb and idb . the project cost is estimated to be around u $ 865 million . other energy resource include sizeable coal deposit and smaller , relatively unexplored reserve of natural gas and petroleum . </s> in 2014 tajikistan wa the world 's most remittance-dependent economy with remittance accounting for 49 % of gdp and expected to fall by 40 % in 2015 due to the economic crisis in the russian federation . tajik migrant worker abroad , mainly in the russian federation , have become by far the main source of income for million of tajikistan 's people and with the 20142015 downturn in the russian economy the world bank ha predicted large number of young tajik men will return home and face few economic prospect . </s> according to some estimate about 20 % of the population life on le than u $ 1.25 per day . migration from tajikistan and the consequent remittance have been unprecedented in their magnitude and economic impact . in 2010 , remittance from tajik labour migrant totalled an estimated $ 2.1 billion u dollar , an increase from 2009 . tajikistan ha achieved transition from a planned to a market economy without substantial and protracted recourse to aid ( of which it by now receives only negligible amount ) , and by purely market-based mean , simply by exporting it main commodity of comparative advantage ; cheap labour . the world bank tajikistan policy note 2006 concludes that remittance have played an important role a one of the driver of tajikistan 's economic growth during the past several year , have increased income , and a a result helped significantly reduce poverty . </s> drug trafficking is the major illegal source of income in tajikistan a it is an important transit country for afghan narcotic bound for russian and , to a lesser extent , western european market ; some opium poppy is also raised locally for the domestic market . however , with the increasing assistance from international organisation , such a unodc , and co-operation with the u , russian , eu and afghan authority a level of progress on the fight against illegal drug-trafficking is being achieved . tajikistan hold third place in the world for [ and raw opium ] confiscation ( 1216.3 ; kg of heroin and 267.8 ; kg of raw opium in the first half of 2006 ) . drug money corrupts the country 's government ; according to some expert the well-known personality that fought on both side of the [ [ civil war in tajikistan and have held the position in the government after the armistice wa signed are now involved in the drug trade . unodc is working with tajikistan to strengthen border crossing , provide training , and set up joint interdiction team . it also helped to establish tajikistani drug control agency . tajikistan is also an active member of the economic cooperation organization ( eco ) . </s> besides russia , china is one of the major economic and trade partner of dushanbe . tajikistan belongs to the group of country with a high debt trap risk associated with chinese investment within the belt and road initiative ( bri ) meaning that excessive reliance on chinese loan may weaken country 's ability to manage it external debt in a sustainable way . </s> <section_title_start> transportation <section_title_end> </s> in 2013 tajikistan , like many of the other central asian country , wa experiencing major development in it transportation sector . </s> a a landlocked country tajikistan ha no port and the majority of transportation is via road , air , and rail . in recent year tajikistan ha pursued agreement with iran and pakistan to gain port access in those country via afghanistan . in 2009 , an agreement wa made between tajikistan , pakistan , and afghanistan to improve and build a 1,300 ; km ( 810 ; mi ) highway and rail system connecting the three country to pakistan 's port . the proposed route would go through the gorno-badakhshan autonomous province in the eastern part of the country . and in 2012 , the president of tajikistan , afghanistan , and iran signed an agreement to construct road and railway a well a oil , gas , and water pipeline to connect the three country . </s> <section_title_start> rail <section_title_end> </s> the railroad system total only of track , all of it russian gauge . the principal segment are in the southern region and connect the capital with the industrial area of the hisor and vakhsh , tajikistan valley and with uzbekistan , turkmenistan , kazakhstan and russia . most international freight traffic is carried by train . the recently constructed qurghonteppakulob railway connected the kulob district with the central area of the country . </s> <section_title_start> air <section_title_end> </s> in 2009 tajikistan had 26 airport , 18 of which had paved runway , of which two had runway longer than 3,000 meter . the country 's main airport is dushanbe international airport , which a of april 2015 had regularly-scheduled flight to major city in russia , central asia , a well a delhi , dubai , frankfurt , istanbul , kabul , tehran , and rmqi , amongst others . there are also international flight , mainly to russia , from khujand airport in the northern part of the country a well a limited international service from kulob airport , and qurghonteppa international airport . khorog airport is a domestic airport and also the only airport in the sparsely populated eastern half of the country . </s> tajikistan ha one major airline ( somon air ) and is also serviced by over a dozen foreign airline . </s> <section_title_start> road <section_title_end> </s> the total length of road in the country is 27,800 kilometre . automobile account for more than 90 % of the total volume of passenger transportation and more than 80 % of domestic freight transportation . </s> in 2004 the tajikafghan friendship bridge between afghanistan and tajikistan wa built , improving the country 's access to south asia . the bridge wa built by the united state . </s> many highway and tunnel construction project are underway or have recently been completed . major project include rehabilitation of the dushanbe chanak ( uzbek border ) , dushanbe kulma ( chinese border ) , and kurgan-tube nizhny pyanj ( afghan border ) highway , and construction of tunnel under the mountain pass of anzob tunnel , shakhristan , shar-shar and chormazak . these were supported by international donor country . </s> <section_title_start> demographic <section_title_end> </s> { class= `` wikitable `` style= `` float : right ; margin-left : 10px `` </s> + population in tajikistan </s> - </s> ! scope= `` col `` style= `` background : # cfb ; `` year </s> ! scope= `` col `` style= `` background : # cfb ; `` million </s> - </s> 1950 style= `` text-align : right ; `` 1.5 </s> - </s> 2000 style= `` text-align : right ; `` 6.2 </s> - </s> style= `` text-align : right ; `` </s> } </s> tajikistan ha a population of 9,275,832 people , of which 70 % are under the age of 30 and 35 % are between the age of 14 and 30 . tajik people who speak tajik language ( a dialect of persian language ) are the main ethnic group , although there are sizeable minority of uzbek and russian , whose number are declining due to emigration . the pamiri people of badakhshan , a small population of yaghnobi people , and a sizeable minority of ismaili are all considered to belong to the larger group of tajik . all citizen of tajikistan are called tajikistanis . </s> in 1989 , ethnic russian in tajikistan made up 7.6 % of the population , but they are now le than 0.5 % , after the civil war spurred russian emigration . the history of german in russia and the soviet union population of tajikistan ha also declined due to emigration : having topped at 38,853 in 1979 , it ha almost vanished since the collapse of the soviet union . </s> <section_title_start> language <section_title_end> </s> the state and official language of the republic of tajikistan is tajik language , which is written in the tajik alphabet . in fact , the tajik language is a variant of the persian language persian language ( or farsi ) . this fact is also recognized by linguist . therefore , tajik speaker have no problem communicating with persian speaker from iran and dari speaker from afghanistan . several million native tajik speaker also live in neighboring uzbekistan and russia . </s> tajik became the official language of the tajik soviet socialist republic on july 22 , 1989 . before that , since the creation of the tajikistan ssr , the only official language of the republic wa the russian language , and the tajik language had only the status of the national language . russian lost it official status after tajikistan 's independence in late 1991 . despite this , according to article 2 of the constitution of the republic of tajikistan , russian language is recognized a the official language of inter-ethnic communication in the country . approximately 90 % of the population of tajikistan speaks russian at various level . the highly educated part of the population of tajikistan , a well a the intelligentsia , prefer to speak russian and persian , the pronunciation of which in tajikistan is called the iranian style . </s> apart from russian , uzbek language is actually the second most widely spoken language in tajikistan after tajik . native uzbek speaker live in the north and west of tajikistan . in the fourth place ( after tajik , russian and uzbek ) by the number of native speaker are various pamir language whose native speaker live in gorno-badakhshan autonomous region . the majority of zoroastrian in tajikistan speak it in the pamir language . native speaker of the kyrgyz language live in the north of gorno-badakhshan autonomous region . yagnobi language speaker live in the west of the country . the parya language of local romani people ( : ru : ) is also widely spoken in tajikistan . tajikistan also ha small community of native speaker of persian language , arabic language , pashto , eastern armenian , azerbaijani language , tatar language , turkmen language , kazakh language , chinese language , ukrainian language . </s> among foreign language , the most popular is english language , which is taught in school in tajikistan a one of the foreign language . some young people , a well a those working in the tourism sector of tajikistan , speak english at different level . of the european language , there are also a sufficient number of native speaker of german language and french language . the uzbek population is learning turkish language . </s> <section_title_start> employment <section_title_end> </s> in 2009 nearly one million tajik worked abroad ( mainly in russia ) . more than 70 % of the female population life in traditional village . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> the tajik language is the mother tongue of around 80 % of the citizen of tajikistan . the main urban centre in today 's tajikistan include dushanbe ( the capital ) , khujand , kulob , panjakent , qurghonteppa , khorugh and istaravshan . there are also uzbek , kyrgyz people and russian minority . </s> the pamiri people of gorno-badakhshan autonomous province in the southeast , bordering afghanistan and china , though considered part of the tajik people , nevertheless are distinct linguistically and culturally from most tajik . in contrast to the mostly sunni muslim resident of the rest of tajikistan , the pamiris overwhelmingly follow the ismaili branch of shia islam , and speak a number of eastern iranian language , including shughni language , rushani language , khufi language and wakhi language . isolated in the highest part of the pamir mountain , they have preserved many ancient cultural tradition and folk art that have been largely lost elsewhere in the country . </s> the yaghnobi people live in mountainous area of northern tajikistan . the estimated number of yaghnobis is now about 25,000 . forced migration in the 20th century decimated their number . they speak the yaghnobi language , which is the only direct modern descendant of the ancient sogdian language . </s> tajikistan artisan created the dushanbe tea house , which wa presented in 1988 a a gift to the sister city of boulder , colorado . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> sunni islam of the hanafi school ha been officially recognised by the government since 2009 . tajikistan considers itself a secular state with a constitution providing for freedom of religion . the government ha declared two islamic holiday , eid ul-fitr and eid al-adha , a state holiday . according to a u state department release and pew research group , the population of tajikistan is 98 % muslim . approximately 87 % 95 % of them are sunni islam and roughly 3 % are shia and roughly 7 % are non-denominational muslim . the remaining 2 % of the population are follower of russian orthodox church , protestantism , zoroastrianism and buddhism . a great majority of muslim fast during ramadan , although only about one third in the countryside and 10 % in the city observe daily prayer and dietary restriction . </s> bukharan jew had lived in tajikistan since the 2nd century bce , but today almost none are left . in the 1940s , the jewish community of tajikistan numbered nearly 30,000 people . most were persian-speaking bukharan jew who had lived in the region for millennium along with ashkenazi jew from eastern europe who resettled there in the soviet era . the jewish population is now estimated at le than 500 , about half of whom live in dushanbe . </s> relationship between religious group are generally amicable , although there is some concern among mainstream muslim leader that minority religious group undermine national unity . there is a concern for religious institution becoming active in the political sphere . the islamic renaissance party of tajikistan ( irp ) , a major combatant in the tajikistan civil war 19921997 civil war and then-proponent of the creation of an state religion # islamic state in tajikistan , constitutes no more than 30 % of the government by statute . membership in hizb ut-tahrir , a militant islamic party which today aim for an overthrow of secular government and the unification of tajik under one islamic state , is illegal and member are subject to arrest and imprisonment . number of large mosque appropriate for friday prayer are limited and some feel this is discriminatory . </s> by law , religious community must register by the state committee on religious affair ( scra ) and with local authority . registration with the scra requires a charter , a list of 10 or more member , and evidence of local government approval prayer site location . religious group who do not have a physical structure are not allowed to gather publicly for prayer . failure to register can result in large fine and closure of place of worship . there are report that registration on the local level is sometimes difficult to obtain . people under the age of 18 are also barred from public religious practice . </s> a of january 2016 , a part of an `` anti-radicalisation campaign `` , police in the khatlon region reportedly shaved the beard of 13,000 men and shut down 160 shop selling the hijab . shaving beard and discouraging woman from wearing hijab is part of a government campaign targeting trend that are deemed `` alien and inconsistent with tajik culture `` , and `` to preserve secular tradition `` . </s> today , approximately 1.6 % of the population in tajikistan is christianity , mostly russian orthodox church . </s> the territory of tajikistan is part of the : ru : of the : ru : of the russian orthodox church . the country is also home to community of catholic church , armenian apostolic church , protestantism , lutheranism , jehovah 's witness , baptist , mormon , and adventist . </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> despite repeated effort by the tajik government to improve and expand health care , the system remains among the most underdeveloped and poor , with severe shortage of medical supply . the state 's ministry of labor and social welfare reported that 104,272 disabled people are registered in tajikistan ( 2000 ) . this group of people suffers most from poverty in tajikistan . the government of tajikistan and the world bank considered activity to support this part of the population described in the world bank 's poverty reduction strategy paper . public expenditure on health wa at 1 % of the gdp in 2004. </s> life expectancy at birth wa estimated to be 69 year in 2020 . the infant mortality rate wa approximately 30.42 death per 1,000 child in 2018 . in 2014 , there were 2.1 physician per 1,000 people , higher than any other low-income country after north korea . </s> tajikistan ha experienced a sharp decrease in number of per caput hospital bed following the dissolution of the soviet union ( since 1992 ) , even though the number still remains relatively at 4.8 bed per 1,000 people , well above the world average of 2.7 and one of the highest among other low-income country . </s> according to world bank , 96 % of birth are attended by skilled health staff , a figure which ha risen from 66.6 % in 1999. </s> in 2010 the country experienced an outbreak of polio that caused more than 457 case of polio in both child and adult , and resulted in 29 death before being brought under control . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> despite it poverty , tajikistan ha a high rate of literacy due to the old soviet system of free education , with an estimated 99.8 % of the population having the ability to read and write . </s> public education in tajikistan consists of 11 year of primary and secondary education but the government planned to implement a 12-year system in 2016 . there is a relatively large number of list of university in tajikistan including khujand state university which ha 76 department in 15 faculty , tajikistan state university of law , business , & politics , khorugh state university , agricultural university of tajikistan , tajik national university , and several other institution . most , but not all , university were established during the soviet era . tertiary education enrollment wa 17 % , significantly below the sub-regional average of 37 % , although higher than any other low-income country after syria . many tajik left the education system due to low demand in the labour market for people with extensive educational training or professional skill . </s> public spending on education wa relatively constant between 20052012 and fluctuated from 3.5 % to 4.1 % of gdp significantly below the oecd average of 6 % . the united nation reported that the level of spending wa `` severely inadequate to meet the requirement of the country s high-needs education system . `` </s> according to a unicef-supported survey , about 25 percent of girl in tajikistan fail to complete compulsory primary education because of poverty and gender bias , although literacy is generally high in tajikistan . estimate of out of school child range from 4.6 % to 19.4 % with the vast majority being girl . </s> in september 2017 , the university of central asia will launch it second campus in khorog , tajikistan , offering major in earth & environmental science and economics . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> the national sport of tajikistan is gushtigiri , a form of traditional wrestling . </s> another popular sport is buzkashi , a game played on horseback , like polo . one play it on one 's own and in team . the aim of the game is to grab a 50 ; kg dead goat , ride clear of the other player , get back to the starting point and drop it in a designated circle . it is also practised in afghanistan , kyrgyzstan , kazakhstan , uzbekistan and turkmenistan . it is often played at nowruz celebration . </s> tajikistan 's mountain provide many opportunity for outdoor sport , such a hill climbing , mountain biking , rock climbing , skiing , snowboarding , hiking , and mountain climbing . the facility are limited , however . mountain climbing and hiking tour to the fann and pamir mountain , including the 7,000 ; m peak in the region , are seasonally organised by local and international alpine agency . </s> association football is the most popular sport in tajikistan . it is governed by the tajikistan football federation . the tajikistan national football team competes in fifa and asian football confederation competition . the top club in tajikistan compete in the tajik league . </s> the tajikistan cricket federation wa formed in 2012 a the governing body for the sport of cricket in tajikistan . it wa granted affiliate membership of the asian cricket council in the same year . </s> rugby union in tajikistan is a minor but growing sport . in 2008 , the sport wa officially registered with the ministry of justice ( tajikistan ) , and there are currently 3 men 's club . </s> four tajikistani athlete have won olympic medal for their country since independence . they are : wrestler yusup abdusalomov ( wrestling at the 2008 summer olympics men 's freestyle 84 kg in beijing 2008 ) , judoka rasul boqiev ( judo at the 2008 summer olympics men 's 73 kg in beijing 2008 ) , boxer mavzuna chorieva ( boxing at the 2012 summer olympics woman 's lightweight in london 2012 ) and hammer thrower dilshod nazarov ( athletics at the 2016 summer olympics men 's hammer throw in rio de janeiro 2016 ) . </s> khorugh , capital of gorno-badakhshan autonomous region , is the location of highest altitude where bandy ha been played . </s> tajikistan ha also one ski resort , called safed dara ( formerly takob ) , near the town of varzob . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * 2006 tajikistan earthquake </s> * central asian union </s> * dushanbe </s> *
